11.content: Was it a Lawyer or assistant?
11.title: Lawyer/Assistant

11111.content: Original Trilogy or post disbarment?
11111.title: Original trilogy/Pre-Apollo Justice

choices: Use it on himself and someone else
Use it on Maya/Larry and someone else
111111.content:
Phoenix was in his office going over case files one more time before heading over to the courthouse for a trial. His friend Larry had gotten into trouble again and even though the charges weren't serious, Phoenix figured he couldn't count on Larry to not make it harder than it had to be. If anyone could go from petty larceny to contempt of court in under 60 seconds, it'd be him.

Satisfied with the details, he looked to his watch and realized that his cab would be there soon. He opened the door of the agency but realized that a small cardboard package was sitting at his feet. "Hmm? It's way too early for mail..." he examined it for a second, but looked up to see his ride had pulled up. "I'll read it on the way," he decided as he boarded the car.

---

As Phoenix sat in the back, he forewent small talk to read over the instructions, telling the driver he was just reviewing case files. 'Body swap, possession, shape-shifting? Would be great if it was real, but it all sounds kooky.' He had to admit though it'd make the trial much simpler if he could become the judge, or have his assistant take over the prosecutor.

"Hey Nick! Took you long enough," speak of the devil, Phoenix's assistant Maya was impatiently waiting for him in the lobby. Larry was sitting in the corner, seemingly inconsolable.

"Sorry Maya, had to look over the case files one more time," he replied. "Have you gotten anything out of Larry."

Maya rolled her eyes, "hardly. I think his girlfriend broke up with him again? He's being difficult, and he wasn't even accused of murder this time!"

"Well, do we know who the prosecutor is?" Phoenix asked.

"I haven't seen them with my own eyes, but I'm pretty sure I heard a whip crack outside the door," Maya responded with clasped hands. "You know what that means, don't you?"

'Oh lord, not Franziska,' Phoenix groaned internally. She'd do whatever it takes to get a guilty verdict, no matter petty the trial. He could only guess she was coaching witnesses right now. 'But I bet if I had someone on the inside, it'd be a lot easier...'

"What'cha thinking about Nick? C'mon, we're partners! Don't hold out."

Phoenix reached towards his pocket, considering sharing the remote with Maya (and maybe Larry), but there was always the risk it wouldn't work and he'd look 'foolish' as Von Karma might put it. If he tried one of the functions himself, like possession, there'd certainly be no risk, but it might pay off in the long run to have other people informed about it too.

"Mr. Wright, the prosecution says you have two minutes," a beleaguered and bruised guard informed him from a crack in the door. "Please don't make her angrier."

"C'mon Phoenix! Show me what you got! Is it some sort of smoking gun? I want to know!" Maya shouted.

Phoenix figured that he may as well test the device now, so he decided to...
111111.title: Original trilogy

1111111.content:
Phoenix chose to use the remote on himself first. After all, he was the one who got the remote, he should at least be involved in it's first use. The question now was, who else should he use it on?

It didn't take much thought. Phoenix wanted to use the remote to gain an edge on Franziska in the trial. The easiest way to do that would be to become her, although he doubted she would exactly be pleased with the results, but what button should he use?
1111111.title: Use it on himself and someone else

11111111.content: Which one did he use?
11111111.title: Aware Swap/Unaware Swap

111111111.content:
Phoenix figured he’d use the ‘Aware Swap’ button, after all, it was his time using the remote, he might as well use the most basic function. He made his way to the Prosecutor’s lobby in the courthouse. As he expected, he found Franziska Von Karma. She seemed to be yelling at and whipping some poor Bailifs, she was far too busy doing that to notice Phoenix. He aimed the remote at himself and clicked the Aware Swap button; he then proceeded to aim at Franziska and once again clicked the button.

In an instant, Phoenix was standing where Franziska was. In his hand was a whip and standing in front of him where two scared bailiffs. Phoenix looked down at himself and was greeted by the unfamiliar chest and clothing of Franziska Von Karma, it was instantly clear that the swap had worked, Phoenix turned around, the two and began to walk toward Franziska in his body. bailiffs running away as he did. Strangely enough, Franziska seemed to be entirely calm about the swap.

Meanwhile Franziska was panicking internally. She was suddenly in a different body, not only that, but she was in the body of that foolish fool of a defense attorney. Of course, while she was panicking internally, she made sure not to show it. No matter what body she was in, she was a Von Karma and a Von Karma is too perfect get fazed by anything.

As Phoenix walked up to her, Franziska gave a cocky grin "Mr. Phoenix Wright, are you so sure that I will annihilate you, that you stole my body to sabotage the trial?"

Sweat was dropping down Phoenix's face, while that wasn't exactly his intention, one can easily interpret it that way. "No, not exactly." He began, but he interrupted himself when he noticed the remote in Franziska's hand. Thankfully, it seemed she hadn't noticed.

"Not exactly? Then what was your intent? Finish your sentence, fool!" Franziska instinctively moved her arm in a whipping motion, but there was no whip in her hand. Although there was no whip in her hand, she definitely had a grip on something. She looked at her hand and saw a remote. Franziska was no fool, she only had to read the labels on the button s to figure out that this remote was what caused the swap. "Putting aside the 'why' for now, you can explain to me the 'how'" She said, holding up the remote.

Phoenix sighed, he was hoping that he wouldn't have to explain the remote. He explained to Franziska how he got the remote and what each of the buttons did.

Franziska eyed the remote "So, am I correct to assume that you used the 'Aware Swap' button to switch the two of us?"

"Yes, you're right." Phoenix answered.

"Good. I'll switch us back right away." Franziska said and pointed the remote toward Phoenix in her body, moved her finger to the Aware Swap button and clicked it. She then pointed the remote at herself in Phoenix's body, she was about to click the button again when suddenly....

"HOLD IT!" Phoenix shouted, he had switched into Franziska's body to give him an extra edge in the trial, if Franziska swapped them back now all he would have accomplished was telling someone else about the remote. "Von Karma, in today's trial, we would be evenly matched." Phoenix bluffed "So, how about a little challenge? You're a perfect prosecutor, but can you be a perfect defense attorney?"

Franziska wasn't falling for his trap "The Von Karma family is trained to be perfect prosecutors, defense attorneys are nothing but bugs to be crushed under our feet."

"So, the only thing you're perfect at is prosecuting? You wouldn't be able to perfectly handle the jobs of the 'bugs' you step on?" Phoenix played on her pride.

Franziska wanted to say something back, but she couldn't think of anything. She wished her whip was in her hand so she could put this fool in his place. She then thought of a retort "You think I am that foolish, Phoenix Wright? If you were in my body for the trial, you would surely take ruin the my reputation."

Phoenix got smug and had already prepared to counter that point "The same can be said of you. If I tried to do anything that would ruin 'your' reputation, you could easily ruin 'mine', why would I take that risk?"

ranziska wanted to counter his argument, but she could think of a counter. She soon gave up "Fine, but know this. The second this trial is over, we are switching back." Franziska said commandingly.

"Of course." Phoenix said as Franziska walked away. He began to read through Franziska's court record. This trial would be.....interesting to say the least.
111111111.title: Aware swap

11111111121.content:
Phoenix couldn't believe what was happening: he won.

Which, from a different perspective, meant he lost.

"I believe the evidence has conclusively proven that Mr. Butz did indeed steal the stepladder with no intent on repaying his victims," the Judge declared from his podium. "It has his fingerprints, there was a witness, and it was in the defendant's home. Since the defense has failed to prove that a third party could have been present during the crime, I will now give my verdict. Mr Wright, do you have any closing statements?"

Franziska gritted Phoenix's teeth, sweat forming at her brow. She was clearly used to the Judge being on her side. Having this much onus put upon her was more than she could adapt to all at once. "N-no. Your honor. I have no more statements."

"But Nick! You believe me right? I was framed!" Franziska glared at Larry in response, shutting him up instantly.

The judge merely shook his head. "With that, I declare the defendant, Larry Butz..."

"Guilty."

"He will report tomorrow for his sentence of 7 hours community service. Now if that's all then I'd like for everyone to vacate the courtroom. We have important things to get to today after all." 'Phoenix' begrudgingly nodded is head affirmatively as he stormed out of the courtroom and into the defendant lobby. Maya ran after him, confused at her boss's behavior. Larry trudged with them, similarly depressed.

"Is everything okay, Ms. Von Karma?" The judge asked.

"Y-yes, your honor," Phoenix replied, still stunned. He was SURE that Franziska would be able to find the contradiction in the witness's testimony. He himself caught it while looking over her notes, but he wasn't in a position to call it out from Franziska's body. There was no way Franziska had let him win though - her pride would forbid that. Not to mention, she seemed very upset over losing.

Phoenix mulled this over as he walked into the Prosecution's lobby, 'The prosecutor has it far too easy out there... my client's ought to really count their stars that they have me at their backs.' He took a seat on a stray couch and awkwardly waited for Franziska to switch them back, trying to keep his hands off her as he did.

"WRIGHT!" a shout rang out as the door slammed open. "This is unacceptable!"

Pheonix's eyes popped as Franziska stomped over to him. "W-what? I won, right? Isn't your record fine?"

She shook her head violently. "No, this isn't a win. Everyone else will think you lost, but I'll know the truth. All this means is that now you have a perfect record as a prosecutor, and I am a complete failure as an attorney."

Phoenix shrugged his shoulders. "Well, that's a shame and all, but you have no one to blame but yourself. If you looked at the photo from the security footage, you would've had all the evidence you needed."

This seemed to enrage Franziska even more. "Unacceptable! I cannot let myself be outdone by you again!"

Phoenix felt his heart sink. "W-what do you mean?" he asked, rubbing the back of Franziska's head.

"I mean I will not switch us back until I've won a trial as a defense attorney," Franziska replied, arms crossed. "I'll be keeping the remote as well, so you don't ruin my efforts. I simply can't let rest until I've proven that I am perfect in all pursuits."

"Wait! You don't want to do that! After all, what if I hurt your reputation?" Phoenix asked, trying to reason with her. "I've never prosecuted before today, after all."

"Hmph. My body seems to have rubbed off on you judging by your performance in the courtroom. You'll do adequately! Besides, maybe having a day to bask in perfection will do some good for you," Von Karma said snidely with a hand on her hip. "Now, I'll be heading back to your office to await a case. I expect you will handle my duties in turn. Do not tell anyone of this!" She then turned and marched out of the lobby, leaving Phoenix in total shock.

Slowly, Phoenix rose from his seat, "can't believe this..." he muttered. He was going to be trapped as a woman until Karma won a case? And a prosecutor?! That device was beginning to look like a curse...
11111111121.title: Phoenix (as Franziska)

choices: Go to the Criminal Affairs Apartment
111111111211.content:
Phoenix couldn't believe the turn things had taken, but he knew that there was nothing he could do about it until Franziska won a trial. Well, he supposed he could forcefully take the remote back and take his body, but if he did that he would surely get a face full of whip. Being in Franziska's body for a while longer was easily the better decision here. Unsure of what to do, Phoenix began to look through Franziska's things. He found her cell-phone and a wallet with her address and car keys.

Phoenix looked through Franziska's cell-phone contacts. It was a bit of a breach of privacy, but his curiosity overpowered his morals. He wanted to know what people a so called perfect prosecutor called on a normal basis. As Phoenix looked through her numbers, he couldn't help but notice that a majority of them were just labled 'Fool' with an initial next to them. He had a pretty good guess on who 'Fool P' was. However, there were two numbers that weren't labeled fool. Miles Edgeworth and Adrian Andrews. This was understandable, Edgeworth and Franziska had a sibling relationship and if Phoenix recalled correctly Adrian and Franziska were close friends. Of course, Phoenix didn't call anyone right now. He was extremely uncomfortable in Franziska body as the trial had went on. He couldn't imagine having to act like her around people who would notice her odd behavior.

He looked through her wallet next. He eyes popped as he saw the amount of money that Franziska had on her. 'why don't I get payed as much? I actually win these trials' Phoenix thought to himself. He looked for an address, but what he found was a bit surprising. Franziska didn't have a home in town at all, not even an apartment. The address he had found was for a hotel room. 'Oh yeah, she doesn't actually live in the country.' Phoenix remembered. Franziska is from germany, she was just often in town. But he hadn't expected that she was staying in a hotel room 'Actually, with all the money she makes, I shouldn't be surprised' Phoenix remembered the money he had just seen in her wallet, he couldn't imagine how much she made if she carried that much on hand. Thankfully he knew where the hotel she was staying at was it was the Gatewater Imperial Hotel, which was close to his office, which also meant if something extremely important came up and they needed to swap back quickly there should be no problem

Phoenix then looked through the last thing that Franziska had on her, her car keys. As Phoenix exited the courtroom he activated Franziska's car alarm and located her car. It was a rather expensive look red sports car, similar to Edgeworth's. 'And so the trend of prosecutor's having it better off than attorney's continues' Phoenix thought Begrudgingly. He got in the car and put the keys in the ignition. Phoenix couldn't remember the last time he had driven a car. He got a small smirk on his face as he thought of the fact that now Franziska had to ride his bike home.

Phoenix wondered what he should do now. His first thought was to go to Franziska's hotel room and just rest there for the day. That way, he wouldn't end up in any weird situations as Franziska, such as having to prosecute a trial against an actual defense attorney. Although, he wasn't sure if that was the best idea. Franziska was expecting him to do her job and it probably wouldn't be smart to anger her. On the other hand, he was still very uncomfortable in her body, it may be in his best interest to just stay at home and get used to the body before doing anything major.

His other idea was to go down to the criminal affairs department and find out if there were any court cases to work on. Either for him to prosecute as Franziska or for Franziska to take the defense for. Either way would be beneficial, if he took a case to prosecute, he would be doing Franziska's job like she asked. 'Maybe I can keep a longer perfect record than her or Edgeworth' Phoenix joked to himself. If he got a case for Franziska to take the defense in, he could find an easy case for her and hopefully get out of her body as soon as possible. Of course, going by experience, the second the name Phoenix Wright was put on a case file, the case would go from easy to near impossible.

In the end, Phoenix decided to...
111111111211.title: Follow Phoenix as Von Karma

1111111112111.content:
Phoenix was still reeling from what had happened in the courtroom. To go and track down another case right now would just leave him exhausted. If there was one good thing about this scenario, it was that he was at least in a body that could afford to relax. If Franziska wanted to be a defense attorney, then Phoenix figured he would let her do just that. He'd take the opportunity as a day off. He'd look into finding her an easy case tomorrow...

After a short drive, Phoenix found himself at the Gatewater Hotel. It wasn't a particularly pleasant place for him, just based on the memories he had, but he supposed he was lucky that it was right next to his office. If anything went wrong, he could rush on over.

Walking through the lobby, Phoenix was surprised that no one asked what he was doing there. People were usually always so distrusting of him in his old body. One of the bellboys even bowed to him as he passed! 'Is this because she's a prosecutor or because she has money?' It was certainly a nice change of pace to be so respected. He only wished it would carry over to his real body...

Phoenix made it to Franziska's hotel room without any problem. He'd been inside a Gatewater room before, but he was still surprised at how spacious it was for just being a single person's hotel room. Aside from a large bed, Franziska's room even seemed to have some furniture installed, including a nice chair, a large wooden work desk, and a bookshelf full of case files. It didn't seem standard - Phoenix had to guess that she had brought those in on her own. He could see it now; Franziska whipping some poor bellboy as he dragged that mahogany desk up the stairs. "Just hope she tipped him well..."

Pushing the logistics of the matter aside, Phoenix sat down on the mattress of Franziska's bed and pulled off her heels. Those shoes had been killing him for the past hour. It was no wonder Franziska was always in such a bad mood - he couldn't imagine anyone being upbeat while wearing those. He threw her gloves away on the mattress while he was at it. After a moment of deliberation, he hiked up her skirt and pulled her stockings off her legs as well. They were far too tight for comfort! With his legs exposed, the fact that he was in a skirt was far more pronounced. He ran a hand down her leg and shivered a bit. He was getting intrusive, but it was too late for anyone to worry about that. If Franziska was worried about her privacy, she wouldn't have let him go off alone with her body.

"If she wants me to be her, then I'm going to do it my own way," Phoenix decided as he pulled himself back to his feet. "Not my fault her ego is so fragile..." he reasoned as he walked over to a dresser to search for some clothes, undoing her neck tie as he went. "Now please, please have something casual in here..."

---

Unfortunately for Phoenix, German apparently lacked a word for 'casual'. At least, that was the only conclusion he could come to after searching through Franziska's clothing. The simplest outfit he managed to piece together was a pair of maroon pants with a prim and proper white shirt - the shoulders still puffed out for whatever reason. She didn't have an flat heeled shoes, but he did manage to find a pair of sandals with some low heels. He forewent the necktie; no reason to choke himself if he wasn't on the job after all. He looked himself over in the mirror and it was clear these were only the components to what was probably a much more complicated outfit, but he was mostly just glad to find some pants. He didn't really care to dress up so complexly the way Franziska or Edgeworth did.

'Hmm... what is Edgeworth doing come to think of it?' Phoenix wondered. He and Edgeworth were friends, but they were always a bit snippy towards eachother as a rule; it wouldn't seem very professional for them to get too friendly considering they were rivals. Now he was Edgeworth's colleague though; he was basically Edgeworth's younger sister in fact! He wondered what it'd be like to pay him a visit like this...

He had to wonder how Maya and Pearl were as well. He hoped Franziska was atleast trying to act like him, but he could wager she wasn't just based on the fact that he wasn't trying very hard to act like her so far.

"Should I maybe tell someone what's going on? Or at least check in? I wouldn't want my friends to be too off put by 'Phoenix Von Karma' after all..."

Grabbing Franziska's phone and her car keys, 'Franziska Wright' left the Gatewater hotel to go visit...
1111111112111.title: Go to Franziska's place

11111111121112.content:
Phoenix reached for the door to his office building, but wasn't quite able to grab it before it slammed open and smashed into his face. He reeled back and regained his focus to see himself pacing away from him, throwing air punches as he walked.

(Well, at least I won't have to deal with Franziska,) Phoenix thought.



"Ms. Von Karma!?" Maya yelled. "What are you doing here!?"

"I just wanted to check in," Phoenix said. "I saw that I... Mr. Phoenix Wright was pretty upset earlier.

Maya took a step back in shock, and silently eyed Phoenix down. Her eyes widened. "Oh, no, not you too!" Maya said.

"What do mean?" Phoenix asked.

"You caught the weirdo bug, too, didn't you!? I wanna go home!" Maya said, puffing her cheeks out as she sat down on the couch.

"'Too'?" Phoenix asked. "What did... that fool do?"

"Nick's being such a weirdo!" Maya said. "As soon as he stepped into court today, it's like his soul drained out of him! And then as soon as he left, he started getting really mad and acting like... kinda like you, actually!"

(Fantastic. So she hasn't been trying to act normal,) Phoenix thought to himself.

"And then, he just runs out and says 'don't follow me, your foolishness is annoying me'! I can't believe he'd say that!"

Does Phoenix explain what's going on to Maya?
11111111121112.title: Maya

111111111211121.content:
Phoenix tried to think of a way to break the news in the least alarming way possible.

"I'm sorry, Maya," Phoenix said. "I think I know what's going on here."

"Gah! You're acting weird too! Like you're Nick or something!" Maya cried. She was just about to stand up, but she stopped, eyes widening as she stared at Phoenix.

"This isn't just a coincidence! There's some kind of connection here!" Maya said, standing and walking up in Phoenix's face. "Are you two pulling some kind of prank?"

Phoenix couldn't help but laugh. "You think von Karma would go along with something like that?" Phoenix said. "What actually happened id that we switched bodies."

"...Huh...?"" Maya said. "So that would make you Nick?"

"Yes."

"Well, what happened!? What do we do!? Who switched your bodies!? How did you switch bodies!? WHAT!?"

"Maya, relax. I'll tell you everything."



After the explanation, Maya finally started to calm down.

"So..." said Maya, "until Ms. Von Karma wins a case, you're stuck like that?"

Phoenix nodded. "Or until she gets so tired of losing cases she gives up. But for some reason I don't see that happening."

"Hmm... is there anything we can do?" Maya asked.

"We could come up with some plan to get her a case she can win. Or we could just let her do what she wants."

"You can't do that, Nick! She'll ruin you!"

"... I guess so. Hmm."

They eventually came up with a plan. But... in the plan, do Phoenix and Maya stick together or split up?
111111111211121.title: Phoenix explains.

1111111112111212.content:
"Okay, Maya, here's the plan," said Phoenix. "You need to find Franziska, or, uh, me, I guess, and distract her until I can find an open-and-shut for her to take. Does that work?"

Maya clapped her hands together. "Got it, Nick! Now I just have to think of a way to distract her."

"That's a good point. She's pretty hard to keep occupied. Maybe you could get her drunk or something."

"But isn't she only twenty!? She's not legal to drink yet!"

"She is now."

"Wait..." Maya said, nose scrunched. "Oh! Ohhhh! Maybe that could work!"

"Just do whatever it takes, okay? I'll try and find a case quickly so you don't have to spend too long exposed to her... demeanor."

"Got it! See you soon, Nick!"

And on that note, they split up.

Who do we follow?
1111111112111212.title: Phoenix and Maya split up

111111111211122.content:
"Well, he must be having a bad day. After all, its rare that he loses a case, even a small one, right?" Phoenix asked, trying to rationalize Franziska' behavior for his own sake. "Maybe you should just give him some space for a day or two? I'm sure he'll feel better and apologize after that." For some reason, he couldn't bring himself to explain things to Maya. He was worried she'd just laugh about him being in a woman's body, or that she'd recommend they try something reckless. He consigned himself to just having to minimize Franziska's damage until she changed them back.

Maya was just staring at Phoenix with a look of pure confusion. "Von Karma, are you feeling alright?" Phoenix had to admit, he wasn't exactly doing much to imitate HER either, but fair was fair. "You're sounding very... rational."

Phoenix gave a nervous grin and waved a hand in front of himself. "Uh, I'm just in a good mood after winning is all! You guys only see me when I lose, right? I can be really nice when I win!"

Maya seemed to consider it for a second, still eyeing Phoenix up and down. "Hmmm, I guess you're right actually. Come to think of it, I've never seen Phoenix lose either, aside from this one time, and that guy was actually guilty. Maybe he's just a really bad sport?"

Phoenix could feel a sweat drop rolling down his face. 'Great, now she thinks I'm a sore loser.'

"Still, I don't have anything else to do if I'm not helping him out. I should go after him!" Maya exclaimed, pumping a fist n the air.

"Wait! You should really just leave him alone for now. I know the feeling after all," Phoenix insisted. "You know, uh, we never really talk that much Maya! How about you just ditch Phoenix for today and we go hang out. Does that sound alright?" Phoenix asked. He was willing to do anything to keep his friends away from Franziska rampaging with his identity.

Maya was taken aback at the suggestion. "I don't know Von Karma. Uh, you seem... great, and all, but I don't think its... professional? For us to hang out together? I do work for an attorney after all."

She was clearly making excuses, but Phoenix knew her weakness. "How about I buy dinner?" he asked blankly. 'Atleast it won't come out of my bank account this time.'

Maya's expression instantly changed to elation, and she jumped for joy. "That sounds great! Let's go! Where were you planning on going?"

Phoenix considered the landmarks around town. He just had to keep Maya busy while Franziska looked for a case right? He decided to pick someplace he knew she'd like.
111111111211122.title: Phoenix keeps quiet.

11111111121112221.content:
Phoenix chose to take Maya to Big Berry Circus, he chose this place because there he had the lowest chance of running into someone that either he or Franziska knew. Plus, the circus itself should do a good enough job at distracting Maya. "Okay, let's go to Big Berry Circus" Phoenix said to Maya.

"The Circus? You don't seem like the kind of person who enjoys the circus, Ms Von Karma." Maya said, confused.

In truth, Phoenix himself actually didn't have the fondest thoughts about the circus, especially after the last time he was there."No, I actually really like the circus, especially Big Berry Circus. A Von Karma only goes to see the greatest of performances." Phoenix said, he tried his best to imitate Franziska by citing her family name.

Maya was a bit skeptical, but she wasn't going to turn down both a free meal and an invitation to the circus. "Alright, let's go!" Maya said and grabbed Phoenix by the wrist, practically dragging him out of the office.

Despite Maya be the one who dragged them out, Phoenix was the one driving. "This is a pretty nice car, Ms. Von Karma. Nick would never get something like this, he's too much of an old grump.

'More like I don't get paid enough and what I do get paid goes to you and burgers' Phoenix thought to himself. The car ride was relatively short and the two of them soon arrived at the Big Berry Circus.

After getting tickets and going inside, Phoenix and Maya took their seats and watched the show. The circus was exactly how it was last time Phoenix was here. With an unfunny clown, to whom which Maya laughed at all his jokes, A ventriloquist with some serious issues, the young animal tamer, and of course, the circus' star and main attraction Max Galactica, the super star magician. Although Phoenix was bored for most of the show, he perked up and payed attention to Max and Regina. Both because of the major roles both of them had played in that case and because their acts were genuinely impressive.

After the show, Maya was clapping wildly, along with most of the audience. Phoenix stood up, sadly he hadn't brought a watch along with him, so he had no way of knowing the time, but he imagined that it was late in the afternoon. He imagined that Maya would be wanting that burger dinner around now.

As the two of them made their way out of the circus, a member of the circus walked up to Phoenix and Maya. It was pretty clear that they recognized Maya from the case and wanted to talk to her. Who was it?
11111111121112221.title: Berry Big Circus

111111111211122213.content: Then was it Lawrence Curls aka Moe?
111111111211122213.title: Someone else

1111111112111222132.content: Then was it the Ventriloquist duo of Benjamin Woodman and Trillo Quist?
1111111112111222132.title: Someone else

11111111121112222.content:
"You know, I've been meaning to go to the aquarium for a while," Phoenix improvised. "Think that sounds like fun? We can give Phoenix some space that way."

Maya seemed elated, giving an excited gasp. "I've been bugging Nick about that place for two weeks now! He's been stingy though and told me its too far and too expensive. You'd really take me there???"

Phoenix gave a nod. It was Franziska's car and wallet, so he was willing to do what he had to in order to keep Maya distracted from his body's incoming rampage. "We can leave now, if you'd like. It's open until late today."

Maya jumped for joy like a child, pumping her arms into the air. "Heck yes! Let's head out!"

---

A half hour or so later, the two arrived at the aquarium and were headed to the ticket counter. They had been chitchatting the whole way over and Maya seemed to forget she was with Von Karma after a certain point, almost treating Phoenix like he was himselft. It was a welcome relief for Phoenix, he needed SOMETHING familiar to grab onto.

"You know, your current outfit looks nice on you. You should wear pants more often," Maya said absently as they approached the entrance.

"Uh, thanks," Phoenix replied, a bit unsure. It was weird being complimented on your looks when you were in someone else's body. He never thought about it much, since Franziska was usually a rival, but he supposed she was actually rather attractive. Before his mind could linger on the subject, however, a loud voice broke his concentration.

"YAR MATIES! WELCOME ABOARD MY VESSEL, I BE CAPTAIN JACK SHIPLEY!" A tall, broad shouldered man stood in the middle of the building's lobby, aboard what seemed to be a small boat on wheels.

"Oh wow! Look, a pirate Nick! Er, I mean, Franzy," Maya said, correcting herself.

'Oh great. She's taking to Larry's nickname for Franziska too.' Phoenix groaned mentally.

"I've seen him before, he's part of the show!"

"I BE HEAR LOOKING FOR MORE SEADOGS FOR ME CREW! WOULD ANY OF YOU LANDLUBBERS WANT TO JUMP ABOARD AND HELP ME TAKE DOWN THAT DARNED WHALE ONCE AN' FOR ALL?" He shouted again, gesturing widely to the crowd.

"Me! Me!" One person shouted raising their hand.

"No I want to go!" another called out, jumping up and down.

"YAR, I CAN'T HEAR YOU OUT THERE! I NEED ALL YA' TO BE LOUDER!"

Maya put her hands to her face in shock, "Franzy, he's asking for volunteers! Maybe we can be in the show?!"

Phoenix felt his heart sink. "Oh no..." He covered his eardrums as Maya raised her hands skyward and broke the sound barrier.

"OVER HEAR! WE WANT TO JOIN!"

The costumed man gave a hearty laugh. "There she blows! That lovely lady has the spirit! Welcome aboard my crew miss, what be your name?"

"Maya!" she cried gleefully! "This is my friend, Franzy! Can she come too?"

"I don't see why not! Come along now, time's a'wasting!"

Maya grabbed Phoenix's hand and dragged him aboard Jack's "boat", which was soon wheeled off backstage. He couldn't imagine that Maya would warm up to 'Franziska Wright' so quickly! 'I'm far too nice... maybe I should take a cue from Von Karma next time...' he thought to himself, as he was taken away.
11111111121112222.title: Shipshape Aquarium

111111111211122221.content:
Phoenix sighed as he and Maya were brought backstage, he couldn't believe what Maya had just dragged him into. Maybe taking her to the aquarium was a bad idea after all.

As the Jack's "boat" got backstage. He began to talk to Phoenix and Maya. "Now, no two member of my crew would be caught dressed as landlubbers! Go to the crew's quarters and get into yer uniforms!"

Phoenix and Maya headed to a back room, which was filled with several pirate-like costumes and props. Phoenix looked at outfits and grimaced. He wouldn't want to be dressed up as a pirate on a normal occasion, much less dress someone else up like a pirate.

After looking at the outfits, Phoenix looked around and to his surprise, Maya had already changed. She was dressed up as a pirate, she was even wearing an eye patch and carrying a rubber sword.

"Avast, Franzy! Be quick to change, we can't be missing the ship!" Maya said, putting a bad pirate accent to her voice.

Phoenix chuckled a bit. At least Maya was happy, he chose a random outfit, stepped into a changing room, and began to change. Never in a million years did he imagine that he'd see Franziska Von Karma, prosecuting prodigy, dressed as a pirate.

Speaking of Franziska, Phoenix had to make sure that she never found out about this, he couldn't imagine what her reaction would be, but he was positive it would end in at the very least a whipping. He put on a bandanna with a skull on it and an eyepatch, hopefully no one would be able to tell that he was Franziska from a distance.

Maya was jumping up and down with excitement. Phoenix decided to put on a show for her "Ahoy, matey Maya, let's get to the ship!" He said with half enthusiasm.

Suddenly, Jack Shipley entered the room, practically shouting "ARE YOU TWO LANDLUBBERS PROPER SEADOGS YET?"

Maya saluted with the rubber sword she had picked up "Aye, Captain!"

Jack laughed "AND WHAT ABOUT YOU, LASS?" He said to Phoenix.

"Um, Aye Captain." Phoenix said, once again regretting bringing Maya to the aquarium.

"ALRIGHT, MATEYS, FOLLOW ME TO THE SHIP! WHEN THE SHOW BEGINS, JUST FOLLOW MY LEAD, OR WALK THE PLANK!" Jack said, walking out of the room. Phoenix and Maya followed closely behind.

The show was about to begin...
111111111211122221.title: Maya and Phoenix go Backstage

choices: "... I don't have any time for something like that."
1111111112111222212.content:
"Hahahaha!" Maya laughed happily as shoved Phoenix off a gangplank an into the water, causing a massive splash as he plunged below. With some nudges from the crew's trained orca, he made his way to the back of the stage, dragging himself onto land where he was out of sight of the audience and could shiver himself dry elsewhere.

"Avast! Excellent job first mate Maya! It seems that the Dread Pirate Franzy has been defeated!" He turned to the audience at home and gave gave them some spiel about how Phoenix -who had been deemed the villain of the show - had been taken away by Ora the whale to Pirate Jail or something equally silly. The captain was very impressed by 'Franziska's' appearance, and seemed to think she was perfect for the role of villainess. Thankfully, Phoenix went to artschool long enough to be able to act his way through the show satisfactorily. Maya herself seemed so thrilled by the whole thing she nearly forgot she was spending her afternoon with Von Karma of all people.

As an attendant brought a drenched Phoenix a towel behind the stage, there was a large round of applause from the audience as Maya and the Captain finished up the show. A mass of footsteps could be heard as they were presumably funneled into a gift shop somewhere.

"That was impressive," the attendant said, in a soft voice. Phoenix turned his head to her as he dried off his hair. She was in costume as well - with a light blue shirt rolled up beneath her chest and darker blue hair that draped past her shoulders. Around her neck was an anchor necklace. "It was... Franziska, right?"

"Wright? Who told you that???" Phoenix asked, worry in his voice. Who could possibly know?

"Er, I hear outside? It is Franziska - right? Or did you prefer Franzy?" She seemed a bit confused.

"Oh, uh, sorry, I misunderstood. Er, yeah... I'm Franziska," Phoenix replied

She extended a hand, which Phoenix hesitantly shook. "Well, I wanted to say you did a great job! I usually have to come in to do some backup but you held your own out there. Have you acted before?"

Phoenix was willing to bet that the answer was no for Franziska. "No but, I uh, do a lot of public speaking at work."

"Ah, I guess that explains it then," she replied. She looked back to the stage, where Maya and the Captain were making their way back to the rest. "Well, I'll let you get changed. We should talk more afterwards though. That sound fine?"

"O-okay," Phoenix replied, not really sure how to act he quickly scurried off to the changing room. He closed his eyes as he peeled the soaked pirate outfit off of Franziksa's body, suddenly feeling quite cold and exposed as he stood in the room still wet and nearly naked. He opened his eyes again to search for his towel and his face flushed red as he saw Franziska's body in the mirror, wearing nothing but her underwear, in a mirror before him - her hair also very messy after his time in the water.

With a high pitched yelp, he quickly clamped his eyes shut once again. "I don't want to give her a reason to be mad at me - she's too young anyways!" Phoenix told himself as he located the towel in the dark and quickly dried off again. The sensations were a bit much for him. He could only hope Franziska was being just as overwhelmed right now - maybe it'd push her into giving up faster.

Satisfied with how dry he was, he quickly rushed to change into the dry clothes he brought. Getting his lower body dressed was simple enough but as he struggled to hook a bra, the door to the changing room slammed open.

"Ahoy Franzy!" Maya shouted jubilantly, causing Phoenix to jump and drop the bra, arms akimbo as he was shocked by the sudden entrance. Maya just laughed it off, "gee Von Karma, I never knew you had a fun side to you - we ought to let you win more often. Oh! Maybe I should go on a case with you some time instead of Nick!"

Phoenix, redder than a tomato, quickly bent down to scoop up the lost garment, facing away from Maya to preserve some sense of modesty. "Uh, you don't have to stress so much - we're both girls here."

"Er, yeah, you just surprised me was all," Phoenix murmured as he got back to the task from before. His fingers twitched with anxiety, which only made it harder to pull off, but he lucked out and heard a satisfying snap as he hooked it into place. He turned around with a sigh of relief, but as he made to grab the shirt he brought he quickly jerked his head away again as he was greeted with the sight of Maya similarly disrobing from her costume.

'Can never let her know about this,' Phoenix made a note as Maya just sorta stared at him quizzically.

"Are you feeling okay Franziska? You look really red. I'd hate to learn your good mood has just been a fever or something," she said bluntly.

Phoenix shook a hand in front him, trying to keep up simple eye contact. "No! Uh, not at all. I'm just, turning over a new leaf you know. Edgeworth won when he got nicer too so uh, I'm trying the same. I'm just, uh..."

"Not used to having friends?" Maya offered.

"Yeah! Sure," Phoenix agreed. "So uh, just be patient I guess is what I'm saying."

"You got it, dude!" She replied with a thumbs up as she returned to taking off her shorts, giving Phoenix a moment to turn back around and button up Franziska's shirt.

"So I was talking to the lady who handles the animals - Azura. She said we did great!" Maya continued as Phoenix kept his view tilted towards the ceiling.

"Yeah, well, I'm glad you had a good time too," Phoenix idly replied, only half paying attention.

"She said they're having a filming crew come by for a show tomorrow - so that they have some clips for a commercial or something. She wanted to know if we'd come back for it! I know you're working slowly at this, but what do you think?"

Phoenix's face went blank at that. 'No way would Von Karma ever forgive me if I did that as her. She'd probably never forgive me if she learned about the past hour or two at all, but atleast that isn't on video.'

"Well, she said it'd be easy. We'd mostly just stand for most of it while she does the hard work."

'But... if she thought I was embarrassing her she'd certainly give up this game... maybe the whip lashes would be worth the chance?'

"Uh, Franzy?"

Phoenix shook his head, frizzy hair shaking about as he did. "Uh, well Maya..."
1111111112111222212.title: After the show

choices: The Following Day at the Prosecutor's Office
11111111121112222121.content:
Phoenix didn't really want this to get any further out of hand than it was. "I'm a prosecutor - I have a serious reputation to uphold. Besides, I could be called to handle a case at any moment - I don't have time for a lark like that again."

Maya, who had thankfully finished getting dressed by this point, pouted at this. "Oh come on! What about law school makes you all so stodgy?"

Phoenix crossed Franziska's arms and shook his head again. "Sorry, but that's how it is. You understand, right? You and er, Mr. Wright are always interrupted by cases. Right?"

Maya looked down dejectedly, "Yeah I guess... actually, that gives me a different idea."

Phoenix could feel an eyebrow twitch in worry. "W-what?"

Maya leaned forward with a wry grin, "how about I be your assistant for a case? Give Nick a chance to cool down. I bet you'd win again with me! I'm the real brains of Wright and Co. after all."

"Uh huh," Phoenix replied skeptically. "Well, Prosecutors are supposed to work with Detectives, you know that right? You're just a civilian."

Maya puffed up her cheeks defiantly. "We break the rules all the time though! The police let Nick and I investigate crime scenes all the time. Honestly you'd think after this long they'd stop putting Gumshoe on Phoenix's cases."

Phoenix grimaced a bit - her logic held up. 'Maybe I'll be better off with company anyways, and keeping Maya and Pearl out of Franziska's crosshairs,' he told himself. "...Alright, fine. You can come to my office tomorrow and lend a hand, and we'll see how things go."

Maya smiled in delight and gave Phoenix an unexpected hug. "I never thought you of all people would turn out to be so cool, Franziska! I'd always wanted to make more friends my age y'know. Nick and Edgeworth are nice, but they're still just old dudes. No fun!"

'I'm barely older than you!' Phoenix shouted mentally, barely hiding the indignance on his face. Maya didn't seem to notice as she twirled around and skipped out of the room however. "I gotta go tell Nick! I'll see you tomorrow!"

"Is she really so desperate for female friends that she'd want to spend a day with Von Karma...?" Phoenix murmured. He kinda felt bad in a way - living in Khurain Village must've limited her social life a bit. He supposed he would never have met her at all if it weren't for her older sister. "Well, I hope she doesn't get used to it."
11111111121112222121.title: "... I don't have any time for somethin...

choices: ...in Franziska’s familiar black and white dress suit.
111111112.content:
...At least, that was his original intent. But the more he thought about it, he started to realize that he didn’t really need to use the remote to get an advantage over Franziska. Sure, being in the same courtroom as her was always a tough battle, but generally, he tended to have both luck and the truth on his side.

Actually, now that he thought about it, there was one thing he could do without: that whip of hers. If he could somehow get rid of that whip without changing how they would proceed with the trial, then he would be completely fine.

With that in mind, he switched the remote over to “Unaware Swap,” so that people wouldn’t think anything was off. He aimed the remote at himself, pressed the button, then pointed it at where Franziska was cracking her whip threateningly at two interns and pressed the button again.

Instantly, Phoenix noticed an assortment of differences in his body. He saw that his vision was closer to the ground, he felt his new hair on his ears, he didn’t feel something familiar in his nether regions...

He looked down at himself to find himself...
111111112.title: Unaware Swap

1111111122.content:
...wearing Franziska’s usual outfit: a black dress suit with teal diamond-shaped buttons and white sleeves with puffy shoulders. On his collar lay a white bow, and on his hands was a pair of black gloves. His legs, now bare thanks to the skirt of his dress suit, was covered in a pair of black nylon stockings, and on his feet was a pair of black high heeled ankle boots.

On his old body, of course, that entire getup would look incredibly weird. But with his new body, everything fit perfectly.

Suddenly remembering his entire purpose for switching in the first place, Phoenix felt around his side and found Franziska’s whip hanging off it. He looked around for the remote (Franziska’s clothes didn’t have pockets, so he was concerned where it was), before spying a purse with a similar coloration and design to Franziska’s dress suit, with a black body and teal diamonds all over it. Opening it up, he breathed an internal sigh of relief as he saw it contained everything he had in his pockets, including both his wallet, the magatama, and the remote.

Maya’s voices snapped him back to reality. “Franny? Are you almost done? Phoenix looks like she’s getting impatient...”

Hmm. So Unaware Swaps change his name, but not the gender the world sees him as? Filing that thought away for later, Phoenix shook his head. “Yeah, just give me a few minutes and I’ll be ready.”

11111111222.content:
The trial, all things considered, went incredibly smoothly. Compared to Phoenix’s other experiences with Franziska, that is. Sure, there were needless complications with the testimonies of the witnesses, but without Franziska’s whip hanging down his back, ready to strike at a single mistake or correct deduction, Phoenix found the trial moving along very quickly. Before long, Larry was declared “Not Guilty, and the real culprit was found within the list of witnesses.

Phoenix lowered the remote. Actually, he was pretty curious about just how his life had been changed after switching with Franziska. Sure, he could try it with literally anyone else, but why not? He already had done the swap, after all, and he knew he’d be seeing Franziska again soon.

So put the remote away and turned around, heading off with Maya to get some burgers.
111111112222.title: Deciding to stick with this for a while

choices: Don't tell Maya/Test out the remote on Maya
1111111122221.content:
Phoenix and Maya had a nice time eating at a new burger place that just opened up a few blocks away from the Wright and Co. Law Offices. After that, Phoenix needed to go drop off some documents at said law office, and so Maya decided to tag along.

Phoenix worked at his computer while Maya busied herself taking care of Charley. After a few minutes, the case was filed in his records, and he was left pondering over an odd thought: Should he tell Maya about this device?

On one hand, she might find the concept weird, or try to limit what he could potentially do with it. On the other hand, it could be useful to see how the remote's functions are viewed by other people. And who knows? She might think the whole thing's pretty cool.

Alternatively, he could try and mess around by using the remote on Maya instead, maybe try out one of the other functions.
1111111122221.title: At the Wright and Co. Law Offices

11111111222211.content:
"Hey, Maya? Could you, uh, come here for a sec?" Phoenix asked as he silently reached into his purse and brought out the remote.

"Sure thing, Franny! What is it?"

~~~A few minutes later~~~

"So, wait, let me just get this straight. You're actually Phoenix."

"Yes."

"You used this remote thingy to trade bodies with Franny, but no one else is aware about this except for you."

"And now you too, Maya."

"Right. This also swapped your names, but not your lives, so in the real world, the person who saved me from jail was actually Phoenix–er, you–and the really mean prosecutor is actually supposed to be Franny?"

"That's correct."

"Okay... so, I immediately have one question."

"What's that?"

"WHY WOULD YOU DO SUCH A CONFUSING THING?!" Maya put her hands up to her head, grimacing in (maybe slightly exaggerated) pain. "My brain is on fire right now trying to figure this all out! I'm trying to sort out which memories are of Franny and should be for Phoenix, and which ones are of Phoenix and should be for Franny, but do I need to do that? After you switch back, will that mess up my memories of the both of you? Actually, speaking of that, why would I be calling her Franny if I apparently don't even know her beyond "that mean prosecutor lady!" What nickname did I give you?!"

"Woah, woah, Maya, calm down!" Phoenix put both hands up placatingly. "I told you about this because I wanted to know, from someone I trust, exactly how using this remote would affect the average person. That's all! I didn't mean anything by it. And as for why..." Phoenix unhooked Franziska's whip from his waist. "You see this? When we're in our normal bodies, Franziska loves to use this. During trials. On me. And she terrifies the judge, so he lets her get away with that. I decided that, if I was going to test this thing out, I'd want to make sure that I maximize the chances of me not getting grievously injured."

After calming down thanks to Phoenix's explanations, Maya looked at him for a few seocnds, then sighed. "I always wondered why you liked to bring that whip everywhere you go. Now I know that it's not technically you doing that." She turned her attention back to the remote. "So, what do we do now with this thing?"

"That's what I was trying to figure out. Obviously we should give Franziska back her body at some point, but I'd rather do that at the end of the next meeting we have with her because of the whole whip thing. Aside from that, there are still three other options that we could test out on this remote."

"Hmm..." Maya put a hand up to her cheek in thought.

Phoenix decided to go with...
11111121.title: Maya

111111211.content:
Phoenix thought about it and soon came to the conclusion that the safest option for a first test would be an aware body swap. It was the most self explanatory option and would be easy to pull off. He pointed the remote at Maya and pressed the aware swap button, registering her as the first target.

"Huh? You pressed the button, but nothing happened! Was the remote a dud after all?" Maya said, a bit upset that nothing had happened yet.

"I only selected you as the first target." Phoenix began to explain. "I just need to select someone else for you to swap with next."

Phoenix began thinking about who to swap Maya with. He ruled himself out, the trial was about to begin and the last thing he needed was Maya taking his place for him.

The first person to come to mind was Larry, Phoenix had a feeling that Larry was going to be called to the stand. Knowing Larry, he would end up making himself look more guilty than any bit of evidence that the prosecution could present. Maybe if Maya was in Larry's body they could get a bit of an advantage, if the prosecution called Larry to the stand expecting him to incriminate himself and Maya acted like a regular person while in Larry's body, it may throw off the prosecution's plans.

The next person to come to mind was the prosecutor herself, Franziska Von Karma. Franziska always put up a near perfect prosecution whenever she was on the case. Phoenix had a feeling that despite this just being a small Larceny case she would put up as much of a fight as usual. If he switched Maya with her, than he may be able to 'even' the playing field. However, this plan had one fatal flaw, Franziska being in Maya's body. Not only would they have to explain the remote to Franziska, but he would probably have to face her whip when she got back to her own body.

Another possibility that came into his mind was swapping Maya with the Judge. Phoenix doubted that Maya would like becoming someone as old as the Judge, even if it was only temporary. However, if she became the Judge, then they would be guaranteed a 'Not guilty' verdict. All Maya in the Judge's body would have to do is sit back for a while and then give the verdict when she is ready.

With these three possibilities in mind, Phoenix chose to swap Maya with...
111111211.title: A Body Swap

1111112111.content:
Now that he had selected Maya as the first target for the swap, Phoenix aimed the remote at Larry and pressed the aware swap button once again. In a moment Larry and Maya were swapped into each other's bodies.

Maya let out a shriek once she noticed who she had become and began to feel herself all over. "C'mon Nick! You could have at least put me in Von Karma's body!" Maya said, feeling Larry's goatee.

Phoenix rubbed the back of his head. "Well, uh, once she got back to her own body she probably would have whipped us to hell and back." Phoenix said, carefully choosing his words so he did aggravate Maya.

Maya felt Larry's hair "Woah! I have an even more ridiculous haircut than you now." Maya said than laughed.

Phoenix was going to say something back, but he was interrupted by the sound of Larry in Maya's body. Similar to Maya, he was feeling his new body all over, although he was more panicky due to not knowing how he was suddenly inside of a girl's body.

After a quick explanation of the remote to Larry, Larry seemed to get excited. "Woah! So that little thing could swap bodies? Sweet! Let me try, Nick!" Larry begged Phoenix from inside Maya's body.

"Not now, we have a trial to get ready for." Phoenix said and put the remote in his pocket. "Maya, do you remember what Larry told us at the detention center"

Maya bounced up and down with glee "Sure do, Larry was going on a date, but the girl stood him up. He was walking around town yelling aloud about stuff when he happened to stumble across the scene of the crime. When the police asked if he saw anything, he went on one of his usual rants and they arrested him because his random gibberish was suspicious!" Maya recapped the night of the crime based on what Larry told them.

"Good, now just make sure you stick to that if the prosecution questions you. Don't go off on random tangents." Phoenix explained.

"So, don't act like Larry?" Maya questioned jokingly

"Exactly." Phoenix responded to her and they both laughed,

"What do I do?" Larry asked. "You have some important job for me, right?"

Phoenix looked to Larry. "Uh, yeah, you, uh, have the most important job of all. You, uh, get to be my assistant for the day." Phoenix said to Larry.

"Great! I won't let you down Nick! I'll do whatever an assistant does better than any assistant you've ever had!" Larry said with a thumbs up.

A few minutes later, they were all called into the courtroom. Maya in Larry's body stood at the defendant's stand while Phoenix and Larry in Maya's body stood at the defense desk. On the opposite side of the room, Franziska Von Karma was standing at the prosecutor's desk preparing for the upcoming trial. Phoenix whispered to Larry. "please don't say anything else like that, I don't Maya to be too mad at me for letting you into her body." Phoenix told Larry and then began to cross examine Maya.

As Phoenix was talking about how 'Larry couldn't have been there at that time' or something like that, Larry got an idea. He saw the remote and manual hanging slightly out of Phoenix's pocket, Maybe he could use the remote to end the trial a bit early? The thought was tempting, after some thinking it over, Larry decided to...

Much to Maya's abhorrence, Phoenix had a point. If she stayed as detective Gumshoe, she could ask people whether or not they saw Gumshoe in her body. Phoenix and Maya didn't even walk halfway down the hallway before Maya began to complain about being in Gumshoe's body. "Ugh, NIck! You have no idea how hard it is to be in a body that is so different from your own!"

Phoenix had a bit of an angry twitch "Trust me Maya, I know the feeling." He said with a bit of a grudge in his borrowed voice

As they reached the end of the hallway, they saw the elevator open. waiting inside of it was Edgeworth. "Ah, Ms. Fey. I could have sworn you ran away from the garage in tears."

Not wanting to spend time explaining the whole 'I'm not Maya, I'm Maya's twin sister' story to Edgeworth, Phoenix decided to just play along and pretend that he was Maya. "Uh, yeah, I did. I actually came up the stairs after I ran from the garage" Phoenix made up an excuse

"Well then, I assume that you passed on what I said to the good detective here." Edgeworth inquired

Edgeworth sighed "Fine, I may as well repeat myself. The good detective is here anyway." He turned to Maya in Gumshoe's body. "That car damage will cost tens of thousands to repair. I'm sorry, but I'm afraid I may have to let you go." Edgeworth said. It seemed that Phoenix and Maya were right in their guess that Gumshoe was fired. As Phoenix and Maya stood dumbstruck, Edgeworth walked by them. "I expect you to bring your badge to my office in about..." Edgeworth paused as if to think for a second "Four hours" He finished. As he walked by, Phoenix could have sworn he saw a slight smirk on Edgeworth's face.

"What are you doing?!" Phoenix exclaimed in a whisper

"I'm teaching Edgeworth a lesson. I'm going to shapeshift him. My body's shape is still saved on the remote. I'll just change him and we'll leave using the elevator before he even knows what's happening. He can deal with being someone else while we find Gumshoe" Maya said, angry at Edgeworth.

Phoenix considered letting Maya do it, just as a small bit of payback. However, something wasn't sitting right. He couldn't take his mind off of that smirk Edgeworth made and it seemed odd that Edgeworth would want Gumshoe to turn in his badge in a few hours, rather than taking it immediately. Perhaps he should stop Maya and let the situation play out naturally. At the same time though, it may be good to let Maya vent off some of her frustration, the investigation into where Gumshoe is may take longer if Maya is too busy thinking about how angry she is rather than focusing on where Gumshoe is.

In the end he decided to.....

With a grin on Gumshoe's face, Maya quickly ran back to the elevator where Phoenix was waiting. 1111112121222212121112111122112.title: Maya

11111121212222121211121111221122.content:
It was absolutely inexplicable. One moment, Edgeworth was in his office, doing paperwork as normal. The next, he was half his height, wearing a set of acolyte robes, and... most notably, female.
He burst through the door to speak to Detective Gumshoe and Ms. Fey, but instead found the two of them going down the elevator... and Gumshoe was smirking? That didn't bode well. In fact, that their faces were anything but shocked at the sight of him was horrifying. A rush of unnecessary feelings ran through his, or Maya's, body.

The only reason they would have to not be surprised at the sight is if they knew it was going to happen. Unless it hadn't registered to either of them, yet. The good detective was always a bit slow. But that doesn't explain the smirk. The smirk formed specifically upon Gumshoe seeing him in his current state. That means he was not only expecting it, but was happy to see it. Gumshoe must have caused this. Was it some sort of petty revenge? Was not taking his badge just then a mistake? Could Gumshoe even be trusted with a badge if he was a man willing to break the laws of the universe to turn him into someone he wasn't for petty revenge?

He wasn't himself. That hadn't hit him until just then. He would be considered missing, and any attempts to claim he was Miles Edgeworth would be brushed aside and he'd be locked in an insane asylum. (Another Fey to be locked up,) he supposed. But... if he was locked up, would the police assume he had escaped if they saw the real Maya Fey walking around like nothing was odd? Would she be placed under arrest as well?

Did he deserve to be placed in an insane asylum? Was he hallucinating all of this? Was he hallucinating that he was ever Miles Edgeworth to begin with? Was there even a person known as Miles Edgeworth?

He looked back into his office. It was the same as before. He checked a signed document from years and years ago. It still bore his name, Edgeworth noted with a loud sigh. At least he wasn't insane on that front.

Edgeworth considered his options. He could wait where he was and hope those came back and tried to fix everything. But he could also leave. He could go down and confront the two, or maybe even make good on that whole asylum idea. Perhaps proving whether or not he was of sound mind would do him good.

What did he do?
11111121212222121211121111221122.title: Follow a confused Edgeworth

111111212122221212111211112211221.content:
While Edgeworth wanted to go out and search for Gumshoe and Ms. Fey, he decided against that. He had no idea where they were going and by the time he either climbed downstairs or took the next elevator down, they would be long gone and the last thing he wanted to be doing was blindly walking around the city in an unfamiliar body. The only thing he could do for now was wait in his office and hope that they came back, hopefully sooner rather than later.

Edgeworth was still panicked about the situation, but there wasn't exactly much he could do about that. The best thing to do for now was calm down. He chose to attempt to take his mind off of the situation and continue doing his paperwork. Hopefully by the time he had finished, Gumshoe and Ms. Fey would have come back.

For about half and hour he attempted to focus on his paperwork, however things like Maya's long hair coming into his eyes, stray itches that would highlight how different the body felt, and the occasional breeze coming into the office made it nearly impossible for him to focus.

Deciding to no longer even attempt to do his paperwork, Edgeworth opened his laptop and decided to do what he always did when he felt stressed and needed to relax, watch a few episodes of the Steel Samurai.

He spent a good while enjoying the show, not even the strange differences with his body could tak his mind off the show. Although as he watched, his mind wandered and he began to wonder about something, what would he do if someone other than Gumshoe and Ms. Fey showed up at his office? He couldn't imagine himself having to explain the situation to Kay and anyone else he had met over time.

As if someone had been listening to his thoughts, he saw the door to his office turn and someone began to enter, who was here?
111111212122221212111211112211221.title: Edgeworth stays in his office and waits.

Make up a reason for Maya to be in his office.

"Mr. Edgeworth! Look!" Said a voice from just outside the hallway. Edgeworth recognized the voice as Kay Faraday's. This was bad.

Kay opened the door to Edgeworth's office, holding a life-sized replica of the Jammin' Ninja's signature red guitar. 111111212122221212111211112211221211.content:
Edgeworth knew that no matter what kind of excuse that he gave her, Kay would end up forcing him out of his own office anyway. The only option here would be to tell her, no matter how insane it may sound, the truth.

"Kay, I'm going to need you to listen for a few minutes. I am Miles Edgeworth." Edgeworth began to explain. He could see Kay begun to roll her eyes, that would be a normak reaction to hearing an outrageous statement like that.

Edgeworth spent the next few minutes explaining to Kay everything that had happened. It somehow sounded even crazier now that he had said it aloud. It was clear that Kay didn't believe a single word of it.

"Uh-huh. If you're Mr. Edgeworth, prove it." Kay said in a mocking voice.

Kay took a short brake from her laughing. "Sorry, I just can't believe that you're a. a, a, a teenage girl!!" Her sentence kept getting interrupted by her own giggling.

Edgeworth supposed that from an outsider's respective, this situation could be seen as a bit humorous. However, as the one who was directly involved, he couldn't find any humor in this.

Kay got a huge smile on her face "Well, let's go!"

Edgeworth was confused "Go? What do you mean go?"

"This could be my only chance! You're always so grumpy and fun hating. Maybe going out and having fun with someone who is, now, close to your age will loosen you up a bit." Kay stated her plan

"No. I have already decided that I am going to wait here in the office until Gumsho returns." Edgeworth refused.

Kay got a devilish grin "You know, security might not like it if the were told that a teenage girl was hanging around Mr. Edgeworth's office while he was gone."

"You wouldn't dare do that."

Kay rubbed her nose "I'm the great Yatagarasu, and I will still that grumpiness away from you" She joked.

Edgeworth could tell that she was serious. She probably wouldn't relent. However, he was unsure about leaving his office. He hadn't been keeping track of time since his body changed. What if Gumshoe were to come back while he was gone?

In the end, he decided to....
111111212122221212111211112211221211.title: Tell Kay what happened to him.

1111112121222212121112111122112212111.content:
"I don't suppose I have much choice in the matter. Very well."

"All right! We're going out on the town!" Kay said, grabbing Edgeworth's now smaller hands. Edgeworth let out a groan as he was pulled out of his office.

"Oh, by the way, what do I call you?" Asked Kay as they began to make their way through the city.

"Miles Edgeworth, please," Edgeworth said.

Kay shook her head. "Not going to happen, buster! You're not Miles Edgeworth anymore, so I'm not calling you that."

"Please do call me that, Kay." Edgeworth pleaded.

"No, no... who did you say you were? Maya Fey? Then it's settled!"

"... Nnngh! Fine!" Edgeworth said. He was going to regret that decision, he thought. He shot a cold glare in Kay's direction.

"You know, I can't believe I didn't believe you really were Edgeworth at first. Your stuffiness and chilly glare transcends your vessel!"

Edgeworth crossed his arms. "... Am I to take that as a compliment?"

"Yeah, of course, Maya!" Kay said with a wink.

And so the two went out for food. Kay decided that wherever they went, it had to have a vending machine with swiss rolls. By sheer coincidence, or perhaps by the sheer power of Maya's appetite, Edgeworth felt a craving for hamburger for the first time in what might have been decades while in Maya's body.

It wasn't too hard to find a place that suited both their needs, and as Maya's stomach filled, so did Edgeworth’s brain fill with worry. Worry, primarily about what would happen if the good detective returned to his office in his absence, made him struggle to focus on the moment. Despite this, he was able to maintain a conversation. But even his worry couldn't prevent him from noticing that Kay was suspiciously intrigued with him.

Near the end of the meal, Kay gave Edgeworth a sheepish look and quietly got his attention.

"If I may be honest with you, Mr. Edgeworth," said Kay. "The main reason I wanted to do this whole 'going out' thing was because I was trying to make sure it really was you."

Somehow, that information surprised Edgeworth less than it would have had the two of them known each other for a shorter period.

"But here's the thing. Now that I'm fully convinced," said Kay, "I think I want to hang out some more! This has been super fun!"

"Really, now?" Edgeworth asked.

"What do you want to do, 'Maya'?"

Does Edgeworth go against his better judgment and continue to hang out with Kay? Not a smart tactical move, but it's possible he may be having fun himself, in his own way.
1111112121222212121112111122112212111.title: Go with Kay

choices: They end up going somewhere Kay wants to go
Someone comes up to Edgeworth, thinking he's Maya
11111121212222121211121111221122121112.content:
Edgeworth figured that he had spent enough time 'Hanging out' with Kay, It must be close to the time that he had told Gumshoe to report to the office by now. Sadly, Maya's body lacked a watch. Thankfully, the eatery that him and Kay had stopped at had a clock on the wall. The time he had asked Gumshoe to eat with him was......Nearly an hour ago?! He should have expected that this would have happened, he hadn't even checked the time before he had left the office with Kay.

While he could go back to his office and check if Gumshoe was there, he knew that would be a waste of time. Gumshoe wasn't the kind of person to stand around when waiting for Edgeworth. Edgeworth had suspicions that Gumshoe had caused this transformation, and if he did then the chance that he was waiting for Edgeworth at the office was even smaller. He imagined if Gumshoe were the one to cause it, especially if the real Maya had helped him, he would want to see his handiwork or himself and go out to search town for Edgeworth.

Edgeworth figured he'd attempt to call Gumshoe.........unfortunately it seemed that either when his body had Shapeshifted into Maya's he didn't get a copy of her phone like he got a copy of her clothes or she wasn't carrying one on her when the Shapeshift had happened. This meant that the only way he would have to contact him would be to use a spare phone he had kept at his office.

It seemed that Kay was patiently waiting for Edgeworth to answer her. She looked eager to be around him. Even if he went back to the office and called up Gumshoe, it would be late at night by the time he made the call. Maybe it would be best to indulge to Kay's desire and spend a little more time with her?

"Alright Kay, I'll spend a little bit more time with you." Edgeworth finally replied to Kay.

Kay was ecstatic. She grabbed Edgeworth and practically began dragging him out of the eatery and down the sidewalk "Thanks so much 'Maya'! I promise, we'll so much fun, even you will have to smile!"

Kay was clearly excited. Edgeworth had a feeling that they were going to be out until she tired herself out, which knowing Kay, would be a very long time.
11111121212222121211121111221122121112.title: Edgeworth doesn't return quite yet.

Do they find the detective in the time allotted?

11111121212222121211121111221211.content:
Gumshoe kept his house address on a piece of paper in his pocket. It wasn't the best-kept of secrets. Either way, that was one of the duo's first stops. They approached the door of his apartment, leaving mudprints over twenty other sets of them.

Knock knock.

"Go away!" Shouted a teenage girl from inside the apartment.

"Detective Gumshoe? Are you in there?" Said Maya.

There was silence.

"Aw... now I'm hearing myself talk. My voice is terrible! No wonder I got fired!" Gumshoe said. He sounded weaker than usual.

"No, no, Gumshoe, I'm Maya. I'm in your body, remember?"

"Oh, the Fey twins? Aw, jeez. I'm sorry I ran off with your body, Ms. Fey. I kinda got a little overwhelmed." Gumshoe said, his voice muffled by the door.

"We heard. We're sorry, Detective." Maya said.

"Oh, uh... thanks. I appreciate that."

"... Are you ready to come out?" Maya asked.

"Nah, pal. I'm feelin' a little down right now, I hope you can understand."

"Yeah, I guess I do. But... Edgeworth wanted you to go into his office in about three hours from now, and-"

"I don't wanna talk to him!" Gumshoe yelled.

More silence.

"Maybe you could clear things up with him, y'know? Like, maybe if you expl-"

"There's no way it'd work pal, you know that." Gumshoe said.

"If I may interject here," said Phoenix, "I think Edgeworth might be hiding something."

"... Hiding something? Whaddaya mean, pal?" Asked Gumshoe, his voice momentarily regaining it's usual... presence.

"I mean, that there might be more to this than just you getting fired for breaking a car. Are you sure you don't want to come out?"

What does Gumshoe decide?
11111121212222121211121111221211.title: Meeting with Cry-a Fey.

111111212122221212111211112212112.content:
"I'm sorry Pal, but I won't come out now." Gumshoe said apologetically.

"Why not?!?!" Maya practically yelled, not happy with how Gumshoe was staying inside, and therefore not giving back her body.

"I don't want to face Mr. Edgeworth right now. You think that he's hiding something, but why would he do that?" Gumshoe questioned

Phoenix wanted to answer, but he didn't have any proof of what he thought Edgeworth was hiding. He had a feeling about what was really going on here, but he needed evidence. "I don't know, but if you just switch back and go see Edgeworth, you can find out for yourself."

"No way, Pal!" Gumshoe yelled back.

Maya was fuming, she was practically trying to break down the door. She was really sick of being in Gumshoe's body. "Gumshoe! Come out here right now!"

There was no response from Gumshoe, it seemed he was ignoring them at this point.

Maya stopped trying to get inside and sighed "What are we going to do now?" She asked Phoenix.

Phoenix gave it some thought, it was clear that they wouldn't be able to get Gumshoe to come out and listen to Edgeworth. He was too afraid to face him. After a bit more thinking, Phoenix had an idea. "Well, you better get ready to go and see Edgeworth." He said to Maya.

Maya was a bit shocked "What? Why do I have to go, he broke the car!" She said

"He's too afraid of being fired to come out, but I don't think Edgeworth's going to fire him. You just need to go and see Edgeworth for him, okay?" Phoenix explained.

Maya grumbled a bit "Fine. I'll do it." She was a bit bummed out. She wanted to go twinning today, but she ended up having to spend most of the day in Gumshoe's body.

There was still a about two and a half hours left until Maya/Gumshoe had to go and meet Edgeworth in his office, Phoenix and Maya decided to go back to Phoenix's office and wait their until it was time to go and see Edgeworth.
111111212122221212111211112212112.title: Gumshoe doesn't come out.

Edgeworth was seated at his desk as Maya opened the door to his office.

"Ah, Detective, you've arrived," said Edgeworth. "How... unexpectedly punctual, given the circumstances."

"I just want to get it over with... pal," said Maya. The "pal" had a little bite behind it.

"Hmph. Well..."

What does Edgeworth say?
1111112121222212121112111122121121.title: Nothing happens while they wait

11111121212222121211121111221211211.content:
"Take a seat, Detective Gumshoe."

Maya complied. Somehow, Maya wasn't sure that "posessed" was the best state Gumshoe's body could be in for what could be a somewhat intimate conversation. Edgeworth stood up, leaving Maya seated.

"Now, I have what you may see as good news. The damages to my car were greatly exaggerated. Repair costs may only be in the hundreds."

"H-hundreds?" Maya asked.

"Indeed. Incredibly cheap, relatively speaking. The costs could be covered with even a few months of your salary, which, make no mistake, will be used in part to cover the repair costs. But this also means one other thing."

"Yeah, Mr. Edgeworth? What is it?"

"It also means that I was exaggerating your punishment."

Maya gasped. She was almost as shocked, and overjoyed, about the news as the good detective would have been himself.

"To be clear, this won't go unpunished," said Edgeworth. "This will not be a good point on your record, and I fear your next salary review will go so poorly that not even I look forward to it. But you were never fired. All of this was simply to teach you about the consequences of your actions," said Edgeworth.

"Yay! Thanks, Mr. Edgeworth!" Maya said, standing up and wrapping her now-huge arms around Edgeworth.

Edgeworth's brow furrowed. "If you could release me before I really do have you fired."

Maya jolted back. "Uh, understood Mr. Edgeworth. Thanks."

Maya exited the office with a huge grin.

"So, it went well, I'm guessing?" Phoenix asked.

"Gumshoe's keeping his job, Nick!" Maya answered.

"Well, that's good to hear," said Phoenix. "I guess we should give Detective Gumshoe the good news?"

"Yeah, let's go, Nick!" Maya said.

On their way to Gumshoe's place, does anything happen?
11111121212222121211121111221211211.title: "You aren't really fired, Detective."

"Alright, who gives him the news?" Phoenix said.

"I'll do it," Maya said. "If it were me, I'd want to hear it from myself."

Ah, of course. (Hopefully she didn't foolishly run here again...)
