Damnation. In all the excitement, "Franziska" had forgotten that she still looked like Maya. (This could be difficult. Pearly may understand Maya's foolishness, but she may consider this a way to try and push us together as "special someones" again. Or, even worse, she'd consider it an outrage that I would be in her body. Or the little fool might be even angrier that the "little girl with the whip" was near her.)

The two memories were conflicting with each other. On one hand, Phoenix's memories knew Pearl loved Nick and enjoyed his company. On the other, Franziska had made a considerably bad impression on Pearls and she knew how much the little one despised the whip lady.

The solution to the struggle was easy. As the command said: Go with the flow.

Franziska clapped her hands together in the best imitation of Maya she could muster. "Just... out having fun! You know me!"

"Oh... but why are you wearing that?"

Erm. "I was behaving foolishly and-" Uh. "My... robes got dirty, so Von Karma lended me hers?"

What an imperfect display. She felt disgust wash over herself.

But Pearly seemed to buy it, a surprised look on her face. "The one from your trials?"

"That's right."

"...she's usually so mean."

Franzy struggled to maintain her mask. "Well, she... has a lot on her mind sometimes! I think you two would get along if you tried."

"...hm. If you want me to Mystic Maya..." But she seemed doubtful.

Best to move past that. "Why don't we get a..." Ms. Fey was always eating so... "A delicious snack! My treat!"

Her eyes glittered. "Really? Thanks Mystic Maya!"

Pearls' face lit up. "Wow! I've never had cotton candy before!" She looked directly up at Franziska, eyes beaming. "Thank you so much, Mystic Maya!"

Conflicting Phoenix-feelings of affection and Franziska-feelings of mild annoyance battled inside her. Eventually, affection won out. Franzy's face softened into a smile and she rubbed Pearl's head fondly. "It's no problem, P-pearls."

After paying the exorbitant price for two cotton candies — and shooting the cashier an evil eye when Pearl's back was turned — they sat at a small table to eat.

Franziska managed to finish off her cotton-candy in a time comparable to Maya, an effort that left her clutching her stomach a bit. "I've been thinking about, um, 'Special Someones'. Don't you think you're a little too ol—"

Pearl cut her off excitedly.

"Oh, you have? Isn't it so nice? Someone who loves you so much, they'll do anything for you?"

"Yes, howe—" Franziska tried to get a word in edgewise, but Pearls' enthusiasm was impossible to quench.

"A prince who'll ride on a white horse to save you! A person who you can always count on, and share spaghetti, and you both eat the same noodle, and you end up... It's perfect!"

Franziska's mind was already wavering before that. Naturally, being perfect herself, she would never consider taking a romantic partner — who else could equal her? That preconceived notion and the command to go with the flow were battling it out in her head, neither side winning out, at least until Pearl said that final word.

Franziska's head swirled with thoughts after that, justifying the complete 180 in her mindset.

(Well, the girl did have a point. A flawless woman with a flawless partner would simply outshine anyone else even more than they already do.)

(Certainly, there needs to be a intense vetting process beforehand — need to make sure their intelligence, looks, athleticism, and commitment to perfection are adequate, but after that...)

A small blush covered her face.

It'd be nice to be cuddle...

Evidently, more Pearls than she realized leaked in there.

She was snapped out of her reverie by the small spirit medium, however.

"What were you going to say, Mystic Maya?"

Franziska blinked in confusion. "I've... forgotten. Anyways, you're quite right."

Both of them gave the other a smile as they walked along.

He had no problem checking to see if Maya was lying, but did he want to offend Desiree by assuming she was lying? At the same time though, if they were lying about not swapping anyone, him not checking for lies would be the equivalent of keeping those people swapped around.

In the end, Phoenix decided to...

Phoenix chose to just trust that the two of them were telling the truth for now. "Alright the, sorry for the trouble Ms. Delite." Phoenix said as he stood up and began to leave.

"No problem Nicky-boy, I would really like to try out that remote sometime soon." Desiree said with a smile. As Maya left behind Nick, Desiree said something to her "I'll be sure to meet up with you next Tuesday."

"Alright, I'll try my hardest to remember." Maya turned around said right before once again walking toward Phoenix.

"What was that about?" Phoenix asked Maya

"Oh, nothing, just some girl stuff." Maya said with a grin on her face. In actuality, Maya and Desiree had swapped quite a few people around town before meeting up with Phoenix. Most of the people who were swapped she knew, but there were some people who were complete strangers to her. She did at least make sure that there was at least one person she knew in each swapped pair. She and Desiree made the plan to keep them all swapped until next Tuesday.

--------Meanwhile in several places around town---------

"You fool!" The body of Detective Gumshoe yelled at the body of Franziska Von Karma "You expect me to believe that you had no role in this!" Franziska yelled loudly from Gumshoe's body.

"I'm as clueless as you are pal. One second you were whipping me and the next I'm holding the whip" Gumshoe said from Franziska's body and rubbed the back of her head as he talked.

Franziska reached for where she normally held her whip, only to grab nothing. She chose instead to keep yelling. "Until you find a way to turn us back to normal, your salary will drop like a rock." Franziska threatened and walked away.

As she walked away, Gumshoe panicked briefly about his salary, but then he realized something. Franziska couldn't lower his salary from his body. In fact, she had his salary right now and he had hers. He opened her wallet and his eyes went wide. He certainly wasn't going to be eating instant noodles while in her body.

--------

Lauren Paups was panicking as she looked in the mirror in the house of a complete stranger, she was suddenly in the body of a man that she didn't know. He had spiky hair and a goatee and was wearing an orange jacket. How could this have happened and if she was in this man's body did that me he was in hers?! She fainted at the thought of what he could be doing in her body.

On the other side of town, Larry was looking at his reflection in a fountain at Gatewater Land. "Well hello beautiful" he flirted with the reflection in the water. He had no idea how he ended up in the body of an attractive girl, but he wasn't one to question how things happen. He was just going to enjoy this for now and hope he was turned back to normal soon.

--------

Miles Edgeworth sat in a dressing room at Big Berry Circus. One moment he was doing some paperwork and the next there was suddenly a flamboyant magician and a wooden puppet both asking him about a marriage proposal. Thankfully he excused himself to a dressing room before he had to actually speak to either of them. Edgeworth racked his mind on how this could have happened, but he had no ideas. The one thing he did know was that he needed to get back to his office and check on his body. He looked down at the body he was currently inhabiting "But first, I'm going to need to change clothes. I wouldn't be caught dead walking around in this ridiculous outfi- cough" Edgeworth began to cough as some glitter got in his mouth

Regina Berry sat bored in Edgeworth's office. She was having a fun day working on her act at the circus when suddenly Max and Trilo came up to her to ask her something, but before she could hear what they had to ask, she was suddenly in a random office in some random man's body. Not knowing what to do, she chose to just doodle tigers on the papers that were on the man's desk

-------

Victor Kudo stood looking at his own unconscious body. He couldn't believe what had just happened. One moment he was sitting at his table in Tres Bien staring at the waitress'....outfit and the next moment he was standing with a tray in his hand. He was going to ask his own body what was going on, but it fainted the second it looked at him. Victor looked down at himself, he recognized that outfit anywhere, he was in the body of the Tres Bien waitress!

-----

Those were only a few of the pairs that Maya and Desiree had swapped around. Maya chuckled every time she thought about it. Who should the story follow now?

(I guess it worked after all,) Phoenix thought to himself, walking over to his bench. (Let's just hope she doesn't give herself away. Or do something really, really stupid.)

"I come from a long, accredited line of spirit-channelers Nick!" Maya shot back indignantly. "That thing has the credibility of a chain letter. Besides, how do we know it doesn't just like, zap whoever you point it at?"

Phoenix paused, he hasn't considered that at all. "Then we have Larry test it," he decided with a shrug. "Are you okay with that Larry?"

"Do whatever you want, I don't care, my life is over!" Larry cried from the bench. "Charlene left me! All because of an accusation! I don't care what happens to me so go ahead and zap me with it! Give me the chair!"

Maya shrugged, "sounds like consent. And if it does work, that'll be good right? Larry's kind of a liability, so if the other side ends up with him, all the more benefit for us!"

Phoenix nodded in agreement; it made sense. "Which function do we go with though? If we use aware swap, we'll have more control over where he goes, but if we use possession, we don't have to worry about the other person causing problems in his body Atleast, more problems than Larry himself would cause I guess."

"It's probably a gag so we'll flip a coin," Maya said, noting the time. "Heads, swap, tails, possession!" She tossed the coin in the air and it landed on....

As the coin landed on tails Phoenix pointed the remote at Larry and pressed the possession button. It didn't seem to work. Larry was still whining about his latest breakup

"Told you it wouldn't work." Maya said smugly

Phoenix rubbed his head. "Yeah, I guess the idea was kind of silly" He said with a laugh. He should have expected nothing to happen, the idea of the remote was just silly. Although, he wished it did, it would have been really helpful

------

Meanwhile Larry was freaking out. He was floating in some sort of ghost-like form and his body was acting like nothing had happened! After about a few minutes he calmed down. Didn't Nick say something about possession and a remote. Larry had been too focused on Charlene's breakup with him to pay attention to anything that Nick was saying.

As he floated he overheard Nick and Maya talking about how they thought the remote didn't work. "It did work! I'm a ghost! Help me Nick!" Larry tried yelling, but neither of them heard him. Larry though about what that meant, the remote made him some sort of ghost thing that could possess people, did this mean he could go into other people's bodies?

He should test it. Maya and Nick were standing right there. He should probably go into Maya's body and tell Nick the remote worked, he'd be in trouble if Nick threw it away. On the other hand, he had heard that Franzy was at court today, maybe he could go and possess her for a while?

What did he decide to do?
111111222.title: Possession

1111112222.content:
"Hey Franzy! Can you hear me?" Larry tried to say to Franziska as he floated in front of her face. She didn't notice him at all and continued talking.

"The Prosecution has decisive evidence against the defendant, Larry Buttz," she spoke with satisfaction as she stretched her whip over her head. "The prosecution calls to the bench Det-" Suddenly, Franziska went silent and her arms became limp. The court stared in confusion as the prosecutor seemed frozen.

"Uh, Ms. Von Karma, are you quite alright?" The Judge asked.

Suddenly, Franziska shook her head, and looked down at herself, a broad, uncharacteristic grin going across her face as she patted herself down, hands jumping from her chest to her stomach to her thighs.

"Mi-miss Von Karma, what is wrong with you!?" The judge asked again, banging the gavel. Phoenix and Maya were similarly confused as the typically serious prosecutor began to giggle with glee, hopping up and down like a child.

"Ah! Uh," 'Franziska' -possessed by Larry- looked up at the judge with a nervous grin. "Uh, what was I saying?"

"You have decisive evidence you said! You were calling a witness," the judge replied. "You... you do have a witness right?"

Larry was fiddling with Franziska's earrings as he thought out a response. "Uhm... no! I lied actually," he told the judge, smiling all throughout. "Larry is like, totally innocent, and I think he's really cute!"

On the defense bench, Phoenix and Maya were very perplexed. "Nick... do you think..."

Phoenix turned to Maya and whispered back, "it can't be, but there's no other explanation. I think it worked!"

"Ms. Von Karma, you can't be serious! The police investigation turned up no evidence, you claim? Why are we even holding a trial then?"

'Franziska' just shrugged, "I don't know! Ask the detective. Anyways, the prosecution rests your highness!"

"That's your honor!" The judge was absolutely baffled, but he didn't really know how to proceed without the prosecution well... prosecuting. "Urk, well, in absence of any testimony or evidence, I suppose the court moves to... find Mr. Larry Buttz... innocent?"

Confetti rained from the sky as the verdict was declared. Larry spun around on one foot and was about to free himself from the courtoom, but tripped up and landed straight on his face due to Von Karma's heels. He looked up to see both Phoenix and Maya standing over him, Phoenix stretching out a hand to help him up. "Uh! Oh, thanks," Larry responded as Phoenix pulled him to his feet.

"Von Karma, is there..." Phoenix was unsure of how to proceed.

"Something you would like to tell us?" Maya asked more confidently. "Something about a certain Mr. Buttz?"

Larry stared at them for a second, recalling that Phoenix still had the device, which meant that his only way out of Franziska's body was Phoenix's help. But, if he told Phoenix what had happened now then Phoenix would surely ruin his fun. Did he admit he was Larry, or did he try to drag things out and get away before Phoenix and Maya could be sure?
1111112222.title: Possess Franziska

11111122221.content:
Suddenly Larry lowered his voice to a whisper, "Nick, I know you aren't going to believe it, but its me! Larry!"

A drop of sweat hung from Phoenix's face, "you don't say?"

"The device works, and now I'm free!" A satisfied Larry-as-Franziska said to the defense team. "...so, what now?"

Phoenix pulled the remote from his pocket, ushering Larry back to the defense lobby, "we get you out of there of course! I think you might've just messed up her career."

"Awww, so soon though? I was having fun!" Larry whined as Phoenix pushed him into the lobby and Maya shut the door behind them. he clasped his hands together as he begged, "please, can I just stay a bit longer! I barely even got to do anything!"

Phoenix shook his head, "Larry, there's no way we're going to let you keep her body! Now, I'm going to use the remote and you're going back to normal, okay?"

Larry hung Franziska's head, "fiiiiiiine."

Phoenix clicked the possession button again, and Von Karma's body seemed to black out for a moment as Larry's spirit left her. Looking around the room, he saw that Phoenix, Maya, and his own bewildered body were all about.

'Hmmm,' Larry pondered. 'He can't stop me from taking whatever body I want while I'm floating here.' Briefly, a devious idea came to Larry. Instead of returning to normal, he could possess Phoenix or Maya! If he possessed Phoenix, he'd have control of the remote. Then, no one would tell him how to use it! Alternatively, he could take Maya's body and act like her; maybe Phoenix wouldn't realize it and he could have some fun as her for a while? She didn't have the same appeal as Franzy, but she was definitely cute.

What did Larry decide to do?

1111112222112.content:
With a grin on his ghost-like face, Larry floated toward and possessed Maya. Thankfully, Phoenix didn't seem to notice that Maya's body went stiff for a second before getting a huge grin on her face.

Larry was tempted to feel around Maya's body, but he restrained himself. If Phoenix found out that Larry didn't jump back into his own body, he would probably make him leave Maya's body.

Phoenix turned "Are you back to normal now?" Phoenix asked Larry's body, which was acting on it's own separately from Larry.

"Normal? How can I be normal if Charlene left me!" Larry's body cried about an earlier breakup.

Phoenix got an annoyed expression on his face. "No, I meant are you back to being yourself?" He asked again.

"As much as I can be. Thanks for the lawyer-y help, but it won't be enough to fix my broken love life!" Larry's body said, referring to Phoenix's 'defense' of him in the trial.

Phoenix slapped a hand on his face and turned to Larry in Maya's body. "I can't tell if he's in his body or not! It could go either way at this point."

"Maybe we should just let him go? It doesn't seem like he went into anyone else." Larry in Maya's body said with a nervous shrug. He was worried that Phoenix would find out that he wasn't Maya.

Phoenix looked around the Lobby, making sure that no one was acting too out of the ordinary. "Yeah, I guess you're right. Let's just get out of here before he starts begging us to use the remote again." Phoenix joked.

"Yeah." Larry in Maya's body said with a nervous laugh. Over the years he had grown used to people making jokes like that about him. Though, normally he wasn't the one who was supposed to laugh at them.

-----

As Phoenix and Larry in Maya's body separated from Larry's body, Phoenix began to speak "This remote is an amazing thing. Who do you think sent it to us? I'm pretty sure we aren't best friends with any super scientists or anything like that." Phoenix joked as he wondered where it came from.

Larry was less concerned with that. "Who cares? It's fun, that's all that really matters!" He said. Larry was far more concerned with what the remote could do than where it came from.

Phoenix laughed. "Yeah, I guess you're right. If they wanted us to know who sent it, they would have wrote their name on the package." He stared at the remote again. "I think we should test it out again at the office. It was a bit risky trying it right before a trial. We were lucky that the possession button did work, but we don't know if the other's do. We should find out as soon as possible."

Larry was really excited by the idea of using the remote again, but he wasn't sure if he should do it so soon. He had just gotten into Maya's body. Maybe it would be better if he didn't go with Phoenix for now. He had heard that Maya lived in a nearby village and was it's 'master' or something like that. He could stay there for the night and get more acquainted with her body. After thinking it over, Larry decided to....
1111112222112.title: Maya

choices: Larry explores Maya's room and body
11111122221122.content:
Larry had apparently been doing a decent impression of Maya up to this point, but he was also sure that his Franziska impression was bulletproof too. He realized it was best that he get away from Phoenix for now - if he stayed then he was bound to be discovered sooner or later. Not to mention, there was no way of telling how the remote might affect him while he was using a 'commandeered' body. Maya was still inside it with him, after all!

Looking to Maya's wrist, Larry realized she wasn't wearing a watch but decided to keep up the act anyways. "Oh! Uh, actually Nick, I got to be back at Cobain Village right away! Official Master stuff."

Phoenix lifted an eyebrow in confusion at this. "You mean... Kurain?"

Larry nodded quickly, sending Maya's hair flying in front his face, "Yeah! That's it! I'll meet up with you tomorrow though, don't worry. Don't use the device without me though!" He gave a big wave with Maya's arm and ran off, going in the direction of the train station that he knew Maya must take to get into the city.

"Uh, alright, see you then?" Phoenix replied, more question than statement. He stood there baffled as Maya ran off, apparently not having time to test out the device she had been interested in seconds ago.

---

An hour or two later, the train rolled into Kurain Village. Larry was sitting laid back, Maya's legs propped up on the seat across from him with a satisfied expression. He did it! He was home free! Larry could have Phoenix release him from Maya's body tomorrow, but until then Larry was free to enjoy her body however he wanted. He felt a bit bad about it, but upon seeing the village he was going to the "Master" of for the day, any guilt gave way to excitement.

The village was definitely rustic, but Larry couldn't wipe the grin off of his face when the people began bowed to him reverently as he cross. "Welcome home Mystic Maya," they would say to him. They were looking at him a bit oddly, but hey were all submissive nonetheless. 'It's like I'm a princess! No one is ever this respectful to me!'

"Mystic Maya! Mystic Maya!" a voice called out, causing Larry to stop what he was doing and look around. At first, he didn't see anyone, but looking down he realized a little girl had run up to him. "How did the case go? Did Mr. Nick win?" Her tone was more informal than the others; she seemed to know Maya more personally.

"Uh, yeah! Nick swept away the case, but I think Larry had a hand too," Larry replied a bit too proudly. He had definitely seen this kid with Nick before, but he was having trouble remembering her name. 'Is it... Garnet? No that's not right.'

"Is something wrong Mystic Maya?" the kid asked, seeing the pensive expression on Larry's face.

"Uh, nothing! Hey, how about you tell me about your day while we walk back to my house, huh?" The little girl thankfully fell into Larry's ploy, and led the way, talking about some show she had seen earlier as she lead Larry straight to Maya's home - the largest in the village.

"Here we are Mystic Maya! Do you have anything else to do today?" she asked, a smile on her face. She was definitely cute, but Larry didn't really want a kid following him around all over.

"Oh! Uh, yeah! Phoenix wanted me to... do some research for him. I'm going to be a bit busy, but I'll come get you if I have time, alright?" This seemed satisfactory to the little girl, who nodded and walked off, leaving Larry to his own devices.

"Finally, just a little alone time," Larry said with a relieved sigh as he entered Maya's bedroom. He wasted no time going through her things. The room was loaded with neat things! Aside from a large closet of robes and dresses, she had jewelry! Pearls and beads were all over, but one particular thing that Larry noticed was that she had some necklaces that were just like the thing Nick carried around. The Magalama he called it? Whatever. Pictures also scattered the room - Nick, the girl, and a woman that Larry recognized as Nick's boss were all in them. Little nicknacks and souvenirs were also all over.

Satisfied with turning over Maya's stuff, Larry opened the closet up and found a fully body mirror. "Heeeere we go!" he said excitedly as he looked himself over. This was great! He could feel Maya's body body bursting with energy - it was like he was on top of the world! He had Maya's cute body and the respect of this town that came with it! "Maybe I'll stay just a bit longer if it all goes well..."

"Guess who you get to spend the day with Franzy? Me!" he exclaimed with a laugh, still thrilled to hear her voice when he spoke. "I'm going to have so much fu-!" Larry nearly fell down the courthouse steps, but was luckily caught by someone from behind.

"Oh! Uh, thanks!" He said, still in shock.

"Me- I mean Larry?" Larry himself exclaimed, a bit shocked. He had almost forgotten he left his own body behind! Was it still acting like him this whole time?

"Yeah! I heard what you said back there!" Larry's body said. "Did you really mean it? That I'm the most handsomest man you'd ever met?" The other Larry was practically tearing up, overwhelmed with emotions at 'Franziska's' declaration.

Maybe, if he made it seem like Franziska really loved him, he could win back his ex! She would be so jealous! And if not, he'd be dating Franzy at the very least.
