1111222.content: In the States or in Khura'in?
1111222.title: Spirit of Justice

11112222.content:
It was a rough entry for Phoenix in the country of Khura'in. It seemed even when he left LA, trouble seemed to follow him, as he had immediately been wrapped up in a murder trial with some of the highest stakes he had ever encountered. Thankfully though, he managed to turn things around and save both himself and his defendant, a child named Ahlbi, from the guillotine. After that, things had calmed down, and he finally had some time to enjoy the sights while he waited for Maya to be done with her training.

While waiting, he had made his temporary residence at Temp'uhl Temple, which had generously given him some lodging after the incident. It had been a long day of walking around the city, finding new places, so he was glad to get back to his room for a bit of rest in the mid-afternoon before he went out on another outing that evening. What he didn't expect to find was a package waiting for him.

"Huh? What's this now?" Phoenix muttered as he picked it up from the nightstand by the bed.

'Dear Mr. Wright. We're horribly sorry for the rough beginning you've had in Khura'in. We trust this will make your stay much easier.' ~ Anonymous

---

"Well the monks certainly didn't leave this here," Phoenix said to himself as he finished reading over the manual. As far as pranks went, this was a pretty abstract one. Phoenix was used to being the butt of jokes though, so he decided he would roll with it. After all, someone went through all the trouble of preparing this for him.

He pocketed the device and exited the temple early, figuring he'd go ahead and give it a quick try before he met up with Ahlbi. Running through the options in his head, which function did he decide to test out first?
11112222.title: Khura'in

1111222211.content:
Looking over his options, Phoenix opted for Aware Swap, as that was the simplest one. The question now was, who should he try it on?

The first person to come to mind was Ahlbi. Other than Maya, Ahlbi was the only person in the entire country that Phoenix really knew, and the kid probably wouldn't freak out too much if Phoenix explained what he was going to do ahead of time.

The second person to come to mind was the princess of the country, Rayfa Khura'in. Rayfa had given him plenty of trouble during the trial and looked down on him the whole time. Perhaps walking a mile in his shoes might teach her to respect people more.

Of course, he didn't need to switch with either of those two. There were plenty of other people in the country.

Phoenix opted to switch with...
1111222211.title: Aware Swap

1111222212.content: But who would Pheonix become
1111222212.title: Unaware Swap

111122222.content:
In his short time in Khura'in, Phoenix learned that the absolute last thing he wanted to do was make the citizens angry, and he was pretty sure that pointing a remote at someone and stealing their body in public was a good way to do that.

It may be best if he used one of the functions that would only affect him. Shapeshift or Possession.

If he used Shapeshift then he could just select that person from a distance and then Shapeshift his own body. So long as he didn't run into the person whose body he copies, nothing should go wrong.

If he used Possession, then he would only have to point the remote at himself, then he would just have to find someone's body and possess them for a while.

Which button did Phoenix use?
111122222.title: Possession/Shape shift

1111222221.content:
Phoenix decided to go with the simpler option and use the Possession function, this way he wouldn't have to point the remote at someone and risk them seeing it.

He pointed the remote at himself and clicked the Possession button. In only a few moments, he was floating above his body in some sort of ghost form. He saw that his own body began to move on, presumably to go and meet up with Ahlbi like he had originally planned.

As Phoenix floated around in his ghost form, he wished he had chosen what body to go into before he used the Possession button, this ghost form was anything but fast. As he slowly floated, Phoenix got an idea! He began to float upward, he floated for what seemed to be 10 minutes, but he thought it was worth it. Once high enough in the air, he saw a good view of the Kingdom of Khura'in, it looked beautiful! He doubted that he would be able to get a view this good by any normal means. Phoenix wished that this ghost form was able to keep his camera.

Now that that detour was over, Phoenix floated back down to street level and resumed his search for someone to Possess. After a few more minutes of floating around he saw someone he recognized. It was Princess Rayfa. She was surrounded by many people, which wasn't that odd. She was a princess and her people did love her.

Phoenix considered possessing her, after all. She did sorta owe him for all the trouble her Divination Seance had caused him during Ahlbi's trial the other day. Of course, while Phoenix could see a disadvantage to taking her body, the fact that she was a princess. More specifically, the fact that he had no idea how to act like a princess.

Does Phoenix possess Rayfa?
1111222221.title: Possession

choices: Phoenix wants to stay out in the city for now
11112222211.content:
Phoenix had barely been in Khura'in for an hour when the trial started, and Princess Rayfa made Phoenix's life incredibly difficult during that time. Because of her, he was nearly executed on his own vacation! The people here seemed to hate lawyers, but they loved the royal family. Rayfa probably lived a pretty easy life in Khura'in - she wouldn't be too out of luck if Phoenix decided to take her body for a day. Phoenix imagined that being the country's very own princess would make his stay much easier.

Not totally sure how to go about possession, Phoenix slowly lowered himself down over Rayfa, who was moving through a crowd of citizens, waving to them and listening to what they had to say. From an outside perspective, Rayfa stopped for a moment, seeming to stare off in to space, before blinking and regaining some level of composure.

"Princess Rayfa, please bless my child!"

"Your Benevolence, will you look at our petition?"

"We thank you for your goodwill, princess!"

All the shouts from the crowd overwhelmed Phoenix as he was trying to come to grips with his sudden change in form. He was suddenly very light, and very small. The people towered over him in his new body - even if they were filled with adulation and praise, it was intimidating. "Uh, yes, uh, thank er - very much!" He tried to muster up in reply, waving feebly. His high pitched voice was too distracting for him though, and it came out as just a squeak. He could hear the chimes of bells as they fluttered on his wrist as well. In his other small hand, the remote was gripped tightly. He certainly didn't seem to fit the role of graceful and resolute princess.

Phoenix realized there was no way he could last as Rayfa in public for long. He was fortunate enough that English seemed to be common in Khura'in. If he had to speak Khura'inese, he'd be utterly lost. He gave a fast series of thanks and platitudes as he pushed his way through the crowd, trying to get to the open street.

"Your Benevolence, is everything okay?" A tall figure suddenly came into view; it was holding a rifle. Phoenix had to look up for once in his life to make eye contact with what he could figure out what a guard.

"Uh, yes, certainly," Phoenix replied quickly. "Could I - uh, we," he stumbled, still taken off guard by how fast it all had happened, "get out of this crowd maybe?"

"As you wish, your benevolence!" The guard replied, Seemingly from nowhere, a number of guards overtook the area, surrounding Phoenix as they escorted him into a long limousine.

'Wow, perk of royalty,' Phoenix thought as he climbed into the back and sat down. He was glad to finally have some of the noise blocked out. Hopefully the benefits would continue to pile up - he didn't have the fortitude to deal with the kind of fame that Rayfa seemed to have here! He finally looked down at himself and took stock of his new body. By his reckoning, Rayfa was probably a bit younger than his daughter. She was very skinny and petite, and her clothing left her legs very exposed. Her arms were only covered by the cloak as well. He didn't seem to have anywhere to hide the device on his person, unfortunately. He wasn't sure he was willing to venture out into public without keeping it safe somewhere.

"Would you like to return to the palace, your Benevolence?" The driver finally asked from the front as the car began to make its way out of the road. Phoenix thought about and realized that it would certainly be a great sight to see; if he was the princess himself, he could explore the entire palace free of restriction! There were likely many places that tourists weren't allowed to go in there, and he'd be able to regroup himself a bit. He hadn't yet finished exploring the city though; even if the crowds threatened to be too much, it would certainly be interesting to go about in public as something more than a mere sightseer.
11112222211.title: He possesses Rayfa

111122222111.content:
Phoenix knew he couldn't stay in this body for too long. He had to go back to see Maya eventually! He also carried the faint fear that he could be discovered. This remote didn't seem like anything Maya had ever showed him, but he imagined that if anyone could spot a possession, it'd be a nation of spirit channelers. While he was here, he knew he had to capitalize on the opportunity and go somewhere that no tourist was allowed to go!

"Take me back home to the palace," Phoenix instructed the driver. He lacked the force of conviction that the real Rayfa had when she spoke, but the driver followed his instructions regardless. In fact, if any of the body guards thought the princess to be acting strange, they didn't show it.

'Just wish my employees back home showed me this kind of respect...' He thought to himself as he took in the sights of Khura'in from outside his window.

---

The palace was somehow more beautiful than Phoenix had expected, yet also more labyrinthine than he could have guessed. He found himself out in a courtyard looking into a koi pond, trying to act natural. It wouldn't do him any good in terms of keeping a low profile if the princess was lost in her own palace. As beautiful as the building was, he couldn't help but feel like someone was watching him, even after he had waved the guards away.

"I'd feel better if only I could find a safe place to hide this thing..." Phoenix mumbled to himself while watching a large frog swallow down a dragonfly.

"There's a space hidden in your bedroom behind the portrait of the warbaa'd," a voice abruptly whispered into Phoenix's ear.

"WHA!" Phoenix cried out in Rayfa's voice, alarmed to find an old, white haired woman suddenly whispering into his hear, hunched over next to him. Where had she been hiding?! "Wh-where did you...?"

"Princess?" the woman asked with an eyebrow raised, slightly befuddled. "I was over behind the tree, like usual. Are you feeling alright?"

"U-uh, yes! I'm fine!" Phoenix almost shouted back. Did Rayfa have ninjas in her staff? "Uh, why don't you show me this secret space? You can lead the way." Phoenix said, trying to regain control of the situation. The attendant could show him to the Princess's bedroom in the process too.

--- 2 Days Later ---

Phoenix could scarcely believe it had been this long since he’d been so relaxed. Being a high-profile attorney at such a young age, getting disbarred, and getting reinstated had really done a number on him. He barely realized how much stress he had built up over his career!

<i>Crack</i>

Phoenix let out a satisfied sigh as the masseuse popped a vertebra along Rayfa’s back. As Rayfa, he had access to everything a princess could want! Great food, an amazing bed, and the ability to see everything the palace had to offer. He couldn’t imagine many foreigners got the chance to see such a place up close!

“My shoulders please,” Phoenix said lazily, eyes closed as the massage continued. Adapting to being Rayfa – a young girl – was certainly a difficult experience, but her body also made him realize the toll age had been taking on him. He was always an active person -even if not by choice- but he’d begun to notice that the long hikes, rough falls, and often the full out sprints that he engaged in were leaving him more and more winded every time. Rayfa’s body was flexible, balanced, and still had plenty of youthful energy left in it. He knew that he was probably going to be in for a sore back when he returned to his old form, but there was no point in dwelling on such negative thoughts in the moment. Instead, he let himself focus on the moment, and how calm he felt to be relieved of his responsibilities over the past few days.

“Anything else, Princess?” The servant asked diligently.

“No, that’s good for today,” Phoenix replied after a moment’s consideration, stretching his new, spindly arms as he pulled himself up into a sitting position. Thankfully, no one here seemed willing to question why the Princess was speaking so much English. “You can go return to whatever you were doing now.”

“As you wish, your benevolence,” the woman replied with a bow as she made herself scarce.

Phoenix tightened the robe he was wearing as he hopped to his feet, making a point to close it around the back. The robe wasn’t a far cry from what Maya usually wore, but it was certainly made of finer materials.

He had to wonder what Maya would think of this situation. Would she laugh at the fact that Phoenix was in a young girl’s body, or would she be jealous that he got the perks of royalty? He half considered visiting her like this, but decided it might cheapen their reunion when he went back to his real body. For now, he was content to live free of concern. Rayfa didn’t realize how spoiled she was!

“Your Benevolence.” Phoenix’s revelry was interrupted as the older attendant, Nayna, came into the room. She gave a short bow like the rest of the staff, but Phoenix noticed that she seemed to be more informal than the rest of Rayfa’s servants.

“Yes? What is it?” He asked, a bit nervous. For some reason, she gave him an uneasy feeling. She seemed to know Rayfa more than the average person in the palace.

“I would like for you to follow me. You are needed…”
111122222111.title: Phoenix heads to the Palace

1111222221111.content:
"For a trial."

Somewhere along the line, Phoenix had forgotten about Rayfa's duty. "Um... certainly," he responded, so nervous it was easy to hear the shake in his voice. "We... should make haste, then."

"Of course, Your Benevolence," said Nayna, "but surely you should first change into something more appropriate?"

Phoenix looked down, eyes wide. Again, he had forgotten. (Yeah, the Dance of Devotion would probably be pretty impossible in this,) Phoenix agreed. (Oh, no. The Dance of Devotion!)

Mental "gulp"-ing aside, the whole trial was waiting on him. Phoenix grabbed all of Rayfa's ceremonial gear and changed into it, and then left for Tehm'pul Temple. (So much for the perks of royalty,) he thought.

The High Court of Khura'in was as dark and oppressive-looking as the last time. The pillars towered over his head, even more so now that said head was so much closer to the ground. And that was before he noticed all the eyes of the gallery, watching his every move with an intensity greater than even the last time. Phoenix shuddered internally.

"Your Benevolence!" bellowed a voice from the Judge's bench he could barely see the top of. "A moment longer and I would have missed my class again!"

Phoenix stared the Judge in the face, terrified. He was so paralyzed, he could have stood there for hours if the Judge's hearty laugh hadn't put him at ease a moment later.

"I'm only joking, princess. The only thing that could keep me here that long is that pesky lawyer showing up again. Ha ha ha ha ha!"

"Ah, I see!" Phoenix said, the irony of the Judge's statement only serving to terrify him further. "Haha!"

"Well, now that Her Benevolence is here, we can begin. Prosecutor Payne?"

Phoenix looked over to the prosecutor's bench to see Gaspen, no longer wearing his gold suit, sash, or crown, instead opting for the brown suit of their first meeting. He seemed less assuming, somehow, his smug persona having apparently been shattered by the events of the previous trial. Phoenix couldn't help but hold in a smirk.

"Yes, Your Magistry," said Payne. "Your Benevolence, have you been informed of the identity of the victim?"

Phoenix looked around awkwardly, as if searching for some kind of secret exit out of this place. "Nayna?"

Nayna approached his side at a speed that could only be described as cartoonish. "Yes, Your Benevolence?" Nayna whispered into his ear.

"Was I supposed to know about that?" Phoenix asked.

Nayna paused for a moment, looking to the side. She then turned back to him. "I suspect the prosecutor forgot to send a message to you, but yes. Just pretend you know and the Séance should still work." Nayna said, before darting off at a similarly cartoonish speed.

Phoenix firmly glared at Gaspen. "Yes, I know, uh, all I need to know! Let us begin!" He said, quickly reaching a crescendo. The gallery didn't react much at all.

So, it was time for the Divination Séance. He'd only heard the speech once and seen the Dance twice, which he could only hope was enough.

It would take a miracle for him to pull this off at all, much less his first try. But does the "miracle" happen?
1111222221111.title: "For a trial."

11112222211111.content:
Phoenix had a good memory, so reciting Rayfa's speech was no problem. "O Holy Mother! We hold this Divination Séance in your name! Let the eyes of everyone here be clear, and our ears be unstopped! O Dance of Devotion! Guide the victim's soul to me! So that we may receive their final memories in the Pool of Souls!" now that the easy part was out of the way, it was time for the difficult part, the dance.

He got into Rayfa's usual starting position, closed his eyes, and began to dance. He had only taken the first step before Rayfa's body's reflexes took over. Every move in the dance just came to him naturally, he wondered how many times Rayfa had done this over the years for her body to be able to do this on pure reflex. How many times has she seen the last moments of peoples lives? The mere implications of this disturbed Phoenix. She was still a young girl, but she had to deal with this who knows how often.

Once the dance had finished, Phoenix opened his eyes and looked into the pool of souls, doing the dance perfectly was only part of the difficult. The most crucial part of this was something he wouldn't be in control of even if he had spent the entire two days in Rayfa's body practicing. Spiritual energy. It wouldn't matter how well he did the dance, if he had no spiritual energy, nothing would happen. The question now was, what was spiritual energy tied to? The body and the royal family's bloodline? Or the soul?

Phoenix's question was answered as the pool of souls bubbled and an image begin to appear in it. The seance had worked. Phoenix and the rest of the courtroom looked into the pool of souls and watched the last moments before the victim's death. Phoenix looked over at the defendant of the current case and sure enough, the vision incriminated them.

The defendant look as pale as a ghost, Phoenix imagined that they were going through the same feelings that he and Ahlbi had. He tried to console himself with the fact that he knew nothing about the person who was currently on trial, but the mere thought of anyone being put on trial with no defense disgusted him. Phoenix then made an important decision. Even if he was currently in the body of the royal priestess, he would defend this person with the best of his ability.

"Well, it appears that the defendant committed the crime. May they find peace in the twilight realm." The judge said and was about to slam down his gavel, but he was interrupted from and unexpected source.

"OBJECTION!" Phoenix yelled in Rayfa's voice. The entire courtroom was shocked, the other day they had heard that word used in the courtroom for the first time in two decades by a foreign lawyer that they all hated, but now their own princess said it! "Your magistry! Let me look over the vision, I'm sure I can find something that can prove the defendant's innocence!" Phoenix asserted himself.

The judge stayed silent in shock. Was the princess being serious?! Was the princess willing to defend someone? Even if there was the risk of the D.C. act? What would the country do if the princess had to be punished under the act? He couldn't comprehend what was happening,

"OBJECTION!" Payne's shrill voice shouted. "Your benevolence, your visions are always flawless. Surely this won't be-" Payne stopped talking as Phoenix glared at him. Payne was smart enough not to argue with the royal priestess.

"Your magisty, my seance was wrong the other day, please allow me to examine it thoroughly." Phoenix requested.

The judge was still confused, but he got a stern face and banged his gavel, silencing the gallery that was chatting among themselves about whether or not the princess had gone insane. "Very well, your benevolence. You may examine the vision." The judge accepted Phoenix's request "I have no idea what you're thinking, but this old servant of the Holy Mother will support you the whole way" The judge added at the end.

"Thank you, your magistry." Phoenix thanked the judge 'Where was this support when a little kid was being accused of murder'

Payne was still silent. He didn't know what to do! If he lost the trial, he would be humiliated. If he won, he would be going against the princess, which would no doubt cause the kingdom to hate him!

Phoenix watched the vision closely, he was ready for a trial
11112222211111.title: The "miracle" happen.

choices: No, he actually screwed that up really bad.
11112222211112.content:
Phoenix let out a deep breath, the eyes of the gallery piercing through him as he walked up to the Pool of Souls. He could overhear a few murmurs, which he was pretty sure were about how nervous he looked. That didn't help.

"Nayna, my robe."

Nayna approached and removed the robe from his shoulders. He propped his staff up on the witness stand and walked back to the Pool.

"Oh Holy Mother, we hold this Divination Séance in your name."

One line down. He was pretty sure he had three to go.

"Let the... eyes of everyone here be clear, and our... our ears, be unstopped!"

(Okay, that was the one I was worried about. No weird looks yet.)

"Oh, Dance of Devotion!" he said, taking a brief pause to gather his thoughts. "Guide the victim’s soul to me! So that we can-
we may receive their final memories in the Pool of Souls! "

He felt relieved for just a moment, before he realized that the hard part was still to come.

By Rayfa's muscle memory, a stroke of pure luck, and some small measure of Wright's actual talent, he was pretty sure rhe Dance went perfectly. The light flying out from the Pool of Souls stunned him. It looked prettier than the last time.

And yet, no image actually appeared in the Pool.

"...Your Benevolence?" Nayna asked, already by his side.

Phoenix stared at the blank pool, exasperated. "...I did that correctly, didn't I?"

Did he?
11112222211112.title: The "miracle" never happen.

choices: He didn't know the victim's name and face.
The body wasn't enough to give him spiritual power.
111122222111121.content:
Nayna nodded. "Yes, the Dance and Prayer appeared perfect to me. Perhaps something else is wrong?"

Well, if he had everything right, there weren't any other options. So what else could be wrong?
111122222111121.title: No, he did it properly.

1111222221111211.content:
Perhaps you've forgotten the victim's name and face?" Nayna said.

"Wait, what? I thought I didn't have to know that!" Phoenix said, struggling to keep his voice down.

"Did you not see the story in the newspaper? I assumed you had read it."

"How was I supposed to know that was this trial!?"

"What do you mean? There have been no other unsolved murders since Paht Rohl's trial."

He probably should've been able to reason that out for himself. But he knew now, and now he had to... do the whole thing again.

"Have you determined the problem, Your Benevolence?" said the Judge, his voice echoing throughout the room.

"Ah, yes!" Phoenix said. "You see, the victim's name was 'Pu'lay Sohl'der' but I had mistaken it to be 'Pu'lay Sohl'jer'! That was a dumb mistake, my apologies."

"No, no! 'To err is human', as they say."

"Okay, I'll start over. *ahem*"

Phoenix did the whole thing again. This time it came much more easily to him now that he knew he was doing it right, but that didn't make it any less scary. The only change was that this time, an image actually appeared.

The image was nearly pure white. It seemed the victim heard footsteps as the silhouetted figure of a woman with tall hair approached with what looked like a knife in hand. The victim turned away from the light and ran, their footsteps joining the pursuer's, before a rush of pain struck and they fell to the ground. The memory ended there.

Phoenix rewound the Séance to the bright light. "Hm... that light. Is that a sunset?"

The gallery's eyes turned to Gaspen, who promptly fumbled with his papers.

"The prosecution has no alternative explanation at this time."

"I see," said Phoenix. "Now, for my preliminary insights!"

Phoenix looked into the crowd. They all watched him with bated breath. "The victim stared into the sunset, when the silhouette of the defendant approached. This frightened him, so he turned and ran, his footsteps echoing off the concrete floor. But his pursuer was too fast, and at that spot, the victim lost his life."

The gallery looked to Gaspen. He took a breath. "As was clearly demonstrated, Your Honor, the-"

"Wait! I'm not done yet!" Phoenix shouted. He could make out a few murmurs and gasps in the crowd when he did. "Those were, as I said, only my preliminary insights. Mr. Payne, may I see the evidence for a moment?"

The Court went silent. Payne squinted at him, confused. "For what purpose, Your Benevolence?"

"I would just like to see it, please. Nayna?"

Nayna obeyed, snatching the copy of the court record from Gaspen and handing it to him.

Was it possible that he found a contradiction in the Court Record?
1111222221111211.title: He didn't know the victim's name and face.

choices: The trial is extended another day right then and there.
11112222211112111.content:
Phoenix turned around to face the defendant. She resembled the figure very closely, but more important to him was her expression. She looked absolutely mortified. He hadn't heard a word out of her and he already knew she couldn't have done it.

He examined the Court Record closely, starting with the autopsy report.

"Time of death: Noon. Cause of death: Punctured lung from knife wound to back. Victim also shows minor signs of blunt force trauma from impact with concrete."

There didn't seem to be anything-

(Wait. Noon!?)

Payne watched with annoyance as the princess sifted through his own personal files. He turned to the judge. "Your Magistry, could you please just hand down the verdict? It would save all of our valuable time-"

"Objection! Or- That's Enough! I meant!"

Stunned, the whole crowd turned to look at the princess, pointing at Payne like some kind of lawyer. "Mr. Payne, when I asked whether the light was from the sun, I asked for a very specific reason."

"Umm... and that would be?"

"The time of death in this autopsy report says noon. In that case, how could the victim have been killed while looking at sunset?"

The crowd chattered, surprised and confused. Why was the princess pointing out faults in her own insights?

"Well, I suppose I don't have an answer for that-"

"That's enough! The explanation for this contradiction is obvious. The victim wasn't staring at the sun. He was looking somewhere else!"

The crowd's murmurs grew into a frenzy.

"I'm going to miss my class agaaaaaain!"

Does the trial continue, or does the Judge suspend proceedings for the day?
11112222211112111.title: There was a contradiction

111122222111121111.content:
The Judge banged his gavel. "Due to unforeseen circumstances, were going to have to delay this trial to tomorrow." The judge said.

"But, your Magistry, surely you can make time to finish it right now?" Phoenix protested.

"I'm sorry your benevolence, but I already missed class once this week. If I have to tell my wife I missed it because of another trial, then I fear I'll be the next person whose vision will be in the pool." The judge said depressed.

'He's scared of his wife enough that he'll deny a request from the princess?! I don't know if that's true love or the worst of fates' Phoenix thought to himself. "Alright your Magistry, go and see your wife before your late." Phoenix agreed.

"Thank you, your benevolence." The Judge said and left at a high speed.

Phoenix put Rayfa's robe back on as he thought of his next move. Should he return to his body as soon as he got back to the palace? That may be for the best, if he went back to being himself he could defend the defendant without having to worry about doing Rayfa's job at the same time.

On the other hand, if he stayed as Rayfa he would have a lot more authority in the trial as opposed to his own body, which would no doubt be challenge during every part of the trial by the gallery and the prosecution. Plus, he wouldn't have to deal with Rayfa's constant mid trial insults if he was her for the trial.

His thought were interrupted by Nayna "Forgive me, your benevolence, but may I ask what you're thinking?" Nayna asked Phoenix.

Phoenix didn't know how to answer, he wasn't really thinking that whole time. Pointing out contradictions and defending those in need just came natural to him. "I just believe that trials need to be fair. I can't have people be executed with defense." he said, despite that being very out of character for Rayfa.

Phoenix could see a small smile on Nayna's face "You sound a lot like someone I used to know long ago. forgive me for speaking out of line, your benevolence."

It was regrettable, as Phoenix had already taken up so much of Rayfa's time by taking her body, but he realized this was the best way forward. He thought about the way things went last time: it was insanely uphill keeping the judge's attention, and the crowd was hounding him the entire time. Perhaps the most disturbing aspect though was the thing that made the people of Khu'rain too afraid to even take up defense: The Defense Culpability Act. When Phoenix had defended Ahlbi, he put his own life on the line by association. That was a risk he had taken numerous times in his career, but he had employees and a kid back home to worry about. It was selfish, but Rayfa's body was like a shield. If there was one thing he learned from being Rayfa for two days, it was that she was very beloved by her country. Since he now knew he could perform a divination seance in her place, his impersonation was complete. Even if he lost defending someone, they'd never put her to death.

'Seeing Rayfa take the defense might even change some minds,' Phoenix mused. 'Although, defending from a teenage girl's body will be... a strange position to say the least.' Still, Phoenix was accustomed to nothing but strange circumstances at this point in his life.

With Nayna in tow, Phoenix made his way 'home' back to the palace. He'd need to spend quite a bit of time reviewing this case if this was all going to end up being worth it. Thankfully, he had the authority to atleast demand SOME privacy in Rayfa's room.

---

The next morning, Phoenix was faced with a dilemma that rarely struck him:

'What should I wear?'

In his normal body, Phoenix was accustomed to wearing the same blue suit whenever he had a case. It rarely changed, and he appreciated the constancy. When he was off the job, he just wore casual clothes. Now, however, he was in a totally different body with a much, much broader set of outfits.

He could just wear Rayfa's usual channeling outfit, which she always wore to trial, but it didn't feel right. He wasn't going to this trial as a priestess, he was going as a defender! He needed something different to show that.

Thinking back to his previous mentor, Phoenix decided to go for something simple. Thankfully, western styles of dress weren't unheard of in Khu'rain. Inga - Rayfa's father - regularly wore a suit and tie. While it was lined with some distracting light blue patterns and the buttons seemed to be made of a reflective silver, Phoenix eventually managed to come across a mostly normal black suit in Rayfa's vast wardrobe, complete with a silk tie and a mid-length business skirt. He opted to have the servants simplify Rayfa's hair as well, holding it up behind his head rather than on the sides in its usual pretzel-looking shape. The tiara and the facial markings had to stay, however.

Giving his temporary form a look over in the mirror, Phoenix was satisfied. Rayfa probably wouldn't appreciate the transformation, but Phoenix needed to feel like a lawyer if he was going to enter that court as one. Even if that meant wearing a skirt, he'd do it.

Being escorted by Rayfa's usual entourage, Phoenix knew that he was drawing the eyes of many. Her bodyguards and servants didnt dare protest him, but he knew they found the 'princess's' knew behavior to be more than odd. Some of the citizens he passed along the way seemed to scarcely recognize her as well.

Confident in his ability to handle the situation even without his usual form, Phoenix strode into the court with Rayfa's small legs to find...

After thinking it over for a little while longer, Phoenix had two ideas of who Ahlbi could currently be. Mr. Wright himself was even considering getting his badge back in order to become a lawyer once again after his name had been cleared.

Apollo grabbed the package from the floor and decided to take it into the room with him, sitting down at the small desk reserved for the office's junior partner, and looked over the contents. Sounds like something she'd want," Apollo said, "well, I suppose it has my name on it. I may as well try it right? I have nothing to do until I get a case anyways."

Apollo considered ways to use it; he could maybe use it on Mr. Wright or Trucy if just to shuffle things around in the office. He was the only lawyer, but they still treated him like the lowest rung on the totem pole since he was new. The last case at the space station was particularly stressful for him. If he wanted some time off, then the possession and aware swap functions would definitely be his best choices. The former seemed to have less consequence, but it would be a bit... amoral to take someone's body without them being able to show dissent. Aware swap would be a bit more ethical, but he'd have to convince the other person to go along with it.

The shape shift function definitely seemed the most utilitarian; Apollo could imagine it being useful on a case. No one had to become aware and technically no one had their body stolen, but Apollo would seem missing to everyone else, and he ran the risk of running into whoever's body he took.

Then finally, there was unaware swap. Apollo couldn't really see a practical use for that one, but he admitted it would definitely be a funnier option. Swapping himself with a coworker or just swapping two coworkers around and having everyone act like it was normal would take the edge off the day for sure.

While he supposed that it was a breach of privacy to keep her body for a whole day, he didn't think that Athena would mind. Heck, if she had access to the remote she would probably do the same thing. Plus, he did her work for her today, she owes him.

Once he had finished up Athena's work he put alway Widget and stood up. "I'm going home Apollo, see you tomorrow!" He said to his own body. saying his own name in a sentence was odd, but it was something he supposed he would have to get used to if he was going to be using this remote.

"Uh huh, see you tomorrow Athena." His own body said uninterested. It seemed that his own body wasn't finished with his paperwork yet. Apollo silently prayed to himself that his double would finish the paperwork so he wouldn't have to tomorrow. 'Of course Mr. Wright gave me more work to do than Athena' Apollo complained internally

Once Apollo had left the office he wondered where he should go now. The first thought to come to mind was to go to Athena's home. He could just relax there and get used to his new body. Although, it wasn't particularly late right now. He could go somewhere else in town and do something else until it got a bit later. Athena's body was getting hungry, he could go somewhere and get something to eat.

Apollo supposed that just standing around in the hallway wasn't going to do anything and began to head out of the building. Where did he go?
11122121311.title: Apollo decides to stay as Athena.

Apollo figured he'd just eat at her place. It'd be better to avoid a lot of social interaction, lest eyebrows raise.

He quickly used one of those "find-an-address" websites and found where she lived. He ran over to the place in an attempt to avoid disrupting any exercise routines, and went in.

He finally made it "home". It was a nice enough place. Not much more or less extravagant than his own, but they did get the same paycheck, so that didn't come as much of a surprise.

He was starting to get pretty hungry. He figured he should eat something. At the same time, he was finally getting a chance to just take in how this new body felt, and this suit was a little uncomfortable. What Apollo decided to do first was...
111221213111.title: To Athena's home

1112212131112.content:
While Apollo was felling hungry at the moment, the curiosity of his new body took propority in his mind. He made his way to Athena’s closet and began to look through some of her clothes. If someone had to describe Athena’s wardrobe it would be, average. While she didn’t own anything particuarlly fancy, her clothes also weren’t poor. She had an average wardrobe.

Apollo looked through her clothes to see if anything in particular caught his mind, nothing really did, he didn’t know much about women’s clothing. However, there was one outfit that did stick out to him. It seemed to be an old school uniform of Athena’s. With nothing else catching his eye, Apollo took out the unifom and decided to put it on.

While it was a bit weird to put on a school uniform and wear it around the house, Apollo brushed off those thoughts thinking that no one else would see him wearing it. Plus, wearing an outfit like this may help him adapt to being in a female body, even if it was only temporary.

Although a bit hesitant, Apollo soon took off Athena’s suit and began to change clothes. He made sure to keep his eyes closed to protect Athena’s privacy. Although changing with his eyes closed was a bit of a challenge, but he percivered. Almost every movement he made while putting on the clothes felt strange to him. Once he had finished putting on the old school uniform, he went over to a mirror to make sure he had put it on right.

Looking in the mirror, he realized that he may have underestimated how long it had been since Athena had last worn this uniform. It was small on her and left her midriff exposed. While Apollo supposed he should go and put on an outfit that actually fit right, He decided against it, do to not wanting to go through the pains of changing with his eyes closed again.

Happy with the change of clothes, Apollo went over to Athena’s kitchen to go get something to eat….

Anyway, when he finished psyching himself up, he opened the door.

Who was it?

Apollo opened the door to Athena's home, to reveal Juniper Woods, waiting patiently by the door.

"Hi, Jun-ie!" Said Apollo. He was going to say "Juniper" but he caught himself on the right syllable, luckily for him.

"Say, what brings you here?" He asked in a way that would be percieved by Juniper as "half-jokingly".

"I didn't call!?" Asked Juniper. "Oh, I must have forgotten! Sorry, Thena!"

"That's okay, I'm not busy." Apollo said.

"That uniform really suits you, Thena." Juniper said.

Apollo looked down at himself. He had kind of forgotten how weird it must have looked to be wearing a uniform from Themis Legal Academy in her own house for no reason. How did Athena even get a Themis Uniform to begin with?! She never went there!"

"Uh... thanks, Junie! I... like your outfit, too...!"

"Anyway, Jun-ie, what do you wanna talk about? I'm all ears!"

And here Apollo thought he was clever. Alas.

Juniper was talking very slowly and stuttered throughout the entire conversation. "Thena, I-I need some advice for talking to.....you know who." Juniper asked who she thought was Athena for relationship help.

Apollo didn't know what to say or do. When it came to romance, Apollo was dense as a brick. He didn't even know what guy Juniper was talking about. If the real Athena could see what was going on, she would've punched Apollo for not being able to tell who Juniper was talking about.

Apollo took a deep breath, if all else fails, bluff. "Well, Junie, why don't you just go up to him and be direct. Tell him that you like him." He gave the closest things to advice that he could think of.

"B-but I...." Juniper began to say before she started to breath heavily into her sunflower. Hearing the discord in her voice was more than enough to tell Apollo that he gave the completely wrong advice for someone like Juniper.

Apollo wanted to say something, but he couldn't think of anything. He wasn't good at this kind of stuff. That's when he had an idea, the remote. It was a bit unconventional, sure, but maybe he could use this to help her with this guy.

Does Apollo reveal the remote to Juniper?

How did Apollo answer?

"I did a test swap and then fixed it right after." Apollo lied to Juniper. He chose to lie to her because this whole time Juniper thought she'd been talking to the real Athena and had even asked her for advice. Telling her that he wasn't actually Athena right now might not be the greatest of idea.

"Oh? Did you make sure to ask before you used it?" Juniper asked, concerned about Athena swapping with someone against their will.

"Um, sure, I made sure to do that." Apollo lied, the discord in his voice was fairly obvious 'Did she buy it?' he heard widget say. He had forgotten that it occasionally said what Athena was thinking

"'Thena" Juniper said, Apollo could hear the disappointment in her voice.

Apollo nodded and handed the remote over to Juniper. Juniper stared at the remote for a minute, it was clear that she was amazed by it. Apollo was curious, both about the guy Juniper liked and who Juniper was going to swap with. "So, who are you planning to ask to use the remote on?" He asked her.

Juniper thought about it for a second, before she answered, who did Juniper plan to swap with?

11122122221.content:
Apollo's ghostly form floated through the door, and straight into whoever was on the other side. As soon as he entered the person, everything sort of went black for a second, so thanks to his hastiness, he didn't actually get to see who's body he was entering. As his vision returned, though, something definitely felt off. He was human again, but the body he'd entered felt rather different to his own.

He looked over at the hand that had been raised to knock on the door. It seemed small and feminine, covered by a white, fingerless glove. He lowered his arm, seeing the feminine hand lower on his command. He probably shouldn't have been surprised, considering he'd been a ghost a few seconds ago, but it was still somewhat off-putting to see a hand that was clearly not his moving as if it was. Of course, now he knew why his body felt so different; he was no longer a man.

He looked down at his new body, seeing the pink dress he was clothed in, and the long, brown braids falling into his field of view. It took him a moment, not being used to seeing it from this perspective, but he recognised the body he was in. He was in the body of Athena's childhood friend, Juniper Woods. After meeting up with Athena again after getting charged with murder twice, Juniper had been stopping by at the office every now and then on days when she didn't have any classes. Apollo supposed she must have been doing that today, although it was a little odd that she showed up before Athena had even arrived at the office.

Looking down at the hand that hadn't been used to knock, Apollo noticed that he was still holding the remote. It had disappeared when he used the possession function, so he supposed now that he'd found a body, it had reappeared in his hand. He did feel a little bad about taking Juniper's body, even if he hadn't meant for it to be her, but perhaps this was what he needed. Juniper likely didn't have anything else she needed to do today if she was visiting the office, so maybe he could use her body to take a little time off.

Before he could decide what to do, Apollo hear footsteps from the other side of the door. His body must have heard Juniper knocking, just like he did, and was coming to answer the door. Now Apollo was more than a little nervous. He knew that taking someone else's body would likely involve having to try and act like them, but he wasn't prepared for it to happen so soon. He especially wasn't prepared to interact with his own body, talking to a copy of himself. If he didn't get his nerves under control, his copy would probably perceive that something was wrong and question him about it. Maybe he should just leave before his copy opened the door. If he could get away quickly enough, maybe he could avoid the situation altogether...
11122122221.title: Apollo enters Juniper's body

111312.content:
Edgeworth shook his head with a half-amused, half-annoyed smile as he read the directions on the package that had been sent to him. It was a small remote and a set of instructions, claiming that the device allowed the user to swap bodies. 'Whoever sent this really doesn't know me all that well,' Edgeworth mused as he played around with the device while sitting at his desk. 'I was never one for fairy tales. I'm sure Wright and Fey would have appreciated it more.'

Edgeworth pushed the contents of the package aside and resumed his work, organizing files and sorting out paperwork. The remote laid out of sight and out of mind for about an hour or two while the prosecutor went about his job.

"Hmm? Oh, yes, the toy," Edgeworth muttered to himself as he picked the remote back up. "What on earth am I expected to do with this thing now? I'm not much a fan of science fictions, and its not as though I have a television in here." Edgeworth was a little bit curious, he had to admit. He didn't believe that the remote would do anything that the instructions said, but he had to wonder what it did do, assuming it wasn't just a solid piece of plastic and buttons. Was it a prank? Would it just make a noise and do nothing?

Edgeworth wasn't willing to seek out a test subject -he'd just look foolish and overzealous- so he was about to throw it out when his phone began to rang.

"Mr. Edgeworth!" Miles could hear Detective Gumshoe on the other line. "You there, pal?"

"Yes detective? What's going on?"

"There's..."

Edgeworth looked down to the remote. He supposed this would be his chance to try it out, if just once. "Yes I suppose that's convenient. Thank you, detective, I'll see them in. Do you know who this individual is?"

"Mr. Edgeworth! Hello," Edgeworth suddenly heard a soft voice say as the door to his office opened. "It's been so long!" She looked much like he remembered - even wearing a white outfit much like the one she wore as a flight attendant. Edgeworth supposed she just liked the look of it.

"Good afternoon, Rhoda. What brings you here today?" Edgeworth asked.

"I was in the area and I wanted to come on by to thank you for your help again," she said. Miles looked behind her back to see she was carting in a gaudy green and purple suitcase. "My designs have been a huge hit since I last saw you! I wanted to let you know I appreciate how you defended me back on that flight, so I brought you my newest design."

Edgeworth forced a smile. "That's lovely Rhoda, thank you." Maybe Gumshoe would like it. Rhoda's visual sense just didn't appeal much to Miles.

"It's nothing. I was hoping to catch up with you a bit, I haven't seen you since the incident on the plane, but you've been all over the news. They say you were integral to stopping a smuggling ring! I was hoping we could maybe go get lunch together and catch up."

Miles thought it over for a second. He didn't care much for her gifts, but Rhoda seemed nice enough. He supposed it wouldn't hurt. Not to mention, he could possibly ask her to help him test the remote.

"Hmm, yes, that sounds fine," Edgeworth eventually said, much to Rhoda's satisfaction.

Miles decided to try...

1113121111.content:
The remote lit up as it registered Edgeworth as the first target for the swap. Miles supposed he was lucky it wasn't actually a taser or something dangerous like that. He proceeded to turn it around and point it to Rhoda, and everything shifted as he clicked the button.

Miles barely caught himself from collapsing to the floor as his senses reoriented. He felt... smaller. He felt a breeze over his legs, which he realized were covered only by a white skirt. A small white hat had fallen to the ground in front of him as well - just like the one Rhoda wore.

"Wh-what's happened!" A deep voice called out. It sounded eerily familiar to Edgeworth, who was still preoccupied looking over his own new arms.

"...I fear that it worked," Edgeworth replied in a new, more feminine tone.

---

"A-a body swap device!? That's insane!" Rhoda cried out. Hearing his own voice in such a panic was rather unsettling.

"I agree," Edgeworth replied, trying to sound cool, "yet here we are. Don't panic Ms. Teneiro, this should be perfectly reversible."

Rhoda fixated Edgeworth's eyes on the device that was now in her hands. "Do you have any idea where this thing might've come from?"

Edgeworth shook his head, Rhoda's bangs shaking left and right as he did, "not at all. In fact, this is the first time I've used it at all. I assumed it to be a hoax."

There was a silence for a moment. Rhoda suddenly seemed to be rather deep in though. "So, if I just click these buttons, then we turn back to normal?"

"That should be correct. I assume you would like to switch back without delay, correct?" Miles was certainly ready to go back into his own body. He had little desire to be anyone else at the moment.

Rhoda turned the device around in her hand before...
1113121111.title: Aware Swap

1113121112.content:
Edgeworth first pointed the remote at himself and pressed the button, mentally noting that the remote lit up a little when he pressed it, but otherwise it seemed to do nothing. Thankfully, that meant it didn't do anything harmful either. Of course, the manual claimed the remote needed two targets for a swap, so Edgeworth turned the remote around and pointed it at Rhoda, before pressing the button once more. This time, there was no way he could deny that something happened.

Edgeworth suddenly felt very different. His felt smaller, more delicate. His arms and legs felt exposed, and he was pushed up onto the balls of his feet. He could feel something resting atop his head, and something pulling his hair back behind him. But most importantly, he could feel a void between his legs, and a weight hanging from his chest. Even just looking at the delicate hand that was holding the remote told Edgeworth everything he needed to know about what had happened; he has swapped bodies with Rhoda Teneiro. He was at a loss for words.

"Um, Mr. Edgeworth?" Edgeworth heard a voice that sounded remarkably like his own. Looking up at the source of the voice, he saw none other than his own body, as was to be expected. No doubt Rhoda was now inhabiting his body. "Was something supposed to happen?" she asked. It seemed the remote was doing exactly as promised. Not only had it managed to switch their bodies around, but Rhoda was none the wiser. She, along with everyone else in the world except Edgeworth, likely thought that the two of them had always looked like this.

"Oh, um, nevermind, it's nothing," Edgeworth managed to get out, a bit off-put when he heard Rhoda's voice come out of his mouth instead of his own. Although the test had been a success, he wasn't sure he should say anything. As far as Rhoda was concerned, this was all normal. He thought it best to keep this quiet for the time being, it may come in handy later.

"Well, okay. Shall we go then?" Rhoda said, gesturing towards the door.

Edgeworth nodded, and said, "Yes, let's go." He did agree to go have lunch with her, after all. That said, Edgeworth wasn't sure he felt comfortable walking around in Rhoda's body. Perhaps it would be best to swap back before he left.

Not until he had tested each of it's functions and was sure that no part of it was defective.

Soon Edgeworth and Rhoda arrived at a small place that Edgeworth had picked out. They served both food and tea here, plus it was close to his office, so he came here often. Edgeworth ordered some tea for himself and began to talk to Rhoda about what he had been up to since they last met. As Edgeworth drank his tea, he noticed that it tasted different than usual. He figured that must have been because the taste buds on Rhoda's tongue were different than his own. Thankfully, the the tea didn't tast particularly unpleasant.

Rhoda and Edgeworth talked for a while. It wasn't too often that Edgeworth was able to talk with someone for an extensive period of time, when he wasn't investigating a crime scene that is. Before he could press the button to switch back, Edgeworth heard an unfamiliar ring tone. He figured that it was Rhoda's phone and returned his focus to the remote. However, Rhoda spoke up and interrupted him. "Um, isn't that your phone ringing?" She asked Edgeworth. It was then Edgeworth realized that the ringing was indeed coming from what 'Was' Rhoda's phone, but was now 'his'. He answered the phone "Hello? Miles Edgeworth speaking."

He was greeted by the frantic voice of Detective Gumshoe on the other end "Mr. Edgeworth! You gotta come quick! There's been a murder at Gourd Lake!" Gumshoe reported.

Make sure no civilians go near the crime scene." Edgeworth said before he hung up. He turned to Rhoda "I'm sorry we have to cut this short, but there's been a crime."
