"Of course, sir! A man was found washed up on the shore of the lake just a few minutes ago. He was already long dead, with a wound on the back of his head."

"So, blunt force trauma would be the cause of death, then?"

"That's what we're thinking so far. We're still waiting on the autopsy to come back. We haven't identified the victim either, and the only person at the lake at the time was the young woman who called the police, so we don't have a suspect yet."

"Hm, in that case, let me ask a different question. Kay, why are you here?" Gumshoe was obviously here as a member of the police force, however Edgeworth couldn't fathom why Kay was hanging around here as well. Now that the whole Yatagarasu case had been dealt with, he'd hoped she might stay out of trouble.

"I'm here to help! I did steal the role of your assistant, didn't I?" Edgeworth simply glared at her with his arms crossed, doing his best to not have his arms press against his newly acquired breasts. Kay rolled her eyes, before responding, "I just happened to be here at Gourd Lake when the police showed up, and since Gummy was here I figured it was alright if I helped."

Edgeworth sighed. "You should go home, Kay. The Yatagarasu case is over, you shouldn't be getting involved in police business."

"Aww, come on, Mr. Edgeworth! I'll be super helpful! I promise! Back me up, Gummy!"

"Yeah, Mr. Edgeworth! What if we need to use Kay's Little Thief again, or something?"

Edgeworth shook his head. The two of them were hopeless. One moment they're arguing over who's better, the next they're working together to try and convince him to let Kay stay and investigate. At this point, it would probably be quicker to just give in. Kay probably wouldn't cause that much trouble... probably.

"Fine, you can stay. But this is the last time I allow you to assist with an investigation. We can't just have civilians running around a crime scene as they please."

"Yeah! Thanks Mr. Edgeworth!"

Between having to deal with both Gumshoe and Kay's antics, and having to adjust to being in Rhoda's body, Edgeworth had a feeling this was going to be a very long day. "Well, with that out of the way, I suppose we should head to the scene of the crime."

"Okay! Right this way, Mr. Edgeworth," Gumshoe said, leading the way through Gourd Lake Park.
1113121112221.title: He doesn't use it

111312121.content:
"Lauren?" Edgeworth asked, confused as the young woman entered his office. She was involved in a kidnapping case a few months ago, coerced into the crime by her boyfriends. She seemed nervous as she entered, pulling at a loose strand of hair with one hand as though trying to distract herself.

"... uh, hello Mr. Edgeworth," she mumbled, averting her gaze.

"Are you alright Lauren? Do you need something?" Miles asked, trying to coax a response.

"I, uh, need your help," she said, putting her hands behind her back. "There's been some appeals since the incident. They called me back to court, and I, uh, think I need a lawyer." She said quietly and reserved.

Edgeworth shook his head in reply. "I'm sorry Lauren, but I'm not a defense attorney. I could refer you to a firm I know, but it wouldn't be ethical for me to represent you as a prosecutor. Edgeworth actually HAD posed as a defense attorney before, but those were extenuating circumstances.

"Please Mr. Edgeworth!" She cried with clasped hands. "I've never been in a trial before! I don't have a lot of people I trust, I want someone who isn't a stranger representing me."

Edgeworth looked to the remote for a second. Maybe it held the answer? It wouldn't be proper for a prosecutor to act as a defense attorney, but what if Edgeworth wasn't a prosecutor? He could use the remote to switch with a defense attorney and represent Lauren that way. However, that'd possibly require bringing a third person into this mess, which would just be embarrassing if it didn't work. The other possibility was having Lauren choose to defend herself, and then switch with her. Then Lauren could feel safe knowing Edgeworth was defending her while the rest of the world just saw her defending herself. Edgeworth wasn't entirely sure how he'd feel about being Lauren though.

"I might have a solution," Edgeworth said, deciding to...
111312121.title: Lauren Paups

1113121212.content:
It felt a bit too overboard, but Edgeworth felt it'd be easiest to just try using the remote on Lauren herself. She wasn't a horribly bright person; she would need someone's help in court. If the device worked, he'd represent her and no one else would get involved, and if it didn't then he'd just assure her that Wright was trustworthy.

"What is that thing, Mr. Edgeworth?" Lauren asked curiously as Miles lifted the device.

"It could very well be nothing," he replied, "but there's no way to know until I try."

Miles considered which button to use for a moment. A body swap would certainly be the most immediate result, but did he really want Lauren to use his body? What if someone needed him to do something while she was him? Shapeshifting alleviates that problem, but it led to another issue: there's be no Miles at all while he was using her body! What if someone came looking for him? Or worse, what if two Lauren's were found? Finally there was possession; possession definitely solved the utilitarian issues, but it raised some ethical problems. His body would carry on and he'd be able to act in Lauren's place, but what would happen to her? It seemed a bit too controlling?

"Did it work?" Lauren's voice asked, wavering with nervousness. Miles realized he was leaving them both hanging. He decided to stop overthinking things and selected...
1113121212.title: Use Lauren's body

111312121221.content:
After those few moments of thinking it over, Edgeworth chose to use the possession button. He had many duties as a prosecutor so letting Lauren into his body, or having his body disappear altogether, may cause trouble for him if a case were to occur before or during Lauren's trial. If he possessed her, then his own body would still act as if nothing happened.

He aimed the remote at himself and clicked the possession button. in an instant he was floating above his own body in some sort of ghost form. The device had worked. Edgeworth's own body had a blank stare for a moment before it regained composure.

"Are you okay Mr. Edgewor-" Lauren began to say, but was suddenly cut off. She had a blank stare for a second before she regained composure, but something was different about her now. Edgeworth had possessed her body.

Edgeworth's own body didn't seem to notice Lauren's sentence get caught off "I'm sorry Ms. Paups, but there is no way I can represent you in court. My offer to refer you to a defense attorney that I know still stands."

'Lauren' had a much calmer and more serious demeanor now then before "That won't be necessary. Thank you for your offer." 'Lauren' did an one armed bow similar to Edgeworth's as she left his office.

Once outside of the office, Edgeworth in Lauren's body took a minute to go over the situation and his new body. Lauren's body had a completely different feeling than his own body did. The most obvious change was that he was female now. Lauren's clothes and hair further emphasized that.

However, he didn't have time to think about his new body. Lauren's trial was coming up soon and he needed to prepare for it. While he had substituted for Wright once, he wasn't completely confidante in his defense skills.
111312121221.title: Possession

1113121212211.content:
It had been a... strange day to say the least. Miles had used the remote to take control of Lauren's body, but he had underestimated the amount of time between the possession and the trial. Miles had just spent over 24 hours inside of a woman's body; it was definitely... unique to say the least. He worried that it was all a bit too intrusive to Lauren, but Edgeworth told himself that this was just the best way. Lauren had a bit of a fragile personality - he doubted she could defend herself, and she'd probably give Wright a hard time. He was sure that, with himself at the helm of Lauren's body, he could get her a favorable verdict without any undue stress towards her. Maybe hearing that she defended herself in the trial would give her a self-esteem boost?

Pushing the thoughts of ethics out of his mind, Edgeworth pulled himself up from the lobby chair as the bailiff called him into the courtroom. He had worn the same black dress Lauren usually did, but removed the apron and bandanna, opting instead to just tie Lauren's hair back. That left him in a simple, yet still formal enough, black and white dress. Miles straightened out the skirt as he walked, still not very accustomed to it.

As he walked up, alone, to the defense bench, Miles' looked to the prosecutor's bench to see it empty. On the witness stand stood Lance Amano, Laruen's former boyfriend, staring at Edgeworth-in-Lauren derisively, his hands still cuffed. Miles opted to ignore him.

"I'm glad to see you have joined us today Ms. Paups," the old judge said from upon his chair. "It's rare that defendants choose to represent themselves. I do hope you know what you're doing."

"I will be just fine, your honor. No attorney is needed for this trial," Edgeworth replied in a matter-of-fact voice, giving the judge a short bow. Lance seemed taken aback at this; he had likely never seen Lauren act this confidently. Edgeworth didn't look at Lance, but he couldn't hold back a slight grin.

'I've thrown him off guard. That's good - he'll be as much trouble as the prosecutor. I'll need to shake his confidence,'

"Now, where is the prosecution?" the judge questioned. "It's rather unbecoming of an attorney to be late."

As if on cue, the door from the prosecutor's side of the courtroom opened. Edgeworth straightened Lauren's back as he looked forward and sighted...
1113121212211.title: The day of the trial

11131212122111.content:
Edgeworth looked at the prosecutor who had just entered the room. It was a young, blond man. Edgeworth recognized him as Klavier Gavin, he was a young rookie prosecutor who had studied in Europe and got his badge at a young age. He as often criticized for not taking his job seriously, however he would always shrug off those criticisms. He was also in a rock band known as the Gavineers. That was all Edgeworth knew about him, he hadn't met Klavier himself yet.

Klavier stood at the Prosecutor's stand and looked to the Judge "Don't worry your honor, the prosecution has been ready." Klavier said with a snap of his fingers.

The Judge looked shocked "Been ready? Have you been in the courthouse this whole time?!" Asked the Judge.

Klavier had a smile on his face "Have to make a big entrance for the Frauleins. Can't disappoint my fans." Klavier looked over to Edgeworth "Hope you Enjoyed it." He smiled.

Edgeworth had a shocked look on his face. He had heard that Klavier wasn't as serious as other prosecutors, but he barley seemed to care about his job at all. He was treating the trial like some kind of performance!

Klavier seemed to take another meaning from Edgeworth's expression "Looks like I've let you speechless. It's too bad a beauty like you is about to be charged as an accomplice." He did an air guitar gesture and then turned to the judge. "The prosecution has key evidence and a witness."

Edgeworth supposed he should at least be glad that Klavier's attitude would make the trial easier for himself. However he was worried about the future of prosecuting if this man could become a prosecutor, but he opted to worry about that later. The fact that Klavier had just flirted with him, or rather, flirted at him in Lauren's body made Edgeworth a bit uncomfortable. He got over it quick, however he imagined that Klavier would keep on doing things like this for the rest of the trial. This was going to be a long day.
11131212122111.title: Klavier Gavin (young)

111312121221112.content:
Some time later

"Well well," the judge chimed in, his tone both surprised and impressed, "it's been a long time since I've had a defendant represent themselves. Even longer since they last succeeded. I think Ms. Paups has proven her point excellently."

Edgeworth-as-Lauren gave a grandiose bow in reply, "I try my best, your honor."

"B-but, I'm telling you it was her idea!" Lance shouted from the witness stand, straining against his handcuffs. "I was just an accomplice is all! Do you even know who my father is?!"

"I believe we've heard enough, Herr Amano," Klavier butted in casually with a snap of his fingers. "The appeal is over, Fraulein over there has made her case. You didn't exactly have much to stand on going in anyways. I suppose it was all a nice practice round though."

"Well, if the prosecution has nothing else to say, I declare the defendant Lauren Paups to be...."

"Innocent."

Confetti came down from the rafters and claps were heard upon the judge's declaration. Edgeworth gave a short bow and wave to those watching as he made his way back into the defendant's lobby, glad to have the trial be over with. It was a pretty crazy thing for him to do! He'd probably do well to leave Lauren's body soon, she'd probably be rather confused when this was all said and done. Miles began to search through Lauren's bag when he heard a voice chime in behind him.

"That was some impressive work back there, you were almost as skillful as a real attorney." Miles recognized the voice instantly, turning to see Klavier Gavin. "Tell me, where did you learn to handle yourself in court like that? You don't seem the type to be a law student."

Miles frowned for a moment. "I had a... legal adviser beforehand. Most of the evidence was laid out in the investigation anyways."

Klavier didn't seem to buy it, and he merely smiled and shook his head. "Well, I just want you to know I don't want there to be any hard feelings. I'm just doing my job out there after all. The fact that there are people like you who can throw down just as hard gives me some faith in the system." Miles was a bit surprised to hear him sound that lax; in his experience, prosecutors were a bit more... competitive than this. "Just so there are no hard feelings, Fraulein, how about I take you to get something to eat? Maybe you can tell me more about yourself on the way."

Edgeworth frowned in discomfort. He didn't expect to basically get asked on a date post-trial. He wasn't totally sure what to do. His gut said to just leave Lauren's body now, but if he did that then she would certainly be confused, and Klavier would definitely be concerned. If he stayed for a little while, then maybe he could steer away from Gavin and get Lauren back home before he left her body. A small part of him was curious as well; there definitely seemed to be more to this rockstar prosecutor than he saw on the surface. Maybe going with him would reveal something enlightening?
111312121221112.title: After the trial

1113121212211122.content:
As much as Edgeworth wanted to leave Lauren's body immediately, he knew that leaving Lauren's confused in this situation would be troublesome for her. Plus, he had to admit, he was curious about Klavier. "Alright. However, I am very busy, so I can only be around for a little while." Edgeworth said.

Klavier gave a slight laugh and shook his head. "Sure, sure. Follow me, I know a good place nearby." He said with a snap and began walking, giving a hand motion for Edgeworth to follow.

After a short walk Edgeworth and Klavier were outside of a small noodle stand. While Edgeworth wasn't a fan of cheap noodles, he was glad that Klavier didn't choose some romantic location to eat at.

"It's not the most extravagant place, but sometimes the simplest of foods are the best." Klavier said with a smile. "I'll order the food. You just sit down and wait." Klavier said as he motioned for Edgeworth to sit down.

Once Edgeworth had seated himself and Klavier had ordered the food, Klavier began to speak to Edgeworth. "You know, both your Ex and the court record described you as a bit crazy, the kind of woman who would speak to herself. Yet in court today, you were as cool headed as a snowman. There must be a reason for that" Klavier questioned Edgeworth.

"There was an important trial. I needed to act in the way most suited to the situation. Nothing more." Edgeworth bluffed, Klavier wasn't completely convinced. Edgeworth had a question of his own. "What about you, You don't seem to take your job seriously at all. Why is someone like you a prosecutor?"

"Well, first off, prosecuting isn't my alone job, I'm also a rock star. Now, before you ask 'Why are you both?', I'm both because I can be both, I put all my effort into both because I know that I can be great at both. The number of honest and good prosecutors nowadays is tiny and the ones who are are growing old. I know if I do my best to do my job right, other new prosecutors will follow. I'm setting the example." Klavier explained with a snap of the finger between each sentence. He end his little speech with an air guitar. He laughed "I think I just got some inspiration for a new song, thanks to you Fraulein"

While the finger snaps and air guitaring annoyed Edgeworth, he felt he could understand Klavier a bit more. Once the noodles had arrived, Klavier and Edgeworth both began to eat, there wasn't much conversation during the meal itself. Edgeworth was never one for conversation and Klavier was too busy thinking of lyrics for his new song.

Once the meal was finished, Klavier stood up. "It was nice meeting you Fraulein, I hope to see you again." He said as he reached into his pocket and pulled out a small piece of paper and handed it to Edgeworth. It was his phone number. He walked away with a wave of the hand. Edgeworth put the paper away in Lauren's bag

Now that was over, Edgeworth was ready to leave Lauren's body. The remote was in the bag and he could use it at anytime. However, he wondered if he should just leave right now while he was in public, or at least walk to Lauren's home so she wasn't just put in the middle of public with no recollection of what happened the past two days since he possessed her.
1113121212211122.title: Edgeworth stays for now

1113121222.content: Maybe it was Shimon Aizawa (John Marsh in the English fan translation), the 13-year-old child actor and first cousin once removed/adopted son of Judge Justine Courtney?
1113121222.title: The Child Actor, Perhaps?

11131212221.content:
"It's John Marsh," said Gumshoe's voice. "You know; the kid from the affair with the murdered fake president and Simon Keyes."

Edgeworth remembered the boy and the case very well. It had been the case that had convinced him to remain as a prosecutor after he had had some doubts about his path in life.

The boy had gotten Edgeworth's deepest sympathies after the debacle had come to an end.
After all; finding out that your dad had been a foreign president that had been killed by an assassin hired by his body-double, was quite a mouthful for any boy to swallow.
Luckily, John didn't appear to have suffered any mental trauma from this revelation.

Edgeworth did wonder why he had come to see him, though. Technically, he had already gotten a reward from the boy's adoptive mother, Judge Justine Courtney, in the form of a free ticket to a front-row seat for the premiere of the movie in which he had the lead role: 'The Great Monster Moozilla vs. Gourdy'.

Although the movie wasn't in Edgeworth's prefered genre, (on the extremely rare occations that he did go to a cinema), he had to admit that the movie wasn't half bad; John was certainly a very skilled actor in spite of being only 13 years old.

Wondering again why the young movie star had chosen to come and say thanks one more time, Edgeworth replied to Gumshoe: "Send him up."

Less than twenty seconds later, the door to Edgeworth's office was opened and John Marsh stepped in.
He looked exactly like he did when Edgeworth had met him the first time; clad in a red jacket with a Holstein-calf-hide pattern; knee-length blue jeans; sock-less feet tucked into a pair of black tennis-shoes; a black backpack with a cow-head keychain on his back; and, most notably, a pair of fake horns in his hair.

Edgeworth noticed that John seemed to have the same bratty expression on his face that he appeared to have during their first meeting, but then realized that it was actually more like an expression of irritation than anything else.

Edgeworth decided to make the first move.

"So; what are you really doing here, John?" he asked the boy. "Your mother already thanked me from both of you for the help I provided during the case, so it's obviously not why you've come."

John's eyes widened a little out of surprise, before he gave a little smirk and said: "Well, you're still as sharp as a tack. You're right; the whole 'saying thanks' thing was just so I could get easier access to your office."

He then sighed. "I have actually come to ask if you could be a consultent on my next film."

Edgeworth was definitly not expecting that answer. His eyebrows almost disappeared into his hair as he stared at the boy in front of him.

"Hey; it wasn't my idea," said John with a huff. "You see; since you solved the case concerning... my father...", Edgeworth could see he was trying not to get emotional at that memory, "the studio decided to take some 'inspiration', as they put it, from the case."

"In a key scene in the next film, my character is put on trial by a corrupt prosecutor that's accusing him of being responsible for all the damage from the previous film, because my character can communicate with Moozilla.
Because of the prosecutor's influence, no lawyer wants to represent him, so he has to defend himself during the trial."

John sighed again. "Normally the studio asks my mom about any legal stuff, but she has been so busy lately that she doesn't have the time. Then Will Powers remembered you from his own trial and suggested to the executives that you might be an excellent candidate to take her place."

Edgeworth couldn't help himself; he actually snorted half with laughter and half with contempt.

John let out a dry chuckle. "I know; sounds ridiculous, right?"

"Actually, it sounds less ridiculous compared to what I recieved in a package this morning," said Edgeworth and proceeded to tell John about the remote. "Whoever sent it must think I'm a fool. Obviously they haven't heard about me."

"Yeah; what a moron," agreed John.

Edgeworth held up the remote with a smug look on his face and pointed it towards John so that he could see it, too. "As if you could swap bodies with someone by pressing a button." To demonstrate how silly it was, Edgeworth pushed a button on the machine, expecting nothing to happen.

Which button did he push?
11131212221.title: A Visit From A Child Actor

111321.content:
Athena had nothing to do today.

Yesterday was the conclusion of her first 3-day trial, one that involved an impossible locked room and a technological genius as the defendant. This was easily the toughest trial of her career, which made it a little disappointing that it was finally over. Of course, she was happy to win, and happy for her client, but that meant that until someone else stopped by, Athena was going to be stuck, once again, with her normal office duties. So, more toilet scrubbing and paperwork. Boring.

Her morning routine was the same as ever, but as she stepped outside, she tripped over a box sitting at her doorstep and fell to the ground, gracefully as always. Brushing herself off, she took the box inside and set it on the table.

"Body Switching remote", read the box. "Simple, accessible controls allow 4 body switching options! Aware, Unaware, Shapeshifting, and Posession!"

(What kind of sucker does the... uh... whoever it is that put this here think I am?), Athena thought, almost insulted that someone believed they could convince her that there's some working body-switching remote in that box. If anything, there's anthrax in there or something.

On the other hand, it couldn't hurt to at least test to see if it works.

Besides the anthrax thing, but maybe it's worth taking that risk, who knows?
111321.title: Dual Destinies

choices: Athena skips work and goes into the city.
1113211.content:
(You know what? Who am I to pass up something like this?)

Athena opened up the box. Inside, was a small remote control and a note.

"As thanks for my acquittal", the note read.

Suddenly, things made a lot more sense, and Athena was a lot more certain this was the real deal. Now, the question remains. How, and on who, is she gonna use this crazy thing!?

Where does Athena go now?
1113211.title: Would this even remotely work?

11132111.content:
Athena opened the door to her place of work to find, as always, Apollo Justice, Phoenix Wright, and his daughter, Trucy. Phoenix was quietly seated doing work, Trucy was taking a short break to watch tv, and Apollo was squatting in the bathroom holding a toilet scrubber.

"Oh, hey, Athena," said Phoenix. "Ready to get back to normal?"

"Ready, Boss!" Athena said, holding up a peace sign with her fingers. That was a lie. In fact, things were about to get even less normal than during the trial.

But when she did it, did she tell her co-workers first or did she make it a surprise?
11132111.title: Athena goes to the Agency.

111321112.content:
Athena figured if she was going to try anything with the remote she didn't really need to tell her coworkers first. After all, she didn't even know if the thing actually worked or not.

The only question was who to test it out on. She wondered how her boss would react to any changes she did to him. The stories of his old cases all seemed to involve the most weird and unusual circumstances. Who knows what sort of reaction she'd get from him.

Apollo, meanwhile, would probably freak out if she did anything. It would be hilarious. Besides, that's how he is when he's helping out in Trucy's performances, and they still got along fine.

And speaking of Trucy, getting her involved might lead to something even more fun than she could imagine. After all, who knows what the magician could come up with if she knew of the remote.

In the end, Athena decided to test the remote on...
111321112.title: Athena keeps it secret.

1113211122.content: Athena decided to test it out on...
1113211122.title: Trucy or Apollo.

choices: The box is found by someone Athena knows.
The box is taken to the garbage dump.
1113212.content:
(Nah, too risky), Athena decided. Athena picked up the box, stepped outside, and set it right next to the garbage bin in front of the building. And off to work she went.

She never opened the box, but if she had, she would have noticed a the note left inside the box that reads, "As thanks for my acquittal".

What happens to the remote?
1113212.title: WASTED Opportunities

choices: She uses the remote on an Interpol agent to work.
She uses the remote on someone she knows for fun.
1113312.content:
A seriously involved Interpol investigation had finally ended yesterday, and so Franziska von Karma had a day off. She hated those. Perfection wasn't supposed to take days off. But, every once in a while, crime of an international nature was so unusually low that Franziska was left with nothing to do.

So, even if she didn't know it right away, it was a huge relief to get that cardboard box in the mail when she did.

Franziska set the box on the table and opened it, with utmost precision, as you'd expect. And inside she found a remote control and an instruction manual.

("Four dazzling modes!"... This product is very full of itself.)

Franziska didn't believe for a second that this remote was capable of anything. But, on the off chance that it does work, maybe she could make use of today after all.

So? What does she use the remote for? Business or pleasure?
1113312.title: Franziska and the remote.

choices: An assistant or associate (Gumshoe, Adrian, Larry)
11133122.content:
Vom Karmas weren't people who had "fun". Anything that got in the way of a perfect record should be dismissed. There was not time for frivolity.

Still. That was father's way and Franziska had her own way of doing things. And that meant, upon occasion, she could find... amusement in things. Especially if they were at a fool's expense.

There were quite a number of fools out there, but she'd limit her fun to someone she knew personally. Someone like...
11133122.title: She uses the remote on someone she knows for fun.

111331221.content: Hmm, which fool did she pick as her target?
111331221.title: A lawyer (Edgeworth, Phoenix, etc)

choices: After he wakes up from his coma
Before he is put in a coma
111332.title: Godot

1113321.content:
Godot sat at his office, looking at the package he had received. It was some kind of remote, the manual that came with it claimed that it could swap people's bodies. It had four functions 'Aware Swap', 'Unaware Swap', 'Shapeshift', and 'Possession'. at first, Godot thought that it was complete nonsense, however, part of him couldn't dismiss it. He had known Mia for years and knew that spirit channeling was real. So, while it was slim, there was a chance that this remote could work.

However, before he tried it out, he needed to think of a purpose to use it for. One thing came to mind, his only purpose in life at the moment, protect Maya Fey. Ever since he heard the news of Mia's death, he vowed he would keep her sister safe. When he became a prosecutor, he learned that Maya's aunt Morgan Fey was planning to do something. He needed to protect Maya from her aunt.

If he used the remote, he could stay close to her, at least until Morgan put her plan into motion. The only person around Maya right now was that trite lawyer who let Mia die. While swapping with him and making him with the pain that Godot was currently living with would be good karma for Mia's death, Godot wasn't willing to put himself into trite's skin. He doubted he could handle looking at the face of someone he hated in the mirror.

The safest thing he could think of at the moment would be to take the body of Maya herself. After all, what would better way to ensure that she was safe than him taking the helm of her body. While part of him would feel guilty about stealing her body, it would be worth it if he could keep her safe.

Of course, he could be being hasty right now, perhaps there was a better body he could swap into to keep her safe. Did he swap with Maya?
1113321.title: After he wakes up from his coma

11133211.content:
Godot decided that the best thing to do for now would be to swap with Maya. The question now was, what swap should he use?

The first button was also the simplest 'Aware Swap' Using this would put him in Maya's body and her in his. This option was also the most ethical because it was the only one where Maya would be the aware of what he was doing. However, was this the smartest option? If he did this, she would be in his body and have no idea how to live his life. Should he really thrust her into that situation?

He didn't see any real use for the next button 'Unaware Swap'. This button would give him Maya's body and give her his, but the two of them would still have their own lives. The world would still see him as Godot, the manly, coffee loving, prosecutor, but he'd have the body of Maya Fey. This button really wouldn't be of much use to him.

Next up was 'Possession', the easiest of the buttons to use. With this he could take her body and she wouldn't be put into his. This button was also the most unethical, if he used it, Maya Fey would essentially cease to exist until he unpossessed her body, and since he was planning to take it until he knew she would be safe from Morgan Fey, that could take a long time.

The fourth and final button was 'Shapeshift' with this, he could turn his body into a duplicate of Maya's. If he played his cards right, he could use himself as a decoy to Morgan's plan without ever getting Maya involved. It would be difficult though.

After thinking it over several times and giving each one of the buttons careful consideration, Godot decided to use the ______ button
11133211.title: Godot swaps with Maya

11133212.content:
Godot reconsidered. Maybe taking Maya's body wouldn't be the absolute best solution. After all, there was still an element of risk involved, especially if he found himself in a physical confrontation. Did he really trust himself to win a fight while still learning the ropes of another person's body? No, maybe not. Maybe there was someone better.

Who was that someone?
11133212.title: Godot swaps with someone else

111332121.content:

1113333331121.content:
Mia was sitting at her office one day when she received a strange package. She opened it and found a strange remote and manual. She read through the manual, apparently this remote had the ability to swap bodies around and other similar functions. She thought it was nonsense at first, but she was still curious.

But what would she use it for? One thought immediately jumped to mind, Blue Corp. She had been looking into Redd White's shady dealings for quite a while now, but most of what she had wouldn't hold up in court. If this remote actually worked, she could easily infiltrate Blue Corp and get any info she needed on White.

She could easily get into Blue Corp if she took the body of an employee of White, or better yet, take White's body. Once inside all she would have to do is look around White's files until she found some incriminating evidence. It shouldn't be too hard to find something like that in White's office.

Now that she had a plan, she needed to decide on one important factor, should she do this alone? She had confidence that she could do this on her own, but even she was a bit afraid of the risk she was taking. If she messed up at any point and the remote got stolen, she could end up stuck in someone else's body, or worse, he body could be stolen. Without anyone else knowing of her plan, things could end up really badly for her

If she had someone else come with her, they could potentially help her if she got stuck in another body or if the remote got stolen. White had several employees and contacts. She could easily have someone else come with her in the body of a Blue Corp employee.

But who would she have come with her? The first person to come to mind was a lawyer that worked for her, Phoenix Wright. Phoenix had just defended his first client in court the other day, he was a rookie in all definitions of the word, but Mia still saw potential in him. It might be good for her to bring him along, he was a good co-worker and Mia felt she could trust him with a mission like this. On the other hand though, it may not be best for her to bring along the man who had a habit of sweating bullets under pressure on a stealth mission.

The next person to come to mind was Mia's sister Maya, she knew without a doubt she could trust Maya to come along with her. Plus, she wouldn't have to worry about convince Maya that the remote was real, she was sure that Maya would believe it without any proof. On the negative side, putting Maya into the body of someone else might not be the best for sneaking into a place. She would probably give them away within five minutes.

So, did Mia decide to tell someone else about the remote and go with them, or did she decide to infiltrate Blue Corp on her own?
1113333331121.title: Pre-death

choices: He calls White out of the office
11133333311212.content:
Phoenix made his way to the Fey and Co. law offices. Mia had called him early that day and said she had something important to show him. When he walked into the office, Mia began to tell him about some remote that she had got in the mail and how it could apparently swap bodies around. He didn't believe a single word of it. "Chief, are you okay? Do you have a fever?" Phoenix asked concerned.

"Don't believe me? Alright, guess I should've expected that. Guess you'll need some proof!" Mia exclaimed and suddenly point the remote at Phoenix. In an instant, Phoenix point of view changed. One moment he was standing in the middle of the office, the next he was sitting in Mia's chair- and looking at himself! He looked down and saw that he was in Mia's body.

"Do you believe me now?" Mia asked smugly from Phoenix's body, Phoenix remained silent and only nodded. "Good, now, let me explain the plan to you. We're going to use this remote to sneak into the building of a company called Blue Corp. We'll be taking the bodies of the CEO, Redd White, and an employee of his. Understand?" Mia asked to make sure that Phoenix was paying attention

"Uh, yeah, mostly, but why are we sneaking into this place?" Phoenix asked, reasonably confused.

Mia explained to Phoenix what kind of company Blue Corp was and why she needed to get Redd White arrested. "Do you understand? This is one of the most important things in my life. Will you help me?" Mia asked for his cooperation.

"Alright chief, let's do this." Phoenix nodded.

Mia swapped back with Phoenix and the two of them made their way to Blue Corp. It wasn't far from the office, so the walk wasn't long. "Alright, Phoenix. I've been watching this building for a while. So I know the perfect employee to use in order to get to White and take his body." Mia explained.

"Who?" Phoenix asked, it seemed that there was a lot of employees at this large company.

"There's a secretary at the front desk, her name is April May. We'll use her. White should come out of his office if his secretary calls him." Mia explained.

"Okay, sounds good. So, you're going to take her body?" Phoenix asked.

"Of course not, you are! I'm going for the CEO himself." Mia stated Phoenix was shocked, he didn't know he'd have to take the body of a woman! He sighed, this was probably the only way. "Okay, Phoenix, I'm going to use the 'Possession' function on you. When I do, you'll be in some kind of ghost form, according to the manual. All you'll have to do is fly into her, and you'll become her! If it works, come outside and tell me." Mia said before she pointed the remote at Phoenix and pressed the 'Possession' button.

Just as Mia said, Phoenix ended up in a ghost-like state, his own body walked off to who knows where, seemingly unaware of anything that just happened. Phoenix flew into Blue Corp. and saw a woman at the front desk, this must have been April May. Phoenix flew into her and possessed her.

He immediately felt unpleasant. The change in gender was just as bad as it had been when Mia had swapped with him earlier, but April's clothing made the changes all the more obvious. "These clothes can't be professional." Phoenix said in her voice. He wobbled outside, her large heels were very hard to walk in.

"It worked." He told Mia, who only laughed at him

"Okay, now all you need to do is call White out of his office, I'll possess him when that happens."

Phoenix wobbled back into the building, the faster this was over with, the better. Is he able to call White out of his office without problems?

111333333112122.content:
Phoenix stood in silence in the elevator as it took him all the way up to the top floor of the building, where White's office was situated. His heart was pounding with anxiety and his legs were shaking. The fact that he had April's breasts and dramatically exposed legs only amplified the problem.

'Please work...' he prayed as the elevator door opened. There was a small waiting room, pleasantly decorated with some plants and light blue furniture. It was very empty otherwise, however. Phoenix could imagine the claustrophobia would get to someone as they waited to be let into Redd's office. Thankfully, he was an 'employee' at the moment, and nervously made his way into the office, taking short steps due to his short and tight skirt.

"Uh, Mr. White..." Phoenix almost squeaked as he slowly opened the door.

"Yes, April?" The vice replied, overly confident and just a bit flamboyant in tone. It somehow seemed distracted.

"There... er, someone here to see you over at the entrance. Its very urgent." As Phoenix pushed his way in, he felt a sinking feeling in his stomach. On a TV screen hoisted up to the far right wall was security footage outside the office. He could see Mia, waiting in the lobby on the first floor.

"Oh, yes, I know very well who that woman is, Ms. May." Redd replied, his voice dripping with disdain. "Quite a nuisisance. But a dumb one atleast! I can't believe she just came right into my castle like this. What a splendiferous afternoon..." Redd's hand calmly moved over to the far side of the desk, where he clicked a switch on a trophy he had laid out as a decoration.

"Security, there's quite the annoying pest over in the lobby. I need you to handle her. Why not take her to the basement floor? I'll be down there in a moment or two to give a hand."

"Affirmative sir," a gruff voice replied.

"Hold it!" Phoenix shouted in a panic. "What are you doing?"

"Just swatting an annoying little bug that flew in through my window," Redd replied jovially. On the TV screen, Phoenix could see two men in suits materialize, seemingly from nowhere, run in and grab Mia by the arms. She shook her left arm free, and reached for the remote, but she was seemingly too late as one guard tore it from her hands.

'This is bad...' Phoenix could only watch as the guards frog marched Mia away, one of them putting a hand over her mouth to keep her from speaking as he did so.

"Well, that was most entertainifying!" Redd exclaimed as he clapped his hands, getting up from the desk. He turned his attention to Phoenix, who was suddenly feeling very vulnerable without Mia as a lifeline. Phoenix's heart was pounding as he began to speak. "Now, Ms. May..."

1113333331121222.content:
"Ms. May, I'll need you to cancel my appointments for the day." Redd said casually with a grin on his face. "Hurry along now, I have business to get to." White waved Phoenix away.

Phoenix walked out of the office without a word. Once Phoenix was on the elevator down, he began thinking about what to do now. The situation was dire to say the least. Mia had been taken to the basement and one of White's guards had taken the remote. How was he supposed to get out of this situation?

He gave calling the police a thought, but quickly decided against it. From what Mia told him, the police wouldn't act against Blue Corp. Plus, even on the off chance that the police would take action, by the time they got there, whatever damage White was going to do would be done.

Phoenix would need to act on his own, but what could he possibly do from April's body? Obviously he couldn't just go down to the basement and fight off the guards to save Mia. He wouldn't be able to do that if he was in his own body, let alone April's. He needed to think of a plan, and fast.

His greatest advantage at the moments was that he left the office before Redd. However, that advantage would only give him at most two minutes. If he didn't act fast, Redd would make it down to the basement and do god knows what. There was no way he would be able to go down to the basement, free Mia, and leave before Redd got down. A confrontation with Redd was inevitable.

The first thing Phoenix would need to do is provide a distraction for Redd, but how? That's when Phoenix had an idea, and thankfully, he had it just as the elevator reached the first floor. He went to April's desk and called White's office. Thankfully, White picked up "Mr. White. There's someone here to see you."

"Ms May, how dare you distrurb me?! I told you to cancel all my appointments." Redd said over the phone, very angrily.

'Think Phoenix, think. What kind of person would a person like Redd want to see, no matter what?!' Phoenix thought to himself, suddenly he had an idea. "The chief of police is waiting outside in their car." Phoenix told an obvious lie, he prayed that White would fall for it.

White was silent for a few seconds "......I'll be there momentarily." He said before hanging up.

Phoenix let out a sigh of relief, he couldn't believe that had worked, but he had no time to be glad over that. This would only buy him a few minutes at most. He needed to hurry. He went to the elevator and took it to the basement. On the way down he had thought up a plan. obviously he and Mia wouldn't be able to get out of this situation as themselves, but the remote could get them out of this no problem. The problem would be getting it.

Once the elevator got to the basement, he looked around and eventually found the room Mia and the guards were in. Mia was, as expected, giving the guards trouble and resisting as much as she could. From the looks of it, she had broken her arm free from the guard's grip once and punched them in the eye.

Phoenix waled into the room, the guards were obviously shocked. It was clear the only person they expected to come was Redd himself. Mia, on the other hand, grinned when she saw Phoenix, however, she made sure to wipe the grin off her face, as not to alert the guards. Phoenix took a deep breath "Mr. White saw that you confiscated something from the intruder, he ordered me to come and retrieve it for him. Phoenix said as confidently as he could, trying his hardest to hide how nervous he was.

Do the guards fall for this?
1113333331121222.title: "...I'll need you to cancel my appointments"

11133333311212221.content:
"It doesn't seem to be a weapon," the guard replied as he pulled the device out of his jacket pocket, "so you can hold onto it. Take it right to Mr. White." Phoenix held his breath, worried the guard would accidentally press a button, but thankfully nothing happened as Phoenix took it from his hands.

"Yes, thank you," Phoenix mumbled as he delicately took the device, looking over it in April's soft hands. He could see Mia, behind the guards, making a gesture with her neck for him to go on, but Phoenix was all of a sudden realizing how little Mia explained about the remote. He wasn't really sure what any of the buttons did, and there wasn't much time for him to find out.

*creak*

Phoenix could see a combination of confusion and rage on his face; the upbeat tone of his voice gave him an incredibly disturbing sense of dissonance.

"Just do it! Anything!" He heard Mia call out as she socked the guard next to her in the stomach, rushing to charge Redd. Phoenix flinched and clicked a button that seemed right, aiming at Redd as Mia rushed into tackle him.

Which one did he choose?

Phoenix panicked and just pressed the closest button on the remote while aiming at White. Nothing seemed to happen. Mia tackled White to the ground, but he quickly pushed her off. As White picked himself up from the ground, White kicked at Mia before she could get up. Before the kick connected, Phoenix quickly aimed the remote at Mia and pressed the same button as before.

White perspective suddenly changed, he was back on the ground, but before he could react, he suddenly felt a large amount of force hit his stomach. He winced in pain. If anyone comes to see White, send them away." Mia told him. Phoenix wasn't exactly happy about doing secretary work, but after the danger he had just been in a few minutes ago, it was welcome.

Mia had spent the next two or so hours looking through all of Redd's files. She found plenty of useful information, ranging from contact lists to full out records of exchanges. This stuff would be invaluable evidence against White.

She was also able to get into his computer fairly easily "Hey Phoenix, you'll never believe it. That egomaniac's password was his own name!" Mia called out to Phoenix in the hallway. She looked through his files and sent whatever seemed useful to her personal email.

Once everything had been sent, she walked back out into the hallway, where Phoenix had been waiting. "Alright, I think we have everything we need. Let's go get my body back. After that, we'll get you out of April's." Mia relayed the plan to Phoenix.

1113333331121222111.title: Aware Swap

choices: They find a way to slow Redd down after the swap
Phoenix agrees to take Mia's body for now
11133333311212221111.content:
Redd was right where he had been before, restrained in Mia's body. The confusion, fear, and anger he had plastered upon Mia's face was palpable. "This is - this is witchcraft! I'll have you hung!"

'He's losing his mind,' Phoenix noted as Redd continued to hurl threats and invective and a number of words that Phoenix was pretty sure that Redd had just made up. Something he said stood out to Wright though:

"The second I get back in my body, you two will be erased! Gone! Eradified!"

Mia didn't seem to pay attention as she reached into Redd's coat pocket for the remote, but Phoenix reached out to stop her. "Hold on Chief, can we really put him back in his body yet? Who knows what he'll do! You fired his guards, but he still has contacts and probably thugs. Can we act faster than him?"

Mia paused, Phoenix's words making sense. "That's an excellent point Wright. If we put him back in his body now, he can mobilize damage control against us..."

"So what should we do?"

Mia shook her head. "Two options, as I see it. We can find a way to slow him down, or we keep his body and sabotage his contacts until we're ready to strike." Redd was still shouting at them in Mia's high pitched voice.

"How can we keep his body though? We can't just leave him in yours; especially if it means tying him up in this basement!"

"That's right. Which is why I think you would have to be the one to use my body."

"ME!?" Phoenix exclaimed in shock. Why was she so intent on leaving him as a woman.

She nodded, "I could use the possession button to go back to being myself, but there's no telling what Redd's body would do. It may very well pick up right where the original Redd left off. I have to stay here and burn his bridges until we're secure enough to go forward with the information we've gathered. April May doesn't know anything that's happening though, and she's just a lackey. If you left her body and took over mine, you'd be able to suppress White and hold down the law office."

"D-do you trust me to do that, chief?" Phoenix asked, surprised at the responsibility she was considering giving him.

Mia nodded. "You proved to be very quick on your feet today. I'd be in dire straits without you right now. The decision is yours to make though."
11133333311212221111.title: White, just as they left him

111333333112122211112.content:
Phoenix thought about it for a minute and made his decision. While they certainly had the option to put White in his body and try to slow him down, but that plan had plenty of risks. Mia probably found out about plenty of his contacts, but if Redd acted before they could do anything....Phoenix chose not to think about that. The best option here was for him to possess Mia's body while she prepared. "Alright Chief, put me in your body." Phoenix told Mia of his decision.

Mia smiled and aimed the remote at Phoenix. She pressed the Possession button and Phoenix once again found himself in that ghost-like form. White didn't know what was going on, but he knew it wasn't good for him. He let out once last string of threats before he suddenly stopped. Mia's body blinked for a second, her body's facial expression changed and it was obvious that Phoenix was now the one in control.

Before doing anything else, Mia turned her attention toward April May, who was obviously confused. How had she suddenly ended up in the basement with her boss and some woman? "You can go home for the day Ms. May, You aren't needed anymore." MIa sent April home. April was even more confused now, Redd was never one to randomly give days off! She had a feeling something was going on, but she said nothing and left.

Once April had left the room, Phoenix spoke up. "Can you untie me, Chief?" he asked, still stuck in the chair they had put White in.

Mia walked over to the chair and began to untie Phoenix "You're the chief now, Phoenix." Mia said jokingly.

Phoenix knew she said that as a joke, but in a way, it as true right now. Mia was trusting him to temporarily take over her job and life. For all intents and purposes, he was Mia Fey right now. Could he handle it? He was still a rookie lawyer with only one case under his belt, could he handle he job? He also barely knew anything about her personal life, could he properly act like her in front of her family or friends? The mere thought made him nervous.

Mia could tell he was nervous. "Don't worry, you'll do fine. It won't take too long for me to burn all of White bridges, the man didn't exactly keep people close. Getting rid of his contacts shouldn't be too hard. Just give me a week or two." Mia said as she finished off untying him.

As Phoenix stood up, he was again had trouble adjusting to the change in body, at least Mia's clothes covered a lot more than Aprils. "I miss my body." Phoenix voiced his discomfort.

"Being in White's body is no vacation for me either." Mia voiced a similar discomfort. The two of them made their way to the elevator, while in the elevator, Mia gave Phoenix a quick summary of people who might visit the office while he was in her body and how he should act around those people. Once the elevator reached the first floor, it was time for them to temporarily say goodbye. "Alright Phoenix, when I'm ready I'll call you."

"Alright Chief." Phoenix said and took a deep breath "I'll do my best to hold down the office until then." He said and began to walk out of Blue Corp. This was going to be a strange week to say the least, but he would try his hardest. Mia rode the elevator back up to White's office. She was going to have a busy week, but the mere thought of finally being able to take down White excited her.

Who will the story follow?
111333333112122211112.title: Phoenix agrees to take Mia's body for now

1113333331121222111122.content:
After a short commute that felt like an eternity, Phoenix managed to find Mia's residence, stumbling into her apartment in her heels. "How can women walk in these?!" He complained as he kicked them off his new feet. "Its torture... dunno if I can handle a week of them." Exhausted, he plopped Mia's body down on the nearest couch in front a small tv. Thankfully, Mia had closed the office for today. She clearly anticipated something like this happening, and wisely decided they would just open back up tomorrow. Thankfully there were no cases to attend to, so Phoenix had some time to acclimate.

It had certainly been a whirlwind of a day. He never believed in the supernatural before, but here he was! He got thrust into a life or death game of intrigue where he was using someone else's body to go undercover! To cap it all off, he was still not himself. Phoenix would never have guessed that Mia would put so much faith in him.
He never imagined he'd spend any amount of time as a woman, let alone a whole week.

"I guess the promotion is nice, even if it is temporary," he murmured as he looked down at his new self. He had to admit that even though Mia was better dressed than April, she could hardly be described as modest. "What kind of shirt even is that...?" he wondered. Her neckline was very much exposed, and her top drew a lot of attention to her breasts. Her skirt left her long legs very exposed as well. He reached downward and ran his hands down his new calves, shivering a bit as he did; the sensation of his legs being hairless was a new one. Phoenix felt like it might've been going out of line to examine his boss's body like this, but it was basically inevitable. She trusted it to him for at least a week, maybe more. It'd be impossible to not be intrusive.

Slowly, he pulled himself out of the couch and looked around at his new living space. Mia's apartment was only a bit bigger than his own, but it was certainly nicer. The kitchen and living were were in one large area, and all the appliances seemed fairly clean and in order. Mia was a pretty well established attorney with a solid record, so Phoenix supposed it made sense she could afford a nice place on her own. The walls of the apartment were a pretty dull beige, and most of the furniture was black, giving it a fairly spartan air to it. A fairly expansive book case full of law books stood on one wall and there were a few tapestries on the other wall as well, but Phoenix couldn't understand the text.

'They look pretty old. She did mention being from a little village outside town, must be keepsakes.' The only other rooms were her bedroom and a bathroom. Nervously, Phoenix entered the bedroom, finding similarly colored walls along with a home work desk, a locked file cabinet, and a drawer for clothes. She seemed to have a closet as well, with some suits hanging up similar to what Phoenix was wearing. Phoenix realized he was going to have to think of the place as his bedroom for the time being.

Finding a mirror inside the closet door, Phoenix took in the sight of himself as he took the scarf off Mia's neck, feeling a bit choked by it. He was feeling exhausted after the crisis moment from earlier, and wanted to take a rest. Searching through Mia's wardrobe, face red, he found what he guessed were her sleeping clothes: a nightgown with a sort of kimono design to it. He couldn't very well sleep in her suit and skirt, so he figured he'd have to change into something.

"Well chief, can't say we won't be pretty close after this..."
1113333331121222111122.title: Phoenix as Mia

11133333311212221111221.content:
Changing Mia's clothes was about as uncomfortable as Phoenix predicted, but even less comfortable was waking up in the morning to the realization that he needed to shower. A solid block of time spent involuntarily looking at the naked body of his superior was about as uncomfortable as this situation could get, short of some of the horrid ideas he stopped his imagination from conjuring up.

Nevertheless, the deed was done. He still felt unbelievably uncomfortable. That word had run through his mind a few times now.

Phoenix checked the shower off the list and moved to getting dressed. Despite his ineptitude when it came to anything to do with cosmetics, he actually managed to dress up and make himself up in a manner that looked presentable and aesthetically pleasing. He sighed with relief as he began to recognize Mia's face as he normally saw it in the mirror. After a bit more time, he finally felt satisfied enough to head out.

A quick breakfast later, Phoenix walked out the door, electing to wear Mia's relatively flat pair of shoes to avoid collapsing on the way to his destination. He knew he'd have to learn to walk in the heels eventually, but since he was already adapting to so much, he gave himself a break. Eventually, before his feet even felt tired, he made it in time to...
11133333311212221111221.title: Phoenix Goes To Sleep

111333333112122211112211.content:
Phoenix made his way to the Fey & Co Law Offices. Even though he had just been here yesterday, the place felt completely different. Probably because he was now the boss and it was now his office. He sat down at Mia's desk. There weren't any cases that she was working on, so he just did paper work. It was an overall boring time. After an hour or two, Mia's phone began to ring. "Hello?" Phoenix answered it.

On the other end of the phone was a voice Phoenix recognized well "Hey, Chief it's me." Phoenix heard his own voice on the other end. "Sorry, Chief, I caught a *ACHOO* a cold. I don't think I'll be able to come to work today."

Phoenix felt relieved for two reason. First off, he was relieved that his own body wasn't coming to work today. He was still getting used to the fact that he was now Mia, interacting with his own body would make adapting to being someone else all that much harder. It was something he'd certainly have to do eventually, but he'd prefer later rather than sooner. Secondly, he missed out on a cold because he became Mia, lucky him. "Alright...Phoenix. Take the day off." Phoenix told the other him over the phone, talking to himself as if he were a different person was difficult.

"Thanks Chief, I should be better by tomorrow." The other Phoenix said over the phone before he hung up.

Phoenix put away Mia's phone and stared at the ceiling. What was he going to do now? He had finished up Mia's paper work and there weren't any cases to currently work on. He spent the next span of time just sitting around the office bored. His boredom was interrupted by the sound of someone knocking at the office door.

Phoenix went over the list of people who Mia said might visit. The most likely person to visit was Mia's sister, Maya Fey. Mia had told Phoenix about her sister, but hadn't told him much about her. He hadn't even seen a picture of her. The second person to likely visit was Marvin Grossberg, Mia's old boss. Mia had said that Grossberg often visited sometimes and that she trusted her old boss. The third, and least likely person to visit was an old friend of Mia's, Lana Skye. Mia said that she and Lana were friends when Mia was studying to be a lawyer, but the two have been less close lately.

Phoenix went over to the door and answered it, on the other side was....
111333333112122211112211.title: The Fey & Co Law Offices

Maya had plans with Mia for today
1113333331121222111122111.content:
As Phoenix opened the door, he was befuddled to find a strange girl clad in purple Japanese-style robes staring excitedly back at him.

"Hey, sis!" The girl said. It became obvious to Phoenix who he was speaking to.

"Hi, Maya." Phoenix said, doing his best impression of his mentor's tonality. "How are you?"

"I'm doing great! You?"

It was easier not to lie, Phoenix thought. "Busy. It's been busy."

"Aw." Maya said, momentarily dropping her cheery demeanor. Well, now that you have your awesome little sister here, you get to be the good kind of busy!"

She seemed resilient. Phoenix wondered how Maya would react to learning that someone else was in Mia's body at the moment. (She'd probably think I was joking.)

Maya started twiddling her thumbs, still standing in the hall. "Oh, come inside!" Phoenix said.

"Good idea!" Maya replied, stepping into the office as instructed.

That little exchange reminded Phoenix that he had no idea why Maya was there. Maybe Maya and Mia had plans he didn't know about. So, he asked.

"Hey, so, this might sound weird, but in the shuffle... this week, uh... I think I completely forgot what the plan was for today."

Maya pulled a face at that, then put a finger to her chin. What was the answer?

1113333331121222111122112.content:
"Oh, Mr. Grossberg." Phoenix tried for the cheerful, yet professional tone his boss often used when Mr. Grossberg stopped by.

The portly man, sweaty as always, dabbed his face. "I'm glad I caught you Ms. Fey. I was worried you might be in trial and I had to tell you the news in person." He peeked inside the room. "Your, uh, prodigy isn't here, I hope?"

The question made Phoenix nervous. What could be so serious that Grossberg didn't want Phoenix to know? He shouldn't be involved in Mia's affairs... but if it involved Redd White, he had to get the info to the chief right away!

"He's out sick. What's going on?"

Grossberg closed the door behind him, wary of prying ears.

"I thought you should be the first to know..."
1113333331121222111122112.title: Marvin Grossberg

11133333311212221111221121.content:
"You, of course, remember Diego." Grossberg said. Phoenix, of course, did not remember Diego, and in fact had no idea who he was, but he's pretend he knew him anyway.

"How could I forget?" He said.

"Yes, well... I just thought you'd want to know, I recieved word from the hospital today. It seems he's woken up."

(Woken up from what? Who is this guy?)

"Oh... that's big news." Phoenix said, playing up his surprise.

"Indeed. Considering your history, I figured you should be the first to know."

"I'm the first to know?" Phoenix asked with a gulp.

"You're the closest thing to a family member he still has, Mia."

Phoenix sensed pity in Grossberg's voice. Pity for Diego, he hoped. He really wished Grossberg would come out and say where Mia fell on this "Diego's" game of FMK.

"Well, that's all. I'll be going." Grossberg said, making his way toward the door.

"Thank you for telling me." Phoenix said as the door closed shut.

He had no idea how to react, or even how his "vessel" was supposed to react. He guessed the easiest way would be to go and visit, but that could cause much more issues than it was worth. At the same time, what if this couldn't wait until he had a chance to call Mia? Then there could be horrible consequences and it would be all his fault.

What did he settle on?
11133333311212221111221121.title: Diego Armando is awake

111333333112122211112211212.content:
Mia had been surprisingly busy in the world of Bluecorp. Redd White was involved in mountains more dealings than she expected. Burning all these bridges and bringing all of White's crimes to light... it could take longer than expected.

The ring of White's phone cued her job to get back into character. She couldn't let anyone catch on to the truth.

"White. Talk to me and quick, I have a meeting." It wasn't quite in character but a brisque, grumpy Redd White would definitely ensure people wouldn't want to bring "him" to anger."

"Chief. It's, uh, me."

Oh dear. "Phoenix, we need to be discreet. I don't want my life tangled with White's by accident. I'm sure whatever it is, you can han-"

"But Chief, its, uh, kind of a personal thing? A personal to you, thing."

She sighed. "Alright, what's going on? Did something happen in Kurain Village?"

"Not exactly? Erm... Mr. Grossberg was here? And he said... Diego Armando woke up."

In the silence that followed, a pin dropping would have been like a violent crash.

"...Chief?"

"No, right, yes, I heard you." She dragged a hand down White's face. After all these years... he finally woke up? Right now?

"What should I do, Chief?"

Mia stared at the desk, considering her options. She'd been waiting so long... but she'd been waiting even longer to destroy Redd White. Which took priority? Her love? Or justice?
111333333112122211112211212.title: Phoenix waits to tell Mia.

choices: There's a knock at the door
1113333331121222111122112121.content:
"Try to avoid him if you can at all help it." Mia instructed. Phoenix groaned internally, still not sure what that meant about their relationship status.

"Okay, but, what do I do if he comes and finds me, or I see him at the grocery store or something?" Phoenix asked.

"... if it comes to that, just know that he and I dated, and technically still are."

The line went silent. He'd thought that this answer would've relieved him, but all it really did was bring to his attention that if it came down to it, he would have to act romantically with Mia's former lover. That he didn't know.

"Okay... thanks for the advice, Chief."

"Remember not to call unless it's REALLY an emergency, alright, Phoenix?"

"I understand."

Mia shut White's phone.

Phoenix slammed his face into the desk. When it occurred to him that doing that may have messed with Mia's makeup, he quickly lifted his head and checked a mirror to find that, luckily for him, nothing had smeared. He then lightly pressed his face to the desk, but failed to get the emotional release of a normal face-slam, which disappointed him. This entire situation was so stressful.

But, stressful or no, Phoenix realized that he had nothing to do. Twiddling with his thumbs had only gotten him so far, and the appeal of counting the leaves on Charley had worn out the second time he had done it. Either way, he had a day to power through.

Does he eventually break down and go out to pass time, or does a knock at the door knock him out of his boredom before he gets the chance?
1113333331121222111122112121.title: Mia tells Phoenix to avoid Diego, but act roman...

choices: Mia makes it to the office without incident.
On the way, someone runs into Mia.
1113333331121222111122112122.content:
Mia knew that there really was no other option when it came to the people that really mattered in her life. Redd White was a man who had become so entrenched in business and crime that taking him down would not only make the city a much safer place, but also she could uncover the truth behind DL-6, the fateful case that caused her mother to leave Kurain in disgrace.

And yet, this was a project that she had spent a lot of time executing and would need to continue spending time to finish. There was only one important fact: Diego needs her NOW. Not tomorrow or the day after that. What he's been through...he needs to know that she will always stand with him. Simply getting Phoenix to pretend to be her around him was not an option. Not only would it embarrass the hell out of her student (even if it might be funny watching him squirm pretending to be in love), but Diego would also be hurt that she couldn't prioritize him when he needed her most.

"Alright," she decided. "Close up early but stick around. I'll come by soon."

"Hey, who even is..."

"Not right now. I'll explain when I get there."

Mia hung up, not wanting to risk anyone overhearing anything more than what she had already said over the phone. She got up and out of the office, stopping to direct White's secretary. "April," she said in a serious tone, "something personal has come up. I need you to reschedule the rest of my appointments for the day."

April looked up with concern on her face. "Is everything alright, Mr. White?"

"Yes, yes, everything's fine. Just...it's very important for me personally, and I need to be there now."

"Alright, sir. I'll take care of everything on our end."

"Thank you, April. You really are the best secretary I could ask for." Mia hoped that those words would help keep her satisfied. After all, she really did seem to be a nice person, if a bit...spacey.

"Thank you, Mr. White." April really was concerned for her boss, but she appreciated that he in seriousness regarded her well.

Mia nodded as she headed for the elevator to get to White's car. It seemed like he often preferred to let others drive him places, but she had taken to driving his car to minimize exposure to people who might get suspicious about her identity.

After some time, she found a space somewhat close to the office, but far enough that, if anyone recognized White, they wouldn't immediately think he was going to the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Mia fingered the remote in her pocket, remembering about the shapeshifting function it had. She planned to copy someone's body then, once they were far enough away, turn into them before heading to the office. She noted a woman with a red afro and green outfit distractedly talking into her phone. Making sure that no one was looking at her, Mia quickly pulled out the remote and pressed the right button to copy the woman's shape. A light appeared on the remote, recognizing the success of the function.

Eventually the woman hung up and headed on her way. Mia waited before heading in the opposite direction into an alley. Looking around to ensure she wasn't being followed and that there were no cameras around, she pointed at herself and pressed the button. The changes happened quickly: Mia felt a huge growth of hair on her head as she shrunk a few inches and grew out in other areas. She sighed in relief. Even though she still wasn't herself, it felt good to at least be a woman again.

The strange woman's outfit happened to have pockets in the jacket, which was good considering Mia hadn't brought a purse with her. Putting the remote into one of the pockets, she headed for the office.
1113333331121222111122112122.title: Defense Attorney Mia Fey chooses love.

11133333311212221111221121221.content:
Thankfully, no one seemed to really pay attention to Mia on her way to the office. Sure, some people took notice of her hairstyle, but no one was getting in her way. When she reached the office, she was satisfied that Phoenix had done as he was told. Mia knocked heavily on the door, waiting for a response.

"Sorry, the office is closed right now!"

"Phoenix, it's me."

She waited as she heard the lock turn and the door opened. "Chief?"

"Not bad, Phoenix," Mia commented as she looked over her real body. She took it as a good sign that Phoenix had managed to adapt quickly to his situation, even applying a small but noticeable amount of makeup. "You seem to have gotten the hand of looking the part of a real woman."

Phoenix kept from reacting to that comment. "Who's that? What's going on?"

"Soon, Phoenix. Just let me get in first and make some coffee."

Phoenix stepped aside as Mia made her way to the coffee machine. As she prepared a favorite of Diego's, she explained first that she had disguised herself as a stranger to keep anyone from seeing Redd White enter the office. When Phoenix asked if someone was wandering around in White's body, Mia explained the shapeshifting functionality of the remote, which had allowed her to copy someone else's form.

"That leads us to why I needed to come here. I hadn't stored a copy of myself on the remote, so I need to do that before I see Diego."

"Huh? How come you don't just want to swap back into your real body?"

"That's the thing. White's still quiet in there while you're possessing my body, right? What do you think might happen if I tried to swap bodies with you while you're still possessing my body?"

Phoenix paused. "I don't know."

"And neither do I. I can't take the risk that White will wake up before we're ready to take him down."

"That makes sense, Chief. But why come here anyways? Who's Diego?"

Mia smiled. "Diego was my senior coworker back when we still worked for Mr. Grossberg. But more importantly, he's my boyfriend."

"Ah!"

"What's wrong, Phoenix? You seemed surprised that I had a boyfriend. Are you saying I'm not pretty enough for one?"

"Huh? Nonono, of course not, Chief! You're incredibly beautiful, and more importantly, you're an incredible person! You could probably be with anyone you wanted to!"

Mia chuckled. "I'm just messing with you, Phoenix. But it was nice to hear you say that. Flattery will get you everywhere."

Phoenix sweated as he was pretty sure that saying went the complete opposite way. "I'm really glad you didn't make me go see him. I can't imagine having to pretend to be in love with some guy I don't know. Speaking of him, though, what happened to him? Mr. Grossberg said he had woken up in the hospital. Was he in a coma?"

Mia nodded as her face became serious. "Exactly. A few years ago, Diego ingested a poison that the doctors thought would kill him. When he was still alive after a few days, the doctors were astounded and kept him as a coma patient. They told me it might be years before he woke up, assuming he ever did."

"But how did he get poisoned in the first place? I can't imagine that he'd just stumble upon some poison and decide to try it out himself."

"Well, it's a long story that started from my very first case as a lawyer. To give you the short version of the story, my first client committed suicide on the witness stand after he ingested poison, allowing the real culprit to escape unpunished. Diego and I didn't give up on pursuing her, and he finally got the opportunity to interrogate her. That's when she laced his coffee with poison to silence him."

Something about this seemed awfully familiar to Phoenix. "Who poisoned him?" he asked, though he felt like he might already know the answer.

"Why, our mutual friend, Dahlia Hawthorne."

Silence reigned as bad memories returned the forefront of Phoenix's mind. It still hurt. He had gone out with her in college, and he had thought they were truly in love with each other. Only Mia was able to show him the truth: that she had been scheming to kill him over a necklace she had given him. A necklace that had contained a bottle of poison. "That day," Phoenix began as his voice returned to him, "when I first met Dahlia and she gave me the necklace. Was that...?"

"You figured it out very fast, Phoenix. Yes, that was the day she poisoned him. I'm just happy that Diego managed to pull through."

The machine beeped a few times, letting the lawyers know the coffee was ready. Mia took out a thermos and poured the coffee into it. "He'll need some of this in his system. I swear, it's like coffee is part of his blood or something."

When she finished pouring the coffee, she took the remote out of her pocket and pointed it a Phoenix. After pressing the button to copy her body's shape, she turned it back on herself. The changes were again quick but noticeable, as her hair no longer felt like a giant presence on her head. "That's better."

"Wow...that thing is pretty powerful. Too bad we can't do anything about me right now."

Mia smiled in sympathy. "Sorry, Phoenix. I know I'm asking a lot of you, but I really couldn't trust anyone more than you to do this."

"It's alright, Chief. Even though I'm stuck as someone else, at least I still look like someone I trust and respect. I can't imagine what it's been like for you to have to pretend to be White."

"That's a very mature outlook to take. You really have come a long way from the boy who proclaimed in court that his Dollie doesn't poop."

"Gee, thanks Chief." Phoenix wondered if Mia would ever let that indiscretion ever go. Most likely not.

Mia chuckled as she went to her desk to get a purse she kept in there. She placed the thermos inside before zipping it up. "Alright, I need to get going. Be sure to wait a bit before heading home, okay?"

"I got it, Chief."

"Really, thank you Phoenix for doing this. I'll find a way to repay you for this later."

"Aw, don't worry about it, Chief. Just go and get to your boyfriend. I'm sure he's hoping to see you soon."

Mia gave a smile as she headed out. The hospital where Diego was at was not very close to the office, and she didn't want to use White's car to get there. The bus to get there, however, would be at a stop not very far. Mia got to the stop just as the bus pulled in. After paying the fare, she found a seat as the bus began to start driving off. Soon, Diego. I'll be with you soon.
11133333311212221111221121221.title: Mia makes it to the office without incident.

Who does she run into?

1113333331121222111122112122221.content:
Before Mia stood an oddly familiar face, although she couldn't quite place him. He had broad shoulders hidden under a lengthy coat and a fat face sitting under a hat.

"No worries, ma'am." A gruff voice. "Say, maybe you can help me out. Do you know where 4114 Valencia Street is?"

It struck Mia instantly and she struggled to keep a straight face. This was one of White's guards. He was working the desk on alternating days with the other detail. And he was asking for the address of the Fey Law Firm.

"Just a couple blocks that way, I think." She smiled, pointing in the opposite direction of the Firm. He grunted without another word and pushed past her. Mia quickly increased her pace, trying to get away from the man.

What could he want? Did he want to rat on his boss? Or had White made orders to spy or harass Mia that she hadn't counteracted yet? How many layers and plans did White have? What wasn't he writing down and she might know about?

Before long, she found herself in front of her office, hand hovering over the door handle. Was it safe for Phoenix to be Mia? She really should switch back with him. But the longer White was free, the chance his schemes could continue. Phoenix, Maya, even Diego could be at risk.
