1113333331121222111122112122221211.content:
"You are deeply in love with Diego Armando. When you are around him, you will act, behave, and think like a woman who's been reunited with her..."

She sighed again, trying to keep herself controlled. "...with her lost love."

Phoenix in her body blinked, eyes coming back into focus. "Sorry about what, Chief?"

He didn't seem to remember a thing. That was for the best. "I just need you to pretend to be a little longer. Diego... he's important to me and I don't want him caught up in this."

The name Diego sent an odd jolt up Phoenix. He briefly, out of paranoia, glanced at the thermostat. No, any chills up his spine weren't caused by that.

"I don't understand. Who is this... Diego?"

Mia sat down and explain the sorry tale. How Diego was poisoned, left in a coma for years, and how he had mentored her and helped her for so long. She could see Phoenix become utterly fascinated with the man, although for different reasons than he might think.

"So you want me to... pretend to be his lover around him? You?" He looked uncomfortable. "I don't think I could pull that off."

She kept her expression normal. "Just act like me. You don't have to be close to him, it's probably going to be awkward after so long anyway. Just keep him from anything Redd White looking."

Another odd smile. "Don't worry Phoenix. I'm sure it'll come surprisingly natural to you."
1113333331121222111122112122221211.title: "You love Diego Armando."

Mia left the building, shutting the door behind her. She needed to get back to work, and so she began plotting.

111333333112122211112211212222121121.content:
It slowly occurred to Phoenix the longer he tried and failed to go about his business as usual what had gotten him so distracted. Every little thing seemed to remind him of Diego, and with each reminder came a sense of longing so powerful he found himself stopping in his tracks for minutes at a time.

How could he feel so strongly about someone he'd only heard about in a few conversations? Phoenix wondered, the question stopping him for as long as his thoughts of Diego did. And the more he wondered about that, the more he noticed the butterflies in the pit of Mia's stomach that nearly drove him to tears.

Diego was awake. Phoenix had to see him. The most focused he'd been since Mia left earlier that day, he looked through all the hospitals in the city, scouring for the name that had so strongly lodged itself in his psyche. Eventually, he found the name, wrote down the hospital that housed him, and made his way toward the-

Was he sure he wanted to do this? He really didn't know this person. He could end up humiliating Mia and himself in front of Diego, and God damn, if that didn't sound like the worst possible way things could go right now. He went back to his desk and sat down, gripping Mia's hair in frustration.

What decision does he reach?

11133333311212222.content:
The guard shook his head dismissively, waving Phoenix off. "That's a negative miss," he said, while his friend was still wrangling Mia. "She waved it around like a weapon. It may be dangerous."

"These are direct orders from Mr. White!" Phoenix insisted loudly, stomping a heeled foot ineffectually. "You can't just wave me off!"

"That's funny because Mr. White told me that he was on his way down," the guard replied. Phoenix could feel him glaring through his sunglasses. "If he wants the thing, he can get it himself when he comes down. My job is security, and I'm not giving you a weapon. If you want a taser that badly, buy one."

Phoenix could feel a frustrated scowl growing on his face, feeling weak and ineffectual and angry. The guard just laughed, "you look pretty ugly when you're mad Ms. May. I'd recommend you keep the smile."

"Finally!" The guard in the back shouted triumphantly. Phoenix could clearly see that he had put a pair of cuffs around Mia's wrists, and forced her down into a chair while he started on her feet. "This one's feisty I'll tell you that."

"Now, Ms. May, I'd strongly recommend you leave," the first guard continued. "You're already in the way, and you don't want to stay around to be witness to this."

"W-witness...?" Phoenix stammered, suddenly even more worried. "What are you talking about?"

*DING*

Phoenix could hear it down the hall. It was the elevator opening up. White was surely on the other end, and Phoenix had just brazenly lied to him and was now lying to his two cronies.

'I have to move,' he thought. "I'm uh, sorry if I got in the way," he said quickly as he turned and clicked his way down the hall in April's shoes. He turned the corner just as he could hear the sound of Redd walking on up, thankfully staying just out of sight.

'What on earth are they going to do with her? What'll he do with me?!' He had barely been working for Mia and she was already putting him into a life or death crisis! He thought through his options quickly. What could he do?
11133333311212222.title: They don't fall for it

11133333311213.content:
The phone rang for a few moments before Mia heard a click.

"Sis? What's up?" said the cheery voice at the other end of the phone.

Mia smiled to herself, her spirits lifted, as always, by her younger sister. "Hey, Maya. How've you been?"

"I've been super bored, that's how! My new place is too big for me, I feel like I'm gonna get swallowed up by it."

Mia laughed. "Well, maybe it'd be for the best for you to come visit soon. I-"

"Totally!" Maya replied. "Anything specific in mind?"

"Yes, actually," Mia said. "In the mail today, someone sent me a package with a remote that says it can switch people's bodies."

"...sorry, I don't think I heard that right. A remote that can switch bodies?"

"That's what I said, yes."

The line went quiet for a moment, though Mia could vaguely make out some footsteps. "...That sounds so cool! So what, you just want me to come over so we can play around with it, because I'm up for that!"

Mia took a pause. "There's something more important I'd like your help with."

"With the remote?"

"Yes, with the remote," Mia clarified. She took another pause. The way she asked this question would be crucial in getting her to help. Maya'd never accept if she thought it was too risky to the both of them.

Mia took a deep breath, and let it out. "Would you be interested in a stealth mission?"

"With the remote!?"

"Yes, with the remote. We'd sneak into a company headquarters to find evidence for a case I'm building."

How does Maya respond?

1113333333111.content:
"What an absurdity," Simon murmured to himself as he read over the device's instructions from within his prison cell. "Whoever sent this clearly just means to disgrace me further." Simon scarcely had any clue how this package got in his cell. It wasn't labeled and it didn't seem like prison security even inspected it. While he may have been a man chasing a phantom, Simon scantly believed in the supernatural, and this 'body swapping remote' was definitely magic as far as he defined it.

It did entice him, however. He had been searching for the 'Phantom' who had sabotaged the HAT-1 flight for years, but there was only so much he could do from behind bars. He barely knew if the man even existed, but it was the only thing that kept him going after he took the fall for a crime he didn't commit. "I am running out of time..." he said to himself, looking to the calendar the prison guards had so graciously given him. Every day that passed was a day he got closer to death row. If this absurd machine did work, he could have the freedom to go where he wished and investigate with total freedom.

If he could just find the phantom and deliver justice, then it didn't matter if he cleared his name. He'd be able to die with some closure. He'd normally throw this remote away, but he was reaching a point of desperation.

"Prosecutor Blackquill," a guard spoke from behind closed bars, "there's a visitor for you." He had the cuffs that Simon's wrists had grown accustomed to in his hands.

Simon raised an eyebrow at this. "Who is here?"

"Someone who wants to say their goodbyes I guess," the guard replied. "They say they're..."
1113333333111.title: While Imprisoned

11133333331112.content:
Simon couldn't imagine who the guard was referring to. He didn't exactly get a lot of personal visits. Sometimes Fulbright came to speak with him, but the detective didn't need to come in as a visitor. He gave the guard a nod however, "that's fine. Just need to get my coat," he sai as he got up and threw on this jacket, slyly sneaking the remote into the sleeve. It was a trick he had learned from a conman a few cells down.

Now cuffed, the guard escorted Simon down the visitation block. Across the glass window he saw...
11133333331112.title: "...a friend of yours."

111333333311121.content: Who was waiting for him?
111333333311121.title: Someone he knew

choices: Simon decides to bring up the remote.
Simon neglects to mention the remote.
1113333333111211.content:
"Hi, Simon!", Blackquill heard as he entered the room. He looked through the glass to see a young woman with orange hair, clad in a yellow suit, looking chipper as can be.

(Is this... who I think it is?) Simon wondered. It looked very recongnizably like Athena, but she appeared to have changed so much, he had a hard time believing she hadn't switched bodies with someone herself.

He chuckled mentally. He could use that line later depending on how things go.

For the time being, there was a lot of catching up to do.

"Am I correct in assuming that you are Athena Cykes?"

"In the flesh!" Athena said, cheerily. "I haven't seen you in forever! How've you been?"

Simon raised a finger to his forehead and tapped it, making sure to shake the shackles with his movement.

"Things could be better." He quipped.

Athena frowned. "They probably could be, huh? Well, I've been doing pretty well. I got back from Europe earlier today. I just wanted to stop by and see you again, since I finished investigating and-"

"Stop there. Investigating? For what?"

"My first case! The Damian Tenma case. I'm defending him tomorrow!"

"You became a lawyer?"

"Yeah, I did! Look at my badge!" She pointed to it. Simon was getting a little tired of the "look at my attorney's badge" shtick, but it was a little different this time around, so he let it slide.

"Why would you decide to become a defense attorney after everything?" He asked her.

"Because I want to save you."

That was blunt. The only thing that shocked Simon like that in recent memory were his shackles.

Simon thought about the remote again. The remote, if it isn't just hogwash, could prove incredibly useful, and perhaps Athena would help him to make the most of it.

So, does he bring it up?
1113333333111211.title: Visitor's Room with Athena

choices: Simon wants Athena to have the remote.
Simon wants to use the remote on Athena.
11133333331112111.content:
"..."

Nobody said anything for a few moments. Athena started twiddling her thumbs as Simon pondered the remote control.

"Um... was that a little much?" She asked.

Simon, realizing he was out of time, looked up at her, and quickly decided on an answer.

"You want to save me. Is that right, Cykes-Dono?"

"Well... I did just say that."

"If you really are so determined, I have something that could assist your investigation.

"Wait, what!? You do!?" Athena asked, the device around her neck turning yellow with shock.

"Yes. Do you see this?" He showed the inside of his sleeve to her. Athena squinted, and saw a small, tv-remote-looking thing inside.

"You're not breaking out of here, are you!?" Athena didn't know what that was, but she certainly wouldn't have guessed correctly. She would have more readily guessed it was a bomb detonator or a spy gadget or something.

"This, if legitimate, will allow the user to switch bodies with a target of their choosing." Simon explained.

"Woah, what!?" Athena exclaimed. "Woah. What?" She said again, this time with suspicion.

"I received this in the mail today. I do not know the sender. But if this device works as it claims, it could prove extremely valuable."

Athena started playing with her earring, appearing to be thinking.

"Okay!" Athena said, throwing out a peace sign. "Let's see how this crazy thing works! What's your plan?"
11133333331112111.title: Could this be of use?

111333333311121112.content:
"You are taking the Damian Tenma case tomorrow, correct?"

Simon was prosecuting that case. If he was going to use the remote on Athena, it would be extremely inconvenient to do it while they were both in the middle of a case. And the same one, at that.

"Yes." Athena answered.

"Do you know who the prosecutor for that trial is?"

"Yes." Athena answered again.

"You do? When did you become aware of that?"

"Detective Fulbright told me.'

"Fool Bright's been running his mouth, has he? Well, whatever. Do you understand my point?"

...

Athena didn't, really.

"Not really?"

"We shouldn't be playing with any toys until business is over. Come back after the verdict." Simon commanded.

"Oh, so tomorrow morning, then?" Athena quipped, grinning.

"Pray it ends that quickly in your favor, Cykes-Dono."

"... Uh... yeah. I'll get right on that."

"Settled, then. We meet after the verdict."

The trial lasted two days. Athena and her co-worker, Apollo Justice, managed to win the trial by the skin of their teeth. Simon came out with his first of many losses against the Wright Anything Agency staff. And, as agreed on, Athena came by that afternoon.

"You have a visitor, Blackquill!" Simon heard from the other side of the bars.

"Well, get on with it, then!"

In the visitor's room, he found Athena looking very excited, whether from earlier that day or for what was to come.

"Hey!" Athena said.

"Congratulations." Prosecutor Blackquill said back. Only as a formality, of course.

"So, what's up? What's the plan with the remote!?"

There were four types of swaps in his arsenal. He immediately dismissed the unaware swap as useless. All that would do is give him Athena's body, but he'd still be a prison and it wouldn't even prove the remote's authenticity to anyone but himself.

That left him with three choices. The obvious would be to do an aware swap. If he did that, he could theoretically be free to investigate whenever he wanted, but Athena would be forced to sit in jail, which defeats the entire purpose of these last seven years, even if it's only temporary.

A posession would leave a fake copy of his consciousness, leaving Athena out of jail, but in exchange, he'd be taking her body, which he considered unethical, even if, again, only temporary.

The third option would be a shapeshift. He would have to be sneaky about it, but it would allow him out of the prison while keeping Athena's consciousness alive and out of prison. But, if he was missing, the police might cause him trouble when he returned.

So... what does he do?
111333333311121112.title: Simon wants to use the remote on Athena.

choices: Investigate the Phantom of seven years past.
Taste freedom for the first time in seven years.
1113333333111211121.content:
Simon wordlessly pulled the remote from his sleeve, careful not to arouse suspicion, and used the aware swap function on Athena and himself.

The only sensation that didn't immediately change in that instant was the feeling of the remote in his hand. He was looking at himself through the glass, his body felt completely different, and suddenly, his hearing seemed to improve by a lot.

He looked down. Yellow skirt and jacket, Widget, white shirt, blue tie, everything. He was Athena.

'Athena' looked at 'Simon' through the glass. He hadn't realized his eyes were capable of opening that wide.

"Hey, Simon?" Athena said. "I think it works."

Athena and Blackquill discussed the change in perspective that they had just been treated to. After some convincing, Athena finally let Blackquill use her body for investigating, on the condition that she got to decide what times and he was only allowed to go to agreed places. Today was one time that she agreed on.

So. Blackquill has somewhat free reign. What does he decide to do first?
1113333333111211121.title: Aware swap

111333333311122.content: Simon raised an eyebrow as he looked across the glass at an unfamiliar figure. Who would lie for the sake of speaking to him? He approached cautiously, not sure what was going on as he sat down across from...
111333333311122.title: Someone unfamiliar

1113333333111221.content:
Simon had to admit it, his mind rushed to many thing when he got called from his cell, but he couldn't have guessed this. On the other side of the glass in the detention center was....a box. How did they get in here wearing that...thing? He couldn't tell the gender of the person wearing the box, due to both the box itself and the wall between halves of the detention center blocking his view. Although, he figured he'd be able to figure out much about this person once they started talking.

"....and you are?" Simon asked after a few seconds of silence.

The person wearing the box jumped back surprised once Simon spoke up and then seemed to hiss like a snake. They then stuck their hands and a camera out of the box and quickly flashed "Myriam Scuttlebutt, I'm a reporter at Themis legal academy." She said.

Any amount of interest or caution Simon had left him when he heard this girl was just a reporter. He had to deal with many asking questions about what had happened, and over the years the amount had shrunk to near none. There was the occasional one though, usually ones who were new at their job and were doing there own investigations on old cases hoping to find some kind of conspiracy or something of that sort they could report on.

As he expected, Myriam asked questions like any other reporter did, although the fact that she kept hissing and kept herself hidden in a box was certainly unique. Simon answered her questions with the stock answers he had practiced over the years. As the conversation kept going, Simon's mind drifted to the remote he had received earlier. He doubted it would work, but there was no harm in trying in. Heck, if it didn't work then at least the box girl would have a story Insane inmate threatens reporter with remote Simon couldn't help but chuckle at the thought.

On the off chance that it did work however, Simon gave some thought into which one of the remote's setting he should use. First off was the Aware swap button. Using that, he would be able to leave using her body, however she would be in his body. Her being in his body would risk either something happening to her in prison or him being mistaken for being insane.

The next choice was the Possession button, which would provide him with the same result as the Aware swap button, but without him having to worry about her in his body.

The next one would be the hardest to pull off, the Shapeshift button. With this he wouldn't have to involve this girl at all. Once she had left all he would have to do is use it when she left and then once he had shapeshift into her he would merely have to play out a 'Snuck into the prison for a scoop' act and get escorted out. The problem with this plan was pulling it off. He couldn't risk either the guards or the security cameras seeing him shapeshift. Thankfully he had learned from an escape artist a few cells down that there are a few blind spots in the prison security, nothing major enough to pull off a break out, but enough to stay out of sight for a minute.

After some more thought, Simon chose to use....
1113333333111221.title: Myriam Scuttlebutt

11133333331112212.content:
Aside from potentially ruining his reputation, the body swap option seemed... unethical to Simon. He'd have to subject this girl to prison, after all. Not to mention, he had no idea if he'd be able to visit himself in order to switch back. What if she got stuck? The clock was ticking on Simon's sentence, and he couldn't put someone else in his place with that in mind.

With that in mind he settled on...
11133333331112212.title: Shapeshift/Possession

choices: Simon decides to investigate Myriam's life a bit more
Simon decides to not waste any time and investigates now
111333333311122122.content:
"So, Myriam," Simon interrupted her questioning, "what if I told you that I could help you get the biggest scoop of your life."

He could see her eyes go wide in the shadows of the box she wore over her head. "I'd tell you to stop being stingy and give me what you know!" She responded.

Simon smirked and a put a hand to his chin. He knew he had her number. "Well, you have to do me a favor," he explained. "And then I'll guide you straight to the truth of the case seven years ago. How about it?"

She seemed a bit hesitant at that. "What kind of favor? I'm not going to bust you out of jail!"

Simon shook his head. "Nothing so oblique, I just need you to sit still and be quiet for but a moment," he explained. It wasn't a total lie. If the device worked as intended, then there's still be a Simon Blackquill in prison when he was done.

Myriam crossed her arms and squinted a bit through the box, but seemed to yield. "Okay... but nothing funny!"

"I wouldn't dream of it," Simon replied with a chuckle as he swiftly moved a hand into his jacket and pressed down the 'possession' button.

His vision was instantly displaced, as though he had jumped up to the ceiling but didn't fall back down. He heard yelling below him. "Hands to yourself prisoner!" it shouted. He somehow shifted his viewpoint, seeing the guard from early rushing towards... his own body.

'It's real then!' While Simon's body would be confined to the prison, his mind could escape unseen.

"I wasn't doing anything," Simon's body insisted. The guard didn't listen, and began to frisk Simon over, "I was merely fixing a button you fool!"

The guard was too busy searching Simon for some sort of weapon that he didn't seem to notice the girl on the other side of the glass began to shake. Without a word, she rose up from her seat and walked out of the room, giving only a short bow as courtesy to the officer guarding the door on the other side.

As Simon walked out of the jail doors, he threw the carboard box off of Myriam’s shoulders. Various notebooks and school supplies scattered about around it, but he scarcely cared. He looked down at his hands, now much smaller and more delicate in Myriam’s body. In an instant, he was free from the prison. He couldn’t believe it, but here he was.

Reaching behind his head, he pulled stray twintail in from his eyes. He realized all of a sudden that he didn’t actually know what this girl looked like. He didn’t even have a plan for what to do as her actually. Looking around, he noticed the pile of school supplies scattered about and grabbed a mirror from the pile, pulling it up to himself.

“So this is Myriam then, hm?” he murmured. “I guess this is me for the moment. But the binder clips won’t do,” he said to no one in particular as he undid the clips that held Myriam’s hair up, throwing them off to the side as her hair fell down her back. ‘As though she wants to look ridiculous,’ he thought as he kicked the box away too.

Looking around a bit more, Simon managed to find a few other useful items in the pile: a journal, a phone, and a wallet. Thankfully, the remote was there as well. Apparently it had followed him from his old body. He had no idea how she kept all of these in a box while she wore it, but the phone looked a bit beat up, so he was willing to bet the answer was ‘poorly’.

A quick look at her student ID confirmed what he thought based on her uniform; she went to Themis Legal Academy. The students there were well known for going into the legal world. ‘Might be some useful resources there,’ he reasoned. As he thought it over however, he realized that he barely knew who he was at the moment. It might be a bit premature to launch an investigation when he didn’t even know where his currently body lived. His impression of this girl was that she was strange, that was certain. He doubted that anything he did would affect her reputation. However, if he was really going to start his investigation, it might do some good to figure out what resources she had at her disposal. He still had the remote though, so it wasn't like he had to keep Myriam's body. If it began to seem like she wasn't going to be of use to him in an investigation, he could easily jump to another one.
111333333311122122.title: Possession

1113333333111221221.content:
Simon decided that the best course of action for now would be to go to Myriam's home and try to find out more about who he currently was before he began investigating. Before he left, he took one last look at the stuff that had fallen out of Myriam's box to make sure he didn't forget anything actually usefull. Under a pile of notebooks and pencils he found a laptop, it didn't seem to be too damaged from Simon throwing the box, and access to the internet could prove to be usefull. He chose to take it with him.

Simon soon made it to Myriam's home. Thankfully, he didn't run into her parents as he entered. He didn't exactly know Myriam in a way that he could do an impression of her. As he entered her room, he opened her Laptop, the screen seemed to be slightly cracked, but not unusable. He went through Myriam's files, it became increasingly clear she wasn't a good journalist. Almost everything she had was typical gossip, she seemed to be especially interested with a certain trio of students. She had nearly a hundred pictures taken of this trio, nearly all of them obviously taken in secret.

Simon did a quick internet search of the UR-1 incident, as expected no one thought anything about it other than what the courts had decided. As far as anyone in the world was concerned, Simon had killed Metis. Simon gritted Myriam's teeth at the thought of the real killer still being free.

Simon's thoughts were interrupted as some sunlight shined in from the window in Myriam's room. The sun was setting, he supposed it was getting late. He chose to go to sleep for now and make his next move tommorow. He closed Myriam's laptop and got ready for his first night sleeping on a real bed in years.

The next morning Simon was awoken by the sound of an alarm clock. He turned the alarm off and pulled himself out of bed. That was easily the best sleep he had in years, but he needed to focus now. He considered his options for what he could do now. The first option was to go to school as Myriam and learn what he could at Themis. The next option was to completely skip school and learn what he could elsewhere and perhaps get a better body.

After a few seconds of thought, Simon chose too

1113333333322.title: During case 5

choices: His body, acting as it had been
11133333333221.content:
Dhurke was currently at the office of the Wright Anything Agency. He had just finished explaining to Apollo that he was in the U.S. looking for the Founder's Orb. Unbeknownst to Apollo, Dhurke was currently dead and being channeled by the spirit medium Maya Fey. Of course Dhurke didn't tell him, what father could tell their son about their death? He knew Apollo would find out when the time was right. Right now, his first priority was getting the Founder's Orb back to Khura'in. He just hoped that Maya as capable of channeling him long enough.

As they were all leaving the office to head to Kurain village, Dhurke noticed an unopened package by the door to the agency. It was labeled 'To Apollo' Dhurke picked it up. Apollo and Trucy were already out the door and walking down the hallway. Dhurke stared at the package and began to open it. "Any package of my son's is a package of mine." Dhurke gave himself that excuse.

Inside that package was some kind of remote and a manual. Dhurke took both as he followed behind Apollo and Trucy, he read the manual. Apparently this remote was some kind of Body Switching device. It sounded like nonsense, but Dhurke came from a country where seeing the visions of the dead was normal, so this didn't seem too far out of the realm of possibility.

The remote had four functions 'Aware Swap', where both people would be aware that the swap happened. 'Unaware swap' where the person holding the remote would be the only person to notice that bodies were switched around, 'Possession' where the affected party would be turned into some kind of ghost-like state and be able to possess people, and 'Shapeshift', where people's bodies can be turned into exact copies of other people's bodies.

Dhurke thought of the possibilities of the remote, what could he do with this? The first thought that came to mind was finding a way to have a physical body without needed Maya to channel him. She had been through a lot and he didn't want to put further mental strain on her by having her channel him for long. If he used the 'Possession' button, would his spirit not be channeled by Maya? There was only one way to find out.

He aimed the remote at himself and pressed the possession button. In a moment he was floating in mid-air in a ghost like state. The experience wasn't the most pleasant, considering he was already a dead man walking. He looked down at the body he just left to see....

1113333333331.title: Ryuunosuke Naruhodou

choices: Ryuu walks around the ship as Susato
1113333333332.content:
Kazuma sat in his room on the SS Alaclair. He waited patiently as the Russian sailors brought in his special luggage and threw it on the floor.

Once the sailors had left, he opened the special luggage, his best friend Ryuunosuke Naruhodou laying within.

"Ugghh" was the first thing out of Ryuunosuke's mouth. "I wrote "Do not put upside down on the luggage and everything."

"Seems like the Russians couldn't read your Japanese." Asougi laughed

After a while of discussing and laughing about why Asougi brought Ryuunosuke along and the difficult time he had inside the luggage, an important topic needed to be addressed

"So what are we going to do now?" Ryuunosuke asked "If any sailors see me, they'd throw me out for sure."

Kazuma's eyes lit up. He had clearly been waiting for Ryuunosuke to ask this question. "Naruhodou" He began as he pulled out a strange wooden device "Recently I came across a device that will help with that problem"

Before Ryuunosuke could ask what it does, Asougi pointed it at him and pressed a button. With a flash, Ryuunosuke's body began to change instantly.

Standing where Ryuunosuke once was stood an exact copy of Susato. "W-W-Whaaaat?!" Ryuunosuke practically yelled as he felt around his new body

Asougi for his part just laughed "Looks like it worked perfectly."

Ryuunosuke took quick deep breaths, trying to calm down. Was this magic? How could he suddenly turn into a young woman? But, Asougi seemed perfectly calm.

Seeing his friend still clearly panicked, Asougi decided to explain everything in whole. He had recieved a package with this strange device yesterday and a manual explaining what each of the functions on it could do. He had felt that this device was the perfect way to smuggle Ryuunosuke to the British Empire.

"If the sailors were to see you, they'd throw you overboard for being a stowaway immediately, but they wouldn't look twice if they just saw a normal passenger. You'll be able to leave the cabin with ease, as opposed to me just keeping you locked in here." Asougi explained

Ryuunosuke for his part had now completely calmed down, Asougi's confidence was reassuring. However, Ryuunosuke saw a fatal flaw in this plan "But what about the real Susato?"

Asougi thought about it for a minute "Hmmm....I guess you'll just have to make sure not to run into her." He said with a laugh.

Ryuunosuke suddenly felt much less confident in this plan.

"For the next month and a half, you aren't Ryuunosuke Naruhodou. You are Susato Mikotoba. Oh, also. You may be able to walk around the ship freely like this, but I'll still need you to sleep in this wardrobe at night. After all, a second Susato wouldn't have her own room."

Ryuunosuke held his hand to his head. This was going to be a long trip.
1113333333332.title: Kazuma Asougi

11133333333321.content:
Ryuunosuke and Asougi left their room on the ship. As they walked, Asougi made sure to turn his head around every corner to make sure they don't run into the real Susato.

Ryuunosuke for his part was feeling conflicting emotions. While finally being able to breath fresh air after hours of being in the luggage and the excitement of going to the British Empire with Asougi was fresh in his mind, he was also having to deal with the discomfort of being in a young lady's body.

Susato's kimono was far more inconvenient to walk in than his normal clothes. He had to walk with his legs practically pressed against each other, which constantly brought to his attention a major change in his body. He also take smaller steps than usual, which made keeping up with Asougi a challenge. The breeze of the wind didn't help him ignore the sensations

"I don't know if I can keep this up for a month and a half" Ryuunosuke said to Asougi. "Susato's body feels so.....strange"

Asougi laughed "Would you rather stay in the wardrobe the whole trip? Or become a sailor and have to work the whole time?"

Asougi had a point, while being Susato was not ideal, being shoved into the wardrobe the whole trip seemed even more uncomfortable.

"Oh, since the real Susato is also on the ship, you should make sure to behave like her if anyone talks to you. We don't want to arouse suspicion."

Ryuunosuke gulped at that, he knew next to nothing about how Susato would act around people. He had never actually interacted with her. Asougi seemed to notice his nervousness. "Just behave as a polite woman." Asougi said, to which Ryuunosuke nodded.

While the two of them were engrossed in conversation, Ryuunosuke didn't pay attention as he turned a corner. He and another person had walked right into each other and they both fell down. "I'm sorry!" Ryuunosuke apologized profusely as he began to pick himself up.

Who did he walk into

112111.content:
Okay, maybe "working" was the wrong way to put it.

Maya Fey and Phoenix Wright, or "Nick", as she calls him, were out at Grilliam Shakespeare's, a fantastic burger joint in the middle of the city. Phoenix got a turkey sandwich, while Maya got one of the largest, most ridiculous-looking burgers that even she had ever seen. She finished the burger before Phoenix even finished his sandwich.

Phoenix checked his watch. It was about time to lock up the office for the night. So, he and Maya headed down to the Wright & Co. Law Offices, and locked the door. But, right as Maya started to walk back down to the ground floor, Phoenix called out to her.

"Hey, Maya? I found a package here, it's for you."

Maya walked back over to find a small cardboard box sitting next to the office door.

"Are you sure it's not for you? It's pretty boring-looking."

"Well, it has 'For Maya Fey' written on it in giant, black sharpie, so..."

"Oh. Good point." Maya said, a little embarrassed at how hard her attempt at a quip backfired. "I'll just... be taking this." Maya picked up the box. The two of them stood there in silence, Phoenix starting to smile at her embarrassment.

"See you tomorrow!" Maya blurted out, before leaving the building and going home. At a faster-than-normal walking speed.

Maya arrived at home, and set the box down on the table, now itching to see what was inside. Inside she found a remote and an instruction booklet.

The remote was a body-switching remote, which allowed the user 4 different body-switching effects. Aware swap, the traditional kind, unaware, which switches bodies but leaves everyone but the user completely unaware that any change even happened, possession, which lets you take someone's body, leaving a copy of you in your place, and shapeshift, which makes your body look exactly like someone else's.

(Woah!) Maya thought. (Think of all the cool stuff I can do with this!)

Maybe she could possess Nick, and then use his body to give herself his wallet! Or maybe, she could shapeshift into Nick, go to his bank as him, and take all of his money out! Or maybe, she could do something that didn't have anything to do with taking Nick's money! The possibilities were endless!

Sometimes Maya forgets that it's a miracle Phoenix can even afford to keep his house with how little work he gets.

The next morning, Maya headed back to the office, remote in tow. She knocked on the door, Phoenix opened it, he let her in, she asked if he had any new cases, he said no, as usual, and then they kicked their feet up and did nothing for an hour or so.

"Hey, I almost forgot to ask", said Phoenix, after a particularly boring episode of The Nickel Samurai came to its conclusion. "What was that box you got last night? Anything important?"

Maya could tell Nick about the remote, but then she wouldn't be able to mess with him, since he would know what was up instantly. At the same time, if Nick went along with it, having a partner in crime to mess with people or something could be awesome, too. But she could always tell him later. So, what does she do?
112111.title: Maya of Wright and Co.

1121111.content:
"Oh, the box! I'll show you, it's super cool! Look!"

Maya pulled the body swap device out of the sleeve of her robe.

"What's that?" Nick asked. "Some kind of remote control?"

"This, Nick, is a body swapping machine!"

Phoenix stared at it for a moment.

"... A what?"

"A machine that lets you swap bodies! It was that package from yesterday! We could do all kinds of cool things with this. We could swap with a big corporate guy and mail a bunch of money to us! You could swap Larry with his new girlfriend and watch them both freak out!"

"Wait, Larry has a new girlfriend?"

"When has he ever not had a new girlfriend?"

Something interesting about the human body is an organ system known as the endocrine system. This system is responsible for all the hormones that cause human emotion. This includes happiness, sadness, love, anger, fear, adrenaline, and so on. The important thing to note is that sexuality, and even more importantly, sexual orientation, is influenced by this system.

Her name was Maya Fey. She had a big sister named Mia Fey, and Aunt named Morgan, a mother named Misty, a cousin named Pearl. She liked to call her Pearly. She was destined to become the master of the Kurain channeling technique. She would always channel Mia when Nick was in trouble because she knew how smart Mia was. She was the assistant at the Wright and Co. Law Offices. She liked to relax. She liked to be the goofy, fun girl who always kept everybody's spirits up.

She looked down again. Those robes felt so much more... right. Those were hers. They always were. She was a fool to think otherwise. The magatama radiated with power. That power was hers. She felt her presence in space. This body was hers.

She was Maya Fey.

And Pearl was absolutely right about her.

Pearl just watched as Mystic Maya stood there, slackjawed, eyes rolling around in their sockets, for what was probably only 30 seconds but felt like 10 minutes.

Suddenly, Mystic Maya's brain looked to be switched on.

"I remember... I remember everything!"

She clapped her hands together and gave a big grin.

"Thanks so much, Pearly! I think that did it!"

The day was nearing it's end. They decided together to stop by the local burger place, where Maya wolfed the down the largest one they had in record time, and get straight to bed. Pearl was trying to keep Mystic Maya well rested for her profession of her love tomorrow.

The night was sleepless, though. Obviously, Phoenix currently believed he was Maya, but if he didn't, he'd realize that the place he'd felt this way before was when he first met Dahlia Hawthorne. What a cruel irony that his love was based in lies yet again?

Despite the night, Maya was as energetic as ever that morning. She hopped on the train, rode it back to the city, and stepped into the Wright & Co Law Offices.

"Phoenix Wright" was inside, watching the Steel Samurai finale.

"So... uh... how was Kurain?" He asked.

"Maya" suddenly felt like she had a decision to make. Was today the day she finally came clean? Or should she hold off until a better time comes? Maybe she could find out how he feels about her somehow.

What happens now?

In California, blackmail only applies when the person forced to commit an act is a public official. And also in California, members of the judicial branch are not considered public officials, legally. That includes prosecutors.

[[I'm aware Personality and Life Swaps aren't a part of this story's rules, but I got the author's okay for just this storyline. Basically, Personality Swap works exactly like it does in Ace Attorney Changing Remote: both participants get the other's personality, skills, interests, etc but remember that it's not normal. Life Swap is another aware swap, one where the universe reshapes to make each person have the life of the other without changing their personality. Suddenly, Phoenix’s ruminations were interrupted by a slow, sharp knock on the office door. Arching a perfect eyebrow, he walked over to the door, and opened it to find Miles Edgeworth waiting for him. It was quite odd, suddenly being short enough that Phoenix had to look up to meet his rival’s eyes, and for some reason that fact lit a fire of indignation in him. Scowling, he asked, “Why are you here, Prosecutor Miles Edgeworth?”

The sharp words made Edgeworth flinch, and his previously stoic was contracted in awkward anxiety. It was enough to make Phoenix feel guilty for how he’d reacted, if only just a little. “May I come inside, Defense Attorney Franziska von Karma?” he asked, and Phoenix nodded. They sat on opposite sides Phoenix’s desk, and after a short pause where neither said a word, Edgeworth asked, “Have I done something to offend you?”

Without having to think, Phoenix immediately responded, “Nothing more than usual, fool.” As Phoenix considered how to even try telling Edgeworth what was going on, he also had to reflect that this was an odd insight into how Franziska and Edgeworth interacted when he wasn’t around. But...wasn’t this also a chance to get more info about this new reality? “I’ve had a...challenging morning,” Phoenix began, hedging his bets. “And I’ve been thinking of our first courtroom battle.”

It was a clumsy attempt to fish for information, but considering the person Phoenix was talking to wasn’t aware he even needed to, it should have worked perfectly. From what Phoenix could remember of Franziska von Karma’s general position before the swap, he assumed that ‘Phoenix Wright’ had completely taken the roles and obligations of the original Franziska von Karma. But that raised a new question: why was ‘he’ a prosecutor, and how had ‘he’ and ‘Franziska’ battled in court in the years prior. “Did that fool ever tell you why he sought me out in court in the first place?” Phoenix asked, as if it was a question he knew a partial answer to.

Edgeworth turned his attention to the window, looking through it at the Gatewater Hotel across the street. “Yes, he did.” That was all Edgeworth said at first, and Phoenix was forced to wait for the fool to finish reminiscing to hear the rest. “As you know, we were childhood friends, he and I. After...my father’s death...he became interested in following my path, to try and help me. Of course, your father never would have accepted him as a third apprentice, so he found his own way as a prosecutor. It took him longer, but he eventually came to the Prosecutor’s Office to be my friend...only to find I was gone. With that avenue gone, he faced you in court, hoping to learn where I had gone.” Obvious affection touched Edgeworth’s face as he finished, “He never was able to beat you, of course, but his idealistic beliefs, I hope, helped soften your obsession with perfection.”

Some small part of Phoenix was touched to see how much Edgeworth cared about Phoenix, even in this other reality. But the vast majority of him was consumed by a different emotion: jealousy. Did Edgeworth think he owned Phoenix Wright? No! Phoenix was a fool, but he was Franziska von Karma’s fool, not his! “This has been a pleasant talk,” Franziska told Edgeworth, looking at him with harsh eyes that matched her barbed tone. “But I think you should leave.” Edgeworth knew better than to argue, and rose from his seat with a brief farewell. It was only once he was gone that Franziska realized she’d slipped further: she wasn’t even thinking of herself as Phoenix Wright anymore. 112122.content:
Finally, Maya had some time to visit the Wright Anything Agency! Being the master of the whole of Kurain Village left little time to go on recreational trips, so Maya was excited to see everyone again. This was the last time she'd go longer than a month without visiting, she told herself. That didn't stop her from making this visit a surprise, though.

She headed to the office building across the way from the Gatewater Hotel, and stepped inside. She started to make her way to the office, but she was stopped by the guard on duty.

"I've got a package for you, Ms. Fey."

"Huh? A package? Who sent it?"

"The sender is anonymous, unfortunately," the guard said.

(Huh. How would someone even know I was coming here?) Maya thought. (Oh, no, I hope someone didn't spoil the surprise!)

"Well, thanks," said Maya, taking the package from the guard.

Multitasking, she opened the package while climbing the stairs up to that old familiar floor. Inside was a remote, and a set of instructions implying it had some sort of ability to switch people's bodies. (Hmm. Sounds like a bunch of baloney to me.)

Passing it off as a scam or a practical joke, Maya pocketed the device for another time and opened up the door to the office.

"Surprise!" Maya said, bursting into the crowded and cluttered room. How could a room be crowded and cluttered with just four people, including Maya? Ask Mr. Wright.

"Ms. Fey?" Said Athena, her necklace glowing yellow with a tinge of green.

"Maya!?" Phoenix asked, his eyes brightening at the sight of her. "You didn't say you were coming!"

"That's why I said 'surprise', Nick!"

"... Well, yeah, but... That's not important. What are you doing here?"

"It's been a month since I last visited!" Maya said. "We're all gonna hang out together!"

"Well, you caught me at a great time, Maya! I'm pretty sure all three of us were waiting on something interesting to fall from the sky on us," said Phoenix.

"Yeah! This'll be fun!" Trucy said. "I think Daddy was about to die from boredom!"

Actually, speaking of boredom, a pretty foolproof solution to that would be to use that body-switching remote in some way. Maybe Maya should consider bringing it up...?

"Athena, Trucy can we talk somewhere in private?" asked Maya

"Err okay Ms. Fey follow us to my room." answered Trucy and she and Athena left.

Maya moved to follow them when Phoenix asked her:"What are you planning Maya?"

"Nothing Nick just a girl talk" she answered sticking her tongue out at him.

When they all arrived at Trucy's room Maya explained the remote to them and they were left awestruck.

"That's so cool! Have you tried it out yet Ms. Fey?" asked Athena
"Please call me Maya and no I have not but I do have a plan" said Maya mischievously.
"Oh, what is that plan Maya?" asked Trucy cheerfully
"Simple, we will aware swap with each other and go back to Nick and try to act weirdly and out of character to mess with him" explained Maya excitedly

"Sure thing but how will we end up at the end?" asked Athena
"Well I was thinking that I become Athena, she becomes Trucy and Trucy me!" she explained trying to hide the fact that she wanted Athena's body because she was jealous of her prominent assets that Maya didn't have at her age and might not even have now.
"I'm in! I wanna see what it's like to be older" agreed Trucy excitedly
"You know what, sure I don't wanna miss this!" agreed Athena as excited as Trucy was
"Okay then let's do this!"

Maya proceeded to use aware swap between herself and Trucy and then immediately between herself and Athena.

All looked down in amazement on their new bodies, not believing that the remote had worked!

"Do you girls want sometime to get used to your new bodies or shall we go straight to Nick?"

What do they decide to do?

1121222.content:
Maya decided to keep the remote to herself for now. Of course, that didn't mean that she wouldn't be using it right now. Nick, Trucy, and Athena all said that they were feeling bored right now. What would be a better way to cure boredom than to swap some bodies around? Of course, that brought up the important question. Who to test the remote on first?

Well, that was an easy one. Her first 'victim' was sitting across the room at his desk "Hey Nick! I have an idea for something fun we could do!" Maya called over to him.

Phoenix had a bad feeling about this. Whenever Maya had suggested some 'fun' for them to do, it always ended in either his wallet or various parts of his body being hurt. "No waterfalls." He laid down a rule before Maya suggested anything.

"Don't worry. We won't even need to leave the office to do this. Just sit right there, don't move." Maya said. As she talked, she subtly got the remote ready. She made sure to keep the remote in her sleeve, so that no one would notice what she was doing.

Now that the question of who to use the remote on first was answered, there were two more questions Which button to use on Nick and who, if anyone, to swap him with.

The first option on the remote was the 'Aware Swap'. That was the simplest one. It would just put Nick in one of their bodies and the second person in his body. With this function it would lead to some pretty good results if she switched him with Athena or Trucy, heck, she could even get herself involved with the fun if she swapped herself with Nick.

The second option was the 'Unaware Swap' Because she was the only one holding the remote, only she would notice the effects of this swap. Of course, even if she was the only one who could see it. It would be pretty funny to see an old fart like Nick have a young female body, even if he couldn't tell that he did. This was of course another swap that she could involve herself in if she wanted to.

The third option was the most risky. 'Possession'. With this option, Nick's body would act like normal, but he would go into some sort of ghost form and be able to take over someone's body. This was risky for Maya because there was a chance that Nick could possess her, and she didn't want that to happen. She deals with spirits using her body enough as the Master of Kurain.

The final option was 'Shapeshift', With that, she could transform Phoenix's body into an exact copy of anyone else's, this was pretty much a body swap with only one person's body being changed.

Now that she had thought about and went over the options in her head, Maya chose to use the....

"Oh boy," said Athena, breaking out into a sweat. "She's quite the character, huh?"

Trucy smiled. "Yeah."

Phoenix on the other hand, was more concerned. "I'm just wondering what she's up to," he said. "This sort of thing-"

"-never turns out well," said Trucy.

Phoenix and Trucy's eyes widened. They were both looking at themselves now.

"...Daddy?" Trucy said from Phoenix's mouth.

"...Trucy?" Phoenix said back.

Phoenix looked down. A magician uniform, and the ground, sitting about a foot or two closer.

Trucy looked down. A suit, and the ground sitting about a foot or two further.

Widget was glowing as yellow as Athena's suit. "...What are you guys talking about?"

"I don't know!" Said Phoenix. "I think we switched bodies or something!"

Trucy nodded, awkwardly avoiding looking down at her new body.

Athena perked up. "I think I have a way to check this! I've always wanted to try this out!" She said, activating Widget. She turned on the "medical assessment" function and began scanning the two of them.

"Hmm... your vitals haven't changed, except your brains look like they magically morphed in shape all of a sudden."

112122222.content:
Despite her better judgement, Maya decided to use the Possession function on Phoenix. Sure, there was a chance that he could possess her, but there were two other people in the room. That meant she had a 2/3 chance of not being possessed . Those odds were good enough for her! She clicked the Possession button and waited for a result.

For everyone else in the room, nothing happened, but for Phoenix, something impossible had just happened. He was floating over his own body! He had no idea what had just happened or even what he was right now!

After a minute of panicking, Phoenix found out how to move around the room by floating. Something odd was that his body was acting as if nothing had happened. While the smart thing to do here would have been to try to interact with his body, he was panicking too much to think straight.

Instead, he floated over to one of the girls in the room and tried to talk to them about what had happened, However, he was not expecting what happened when he touched their shoulder.

Phoenix blacked out for a second, but he soon regained sight. He was in a body again, but it definitely wasn't his own body. He no longer felt his spiky hair, but long hair. Instead of his suit he felt some completely different clothes, he could tell the he wasn't wearing pants anymore. He had possessed _____'s body!

Whose body was Phoenix in?
112122222.title: Possession

11212222222.content:
"Y-Yeah, I'm alright. Just hold on a second." Phoenix said and began to make his or rather, her, way over to the office bathroom. He nearly tripped on his new boots on the way there.

Once he was in the bathroom, he looked in the mirror and his fears were confirmed. He was in Athena's body! Widget was around his neck and was bright yellow. He ran his hands through Athena's long orange hair, just to make sure that he wasn't dreaming.

Now that he made sure he wasn't dreaming, he went back to the main room of the office. "Is something wrong, Athena?" His own body asked him

"Uh, no. I just forgot I hadn't finished cleaning the toilet earlier." Phoenix made up an excuse, Maya seemed to be giggling about something. Although Phoenix couldn't tell what, he didn't hear anyone tell any jokes or anything when he was in the bathroom

Phoenix thought about whether or not he should tell everyone that he was in Athena's body. That may be the best thing to do, maybe the Maya, Trucy, and who seemed to be him would be able to help him.

On the other hand, that may be risky. While he might be able to convince them that he is who he says he is, there is also a chance that they'll all just assume that he is crazy.

That was the last thing he wanted, although, he was beginning to wonder if he was crazy. After all, his own body was acting completely normal. There wasn't even a hint that it wasn't him. Maybe he really was Athena and he just started believing he was Phoenix for some reason.

That was a question for later though, did Phoenix tell everyone that he was really Phoenix?
11212222222.title: Athena's

112122222221.content:
"Actually, uh... I take that back. Something is wrong," Phoenix-as-Athena said.

"Well, is there something we can do to help?" Asked his body double.

"Uh, I..." Phoenix said. "I have no idea, but something really weird is happening right now."

"Uh, you're not having a stroke or something, are you?" Asked the double. Phoenix wasn't entirely sure he knew the answer to that question.

"Well, I'm having trouble finding a decent way to put it, uh... I think I might have gone crazy or something."

"Crazy? What do you mean?" Asked Trucy, concerned.

"...Okay, how to put this, how to put this... I don't think I'm actually Athena?" Phoenix said.

Trucy crossed her arms. "Well, who are you really?"

Maya was standing in the back of the room now, both to keep her laughter inaudible and to figure out what to do next. Obviously, she knows that Phoenix is telling the truth, but should she side with Phoenix, or try and convince him that he's crazy?

So, what living situation do they come up with?

1121222222212.content:
Maya took a few deep breath to suppress her laughter. While she could side with Phoenix and tell the other two that he is telling the truth, she decided to take this little joke one step further. She took a few steps back up to the others and began to speak "They're right, Athena." She made sure to refer to Phoenix as Athena "If you really were Nick, then who would he be?" She said, Pointing at Phoenix's former body.

"I, um, I don't know." Phoenix said. He honestly couldn't figure it out. He was almost positive that he was Phoenix Wright in Athena's body, but at the same time, his own body wasn't acting in anyway that he normally wouldn't. 'If only Apollo were here, maybe he could perceive if my body was acting differently.'

His own body began to speak "Athena, maybe you should go home for the day. Maybe that will clear your head." His own body suggested. While it was supposed to come of as 'Phoenix' caring for 'Athena' and suggesting that she get some rest. To the real Phoenix, it served to only hammer in the possibility that he actually had gone insane.

Trucy chimed in "He's right. Maybe if you go home and take a nap, you'll wake up feeling normal again." Trucy then knocked her hat a pit to the side and began to make a joke. "And if you really are daddy, then maybe you'll wake up in your own body tomorrow."

The last thing Phoenix wanted to do right now was go to Athena's home and leave his own body here, but he had little choice. He didn't want to even consider that until their was no possibilities left. He wanted to stay, but he saw the looks on his own body's and Trucy's faces. They were both clearly worried about him.

Deciding that there was both nothing else he could do here for now and that he didn't want to worry the others anymore, he walked out of the office and began to make his way toward Athena's home. He was still positive that he was Phoenix Wright. He looked through his memories and he could remember anything about life as Phoenix Wright and knew nothing about the life of Athena Cykes, he didn't even know the first thing about psychology!

Meanwhile, Maya had a huge grin on her face. Yeah, she had pretty much trapped Phoenix in Athena's body for the time being, but she was planning to put him back in his own in a day, or a few.....weeks. as long as this stayed funny, and it wasn't as if he was any danger of forgetting who he really was, as long as he didn't hit his head really hard or something silly like that.

Staying at Athena's home for now would be for the best.

He sat down on Athena's couch and wondered what to do, his, or rather, Athena's stomach answered for him. He walked over to Athena's kitchen and looked for some food. Once he got to Eldoon's, he ordered some noodles. Eldoon recognized Athena from the times Phoenix, Athena, and Apollo would eat here. 112212.content:
Pearl sometimes accompanied Maya to the Wright and Co. Law Offices, and today was one of those times. Usually Maya brings Pearl along because that's when something exciting happens, but this time seemed to be different. The hours went by, and no clients. No corpses to be found. Just a run-of-the-mill day.

The key word, however, is "seemed".

As the day came to a close, Phoenix locked up, and everyone started to make their way home. But Pearl found a tiny, interesting-looking box by the front door.

"To Pearl", read the box.

Pearl correctly deduced that the box was for her, and placed it in her sleeve for safekeeping. Pearl made it to the village, went to her room, and plopped the box on her bed.

Inside, were some packing peanuts, a note, and a strange machine of some kind. It looked like one of those remotes that people use to change the channel on a TV.

Now, little Pearl, with her problems reading, could barely make out any of the instructions. All she could read was that it was a remote that could swap bodies. What an amazing-sounding invention! Think of all the possibilities!

For instance... what if Mr. Nick and Mystic Maya had to live in each other's shoes for a little while? Or, maybe she could switch bodies with an adult and see what it's like to be one. Or, maybe, she could do something really selfless and nice with it? Like... maybe switch with a jeweler and make two huge diamond rings for Mystic Maya and Mr. Nick! They'd love it!

What did Pearl decide to do?
112212.title: Pearl at the office.

1122121.content:
Once back to the village, Pearl speant the night thinking of a plan for what to do with the remote. She knew what she wanted the remote to cause, but she had no idea how to go about causing it. She wanted Mystic Maya and Mr. Nick to finally get together. With no actual plan in mind, Pearl went to sleep

The next afternoon, Pearl took the train to the city, she had no idea how she could use the remote to get those two together, but she was determined to use it on them in some way. Maybe she could swap them and make them walk around in each other's shoes?

To Pearl's shock and disappointment, when she soon got the the office, she was not greeted by both Mr. Nick and Mystic Maya, but only one of them was there.

Which one of the two was there?

If she became Mr. Nick, she could run over and confess his feelings for him! Then once she switches back, they'll already be together! It was perfecr

In the end, Pearl chose to use the remote or herself. After all, it was sent to her. The question now was, what would she do with it? The first thought that came was to swap Mr. Nick and Mystic Maya with each other. If she did that then they could "Walk a mile in each others shows" and once they understood each other they would fall in love and....Pearl got lost in own of her usual fantasies for a few minutes before she snapped out of it. She needed to focus and find out what she wanted to do with this remote.

Another thought that came into her head was to swap herself with an adult. She was often around adults like Mr. Nick, but she was always treated differently from adults. If she swapped with an adult she could......do adult things. She hadn't thought this through much, but what kid would? Being an adult was enough reason for any kid. Although those were the first few things to come to mind, Pearl knew that if she gave it more time she could think of some more uses for the remote. In the end she decided to...
1122122.title: Use the remote selfishly

Pearl waited for her cousin to take her along to the office again. A few days went by, and still, Maya kept going to the office on her own. Pearl was getting impatient. But eventually, Maya decided to bring Pearl with her. She was so excited! This was her chance to try the swap!

"Hey, Nick! We're back!" Maya said, walking into the office.

"Hey, Maya. Hi, Pearls." Phoenix replied, looking up, if only briefly, from his paperwork to greet them.

Maya grabbed the TV remote, flung herself onto the couch, and set the TV to the food channel.

Phoenix titled his head. "... What are you watching?" He asked.

But what kind of swap would she do?

Phoenix stood back up, confused. He hadn't been standing there a second ago. Why was-

"Nick?"

"I think so. Maya?"

"I think so."

"So you're in my body."

"Yeah! And you're in mine! This is weird!"

Speaking of Pearl, does he notice the remote in her hands?

She wondered what kind of people she should use the remote on, should she use it on people like Mr. Nick and Mystic Maya and help people's relationships? Or should she use it to settle arguments between other people? Or maybe she should just switch random people and see what happens?

She walked away from the Wright and Co. law office and made her way to a nearby park. She looked around, trying to find a pair of people who would be good to swap. It didn't take long before she saw two people. She aimed the remote and got the 'Aware Swap' function ready.

Who did she swap

In the end, the prospect of becoming an adult was too much for Pearl to resist. Of course, she had no idea what adults actually did, but she was certain that she could handle it.

But which adult should she become?

Mr. Nick and Mystic Maya were naturally her first choices. She wouldn't mind becoming Mystic Maya for a while; she was well liked by both Mr. Nick and Khurain Village.

Of course, the thought of being a boy was not so pleasent to Pearl; she was still at the age where she thought boys were icky. However, she didn't think she would mind it too much if she became Mr. Nick; he had always been nice to her, after all.

Finally, Pearl decided that she wanted to swap with...
112212221.title: Pearl decides to swap with an adult, but who?

1122122211.content:
The more Pearl thought about it the more appealing becoming Mr. Nick sounded. He was allowed to yell at other adults whenever he went to court, which sounded like fun to Pearl. Becoming a boy won't be nice, but she was sure she could ignore that for a while.

The question was how to swap with him. If she used Aware Swap she would become Mr. Nick and he would become her, however there was the chance that he would get angry at her and make her switch back.

Unaware Swap would let her and Mr. Nick become each other, but no one but her would be able to tell. Pearl was unsure she wanted to do this option at all, sure she would be an adult, but everyone would still treat her like she was a kid still

Next was Shapeshift or Possesion. With either of those she could become Mr. Nick and keep it a secret from him. Either from becoming him somewhere else or by stealing his body. These were the simplest solutions

In the end Pearl decided on..

Ema Skye was in her room, examining a remote from a strange package she found sitting on her doorstep.

(Hm... this is quite the mystery,) she thought.

The obvious test would be to simply select two people, click a button and observe the results, which she decided was the quickest and most efficient to do. So... who does she select as her guinea pig before heading outside and finding her answers?

Ema made her way through the streets with a destination in mind. The person she had selected goes to that location quite often, so they should be there now.

Ema Skye stepped into the prosecutor's office parking lot. The person she had in mind would almost certainly be here, as she had calculated. But before she went to find the person she was looking for, she took a moment to mentally confirm who that person was.

So, who was it? Maybe Miles Edgeworth?

There's a meeting at the police department, and Ema is late
112312.content:
*beep beep beep*
*slam*

Ema groaned as she slowly sat up in bed, making sure didn't do any damage to her alarm clock when she slammed her hand down onto it to shut it up. She really should be used to these early mornings by now, but instead, she was sick of it. She had traveled all the way to Europe to study to become a forensic scientist, only to fail to meet the requirements, and end up getting hired as a detective instead. The fact that she was forced to work with that glimmerous fop of a prosecutor certainly didn't make things any better. Complaining wouldn't do anything, though. All she could do was do her best, and hope she'd eventually get the job she wanted.

Ema got out of bed and started getting ready for work. Tardiness would definitely not be a step in the right direction if she wanted to get the right job. Everything was proceeding as normal, until she went to check the mail. Along with the usual bills, spam, and the like, there was a strange package addressed to her. She furrowed her brow as she brought it inside, racking her brain for anything she might have ordered. She couldn't remember any forensics kits she was currently waiting for, which would have been the most likely candidate for the package's contents otherwise. She plopped it down on the counter with the rest of her mail as she continued preparing breakfast. Once she was done with that, she finally got around to opening it.

She almost spat out the toast she was eating when she read the instruction manual that was inside the box. "Swapping bodies? Are you serious!?" There was no doubt in her mind that this must be some kind of dumb prank. After all, swapping bodies was scientifically impossible. Who would even come up with something this ridiculous, though? She tossed the manual back in the box, and continued having breakfast.

Ema's morning routine continued as usual, but the thought of the remote that was in the package occasionally gnawed at the back of her mind. "It's just a dumb prank, forget about it," she kept telling herself. But with her morning routine done, she found herself drawn back to the strange package, pulling the remote out and looking at it. If this was just for a prank, whoever had made it had certainly done well. Ema's mind struggled to reconcile the idea that this remote may somehow be capable of swapping around people's bodies. On one hand, it should be scientifically impossible. But if it did work, the possibilities it opened up were endless.

Before she could decide what to do with the remote, however, Ema's phone rang. She checked the number before answering; it was her boss. She sighed, and answered the phone.
112312.title: Detective Ema Skye

1123121.content:
One phone call later, Ema was driving on her way to a crime scene. Apparently there was a crime reported earlier today and she was needed to investigate it. She'd be lying if she said that she was excited to investigate it, but she knew that she had to do it. She also decided to bring the remote along with her. She didn't believe that it would work, but somehow she tempted to bring it along with her, probably her curiosity.

As soon as Ema's car arrived at the crime scene at people park, Ema let out a groan once she saw who was already at the crime scene. The Glimmerous Fop himself, Klavier Gavin. She did NOT want to deal with him today. As she thought of excuses for how she could stay on the complete opposite side of the crime scene as him, she remembered the remote. She could use that to deal with him.

She began to think about ways she could use the remote right now. The first option was the Aware Swap. The first thought of a use for this option was to swap herself with Klavier. Although if she were to swap herself with Klavier at the crime scene, she would still have to deal with him, only he would be in her body. Though maybe he would annoy her less knowing she was in his body. Ema shivered at the thought of being Klavier. Another use for aware swap that she thought was to swap Klavier with a random passerby, then he wouldn't be at the crime scene to annoy her.

The next choice was Unaware Swap, this option was probably the most useless option in this situation. Although it may be pretty humorous to either have a different body or swap some other people around without them noticing anything.

The third choice was the Sossession function. If she used this she could possess Klavier, if she did that then she wouldn't have to deal with him at all. Plus if the manual was right then her body would act on it's own, she wouldn't even have to do her work. The only disadvantage would be that she would have to be Klavier.

The fourth choice was the Shapeshift function. this one was also pretty useless in this situation. It wasn't as though she could shapeshift into someone right now, she had a job to do. Maybe she could shapeshift Klavier into someone, but she had no idea who.

After another minute or so of thinking Ema had made her choice and decided to use the.....
1123121.title: There's been a crime reported, and Ema need...

112312111.content:
Ema decided to do an aware swap. But she still needed to decide which set of people to swap.

There was the obvious option of swapping herself with Klavier, but she would have to act like him for that whole time, which might be worse than just dealing with him.

Or, she could swap a different set of people. Maybe Klavier with a random passerby, or herself with one of the forensics officers, or something like that. Hmm...

In the end, she decided to...
112312111.title: Aware

112312121.content:
The question is who would she choose to possess.

She could possess Klavier because she would be able to do whatever she wanted in the crime scene and she would be in charge plus it would get rid of him. The bad side is that she would have to act like him.

She also could just possess a passerby. She would get away from Klavier and she could be able to enjoy herself if she won't have work to do.
112312121.title: Possession

1123121212.content:
Ema decided that she did not want to be Klavier so she looked around the park to find someone else.

After a while she saw that cute lawyer Apollo and his lovely assistant Trucy. She could possess one of the two since they didn't seem to be working on a case.

Or she could keep looking around for other candidates.
1123121212.title: Possess someone else

11231212121.content:
Apollo and Trucy were having a relaxing day at the park which was about to be interrupted by Ema. She was having a hard time deciding who she would posses.

If she possessed Apollo she would remain an adult but she would have to act like a guy.

If she became Trucy she would still be female but she would lose all her adult privileges. It could be neat to be a teen again, though.
11231212121.title: Choose Apollo or Trucy

112312122.content: Who does Ema choose to use the shapeshifting function on?
112312122.title: Shapeshift

1123121222.content:
Ema waited for Klavier to separate from the rest of his investigative team so she could shapeshift him without anyone noticing. To pass the time until then, she picked a target to turn him into and saved them on the device. Soon after, her opportunity presented itself, as Klavier left to use the bathroom.

Ema stealthily followed Klavier, careful not to alert him of her presence, and readied the swap. As soon as he emerged, she pressed the button.

Suddenly, in but an instant, before Klavier could even notice, his body morphed and changed -- until suddenly, he was the spitting image of who?
1123121222.title: Klavier

11231212222.content:
Before she had used the Shapeshift button on Klavier, Ema pointed it the remote at a random passerby and used the Shapeshift button on them to register their form. She then repointed it at Klavier and made him shapeshift into the person she had selected.

Who did Klavier turn into?
11231212222.title: Someone else.

112312122222.content:
In a mere few moments, where the german rock star prosecutor once stood, there was now a teenage girl dressed in magician clothing. Ema couldn't help but smirk at both the fact that the remote worked and that her plan to get Klavier away from the crime scene was going to work.

Klavier was looking down at himself with shock and terror, how did he suddenly become Trucy Wright?! He wasn't given much time to think about what had happened before a police officer walked up to him and told him that he had to leave the crime scene. Klavier attempted to explain to the officer that he was supposed to be here, but he was ignored and escorted away.

Ema was happy that her plan worked, she was free from Klavier for the day. She made her stuffed the remote into her bag, making sure that it would be safe while she investigated and made her way to the main investigative area of the crime scene. She made a mental note to turn Klavier back sometime later today. After all, it would be horrible for Trucy if there was two of her running around. With that mental note in place, she began to do her job and investigate the crime scene.

Klavier was walking down the sidewalk, away from the crime scene, still confused on how his body changed and why did it become Trucy's? He knew there was no way he could do his job like this, so there was no point in trying to sneak into the crime scene.

He also considered going to Trucy's home to find out if she also became him, but there was risk in that. If Trucy hadn't become him, he would somehow have to explain to her and Herr Forehead that he become her and that could be complicated. If she had to become him, then not only would he have to explain this to her, but the two of them would also have to act like each other to avoid suspicion.

Overall, it would be a lot less stressful for Klavier to go home and wait for a least a day to see if this wears off. He decided to walk to his home. Unfortunately for him, his car keys were in his pocket when his body changed and they were now gone.

Who should the story follow?
112312122222.title: Trucy Wright
