1253122112111221121121122222111211.content:
After what felt like an agonisingly long time, Apollo finally heard a voice come through on the other end of the line. But not just any voice, his own voice.

"H-Hello?" he heard his voice say through the phone. From the stuttering and lack of confidence he could hear in his old voice, he could tell his hypothesis was correct; his old body was currently being occupied by Vera Misham. However, he supposed he should confirm it first, just to make sure.

"Vera? Is that you?" Apollo asked. Anyone observing would have found it a little ridiculous that Vera was asking if she was talking to herself over the phone, but thankfully, Apollo was alone in Vera's house.

"Wha-!? Who is this?" Vera seemed shocked that anyone else knew about the fact that she wasn't really Apollo.

"It's me, Apollo. I'm in your body."

"Oh. S-So... we swapped bodies s-somehow?"

"Yeah, something like that." In reality, it was a bit more complicated, but for the time being, Apollo figured it would be fine to let her think that. He could explain further in person. "Where are you right now? I'll come over so we can talk this through."

"I-I'm at your I apartment. I found your address in your wallet. I d-didn't want anyone else to see me and mistake me for you."

"Alright, I'll be right over. See you then."

"B-Bye."

With that, Apollo hung up. At the very least, Vera had had the sense to get out of the public eye while in his body so that people wouldn't notice him acting strange, which is more than he could say for Wocky. Now he could head over to his apartment and explain the situation to Vera, and hopefully the two of them could come up with a plan to get Wocky back into his own body.

Before he left, though, his attention was once again redirected to his attire. Wocky had dressed Vera's body in an outfit that was rather unlike anything he'd seen her wear. If anyone who knew Vera saw her like this, they'd certainly be suspicious, just as he was when he saw Wocky in Vera's body. He'd have liked to avoid confrontation on his way back to his apartment, but putting on a more Vera-like appearance would mean getting changed into a different outfit.

Apollo could already feel his face heating up at the thought. It felt like a massive breach of her privacy, and he wasn't really comfortable with the idea of undressing Vera's body and putting on another set of clothes. However, as far as Vera knew, the two of them had simply swapped body, with no involvement from Wocky. If he showed up to his apartment looking like this, she might assume he'd been the one to dress her up like this, so maybe she should try to find the outfit Wocky had taken off and put it back on? Either way, he should probably make his decision quickly, so as not to keep Vera waiting too long.

He headed over to Vera's room, hoping to get this over with quick and then head over to meet Vera at his apartment.

Thankfully, Wocky had left the clothes he changed out of laying around Vera's room, which saved Apollo the trouble of finding what he needed. He sat down on Vera's bed and took off the shoes he was wearing. After taking a deep breath, he looked up at the ceiling, before pulling of the jacket and tanktop, and slipping out of the jeans. He tried not to think about the fact that he was currently naked, save for Vera's underwear, but he could feel his face heating up regardless. He couldn't tell whether Wocky had changed Vera's underwear or not, seeing as he refused to look down at himself while he lacked clothing, but thankfully, it wouldn't matter, as it would be covered up anyway.

He felt around for the clothes Wocky had discarded, his hair tickling his back as he did so. He put on her sweater and overalls, before finally lowering his head as he looked for her socks and shoes. Once that was done, he did his best to tied his hair up like Vera usually did. Having finished getting dress, Apollo observed himself in the mirror again. He was still Vera, but now he looked more like the Vera he knew, and not the twisted version Wocky had created. A bit red in the face from embarrassment, but otherwise indistinguishable from the real Vera.

Glad that the ordeal was over, Apollo left Vera's house, heading over to his apartment as quickly as possible.

Just... imagine I'm walking next to you." Maybe it'd be good practice for her in the long run? She'd have to get more independent eventually, especially if she wanted to make new friends. If he was going to be stuck in her head for a couple days, he ought to atleast do something nice for her.

'Okay... can you just handle it for me though?' It seemed she was dedicated to dodging the problem. Apollo sighed and scratched the back of his head, brushing away Vera's longer hair as he did so.

"Alright, that's fine," he replied, unwilling to fight it out. "Just watch me and you'll see it's no big deal, alright?"

Vera might've picked up on this, as she was pretty silent during the walk down to the crafts store. Thankfully it wasn't as long as she made it out to be.

Entering the store, Apollo had to admit he was feeling nervous. Maybe Vera's personality was rubbing off on him? He picked up a basket and walked through the aisles slowly. It was hard enough interacting with Mrs. Kitaki's husband; being out in public as someone else was rather stressful, especially when that person was spectating everything you did.

Following Vera's instructions, he gathered the paints and canvases that she needed, trying his best to avoid eye contact with the various strangers he passed by. Scanning the store, he searched for someone who might be easy to speak with. Either someone he knew or someone who looked to be around Vera's age, just so long as he could strike up a conversation.

'Uh, I think that's everything,' Vera suddenly chimed in. 'I think we can leave now...'

A screw coming from near him told Apollo that he wasn't the one Gavin was reaching for, he turned to see Vera, cowering in fear from Kristoph's towering form. When Vera realised she hadn't been grabbed, by Gavin, she seemed incredibly surprised to see who had actually grabbed her. "Apollo? What are you..."

"YOU!" Gavin's voice boomed once more. He seemed annoyed that Apollo had gotten in the way. "NO ESCAPE THIS TIME!" Before Apollo could even question what Gavin was talking about, the ground behind him crumbled away, leaving him and Vera isolated on a pillar. Gavin raised his fist up above his head. "YOU. WILL. PAY!" His brought his fist down, Apollo and Vera unable to do anything but watch as it got closer and closer.

~~~

Vera's body sat up in bed, screaming. Which of the body's occupants had caused the scream, neither could say, but silence followed, leaving them to contemplate what had just happened. As their breathing slowed back down to a normal pace, Apollo broke the silence by asking aloud, "What... what was that nightmare?"

It was meant to be a rhetorical question, but he heard Vera answer in his mind regardless. "It's been happening for a while now. Not all the time, just, sort of, on and off. Although, normally you aren't there."

"I guess that's another side effect of us sharing a body." Apollo looked down at himself, as if to confirm that he was still in Vera's body, regardless of the fact that he had already spoken in her voice and heard her in his head. He frowned, seeing that he was still dressed in the outfit that Wocky had worn when he was in Vera's body.

The sun was beginning to peek through the blinds, so Apollo figured it was probably time to get up. He could use all the time he could get to figure out how to get Wocky back into his own body, and thus get him back into his. He was about to go out into the kitchen and make breakfast when he heard Vera's voice again.

"Um, shouldn't we, uh..."

She seemed incredibly sheepish about whatever it was she had to say, and Apollo had a feeling he knew why. He had stopped right in front of the mirror, and through their shared eyes, Vera could clearly see herself. Apollo hadn't showered last night, nor even changed his clothes. Apollo knew what she was getting at, and he was probably feeling just as embarrassed about it as Vera was.

"I, uh, thought that would probably be a breach of your privacy."

"Well, yeah, but... I don't know."

It seemed neither of them really wanted to do this, but both of them felt it might be a good idea to not just keep wearing the same clothes Wocky had put their shared body into.

The stress of fighting Mrs. Kitaki and then walking back and forth to the store probably had some effect too - they had gotten a bit sweaty. He supposed a shower was warranted.

'Keep it simple,' Apollo reminded himself. He looked down and saw the shirt Wocky had dressed Vera in, a simple tank top with no sleeves. 'Just go fast.' It'd just be weirder if he took his time. Thinking ahead, Apollo spun the faucet and let the water start pouring down. While it began to heat up, he closed his eyes and threw off his top, feeling a cold breeze over his mostly exposed torso. The jeans followed. After disrobing, Apollo hopped into the shower, eyes still clamped shut.

---

True to his word, Apollo kept it short. He washed out Vera's long hair the best he could, scrubbed her arms and legs, and then promptly exited the shower. It was only about 10 minutes, but probably the most awkward of his and Vera's lives. He could only hope that she'd be willing to forget about it later.

Now with a towel wrapped around their torso, Apollo went back into the bedroom, eager to find a change of clothes. Vera walked him through the more troublesome articles; Apollo would never have thought two days ago that he'd need to know how to clasp a bra. it seemed that Wocky had unfortunately ruined her last clean pair of jeans, though. Looking through her closet, Apollo instead had to throw an old dress - striped blue and white - that went down to about their knees. He threw a jacket overtop and pulled on a pair of long socks, as per Vera's instructions, to finish the outfit.

'Hm, uh, good job. Now for the hair, you'll need to, um-'

"Let's just cheat on that one," Apollo interrupted, opting instead to just tie her hair behind her head. He looked into the mirror at the full image; they skipped makeup completely, but he doubted they'd need it. "That wasn't bad, right? We look presentable." Apollo said, trying to assure both himself and Vera that everything was going well, even though he was wearing a dress. 'Really hope Trucy doesn't hear about this one...'

'So what do we do now?' Vera asked. It was honestly a pretty good question. 'Do you think you have a solution yet?'
12531221121112211211211222221112211111.title: Awkwardly getting ready for the day.

choices: It doesn't go quite as planned
125312211211122112112112222211122111111.content:
"I do have a plan," Apollo replied as he planting his fist into his palm. "I don't know if it'll work, but it's not like waiting here will solve it, right?" Hearing Vera's voice from his mouth and in his head was beginning to be a bit too much for Apollo; they'd have to solve this today. He had gambled in court before, so he was no stranger to risks. If this didn't work then he'd just have to try something else.

'What if it doesn't work?' Vera asked, clearly nervous about the whole thing.

Apollo was quiet for a second before shrugging. "Then we just steal the remote I guess?" he said with a nervous chuckle, running a hand through Vera's hair.

'Are you sure? That women sounded dangerous...'

Apollo shook his head. "She talks a big game, but she and her son owe me. Not to mention, she wouldn't hurt you without any reason. We'll be fine if we mess up, don't worry!"

It wasn't a fantastic plan, but it was all they had.

---

It was a much longer walk to Kitaki Manor than Vera would've cared for. After they got a mile out from her home, she went totally quiet. Apollo felt sorry for her, but he felt bad to admit that it was a little bit of a relief too. He didn't want her second guessing his plan along the way. He felt a bit frightened himself, having to walk so far out alone in a strange body, but pushed through it. After all, he had to do this for himself and Vera. She deserved to have some privacy after all of this.

*Knock Knock*

Apollo stood uncomfortably outside the main door of the mansion. After a moment or so, the door creaked open slowly.

"Mr. Justice?" The voice of Mrs. Kitaki could be heard.

Apollo nodded, "yes, it's me. Can I come in?"

The door moved open a bit further, giving Apollo some space as he entered Kitaki Manor. Plum was looking a bit worse for wear herself after the night. Her clothing was the same but her hair was rather messy and the headdress she usually wore was nowhere to be seen. Her eyes had some rings underneath them, making it look like she didn't get much in the way of sleep either after the last night. She gave Apollo a quick scan before shaking her head, "well, you certainly adapted quick haven't you?"

"Are you okay, Mrs. Kitaki?" Apollo asked, feeling concerned.

Plum shook her head, "no, not particularly. Wocky hasn't exactly been quiet in here. If I rest, I'm worried he'll just take over and take that device. My husband's out right now - I told him I wasn't feeling well, so we should be fine for a few hours. I hope you're here because you have an answer for me."

Apollo nodded. "I have a solution that might work. Wocky's body is still here, right?"

Plum nodded, "right in his room. He's still recovering after all."

"My thoughts are that, if he is in your body with you, his body has to be, I guess, 'empty'," Apollo began, unsure how to describe it. "It's just acting on autopilot. Therefore, if we tried to switch him with you, maybe Wocky's consciousness would just be sent back into it? And since he's recovering, he wouldn't be able to steal that remote again. Are you willing to try it?"

She sighed, and shook her head. "I'd try anything for some quiet." She fished around her pocket, and handed Apollo and Vera a key. "I'm going to trust you to handle this Mr. Justice. Don't disappoint me, or you will likely regret it." Apollo gave a nervous nod in response. Plum guided Apollo to a chest hidden in her bedroom where they retrieved the device. Apollo pointed it at Plum's body and clicked 'Aware Swap'. The two them then walked down to Wocky's room once more.

"Just, uh, wait right here, alright?" Apollo suggested. "Let me know what happens once I press the button." Plum, thankfully, complied, as Apollo turned the doorknob and stepped into the bedroom, facing Wocky's body.

"Huh? Mom, what's this chick doin' in my-"

Apollo didn't care to hear the fake Wocky keep speaking, and immediately clicked "Aware Swap" once again.

1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Wocky's body stopped mid-sentence as Apollo pressed the button, only to start right up again almost immediately. "Yo, lawyer-man, why'd you have to go ruin my fun?" He attempted to get out of bed, but his body wasn't really in any condition to do so, and he didn't really get far. Apollo could guess that Wocky was likely back in his own body. Letting out a sigh of relief, he closed the door to Wocky's room, and headed back down to where Plum was.

Before he could say anything, Plum spoke up the moment he was in view. "Oh, Mr. Justice! I can't thank you enough! Is Wocky alright?"

Apollo nodded. "He's back in his own body."

"Thank goodness. It's so good to have my body to myself again."

"Speaking of which, I think it's about time I get back to my own body." That had been the end-goal of this endeavor, after all; to get out of Vera's body, and back into his own.

"Um, Apollo?" Apollo heard Vera's voice inside his head. "Could we go back to my place before you get out of my body? I don't really want to walk home alone." Apollo figured he should have expected that. It was a rather long walk from Vera's house to Kitaki Mansion, after all.

Before he could answer, however, Plum said, "Before you do that, I think we should talk about who's keeping this device."

"Huh?" Apollo hadn't really thought about that. He was mostly just focused on getting back to his own body that he hadn't thought about who was going to be keeping the device afterwards. Although if Vera wanted to head back to her house, he'd probably have to ask Plum if he could take it with him. It was probably better that it was far away from Wocky, anyway.

Someone they know spots them on the way

"Well, Vera would like to be back at her house before I get out of her body, so I'd have to take it with me," Apollo stated, hoping Plum would comply.

"Good, take that thing far away from here! I don't want it anywhere near my family ever again," Plum replied, clearly still a bit shaken up by the whole experience. And with good reason.

"Okay, well, I guess I'll be going then."

"I'll see you around, then. Just don't bring that device around here, or you'll regret it."

"Bye," Apollo quickly said, heading out the door. He was walking a bit quicker than he had been when he first headed to the mansion earlier today. Just a little longer and he'd be able to get back to his old body. After spending about a day in two different female bodies, both times with another person inside his head, he couldn't wait to be himself again.

"It's finally going to be over," he heard Vera say inside his head.

"Yeah, it is," Apollo said aloud, as there was no one else around to hear. He could almost feel the sense of relief coming from Vera. This had been hard on her too, after all. First she had been possessed by Wocky, and once she regained consciousness, Apollo was the one in control of her body.

All that was left was for the two of them to walk home before they could finally be separated again.

"Well, Vera would like to be back at her house before I get out of her body, so I'd have to take it with me," Apollo stated, hoping Plum would comply.

"Oh no you don't. It's getting locked up in my personal safe so I know it's not being used on anyone. You are not taking it with you," Plum replied in a very forceful tone. "Now, hand it over."

As much as he didn't want to leave Vera in an uncomfortable situation (after a very uncomfortable day yesterday), Apollo knew better than to argue with Plum, especially while he had Vera's body. "Sorry Vera," he mumbled, "It looks like we'll have to do it here."

"What was that?"

"Oh, uh, just talking to Vera," he said, tapping one of his temples to indicate who he was speaking to. Speaking of which, Vera seemed to have gone quiet. If Apollo had to guess, he'd say she was probably mentally preparing herself for the walk home. He begrudgingly handed the remote to Plum.

"Now, which one of these will let you out of that girl's body?" Apollo pointed out the button which Wocky had originally pointed him towards the day before, and without another word, Plum aimed at him and pressed the button. "Well?" she asked.

"...He's not in my body anymore," Vera said quietly. Even without knowing Vera personally, Plum could definitely see the difference in personality.

Vera, on the other hand, went back to the front door of the mansion, and took a deep breath. "You can do this. You can do this," she told herself, before stepping outside and walking home.

Unseen to both of them, Apollo had been floating in the room in some sort of ethereal form, watching the scene unfold. He did feel bad about making Vera walk home herself, but he needed to get out of her and back to his own, and this was the only way Plum was going to let them do it. Well, he was out now, so that was half the battle over already. Now he just needed to get back to his own body. Considering the time of day, he guessed it was probably at the office, doing his job. He floated through the door, finding his ethereal form to be slower than expected. This was going to be a long trip home.

Apollo began to float his way back to the office. The ghost-like form that he was currently in was slow, but Apollo himself was partially to blame for how slow he was going. While he could go slightly faster, he decided against it to avoid accidentally flying into someone and possessing them because he was going to fast. While he could avoid that possibility by flying upward into the air, he didn't due to his fear of heights.

As he made his way to ward the office, he couldn't help but think about the past day. If he hadn't experienced any of it first hand, he wouldn't believe any of it. He thought about the remote, he wondered if it was okay to leave the remote at Kitaki Manor. After all, Wocky was still there and if he ever got his hands on it. then this whole situation could start up again. Apollo would just have to hope for now that Mrs. Kitaki would be able to keep it away from him.

Another thing he wondered about the remote was what the other two buttons did. He knew that 'Aware Swap' swapped two people bodies and the 'Possesion' button would send him into the ghost form he was in now, but he wondered what the other two buttons would do. Wocky had only explained those two when he wanted Apollo to help him leave Vera's body. Apollo figured that the reason he hadn't told him was because those two wouldn't help him get away from Mrs. Kitaki, but that only made him wonder, what did they do?

After what felt like an hour, Apollo was only a block away from the Agency. It had only been a day since he had last been there, but it felt like forever. In his excitement to get back to his body, Apollo began to speed up. However, as he reached the corner, everything suddenly went black. It was only black for a moment and once Apollo got his senses back he realized what happened. He was once again in a body

He was in 'A' body, but it wasn't his body. Apollo felt like screaming out of anger. He made it so close to the agency only to mess up on the last block! Now he was going to have to walk all the way back to the Kitaki Manor and hopefully convince Mrs. Kitaki that he was really Apollo so she could let him out of this body, and once that was done he would have to do that long float over here again. He supposed he should at least find out whose body he was in before he began the walk back.

1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Apollo looked at his reflection and sighed. His was once again in a girl's body, however, unlike the last two female bodies he was in, he had no idea who this girl was. From the look of her reflection, Apollo guessed that she was around his age, but that wasn't good enough for him. He began to rummage through her bag.

After a quick search through the girl's bag, Apollo found various things. Among them was a cell phone, a card which had two wings and three crow's feet on it, a strange device labeled 'Little Thief', and most importantly an ID.

According to this ID, the girl's name was Kay Faraday. Apollo was pretty on the mark in guessing her age, she was only two years older than him at 24 years old. Strangely, on her ID the words 'Great Thief' were written below her name in what looked like marker.

Apollo gulped, he had no way of knowing whether or not this girl was actually a thief, but if she was, he wanted out of her body as soon as possible. He didn't want to be sent to jail over another person's crimes.

Sadly, throughout his search of her bag, Apollo found no car keys or anything similar, meaning he would have to walk his way back to Kitaki Manor. He sighed and began his walk over. As he walked, he couldn't help but feel bothered by the breezy that blew between his legs. The dress he wore earlier in Vera's body at least went to the knees. Kay's skirt was really short.

After a while of walking, Apollo heard something that made his heart stop. The ringing of a cell phone. Normally a cell phone ringing wouldn't be a big deal, but the ringing was coming from Kay's bag.

Apollo opened Kay's bag and pulled out her cell phone. The caller ID said the person calling was someone named 'Edgeworth'. Apollo recognized the name Edgeworth, but he couldn't remember from where.

He took a deep breath and answered the phone "Hello?"

On the other side of the phone, a man spoke "Ah, Kay. You said you would be visiting today. I was wondering why you were running late. I know it's been a while since you visited, but I doubt that even you could get lost."

Apollo had no plans on going anywhere in Kay's place. "Oh, I'm sorry. I forgot where I said I would meet you. in fact, I may not be there for at least another hour." Apollo made up an excuse as to why 'Kay' wouldn't show up.

"Really? You forgot that you were meeting me in my office at the prosecution headquarters?" The man on the phone said, clearly not believing the excuse Apollo gave.

The second the word 'Prosecutor' was said, Apollo realized where he had heard the name 'Edgeworth' before. He was the prosecutor Mr. Wright had faced many times before he was disbarred! The man was a famous prosecutor, and unlike a certain rock-star Apollo knew, Edgeworth's reputation was solely earned by his abilities in court.

"Hello? Kay? Are you still there?" Edgeworth asked over the phone.

While Apollo knew that he should just hurry to Kitaki Manor and leave Kay's body, he couldn't help but feel curious. Mr. Wright was a very...strange boss to say the least, Apollo couldn't help but wonder what kind of man the prosecutor the Mr. Wright had faced in court was. After all, old court videos could only tell him so much. He could just drop by Edgeworth's office for a little while and go to Kitaki Manor later tonight. The prosecution building wasn't very far from where Apollo currently was, it was a very large building and very hard to miss.

Of course, there was also some minor risk if he stopped by Edgeworth's office. He was already in for some major explaining to Mrs. Kitaki about how he had ended up in Kay's body, he didn't want to explain why he also took much longer than he should have to get back to Kitaki Manor.

Does Apollo go straight to Kitaki Manor or stop by Edgeworth's office?

If he convinced Mrs. Kitaki to let him out of Kay's body, would he be able to convince her again if he ended up in someone else's body again?

There was something else that he considered. This Kay Faraday looked like she had labelled herself as a "Great Thief." What type of person was Prosecutor Edgeworth if he seemed to treat her like an old friend? Perhaps he simply took the strange people that seemed to pop up in L.A. in stride. If he played his cards right, Apollo might even be able to get his help when he asked Mrs. Kitaki to let him out of this body. Or he may secretly be a criminal who will silence him for discovering his connection with Kay. Well, what's life without taking a few risks.

"Sorry, Mr. Edgeworth," Apollo said. "I haven't been feeling like myself lately." Well, it was true. Apollo had spent the past few days in the bodies of three different women. "I'll be there as soon as I can."

Apollo hung up as he began heading for the prosecution headquarters.

1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Whoever Kay was, she kept herself in shape. Apollo had decided to jog for a bit to save some time, and he soon found that he wasn't getting tired at all. By the time he reached his destination, only fifteen minutes had passed since he had hung up on Edgeworth, and he still didn't feel winded. (It is kind of nice to not get tired when I need to be somewhere quick. Though I'm not sure I want to know why this woman is in such good shape.)

As he passed through the entrance, a thought occurred to Apollo. How was he going to convince the security guards to let him into a prosecutor's office? On the one hand, he found it unlikely that the security guards would simply let someone like Apollo through without asking questions. On the other, Prosecutor Edgeworth seemed familiar enough that maybe there was a chance that Kay actually worked with the police.

(I'm already taking a risk coming here. I may as well go all in. And I need to stop making poker references. Mr. Wright might be rubbing off too much on me.) Apollo approached one of the guards, deciding to be completely honest with his intentions. "Excuse me, sir. I need to see Prosecutor Edgeworth."

The man actually seemed to lighten. "Hey, Kay. Mr. Edgeworth was expecting you. Oh, and he decided to keep his old office on the twelfth floor, so you know exactly where it is."

"Thanks," Apollo said, thankful the man both let him through and told him what floor the office was on. He decided to walk at a brisk pace, looking in on some of the offices as he searched for the elevator. It was easy, for instance, to tell which office belonged to Prosecutor Gavin. The rock memorabilia was out of place with what a professional environment would look like. Though, Apollo wasn't really in a position to criticize considering he worked at the Wright Anything Agency.

After he made it to the elevator and got to the twelfth floor, Apollo decided to look in at the office with its doors still open. Room 1202 had a large bookshelf full of both books and legal documents. Across from it was a burgundy...or maroon...or pink sofa beneath a regal looking suit. He then noticed a chessboard with many...definitely maroon pieces surrounding a single blue piece. (That probably means something, but hell if I know what it is.) Perhaps the strangest item in the room was a figurine Apollo recognized as the Steel Samurai, the protagonist of an old kid's show he watched growing up. (Wonder what something like that's doing here.)

"How nice of you to finally show up, Kay."

Apollo's eyes widened as he turned around. The figure could perhaps be best summarized as what he was not: he was certainly the exact opposite of Mr. Wright in almost any manner. The man carried himself with a dignified air, even if the glasses made him seem a bit old. The suit he wore was perhaps the furthest thing away from Mr. Wright's normal outfit. And the look on his face conveyed a very serious nature, which often seemed not to define Mr. Wright except when it came to Trucy.

"Hi, Mr. Edgeworth," Apollo said. "It's nice to see you again."

"Huh? What do you mean, Mr. Edgeworth?"

"You forgot about a meeting here that you arranged and said that you haven't been feeling like yourself lately. I just want to make sure an old friend of mine is alright."

"Oh, I'm fine, Mr. Edgeworth. I think I'm just coming down with something."

1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
"Sure thing, Mr. Edgeworth!" Today seemed to be all about taking risky gambles. Apollo would try to pretend to be Kay; hopefully when the truth came out, Prosecutor Edgeworth would at the very least be inclined to help her.

"Now then, let's start with what you've been up to lately. Have you made any headway into your career as the Great Thief?"

And suddenly, Apollo was worrying about the possibility that Edgeworth was a criminal mastermind like Kristoph Gavin turned out to be. "Huh? What makes you say that?"

This was evidently the wrong answer, as Edgeworth simply stared at him, crossed his arms, and tapped his finger.

"Really, I don't know what you're talking about."

OBJECTION!

"Tsk, tsk. Coming to a contradiction so soon. You deny any connection to the Great Thief, but the evidence is plain as day. Surely, you've noticed the badge on your scarf."

"Well, what about it?"

"That badge is the shape of the Great Thief Yatagarasu, worn proudly by the one who inherited the title."

(Damn, I can't believe I made such an easy mistake!) "Ehehehe...I'm just teasing you, Mr. Edgeworth. Of course, I've been doing great as a thief!"

"Really, now? You do realize that admitting to such a crime is not a very good idea since I'm a prosecutor. In fact, I was recently named the new chief prosecutor."

"Whoa, really?!"

"Yes, you even congratulated me over the phone the other day. But enough about that. If you're so intent on confessing your crimes, why don't you tell me all about your exploits?"

"Oh, well..." (What would a thief even brag about?) "I've been getting everything from everyone! Why, I bet you haven't even noticed you're missing anything yet, Mr. Edgeworth!"

"You're exactly right, I haven't noticed anything missing. Because nothing is missing."

"..!"

"For shame. Do you not even know why you are the Great Thief? Such petty crimes are beneath you."

"Uh, of course! I've obviously taken extremely valuable things!"

"But haven't you taken the most valuable thing of all?"

"Huh?"

"Perhaps, this might jog your memory."

TAKE THAT!

"And this is?"

"A newspaper article about a confirmed theft by the Great Thief Yatagarasu. The articles taken were later found to be crucial evidence in a trial. Do you see yet? The most precious thing, the only thing worth stealing for a Great Thief, is the truth! That is the creed of the Yatagarasu!"

"Eep!" (Even if I'm really bad at hiding that I don't know stuff, it's still kind of cool to see...Chief Prosecutor Edgeworth in his element.)

"Surely, your predecessor told you of this fact and of the rules of being the Great Thief."

(I'm still not sure what he's trying to do, but I guess I'll fall into this trap.) "Well, of course she did! I just...forgot..."

"Hmm...you seem to be forgetting a lot of important things. You don't happen to be having amnesia right now, do you?"

"Yeah, that's it. You got me. Sorry, Mr. Edgeworth, it was embarrassing to say that."

"I think it should be embarrassing to say that."

"Huh?"

"After all, you really did have amnesia once. In fact, a man high in law enforcement sought to take advantage of your state by framing you for a murder you even came to believe you committed. The Kay who had amnesia most certainly did not act like you; she was afraid she was a bad person because of her identity as a thief."

"..."

"Every statement you've made up to this point has been trying to convince me you are Kay Faraday, the Great Thief Yatagarasu. But the truth is, you are an imposter. The real Kay, if arguing about her predecessor, would remember who HE is."

"...!"

"Though the original Yatagarasu was in fact a group of three, there was one person who stood above the others. The one whose path Kay wanted to follow in. And that person was her father, Prosecutor Byrne Faraday!"

"ACK!"

"Now, then. Who are you, really?"

"Well, you know I can't just say it. Now that we're on this path, it's actually kind of cool watching you do your thing, Chief Prosecutor Edgeworth."

"Interesting...you seem to know nothing of Kay Faraday, yet you make a claim that you know about me. I wonder, are you a person involved with the law?"

"Now, what makes you say that?"

"Unlike a certain prosecutor, I'm not very well known beyond legal circles. I may have a high position now, but to the public at large, I may be as interchangeable as a Payne. So, tell me. How do you know of me?"

"Well, alright. When you called over the phone, I didn't actually recognize you at first until you mentioned you were a prosecutor. Then, I remembered about that brilliant prosecutor who stood as Mr. Wright's rival when he was a lawyer."

"How very illuminating! The person you truly follow isn't me, it's actually Wright! That narrows down the possibilities quite a bit since his reputation is down the drain ever since he was disbarred for his forgery."

"Hey, I...he was proven innocent of that!"

"Yes, yes he was. In fact, I never believed that he had done so at all, but there were many jealous of Wright, eager to pounce when the opportunity arose. I'm even hoping to convince him to return to law, though he has been hesitant since it might mean less time spent with his daughter. But I believe just now you gave a very important clue to your identity."

"Oh, really?"

"You protested about that forgery, leading with 'Hey, I.' That sounds to me like you personally had a role in proving his innocence."

"Well, what if I did?"

"Then, I can think of very few people you could be. If I didn't know Wright like I do, I would have easily dismissed the possibility. But with him in the picture, the unplausible is most certainly not impossible. But I have one more piece of evidence. Tell me, what do you think of that object at the end of my bookshelf?"

Apollo turned to where Edgeworth pointed. "I don't get it. That's a ladder."

"Are you sure it's not a stepladder?"

"What's the difference?"

"Exactly. It's a debate that has been going on for ten years with Wright. He has corrupted his daughter with his thoughts on the subject, but the attorney who works under him has vehemently resisted the argument."

Apollo had to give one last effort to deceiving Edgeworth, even if it was weak and rather embarrassing to say. "But,...I'm very clearly a woman."

"You very clearly have Kay Faraday's form...perhaps it's even her body. But I never mentioned the sex of Wright's student. Of course, you would know about him. He proved Wright's innocence after seven years of injustice. Wright even believes that his student will soon grow to surpass his legacy."

"Wait, really?" (Mr. Wright...he really believes in me that much?)

"That reaction...it tells me that you were not sure that Wright believes in you that much."

"...I'm really that readable, huh?"

"Yes, you are, Mr. Apollo Justice."

"Heh..." Apollo sheepishly put a hand at his neck. "You really are amazing Chief Prosecutor Edgeworth. You took apart everything like it was child's play!"

"Hmph. What a strange situation you must be in. But for now, it's checkmate."
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Apollo tries to hold out on Edgeworth.

choices: Apollo and Edgeworth head for the manor.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Edgeworth could feel his brows furrow deeper and deeper as the young attorney told his tale of the sudden theft of his body and everything that happened after that. At one level, he could sympathize with the young Kitaki getting stir crazy from enforced bed rest. All his other actions, however, wiped out most of that sympathy as it was clear the young man had no qualms about what he had done to his relief. He considered Apollo rather lucky that his ideas to fix everything ended up working, perhaps he had some of that strange luck that allowed Wright to emerge from situations that would kill ordinary men relatively unscathed.

"So, Mrs. Kitaki let me out of Vera's body before storing that remote somewhere. I headed for the agency, hoping to get back to my body, but I accidentally ended up in Kay's body right when I almost got there."

"Hm..." It was a lot to process, even for him. He wondered how such a device had made its way into Wocky's possession, but he supposed he had to fix one problem at a time.

"Um, Mr. Edgeworth, you aren't mad at me for taking over your...friend's body, are you?"

"I would if I had any reason to believe you were trying to take advantage of her body. Your regard for the Misham girl is enough proof for me that you're trustworthy. That being said, I would prefer if you returned to your body as soon as possible. I'm not sure whether Kay would be upset or impressed that someone managed to steal her body."

"Hey, Mr. Edgeworth. How come you know someone who purports to be a thief?"

"I'll tell you on the way to the Kitaki manor."

"Right. Is there a bus stop nearby?"

"Mr. Justice, unlike you or your boss, I have a license and a rather nice car. We should arrive there in a timely manner once we leave."

"Gee, thanks Mr. Edgeworth." (Must be nice actually getting paid for doing your job.)
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Edgeworth learns the truth.

choices: It was Gumshoe, who wanted to see Kay.
It was Phoenix, who seemed worried about something.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Before they could leave the office, Apollo heard a ringtone different form the one Kay's phone made earlier. It sounded kind of like the Steel Samurai's theme song. Strange. Mr. Wright had that ringtone too. Mr. Wright had mentioned that an old friend of his changed his ringtone as a joke, and he never bothered to change it back. Perhaps the same had happened to the chief prosecutor?

Edgeworth picked up. "Edgeworth speaking."
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: A phone call interrupts them.

1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
"Edgeworth, it's me."

"Wright?" Edgeworth frowned. "Why are you calling? I assume you haven't decided on what we've talked about."

"No, Edgeworth. This is more important to me. You're not in the middle of something, are you?"

"No. Is something wrong?" Wright seemed very serious and very worried about something.

"Actually, yes. I think something happened to Trucy."

"Your daughter? What's the matter?" Edgeworth saw concern appear on Apollo's face.

"When I went back home last night, Trucy seemed different. She didn't greet me or tease me about staying late. She didn't even seem to regard me at all until I got right in front of her. I thought she might just be tired after a long day, but she was still out of it in the morning."

"Can you describe her behavior further?" At this point, Edgeworth put the phone on speaker, hoping that Apollo would be able to glean something from his boss's words.

"She went to go get some magic props. Kind of easy to do that when the office is full of them. But she seemed like she was trying to look for something in them, not practice magic. A friend of hers called earlier, but she didn't notice her phone go off at all. After the third time, I picked it up myself and gave an excuse for why Trucy was busy. I asked her why she didn't remember setting up a meeting with her friend, but she just waved me off like she had more important things to focus on. I'm really worried, Edgeworth. It's like she's an entirely different person."

"Interesting," Edgeworth remarked as he put the phone off speaker. It seemed like he had given Apollo enough information to work off of.

Apollo was processing his boss's words. None of those things sounded like Trucy's behavior at all. She loved Mr. Wright and certainly wouldn't be dismissive of him. Like an entirely different person...what if Mr. Wright was correct about that? The fact that he was currently not himself was evidence of the possibility, but then who could possibly fit that description Mr. Wright gave? (Forget it. It's not about thinking about who fits that description. The only thing that's important is who had the chance to take Trucy's place? Wocky was the only one who had the remote, and it was clear that after he had taken Apollo's body, he moved on to possess Vera. If Wocky himself didn't take Trucy's body, he might have swapped her with...the other person who was in the agency...Oh no.

"AAAAAAAAAAHHHH!" Apollo exclaimed as he came to a horrifying realization.

"Huh, are you with someone, Edgeworth?"

"Just an associate of mine. Could you wait for a moment?" Edgeworth muted his phone's microphone. "So, Mr. Justice, have you figured out what happened?"

"Wocky swapped her with Wesley Stickler! That sicko's been in her body...and that means she's been stuck in his." Another horrifying realization occurred to him. "Oh, God. When we were forced out of the agency, I...I pushed her away from me. She was just as confused as me...and I...Trucy..."

Edgeworth became distinctly uncomfortable as Apollo seemed like he was on the verge of tears. "Calm down, Mr. Justice. Now that we know what happened, we can do something about it. First, I have a concerned father I have to deal with."

Satisfied that Apollo was not about to emotionally break down, he turned his attention back to his phone and unmuted it. "Wright, I have a feeling I know what's going on."

"Really, you do?!"

"Yes, your situation seems to be very similar to something that's going on right now, and I'm going to get to the bottom of it."

"Is there anything I can do to help?"

"Yes. Are you still at your office?"

"Sure, why?"

"I think you need to have a talk with your 'daughter' and find out the truth yourself. Leave no question off the table, and call me back when you're ready."

"Edgeworth, this isn't funny. I'm the one who gives cryptic hints."

"Turnabout is fair play, Wright. I expect to hear from you soon." Edgeworth hung up and led Apollo back into his office. Inside, Edgeworth retrieved a laptop and booted it up quickly. "If you recall, Mr. Justice, Wesley Stickler appeared as a witness in court during one of your cases. We took down his contact information in case he was needed for further testimony. I should be able to retrieve that information, and hopefully we will be able to contact Ms. Wright."

Those words seemed to shake Apollo out of his stupor, though he still looked emotionally vulnerable. A few minutes passed before Edgeworth found the information he needed. He dialed the number into his phone and awaited a response.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Phoenix called, worried about something.

choices: Apollo and Edgeworth finally head for the manor.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
A voice finally came from the phone. "Um...hello?"

Edgeworth decided to get straight to the point. "Am I correct in assuming that the person I'm speaking to is not Wesley Stickler and is, in fact, Trucy Wright?"

"Uncle Edgeworth! You have no idea how relieved I am to hear from someone who knows who I really am! How did you figure it out?"

"Very simple: I didn't. I had the help of Mr. Justice."

"Polly's with you? Can I talk to him?"

Edgeworth handed his phone over, and Apollo began bawling. "TRUCY! I'MSORRYI'MSORRYI'MSORRYI'MSORRYI'MSORRYI'MSORRYI'MS ORRYI'MSORRY!"

"Whoa, Polly, slow down!"

"I shouldn't have pushed you away from me! I should have noticed it was really you and not him and I'm sorry and..."

"Polly, please! Don't be so hard on yourself! I'm just happy to hear from you...even if your voice sounds really different."

Edgeworth observed as Apollo slowly but surely calmed down. Really, it was touching that the young man cared a lot for Wright's daughter, almost as if they were siblings. He knew from talking with Wright that the young lawyer often ended up as a guinea pig for the magician's acts, but when push came to shove, he could tell that they both would stick by each other. It almost reminded him of himself and Franziska.

"Thanks, I'm fine now, Trucy. You hear me? I'M APOLLO JUSTICE, AND I'M FINE!"

Edgeworth thought he was also very loud, but at least the young man had returned to his emotional equilibrium.

Eventually, Apollo handed the phone back to him. "Trucy wanted to speak to you, Mr. Edgeworth."

Edgeworth nodded as he took his phone back. "Good job getting Mr. Justice to settle down."

"Heh, Polly gets worried about me so easily. But that's why he's so endearing: he really cares."

"He's not the only one worried about you. Your father has noticed that your body's current occupant has not taken much care to acting like you."

"Daddy...does he already know?"

"I told him to seek the truth himself. It won't be very long now. Rest assured, Mr. Justice and I are on our way to resolving this situation. You should just make your way back to your...agency as soon as possible."

"Alright, Uncle Edgeworth. Thank you."

Edgeworth hung up. "Alright, Mr. Justice. Trucy is on her way back to your place of employment. We should get going."

"Alright. And really...thanks for everything, Mr. Edgeworth. I'm not sure if I would have found Trucy without you or how long it would be before I noticed anything wrong with her."

"You have been caught up in a very unusual situation. Taking everything into consideration, I think you've done very well. Wright is very lucky to have a fine young man working under him."
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Trucy picks up.

choices: They make it to the office
Apollo accidentally pressed a button along the way
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Apollo and Edgeworth made their way to Kitaki manor. While Apollo was glad Kay's body would have had enough energy to walk there, the car ride from Edgeworth was very welcome. Once they arrived, Edgeworth knocked on the gate of the manor. The one who came and answered the door was Mrs. Kitaki, who still seemed to be suffering from a headache because of what Wocky did earlier. "What is it?" Mrs. Kitaki asked coldly, she was clearly not in any mood to deal with people.

Edgeworth spoke up before Apollo could say anything "My apologies, but we're here to discuss something that your son has done. I'm sure you're more than aware of how he has altered people's bodies."

Mrs. Kitaki was silent for a few seconds before she spoke again "Come in." She said and invited them into the manor.

Once inside, Edgeworth explained the whole situation to her, he didn't leave out any details and made sure to thoroughly explain who was in whose body now. Mrs. Kitaki's expression was a mixture of sadness and anger at what her son had done. "As you can see, Mrs. Kitaki, we are going to need to use the device that Wocky had first used to fix all of this."

"Oh, yes, of course. I left it upstairs, I'll be just a minute" Mrs. Kitaki said as she got up and left to go grab the remote.

Apollo was a bit amazed by Edgeworth, throughout his entire explanation and his request to use the remote, Mrs. Kitaki had listened and didn't argue once. Edgeworth was such a smooth talker and if he was able to make even someone like Mrs. Kitaki agree with him so easily, Apollo wondered how fierce in the courtroom.

About 2 minutes later, Mrs. Kitaki had returned with the remote. "Here, I don't want my son using this ever again" She said as she handed the remote to Edgeworth.

"You can rest assured, I will make sure that the device won't fall into the wrong hands." Edgeworth told Mrs. Kitaki as he stood up "Come along, Mr. Justice, we have to fix all of this." Edgeworth said as he began to leave the manor, Apollo followed close behind.

As they got back into Edgeworth's car, Edgeworth handed Apollo the remote. "Be careful with this, Mr. Justice. I would like to avoid any accidental button presses before we arrive at Wright's office." Apollo nodded.

Now that they had the remote, the only thing left to do was head back and fix Trucy.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Apollo and Edgeworth finally head for the manor.

choices: Inside the agency, they find Phoenix, Trucy, and Wesley.
Inside the agency, they see that someone's missing.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
With the remote in their possession, Apollo felt like all the craziness was finally coming to an end. Well, all the craziness in excess of his usual life. During the car trip to the Kitaki's, Apollo still had guilty feelings about leaving Trucy all by herself in the mess. He had even forgotten to get Edgeworth's story about why he seemed to keep in touch with a thief. It was on the ride back that he learned about the girl whose body he was currently using. Apollo knew that he really shouldn't judge a book by its cover, but everything Edgeworth told him about Kay's morals and altruism made him feel bad for worrying about time in jail for crimes he didn't commit. Of particular note was that incident of amnesia Edgeworth had mentioned previously. The lengths the chief prosecutor had gone to in order to defend her in her most vulnerable state, believing in her even when she didn't believe in herself, heightened the already great respect the attorney had for his boss's former rival.

"Wow, Mr. Edgeworth. To wager your profession and freedom so you could pursue the truth and save your friend..."

"A mere badge for a dear friend. I didn't even have to think about it. And I think you would be the sort of person who would do the same, Mr. Justice. Otherwise, I doubt Wright would have put his trust in you."

"To think I only knew about you because you had gone up against Mr. Wright so many times in court..."

"It's not really that surprising, especially for someone who followed Wright because of his own beliefs in fighting for the truth. After all, I didn't always place value on such things in my youth."

"Wait, really? After everything you've done for Kay, I can't imagine you as someone who wouldn't fight for the truth."

"Believe it or not, my early career revolved around a very different set of priorities. Back then and even still among a lot of prosecutors today, the predominant goal of a prosecutor was exactly what was stated in the job description: to get defendants found guilty. Even I subscribed to this belief for many years, and it wasn't until later that I had relearned what was truly important."

"And how did that happen?"

"That...is a story for another time. We have already arrived at our destination."

Apollo turned away from the chief prosecutor to find that Edgeworth had parked right outside the agency. He breathed a sigh of relief as they headed for the entrance.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: They make it to the office.

choices: Apollo swaps Trucy and Wesley back.
Apollo accidentally pressed the wrong button...
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Apollo felt relieved to be back at the agency for real this time. It was another sign that things would get back to what passed for normal soon. Inside, he and Edgeworth found both Trucy and Wesley tied up and cuffed. Wesley appeared to be trying to figure out how to escape, but even though he had a magician's body, he was still no closer to understanding a magician's tricks. Mr. Wright meanwhile had an exasperated look, as if containing Wesley had put him through the wringer. It had probably been years since he had to deal with a situation remotely similar to this one, though Apollo couldn't imagine what such a situation would entail.

"Uncle Edgeworth, you're here!" Trucy exclaimed as the first to notice them. "And is that Polly with you?"

"Ehehe...hey, Trucy. Hey, Mr. Wright."

Phoenix shifted his attention to the new arrivals. "Trucy filled me in on everything you told her over the phone. Heh...so you really did get dragged into this, Apollo? I'd make a joke, but there are more important things that need to be done."

"Speak for yourself, Daddy. I think Polly looks super cute now! I bet he'd be way more popular and get a lot more clients like this!"

That teasing smile was kind of unsettling on Wesley's body, but Apollo was glad that Trucy was so resilient. (She sure is a tough girl.)

"That may be the case, Trucy," Edgeworth opined, "but I for one would prefer to have Kay in control of her own body again."

"First though, let's get my daughter back in her body."
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Phoenix, Trucy, and Wesley are all here.

choices: "I had Apollo go somewhere else earlier."
"I have absolutely no idea where he is."
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Apollo managed to recall the function that had allowed him to swap out of Plum's body and into Vera's, first pointing the remote at Trucy and pressing the correct button before doing the same to Wesley. The two seemed to be disoriented for a moment, but it immediately became clear that the swap had worked.

"Oh, thank goodness!" In a flash, Trucy broke free from the bonds and cuffs before running up to Apollo and giving him a hug. "Thanks, Polly!"

Apollo stiffened for a moment due to the suddenness of the gesture but soon reciprocated. "I'm just glad you're safe and alright."

"Alright? I'm better than that. I'm fine! In fact, I'm feeling very fine!"

"You sure about that, Trucy?" With his daughter back in her body, Phoenix finally relaxed. "I don't seem to recall Wesley making any effort to take care of your body. He seemed to have single minded focus on figuring out your tricks."

With his mention of her body's needs, Trucy let go of Apollo, frowning and crossing her arms. "...Daddy, why did you have to mention that? Now I feel like I didn't sleep well or eat anything, and I also suddenly need a shower."

"Hahaha...sorry Trucy. Why don't you freshen up first? I'll make you something to eat, and then you can take a well earned nap."

"Yay! Thanks, Daddy!"

With that, Trucy rushed off, and the smile on Phoenix's face fell too. "So, what are we going to do with you, Mr. Stickler?"

For his part, Wesley seemed unconcerned about the danger staring him in the face. "To think that there is a way to simply undo these material bindings and trick cuffs with such ease! Yet another mystery I must uncover. Such a task may seem so daunting: to unravel the tricks and gimmicks that defy all bounds of logic. But I, Wesley Stickler, will find out how to..."

HOLD IT!

Apollo was covering his ears. "I don't know about anyone else, but I couldn't take any more of his talking. I already got more than enough of that in court."

"I concur, Wright. But before you start anything, please remember that Mr. Stickler too is a victim of Mr. Kitaki's gross disregard for consequences. At least he did not violate your daughter's body in any manner approaching Mr. Kitaki's disregard for Ms. Misham's image."

Phoenix paused to consider his old friend's words. "Fine, then. I'm going to let you go, Mr. Stickler, but I'm not going to let you just come by whenever you want to hassle my daughter over her magic. In fact, I'm going to file a restraining order against you on behalf of Trucy."

The threat to his inquiries finally caught Wesley's attention. "You...you can't do that! It is beyond the pale of human comprehension that such tricks should remain a mystery. Inquiring minds everywhere need to know everything about the lengths to which..."

OBJECTION!

It had been awhile since Phoenix had last uttered a good, courtroom style "Objection," but he felt the circumstances warranted it. He slammed against a nearby table to accentuate his point. "I don't think you truly understand why magic is so important to Trucy. These aren't mere "tricks" that you're talking about; they're the accumulated legacy of her birth family. They are the positive memories of her birth father, mother, uncle, and grandfather. The performance rights of the Gramarye's most celebrated tricks are what Zak sacrificed everything for to pass onto her. The secrets are hers alone to share with those she believes are worthy. To try and take the secrets from her amounts to theft. And in case you haven't noticed, I have very high friends in law enforcement. This is your only warning. If you continue to try and steal the magic, there will be hell to pay." With that, Phoenix quickly undid the restraints and handcuffs. "Now get out of my agency."

Whether Phoenix's angry father shtick truly sunk into Wesley or not remained to be seen. Still, he did seem to get the memo enough to immediately run out the exit. The smile returned to Phoenix's face. "Well, I think I got my point across."

While Edgeworth remained impassive, Apollo was not. (I don't even think Mr. Wright was really that angry at him, but his presence was overwhelming. I'd hate to see what he's like when he's really pissed off.)

"Now that this bit of unpleasantness is over, I would like Kay to have her body back, and I'm sure you would prefer your associate to be back in his as well."

"Oh, I don't know, Edgeworth. I agree with Trucy. He is a lot cuter like this, and he might actually get paid for his legal work too."

Apollo drooped. (And there's the boss who jokes at my expense.) "Gee, thanks, Mr. Wright. I'm glad I currently fit your bill of cuteness."

Edgeworth gave his patented glare at Wright, arms crossed with a lone finger tapping.

Phoenix merely chuckled at the sight. "Alright, alright, Edgeworth. Gee, I thought you might have mellowed out with age."

"Wright, I very much doubt you would be as amused if it were Ms. Fey being possessed. Or if it were Ms. Fey being the troublemaker."

The chuckling stopped. "Don't even joke about that. I can only imagine how crazy things would get if Maya got her hands on that remote."

"Well, you've made your joke at Mr. Justice's expense. Now where is his body? I'd like to be done with this as soon as possible." Despite being able to roll with the punches, Edgeworth did not like any of the logical implications the remote had. As soon as this was over, he would box away the whole experience into the corner of his mind which contained the psycho-locks he had once had to deal with.

"Funny thing you should mention that now..."
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Apollo swaps Trucy and Wesley back.

1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
"What." Apollo flatly stared at his boss, but Phoenix just shrugged his shoulders.

"Well, I had just gotten a bizarre statement from Edgeworth telling me to have a talk with my daughter and find the truth. Since I had no idea what was going on, I figured I should confront her alone, so I sent the person who I thought was Apollo out."

"That...does make sense..." While Apollo couldn't really fault that reasoning, he still drooped at the fact that he would STILL be unable to return to his body for a while longer. It was as if someone up there was conspiring to keep him as a girl for as long as possible.

"Wright. Where exactly did you send Mr. Justice's body to?"
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: "I had Apollo go somewhere else earlier."

choices: Apollo and Kay walk back to the Agency
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
"I sent him home a while before you arrived. He should be there by now" Phoenix explained.

Edgeworth sighed. "Alright, Mr. Justice and I will go and fix this final mistake. We'll be back shortly." Edgeworth said as he turned about and began to walk toward the office door, however, he was interrupted before he could leave.

"Actually, Mr. Edgeworth, I don't live too far from here. If you give me the remote, I can quickly run over and get my body back." Apollo volunteered, Edgeworth had already helped out so much today and Apollo felt the need to prove he could fix at least some of this by himself.

Edgeworth seemed to think about it for a second before he gave a nod and handed the remote to Apollo. "Mr. Justice, once you have returned to your body, head back here with Kay. After that, we'll all have a discussion about what should be done about this device."

Apollo gave a short nod "All right! I'll be back in around half an hour." He said before he left the office, his first destination was his house

After a short jog, Apollo was standing in front of the door to his home. He gave a short knock and listened for the sound of his own body walking to answer the door. Once he saw the doorknob turn, he aimed the remote at himself and pressed 'Possession' he was once again in the ghost like form from the first time he used the 'Possession' function. He flew toward the door as it opened and possessed the person on the other side.

A few seconds later, Apollo was looking at Kay. His eyes immediately shot downward however, as he examined the body he had ended up in. He was finally back in his own body! After the days he just had, he never felt happier to be himself. His celebration was cut short however, by a very confused Kay.

"What the? How did I get here?" Kay said confused as she looked at her surroundings.

"Uh, hi." Apollo said, not sure how he should start explaining what was going on. He explained to Kay everything that had happened in the past few hours.

"So, that remote in your hands can swap bodies?" Kay asked just to make sure

Apollo rubbed the back of his head "I know it's hard to belie-"

"That is so cool" Kay interrupted him. It seemed like she believed everything Apollo told him

"Trust me, it's much less cool when someone else puts you in another body." Apollo said deadpan, cool was one of the last word he would use to describe the time he had. "Anyway, Mr. Edgeworth is waiting for us at Mr. Wright's office. We better not keep him waiting." Apollo said as he walked past Kay.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Phoenix had sent "Apollo" back home.

choices: Edgeworth and Phoenix had decided to let Apollo keep the remote.
One of the two takes the remote.
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
Apollo was thankful that Kay had not decided to take the remote. With everything he had heard about her from Chief Prosecutor Edgeworth, he was worried that she might be up for mischief making. Exactly what she would do, he had no idea, but that made the prospect scarier.

Instead, she seemed to content to tease him about the situation. "So, you became three different women. Whose body did you like the best?"

"Er...I'd rather not say. I'm just glad this whole thing is almost over."

"Why not? It's not like I'd judge you if you secretly liked being someone else. I bet you liked me best since you got to have my body all to yourself. It must have been really embarrassing showering while Vera was also aware of every movement on her body."

"Ngrk..."

"Oh, wow. I didn't actually know if you had done that, but that blush says everything. And if you weren't comfortable in her body with her watching, I kind of doubt you would like being a middle-aged woman, let alone sharing that body with her. So, that leaves me, your happy little accidental theft. Kind of impressed you managed to steal my body, though I will eventually get you back for that."

Apollo decided to tempt fate to satiate his curiosity and get the subject off of body comparisons. "So...how come you haven't tried to take the remote and do something to me?"

"Oh, that thought definitely crossed my mind. But then I thought, 'Nah, it's no fun if he's expecting that to happen.' I'll make sure to get you back one day, but it's so much better when you don't know what's coming. That way, you can stew in dread and horror up until that time! Doesn't that sound fun?"

"I think out ideas of fun are a bit different..."

Apollo was grateful to find that they had arrived back at the agency. He and Kay found Mr. Wright and Mr. Edgeworth discussing something over a game of chess.

"Hiya, Mr. Edgeworth!"

Edgeworth looked up and gave a smile. "Ah, Kay and Mr. Justice. Everything is sorted out now, I presume?"

"Thankfully, yes." Apollo held out the remote. "Now we can decide what to do about this."
1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.title: Apollo and Kay walk back to the Agency.

1253122112111221121121122222111221111111.content:
"Mr. Justice, I think Wright and I have figured out the best person to keep that remote from causing any more trouble."

"Great," Apollo said. "And who would that be?"

"You, naturally," Phoenix said.

"WHAT?! I don't want it!"

"And that's exactly why you should keep it," his boss replied. "Edgeworth's got a lot of things to worry about in his position. And I've...got a little project of my own. Since you've already gone through a lot to sort out the mess left in its wake, I think you of all people would know to keep it away from dangerous situations."

"And...what if I wanted to use it on someone?"

"For one, I highly doubt you would want to do so, at least without someone's permission. But even if you developed a mischievous streak, you're a pretty bad liar. You can bluff in court as a desperation move, but your bluffs are always anchored by the possibility of them being the truth. Edgeworth could tell pretty easily that you weren't Kay, so I'm pretty sure that you'd be very stoppable."

"Eh, so much for taking over the world."

Phoenix chuckled at that, and even Edgeworth had to suppress a smirk. Just then, an alarm went off on Edgeworth's phone. "I must be going, Wright. I'm very glad you've come around to my thinking about the subject we have discussed."

"Yeah, yeah. Who knows, maybe one day we'll find ourselves reliving the good old days."

"Perhaps. Come along, Kay. We can still catch up on all your misadventures on the way back to my office."

"Sure thing, Mr. Edgeworth!" She turned to face Apollo. "But seriously, it was nice meeting you, Apollo. Even if you are a sick in the mud."

"Gee...I'm really flattered."

"You better be, otherwise...well, a real girl can get creative with mischief." Kay gave a winning smile and an ambiguously friendly wink before dashing out of the office.

"Wright, I'll be seeing you later."

"Take care, Edgeworth."

After the chief prosecutor departed, Phoenix turned to face Apollo. "So, I'm going out to get some groceries. And maybe get Trucy something nice. You can find a hiding place for the remote. Or, you could decide to just keep it on you. Whatever you choose, I'm counting on you to be responsible with that remote."

"Don't worry, Mr. Wright. No one's going to use this against Trucy."

"Good. I'll see you later, Apollo."

With that, Phoenix departed, allowing Apollo time to consider what he wanted to do with the remote. Part of him was tempted to use it for fun. It didn't take long for Wocky to attempt to grab the remote from them again. Apollo was lucky and kept the remote away from him. As he dodged Wocky's grasp, he had and idea.

'Vera, I'm going to use the remote, I'm going to press the possession button. When I do it, one of us is going to be kicked out of the body. If it's you, possess the body of someone outside the Kitaki Manor and head to your home, I'll meet you there. If you are in control of this body when I press that button, immediately point the remote at yourself and hit the possession button. From there do what I said a moment ago, Understand? Apollo explained to Vera

Apollo dodged another one of Wocky's attempts to grab the remote. On the positive side of things, it seemed as though Mrs. Kitaki's body was getting tired out. Apollo aimed the remote at himself and pressed the possession button, and in a mere instant one of the two people currently inhabiting Vera's body was now in a ghost like form, floating above the other people in the room.

"Me and two of my friends were going to hang out TODAY! I wanted to know if you wanted to come TOO?!" Robin shouted into the phone.

Apollo was holding the phone an arm's length away and could still hear Robin perfectly. He decided to ask Vera for her opinion on the matter 'What do you think, Vera? His friends could be nice. Maybe hanging out with some other people will help relief some stress that Wocky caused us'

Vera thought about it, she didn't have much time to think since Robin was still waiting on the phone. In the end she decided she and Apollo should...

125312211211122112112112222211122111221.content:
Wesley had an understandably confusing day. Earlier he had been at the Wright Anything Agency trying to inquire the secret of Trucy Wright's magic panties trick. She was instantiate on keeping it to herself, but he was persistent. However, before he could inquire the panties secret, there had been a strange flash in the room and he had suddenly found himself in the body of Trucy Wright.

That had all happened earlier in the day. Wesley had spent most of the day as Trucy Wright. This had truly been a mysterious day, however, this situation could be full of opportunity. Not only could he attempt to find out the secret of her panties without any risk of getting into trouble, but he could end up being the first person to ever academically study 'Body Swapping'. Of course, he was sure that he was the only person that 'Body Swapping' ever occurred to.

He went and located the Magic Panties inside the Wright Anything Agency a little while after he had been put into Trucy's body. Unfortunately, despite many hours of trying to figure out how she did it. The secret to the magic trick was still out of his grasp. Of course, he wasn't going to give up yet, he would study these panties until he found all their secrets!

Throughout the day, Trucy's cell phone rang several times. Wesley had been so persistent in his studies that he didn't realize that it was technically his phone now. Once he had checked it he noticed that their were several missed calls from numbers labeled 'Daddy' and 'Vera' Wesley reasoned that the first one was Trucy's father's number, however, he had no idea who the second number belonged to.

Wesley looked out of a window of the Agency and noticed how late it had gotten, he had completely forgot to keep track of time. He supposed it was time to head home, or rather, head to Trucy's home. He knew where it was......for academic reasons. He headed out the door and made his way to the her home.

When he got there he was greeted by Trucy's father, who was worried since she hadn't picked up is phone calls. Wesley assured Mr. Wright that he was fine and made his way to Trucy's bedroom. He had no interest in associating with Mr. Wright.

Once he was in Trucy's bedroom, he made a way for her bed and laid down. While the day hadn't been particularly long or exhausting to him. He had an odd feeling that tomorrow would be a long day, since it would be his first full day in Trucy's body.

---------

The next morning, Wesley had woken up to a semi-familiar ringtone. It was that of Trucy's phone. He figured that after not picking it up at all yesterday, he should at least answer a few of her phone calls. "Hello? Wes- Trucy Wright speaking."

Who was on the phone?

Apollo should have expected this. It wasn't too long ago that not only was Vera proving not guilty in the trial for the murder of her father, but it was also revealed that she was a famous forger. Apollo couldn't help but smile. Yeah, Vera was clearly very nervous, but it was clear that she had gained some self confidence since her trial. Of course, they needed to fix this before that interview. "When is it?"

'Oh! Oh no, it's tomorrow!' Vera said mentally.

Apollo was afraid she would say something like that.he needed to think of what to do quick. Apollo gave it some thought and he had an idea for how to get Wocky to willingly go to his own body. It was a bit cruel, but if they had him stay in his own mother's body for a few days he would eventually crack and want to be himself again, but would he be willing to be himself again before Vera's interview.
