1253122112111221121121122222111222.title: '...I've been asked to show up at an in...

12531221121112211211212.content:
Apollo could scarcely believe what was happening as he felt himself lose control over Plum's body, being relegated to the "passenger's seat" so to speak as Plum opened their eyes back up and stared at her husband, shaking her head.

"No! No, not at all dear, I'm fine," she replied with a smile, "just a minor headache is all. Spent too much time out in the sun today!"

Winfred gave a glad smile back, "well, you'll feel better after tonight. I've already arranged for someone to keep an eye on Wocky, so we'll have the night to ourselves to relax."

"That's lovely dear," Plum said back, "I have to go get ready and freshen up. I'll be back in just a moment."

'Mrs. Kitaki, you can't be serious right now!' Apollo complained mentally as she quickly maneuvered into the bedroom. 'This is a dire situation!'

"Hush yourself," Plum said aloud, turning her head towards a nearby mirror in order to address Apollo more 'directly'. "This has been a nightmarish day for me, and now that I have control over my body again, I'm not about to give it back over to you so you can ruin my anniversary. I know my husband and son are safe, and for now that's all I need to know, and I need you to be quiet."

With that, Apollo had no option but to watch from Plum's eyes while she prepared herself for her night with her husband. Having his (well, technically her) body move outside of his power was a surprisingly frightening experience. No matter how much he seemed to focus, it didn't seem like he could turn the tables back around like Plum herself did. To his displeasure, Plum took the time to disrobe and shower herself off, forcing Apollo into silence again when he tried to object.

"Ah, finally. Needed to refresh after all that walking around," she said with a relieved sigh after she stepped out of the shower, quickly putting on a robe. "I don't think you appreciate what I've gone through today Mr. Justice. All these different people walking about in this hot weather using my body like some sort of jogging suit, I swear..." she murmured as she sat down in front of a large makeup table.

'I think my day has been just as bad, thank you very much,' Apollo replied sardonically, already rather traumatized.

Plum gave a sharp laugh in reply as she applied makeup to her eyebrows. "Oh don't be so dramatic. You're aboard the SS Plum for tonight. Behave yourself and I'll treat you right."
12531221121112211211212.title: Plum

1253122112111221122.content:
Apollo stood silently on the sidewalk, alone save for the occasional person walking past. He had every reason to freak out and panic right now, what with him suddenly becoming a woman, losing 20 years off his life, and gaining more weight than he dared to estimate. However, panicking wasn't going to get him back into his own body, so despite the oddity of the situation, he did his best to remain calm and think things through.

Whoever was in his body right now, and was previously in Plum's, was clearly behind this. Plum had already been acting rather strangely before the swap occurred, and that same odd behaviour had been coming from his own body after the swap. There was also the fact that whoever it was didn't seem surprised or shocked by what had happened, and immediately reached for that strange device Apollo had found held in Plum's hand. That device must have been what caused the swap. Apollo couldn't help but wonder how far down the chain he was. The person who swapped with him wasn't acting like Plum, so it seemed clear that whoever it was had swapped with her first, before coming to his office and swapping with him. But then, where was Plum now? How many other swaps had this person performed, displacing everyone into incorrect bodies along the way?

Apollo knew he needed to get that device back from this body snatcher. He had no intention of spending the rest of his life as Plum Kitaki. That said, he couldn't just waltz in and demand his body back. There wasn't much he could do with Plum's hefty frame to combat his old body, but perhaps intimidation could work. Although he didn't appear to have it with him right now, Apollo knew Plum typically carried a broom with a hidden blade. Perhaps he could threaten the body snatcher with that? Of course, he had no intention of actually cutting his old body, but he didn't really know how else he'd be able to get that device so he could get his body back.

Apollo guessed the broom was probably back at Kitaki Mansion. It wasn't too much of a walk over there from the office, but Apollo had a feeling it was going to feel a lot longer in Plum's body. With a heavy sigh, Apollo began to walk off, hoping the body snatcher wouldn't leave with his body before he could get back.
1253122112111221122.title: No

12531221122.content:
Wocky figured he would apologize to his mother for the body-theft later. Right now, he was just thrilled to get out of the house! Looking through the manor, he eventually made his way to his parent's bedroom. He crept in slowly; even if it was technically his room at the moment, he still feared getting caught in here. He managed to find his mother's make-up table however, and opted to hide the remote away in one of its many drawers. No one in the home had any particular reason to look in there, so Wocky figured it was safe.

As he closed the drawer and looked up, Wocky caught a glance of his new reflection in the mirror. His face was wide, his lips large, and his hair graying. It fully sunk in that he was in a new body; he was effectively a different person. He brushed some hair out of his face and gave a broad grin. 'And it ain't gonna stop here. I'm going to have a lot of fun with this.'

With the device sequestered away, Wocky walked out of the room and down the stairs with a confident stride. He wasn't confined to his recovering body anymore, now he was someone with some authority! When Plum talked, people listened.

As he stepped out the front door, Wocky was glad to feel the sun again. Wocky’s first impulse was to go find some people to hang with. He’d been cooped up for a while and it’d been some time since he last had visitors; some friends they all were! He could maybe give them a piece of his mind for abandoning him while he was recovering. Otherwise, he could just go grab a bite to eat; there wasn't a lot of good food he could eat while recovering. That noodle guy should be close by, right? As Plum's sandals hit the street, Wocky decided to...
12531221122.title: He leaves it behind

125312212.content:
Wocky wanted to get some air and move around a bit, so he floated out of the house and across the street to People Park. The last time he'd gone to the park, he ended up being tried for a murder, but he figured that his luck was turning around with this device. 'After all, won't be Wocky walkin' 'round the park,' he thought to himself.

Floating outside, Wocky noted that the sun would feel great if he actually had skin. Eager to get some air, he began to scan the field for some potential candidates. His eyes were drawn to what seemed to be a crowd assembling around a small stage, people clapping and cheering.

"And for my last trick!" a voice shouted, "I'm going to saw my assistant in half!"

The voice was familiar. Floating over, Wocky caught sight of who it belonged to. It was Trucy, that girl who kept following his lawyer around. He had taken to calling her 'Shorty' while they were acting as his defense though. Speaking of his lawyer, he caught sight of the guy looking resigned as he climbed into a big, wheeled box. Wocky guessed that when there were no cases to solve, he was her assistant.

People oo'ed and awe'd as the girl took the saw through the box. Apollo, for his part, seemed anxious about the whole thing. Wocky supposed it was a neat trick, but it was hard to be amazed by anything she was doing while he had this in his hands. Either of them could make acceptable targets, if only for the fact that Wocky actually knew their names.

Looking over the crowd, he managed to catch a few more faces he recognized from his court trial. One in particular was the lady who served as the detective, clad in a white coat with those weird red glasses over her forehead. She seemed to be off duty, clapping politely along with the crowd. Wocky would have laughed if he had a voice; the idea of him possessing a cop was hilarious. The irony of it was hard to pass up; not to mention, she was pretty attractive in her own right. The fact that she didn't seem to be with anyone helped as well.

Who did Wocky ultimately settle on?
125312212.title: Go to people park

Shorty on the other hand is a pretty cool gal. The only problem is that she is a girl. Or is that a problem? ;)
1253122121.title: Trucy or Apollo

1253122122.content:
The situation was too tempting for Wocky to resist, He flew toward the detective lady and went into her body. Everything went black for a second, but when he came to he was standing where the detective lady was. He looked down at himself and saw that it had worked. He was in her body!

Everything felt different. He felt her long hair touching the back and the completely different proportions of her body. There was a purse on his shoulder, he wouldn't be caught dead with a purse if he was in his own body. He felt the pink glasses on top of his head. In his hand he felt the remote, it must have came with him when he used the possession button. He put it in the purse that was now on his shoulder.

As Trucy finished her show she ran up to Wocky. "Thanks again for coming to my show Ema! I told you I could get Polly into the box if pestered enough!" She said with a tip of her hat.

Wocky was thankful that Trucy came to talk to him, it gave him a chance to figure out the Ema's name. "Tru dat, Shorty. Next time ya put Attorney-man in a box, make sure I'm around to see." He said. He new nothing about Ema, so he didn't even attempt to act anything like her.

Trucy was taken aback at 'Ema's' strange behavior and way of speaking. "Are you okay Ema? You're acting a bit...different." She asked

"Nah, nothin' wrong with me. Same as I've always been…You know what I’m saying?" He said.

"Um, no." Trucy said. "But it you say you're okay, who am I to question it?"

Trucy and Wocky's conversation was cut short as Apollo yelled for Trucy. "Oh yeah, I forgot to take Polly out of the box. See you later Ema!" Trucy said with a wave as she left.

Wocky stood around for a few seconds wondering what to do now. He couldn't go back to his home right, since he wasn't himself right now. He could go to Ema's home, she probably had her address written down somewhere in her purse. Alternatively, he could stay at people park for now. Not much to do here, but Trucy and Apollo were here, so he may be able to find something to do with them.
1253122122.title: Ema Skye

12531221221.content:
Wocky figured he'd take the chance to split. Shorty was fun and all, but he was willing to bet that his lawyer would bring down the mood the moment he got out of that box. Apollo helped him get out of a jam, but Wocky didn't like attorneys as a rule. They're all sticks in the mud! Not to mention they're all a bit too keen on following the law.

Excited at the prospect of going on an excursion, he opted to go to the parking lot to track down Ema's car. To his disappointment, however, Ema's vehicle was actually pretty standard. He had been hoping for a cop car, but he guessed that it would be silly for a detective to drive a police vehicle while technically off-duty. He had been wanting to blare the sirens...

A quick shuffle through Ema's purse revealed her car keys, in addition to her police badge and her driver's license. "Sweet! All pretty useful," he said as he climbed into the driver's seat, ready to take Ema's car for a joyride. Another upside: no one could charge him for taking this lady's car if he was her!

Well, until they passed a law against body theft.
---

A short drive later, Wocky found himself in Ema's home. It was modest, but still decent. He guessed she must be paid a fair wage by the size of the apartment. It was brightly colored, but rather messy. Ema had little nick-knacks ornamenting the main living area, and bags of weird powders and liquids were strewn about her kitchen. A brief smell of it was enough for Wocky to realize they weren't for cooking. He didn't recognize most of their labels, but their names sounded like something out of a lab.

"Weren't for the badge I'd think she was a scientist," Wocky said to himself as he looked down at the white labcoat she had on. Her whole getup was starting to bother him the more he thought about it. "About as tight as she probably is..."

Absently, Wocky tossed off the labcoat and the tie that Ema was wearing, leaving them on a couch with her purse. He began to remove the vest too as he entered the door to what appeared to be her bedroom. Looking in a mirror, he began to examine Ema's face, wowed by his new form. "Damn, she looks fiiine," he muttered, laughing at the sound of his voice. "Could get used to this I guess," he said as he crossed his arms. By this point, he was wearing her button up and slacks, and his attention went down to her feet.

"Could take or leave the shoes though," he said aloud as he kicked off Ema's heels, breathing a sigh of relief. He didn't realize how much they were bugging him until they were gone. It was surprising he had managed to go for so long without getting rid of them; might've just been the wonder of the remote distracting him.

Looking in the mirror, Wocky couldn't help but think that Ema's look was overall just too plain and uptight. "I bet I could make a G outta her," he announced as he fiddled with her hair. He didn't regard her privacy much at all as he began to rifle through her wardrobe, looking for something more his speed to wear. He had to be true to himself even when he was someone else, after all.
12531221221.title: Go to Ema's place

Wocky looked through Ema's closet trying to find clothes that were more his style. Ema's clothes were generally plain, but he soon found some clothes that he could wear.

choices: Wocky waits for a moment to separate from Klavier at the concert hall
Wocky uses the remote to get away
1253122122111.content:
Knock Knock

"Huh?" Wocky asked as his head turned away from the mirror, hearing a knock from the other room "The hell could that be?" Ema had only been at the park like, a half hour ago before Wocky took her over. Was she really expecting visitors so soon?

Somewhat frustrated, Wocky left Ema's bedroom and made his way to the front door. He looked through the peephole and saw yet another familiar face: that blonde pretty-boy from the trial. The prosecutor! Wocky remembered now - the guy was some sort of pop star/attorney combo or something like that. It sounded a bit wild, and honestly lame at the same time.

"You ignorin' me in their Fraulein?" the voice called from behind the door? "C'mon! You said you'd go, right? Don't back out on me."

'Oh gross,please don't let this guy be her boyfriend,' Wocky prayed.

"It's going to be the last concert the Gavinners do as a band," Klavier continued, "I wouldn't want a friend to miss it, even one with a temper like yours."

That calmed Wocky's fears a little bit. Looking down at himself, he supposed he had inadvertently dressed Ema in more concert appropriate attire anyways. With a sigh, he called out, "yeah yeah jus' a sec man." He unlocked the door and opened it up to face Klavier, who seemed surprised.

"Well Fraulein Detective, you certainly look different off duty," Klavier said with a thumbs up as he looked Wocky's new outfit over. "Didn't think you had a fun bone in your body. Heck, you're even wearing one of those silly mascots shirts."

Wocky leaned Ema's head back and spoke a bit disdainfully, "what of it? Can't dress however I like?"

Klavier just laughed in response. "Nah, I think the look suits you. Now c'mon, let me give you a ride." For some reason, Klavier's approval was making Wocky uncomfortable. He guessed that he didn't have any real plans to follow through in this body though, and reluctantly followed the prosecutor out to his car. Luckily enough, his hostility was apparently the norm for this woman.

---

After what felt like ages, the two arrived at the concert hall, and Wocky couldn't be more grateful. He swung his feet off the dashboard and immediately jumped out the vehicle after it was parked. This guy was bad enough when he was trying to put Wocky in prison; he was worse when trying to be Wocky's friend! He babbled away the whole car ride about music and other topics Wocky didn't care about. Wocky was now sure he wasn't Ema's boyfriend, but he felt Klavier was getting a bit too flirty during that car ride. He might've been using a girl's body, but he didn't care to have a guy ask him out.

"Hey, wait up there!" Klavier called as he walked to catch up with Wocky. "I got the passes, you need them to get backstage," he continued as he pulled a small ID card from his pocket for Wocky to use. "Now follow me, I know where to go," he said confidently with a snap of his fingers as he pointed towards the path.

As he put the pass away in Ema's purse, it suddenly occurred to Wocky that he didn't have to put up with this guy to enjoy the concert. He had the pass now, so he could just go where-ever! Not to mention, he had the remote. If he wanted, he could just leave Ema's body and go for a different target. He'd started to acclimate a bit after changing around her outfit, but he was sure there were better candidates anyways. He could also just mess with Klavier and use the remote on him directly. It didn't particularly matter which, so long as he got the pretty boy out of his hair.

Wocky decided to pick a new look so ge headed to Ema's closer to pick out some fitting clothes.
