12531221222.content:
Wocky had no idea what he'd do on his own as this lady, so he hovered around the park as Trucy and Apollo cleaned up the stage. It took Trucy a minute or so just to get Apollo out of the box, much to the lawyer's frustration and Wocky's amusement. That guy had helped him out of a tight spot, but Wocky couldn't help but laugh at him from Ema's body. Lawyer's were uptight! He needed some levity.

Eventually the two had everything taken down and put away. "Hey Ema, you mind helping us carry these back to the office?" Apollo asked as he wheeled away the box he had been trapped in a moment before.

"Eh? Uh, sure man," Wocky replied with Ema's voice. "What'cha need done?"

Apollo raised an eyebrow, more than a bit confused by Ema's tone, but pushed it aside. "Uh, well, there's a crate full of props over there," he said, gesturing to the steps leading up to the stage. "If you can grab those for us, we won't need to make a second trip."

"Right right, whateva," Wocky said as he headed over to the box, heaving it up with Ema's arms. It wasn't a particularly heavy object, but if he were in his real body right now he bet he would barely be able to carry it all the way back to his room let alone some office. It felt good to do something physical! "Lead the way G!" he called to Apollo as he followed behind.

---

A short walk later, the three of them ended up at the Wright Anything Agency. Wocky had never been here before, despite being a client. His former fiance had hired his lawyer for him, in fact. He was examining the messy place with curiosity, placing the box in the center of the room without much care. He was surprised that someplace like this would be a law firm.

"Something wrong Ema?" Trucy asked, "this shouldn't be the first time you've been here!"

Wocky turned his head back at them, Ema's hair flicking over her shoulder, "yeah yeah its coo'. Just, uh, looking at your props and all."

"You sure you're feeling fine, Ema?" Apollo asked. "You're... speaking strangely. Something up?"

Apollo raised Ema's arms up defensively. "Yo! I'm fine, now step off, for real. I don't 'preciate you guys gettin' up in my grill. So, what're we going to do now that the stuff's all packed off?"

"Well," Apollo mumbled as he ran his hands through his hair taken aback, "we were about to head over to the Borscht Bowl for a bite to eat."

Trucy raised up a hand in excitement, "Daddy's playing piano there tonight! We figured we'd visit him. You're welcome to come along."

"Sure thing," Wocky replied, glad to get the chance to go eating somewhere other than the home. He let Apollo and Trucy lead the way out of the agency as he thought over his plan of action. He could keep accompanying these two, lying low so that he could keep using this lady's body - maybe have some fun later as a cop- or he could have some fun now with the remote. These two were getting all over his case about acting strangely, how about he use the device on them to see how they like it? He didn't even have to reveal who he was if he did, he could just switch them around and play dumb about it.

Which did he decide to do?
12531221222.title: Stay at people park

choices: They get to Borsht Bowl uninterupted
They get interrupted along the way
125312212222.content:
Annoyed with how they kept asking him why he was acting so different, Wocky got the remote from Ema's purse and aimed it at Apollo and Trucy. He clicked the aware swap button at each of them. In an instant both of them stumbled where they stood. It took them a moment to notice what happened. Once they did they looked down at themselves and then each other in silence. It was obvious that the swapped had worked.

"Yo! You two okay?" Wocky said, pretending that he didn't know what was going on.

After staring at each other in utter shock for a few more seconds Apollo in Trucy's body spoke up "Um, Ema, me and Tru-Apollo forgot something at the office. Can you wait here for a minute?" He said as he began to pull Trucy in his body by the arm to the office. Leaving Wocky alone in the hallway

As they went into the office, Wocky couldn't help laughing. He had a feeling that tonight was going to be pretty interesting.

-----

Inside the office Apollo and Trucy were freaking out. "What happened Polly!?!" Trucy yelled at him. She was feeling around herself, shocked to have a male body.

Apollo was acting similarly "I have no idea!" He said, equally shocked. What could have possibly have made him swap bodies with Trucy? He had heard that Mr. Wright had worked with ghosts or something like that, maybe that was the cause? As much as he wanted to swap back he had no idea how to.

As they kept thinking about the situation, five minutes passed. "Ema's still waiting for us in the hall." Trucy said. "Should we tell her what happened?"

Apollo thought about it for a few seconds, then he shook his head no "Would she even believe us if we told her? Let's just continue the day as normal as we can, acting like each other, then ask Mr. Wright for help when we get back, okay?"

Trucy didn't particularly like the idea, but she didn't exactly have any choice. "Fine, hopefully daddy can help us." Trucy said with a sigh.

They went back to the hallway where Wocky in Ema's body was waiting for them. "Yo! What took ya' so long. I'm hungry!" He said impaitently. This was going to be a long day
125312212222.title: Use the Remote on Apollo and Trucy along the way

choices: "Go back up and ask 'Ema' some questions."
"Call up an old friend of mine."
1253122122221.content:
Thankfully, the possessed Ema and an uncomfortable Trucy and Apollo made it to the Borscht Bowl without being impeded. Wocky found himself snickering the whole way at how awkward the two were acting in eachother's bodies. Trucy was walking as stiff as a board, as though every movement was creeping her out. Apollo, for his part, kept pulling at the hem of Trucy's skirt, feeling excessively exposed with his legs to the wind. Wocky wasn't in a huge place to critique their acting, as he wasn't behaving like Ema at all, but they were far too distracted to notice Ema's strange behavior anymore.

The switched up trio got a few odd looks from the waiter as they were sat at a table. Wocky was tripping up on Ema's heels, Trucy kept fidgeting about with Apollo's hair, and Apollo himself struggled to straighten out Trucy's dress as he sat down in his chair. Wocky looked up to the stage and eventually managed to catch a glance at another familiar face; that scruffy guy who seemed to hang around Apollo. Was that his boss? He was dressed in a hoodie and a loos cap; hardly seemed like something a lawyer would wear. 'Why couldn't I get that guy? Seems more laid back.'

Mr. Wright's piano playing was, however, mediocre at best. Wocky did his best to ignore it, and instead focused on his menu. Trucy and Apollo didn't even give theirs a glance, and instead waited intently for Wright to finish his 'performance'. The moment the piano stopped playing, they got up from their seats and made their way to the stage, leaving 'Ema' behind at the table.

" 'Grape juice' huh...." Wocky muttered to himself as he continued to flip through the menu.

---

Trucy and Apollo reached the stage just as Phoenix was stepping down to greet them.

"Hey there! You two come to visit?" Phoenix asked with a grin as he approached. "Its a pleasant surprise either way."

"Mr. Wright, can we talk in another room? This is important," Apollo said in a low breath.

"Mr. Wright? Why are you talking to me like I'm your boss sweety?" Phoenix asked confused at who he thought was his daughter.

"Uh, sorry, 'Daddy'," Apollo recovered, "but we need somewhere private to talk."

Phoenix looked to 'Apollo' who silently nodded in agreement with 'Trucy'. Phoenix shrugged, "alright then, follow me. Move quickly though," he said as he led them down to one of the Borscht Bowl's secret room.

---

"Ma'am are you sure that you need another drink?" The waiter asked as 'Detective Skye' ordered another bottle of grape juice.

"Yo! I don't come into your crib to tell you how to live yo' life!" Wocky shot back. "Now bring me my order!"

"Yes yes, right away," the waiter replied, not willing to escalate the encounter.

Wocky grinned as the man scurried off. It was nice being back on the town, even if he wasn't himself. Getting to throw some weight around as this cop lady was fun! Ema herself probably wouldn't be all that pleased with Wocky's behavior, but that was partially why Wocky took her body in the first place.

"Where'd Shorty and Law-man run off to anyways? Was fun watching them freak out..."

---

"You're saying you switched bodies?" Phoenix asked, his tone becoming more serious.

"Yes!" Trucy-as-Apollo exclaimed. "You believe us, right?"

Phoenix thought about it, "I've seen a lot of crazy things in my day. It'd be hypocritical to not give you two the benefit of doubt."

"But do you know what might be causing it!?" Apollo asked loudly. "What if there's a case? Trucy doesn't have a law degree! And I can't saw people in half!"

Phoenix covered his ears at that. "Okay, I definitely believe you guys now. Only Apollo would yell like that. I suppose I have two ideas..." Phoenix said.

"What are they, daddy?" Trucy asked, sounding very strange from Apollo's body.

"I think we should..."
1253122122221.title: They get to Borsht Bowl uninterupted

12531221222211.content:
"I think we should go up and ask 'Ema' some questions." Phoenix said, with a small smile on his face. He seemed to figure out the whole thing

"Ask Ema? Why, would she know something about this?" Apollo asked confused.

"Didn't you notice? I only saw her out of the corner of my eye while I was playing piano, and even I could tell." Phoenix vaguely gave Apollo hints.

"What do you-" Apollo began to ask, but then he thought about everything that happened before he and Trucy were switched. More specifically, how Ema was acting "Ema's not Ema right now." He deduced

Phoenix's smile got bigger. "Nice work, you were only the last one to figure it out." Phoenix congratulated/insulted Apollo.

"Uh, thanks, I guess." Apollo said, unsure how to feel.

"C'mon you two! We need to go back up and ask whoever that is about this!" Trucy said, wanting to get out of Apollo's body as soon as possible

----
Upstairs Wocky was having yet another bottle of grape juice as he saw Apollo, Trucy, and Phoenix approaching. "What took ya so long?!" He said rather impatiently.

Apollo in Trucy's body sat at the table and glared at Wocky. "Who are you?" He asked.

A bit nervous, Wocky answered the best he could. "Whatcha talkin' about Shorty?"

Apollo took note of the word shorty, there was one person he knew that called Trucy 'Shorty'. "I think you know what I'm 'talkin' about, Wocky." He said.

Wocky was panicking, somehow Apollo and the others figured him out. There was only two things he could do now. He could tell them about the truth and explain what happened, but he didn't know if it was smart to let them in on it, they might ruin his fun. The other option was to use the remote and leave Ema's body before they questioned him more, but he wasn't sure if he wanted to do that either. He was barley in Ema's body for more than an hour, he wanted to be in it for a little longer. Plus, he wasn't sure if he could get the remote out of Ema's purse and hit the possession button without them noticing.

Apollo and Trucy were staring at him impatiently. Having barely anytime Wocky decided to...
12531221222211.title: "Go back up and ask 'Ema' some ques...

125312212222112.content:
Wocky wasn't really in the mood for sharing his device. He just wanted to get out of dodge fast. "Look, all y'all need to calm down," he said, pulling up a hand defensively. "I dunno what any of you are talkin' 'bout. It's me, Ema!" While speaking, he snuck a hand into Ema's purse, slowly reaching for the remote.

"Yeah and I'm Trucy," Apollo replied (still in Trucy's body), "explain yourself and fix this! I can tell you're lying." Apollo stepped forward towards Wocky-in-Ema, and in a flash Wocky pulled his hand out of the purse, flourishing the device.

"Stop her!" Trucy shouted, jumping forwards to grab the device. Mr. Wright and Apollo joined in, clamping their grips over Wocky's hand.

"What is that?" Phoenix shouted through gritted teeth, trying to tear away the device.

"None of your business!" Wocky grunted back, pushing away at the other two as he tried to wrench the device towards himself. In the frenzy, he finally managed to free his thumb and put it over the possession button. However, with all four of them trying to pull away the device, his aim was hectic and off kilter. Who ended up getting hit by the possession function (and as a result taking the remote)?
125312212222112.title: Use the remote to escape

12531221222211211.content:
Thankfully for Wocky, despite all four of them struggling for the remote, he ended be the one that the remote was pointing to when the Possession button was pressed. In an instant he was once again floating above everyone in a ghost like form. Leaving a rather confused Ema below him. Just like before, the remote seemed to follow him when he used the possession button.

"Where'd the remote go?!" Trucy in Apollo body shouted and began searching the floor, trying to see i maybe they all dropped the remote and none of them noticed.

Apollo in Trucy's body looked sternly at who he thought wasn't Ema "Don't move an inch"

Wocky couldn't help but laugh, could ghosts laugh? Not that the answer to that mattered since no one heard him anyway. He wondered what to do now. Although He knew one thing he definatley wouldn't be doing, switching back Apollo and Trucy. He, probably, would have swapped them back sooner or later, but after they ruined his fun as Ema, there was no way he would swap them back.

The safest thing to do would be to fly out of the Borscht Bowl and possess some random passerby, hat way neither Apollo or Trucy could follow him and get the remote back. Of course, while that was the safest thing to do, there was a funner, riskier, option. He could Posses either Apollo, Trucy, or that third man who was with them and watch the chaos of them not knowing what to do.

"C'mon, it has to be around here somewhere!" Trucy said, panicking over the fact that none of them could find even a trace of the remote.

"What's going on?" A confused Ema asked "How did I get here?" Her question fell on deaf ears as the other three were too busy searching for the remote to listen to her.

Wocky thought over his choices once again and decided to....
12531221222211211.title: Wocky

12531221222211212.content:
As everyone struggled for the remote, Wocky managed to press the possession button however, to his surprise, he did not become a ghost again. Not only that, but the remote had vanished! "Where'd it go?!" He shouted. Being in Ema's body for a while was fun, but being stuck in it because the remote was gone was not something he even wanted to think about.

Likewise, Apollo and Trucy were both freaking out. It didn't take a genius to figure out that the remote was what had swapped them. All three of them searched the table and the floor around it to make sure that they didn't drop it during their struggle. None of them took notice to the fact that Phoenix's body looked at them strangely and had walked away.

Meanwhile above them, Phoenix was freaking out. Somehow he had become some kind of ghost and his own body had just walked away without him. After calming down he thought the situation through. He figured that Wocky in Ema's body must have planned to use this to escape. He probably used this to get into Ema's body in the first place.

Looking at the mis-bodied trio below him looking for the remote. Where did it go? He was sure that he was holding it when he and the other were struggling for it, how did it vanish? Deciding to help them search for it he flew toward his own body and was about to repossess it, but he hesitated. If he just went back to his own body for now and helped look for the remote and ended up finding it, then they would just end up in the same struggle for the remote again. He thought, unaware that the remote would appear with him when he possessed a body

It was then that he got an idea, he could possess someone else while helping look for the remote. If he was someone else and Trucy and Apollo convinced his old body to help look for the remote along with them, then that may turn the tables if they ended up in another struggle with Wocky.

Looking around the room, Phoenix saw there was really only one person that he could really possess right now. Olga Orly, who had taken a job at the Borscht Bowl after being a witness at his trial. While possessing her would help him with his plan, it did seem like a breach of her privacy. Maybe he should just go and possess his own body.

After thinking it over for a second he decided to possess...
12531221222211212.title: Phoenix

125312212222112122.content:
Thinking quickly, Phoenix settled on possessing Olga. It would give him an element of surprise over Wocky and might also help him get some control over the situation since Olga was an employee. Patrons were staring at the 4 others struggling and fighting amongst themselves, and Phoenix worried that Olga would go look for a manager or something if he left her to her devices.

'She owes me one anyways,' Phoenix reason, recalling the poker game she tried to rig. He pushed himself towards her body as she watched the scuffle, causing her to shudder as his consciousness took over.

What happened as he took Olga's body surprised Phoenix... other than being a woman. As he took stock of her body, nearly tripping on her heels, he realized that Wocky's device was now in his hands! Had it left his body with him? However it happened, this dramatically simplified things.

"You three!" he called out to Wocky, Trucy, and Apollo, "why don't you come with me." He held up the remote, making it clear to them where it was. All of them seemed simultaneously surprised and worried to see the remote in Olga's hands.

"Ms. Orly," Apollo began cautiously from Trucy's body, "we - we need that, please just hand it over to me."

"Yo! Hell naw, give it to me," Wocky asserted from inside Ema, pushing Apollo aside. He approached Phoenix aggressively, only stopping once Phoenix pointed the remote at him.

"How about not," Phoenix replied coldly, "like I said, you three follow me."

---

"Mr. Wright?! That's you?" Apollo exclaimed, surprised as 'Olga' explained what happened to the three of them now that they were all back in the bar's basement room.

"That's... right," Phoenix replied. "Somehow the device was used on me, and I got thrown out of my body. I ended up taking over Olga's," he gestured downwards towards his current form. "My own body seems to be acting almost deliberately ignorant of all this, so I guess we're all displaced."

The three of them managed to subdue Wocky-in-Ema, tying her down to a chair at the poker table. Thankfully, there were all sorts of props left around the room for ambiance, a big coil of rope being one of them. "Yo! This is whack, let me out!"

Phoenix shot Wocky a glare, "We know its you in there now, Wocky. I've already used the device."

Wocky turned his head away with a scowl. However, his face went a bit smug as he kept on talking, "well so what? What are you going to do about it now?"

"What do you mean 'What are we going to do about it?', we have your remote thing!" Trucy shot back. "We'll just push you out of her body!"

However, a grim look overtook Phoenix's borrowed face as he considered Wocky's words. "It might not be that simple, Trucy," he replied.

"Why not Mr. Wright?" Apollo asked, feeling a bit weird addressing a con woman as his boss.

"If he used the same function as me," Phoenix explained, "then all we could do to him is send him out of Ema. But we can't control where he'd go after that - he could take over one of us or someone else entirely."

Apollo seemed frustrated, "well, what do we do then?! We can't just leave him there."

"First off, we should fix the two of you," Phoenix replied as he turned to the swapped Trucy and Apollo. "I'd prefer my daughter and my protege separate after all," he said with a wry smile as he looked over the remote. He found a function labeled 'aware swap', and used it on Apollo and then Trucy. The two of their faces went blank for a moment, but when they collected their senses, they both breathed a sigh of relief to be back to normal.

"Now," Phoenix continued, "I get the feeling that Wocky here didn't intend to stay as Ema."

"Well, I won't leave until I get that thing back!" he shot back defiantly, struggling with Ema's arms.

Apollo moved back to hold him down while Phoenix thought over the situation, idly rubbing the back of his neck. "Actually Wocky, I think we could outlast you."

"Huh?" Both Apollo and Wocky replied at the same time. "Mr. Wright, you aren't just going to let him stay in her body, are you? He can't be trusted!"

Phoenix nodded, "no, we just give him some of his own treatment. The device makes your body operate without you in it, so one of us could use it to take over Ema's body while he's still in it. It's not a great solution, but I'm sure she'd prefer one us in her body compared to him walking around with it. I'm sure after a few missing days - maybe weeks! - Wocky'll crack. If not, well, we'll have time to come up with a new solution."

"Woah wait!" Wocky shouted with Ema's voice, "that ain't cool at all! You can't do that!"

"Then you should probably get to talking about the device and how it works!" Trucy bumped in, "unless you want to be stuck in there! Why'd you even take over Ema's body? What did she do to you?"

Wocky gritted Ema's teeth for a second. In all reality, he didn't care that much for Ema's body, but he was often defiant for the sake of it. If he backed down now, they'd probably find a way to put him back to normal, and he might never get the remote back. Not to mention, he'd seem weak! The idea of getting possessed and essentially being a prisoner in Ema's body was almost enough to make him consider giving up though. They had to be bluffing though - they wouldn't really do that... right?

Ultimately Wocky...
125312212222112122.title: Olga Orly

1253122122221121221.content:
Wocky tried to remain defiant and quiet for a while, but the longer he remained quiet, the more serious they seemed about possessing him for days, maybe even longer. "'lright! I'll spill!" He yelled at them.

Phoenix put the remote into Olga's pocket. "Good. First, tell us where you found this remote and what you've done with it so far. Don't leave anything out or we might use this on you just for the fun of it." Phoenix demanded.

Wocky went on to explain to them about how the remote was delivered to his house out of nowhere, that he used it to leave the house because his body was recovering from surgery, and that the only things that he had done with the remote were possess Ema and swap Apollo and Trucy. He also told them all about the remote's buttons and what each of them did.

After listening to his story, Apollo couldn't help but feel some sympathy for Wocky's situation. He was very lucky to even get the bullet removed and he couldn't even enjoy that. However, that didn't give him any right to take Ema's body. Who knows how long he would have stayed in it if Mr. Wright hadn't figured out he had taken her body.

Apollo's thoughts were interrupted as Trucy spoke up. "What do we do now, Daddy? How are we going to get Wocky out of Ema's body?" She asked Phoenix.

"Well, there's the problem. From what I understand the only way to control who Wocky would possess if we used the possession button on him is his own choice of who to possess." Phoenix explained, trying to think up a way around this.

"Dat's right and I ain't goin' back to bein' me til I'm I want to!" Wocky said smuggly, although his smugness had less effect due to him being tied to a chair.

Phoenix, Apollo, and Trucy all tried to think of what to do. There was no way they could convince Wocky to go back to his own body with because of it's current state, but they couldn't let him stay in Ema's body. With how he was acting as her, it was only a matter of time before he ruined her career as a police officer.

After a few minutes of silence, Trucy spoke up with an idea. "Maybe we could compromise?" She began to say, getting a curious looks from Phoenix, Apollo, and Wocky. "Wocky can't stay in Ema's body, so we could just have him leave it and possess someone else. Someone we can keep an eye on to make sure he dosen't ruin their reputation."

While the idea wasn't exactly the best possible scenario for them, Phoenix and Apollo couldn't think of any other idea. "But who should we let him possess? We can't have him take of the body of anyone we know, we wouldn't be able to keep our eye on him then." Apollo said.

"Well, that leaves one of us." Phoenix said. "One of us could give up our body for Wocky to possess." He turned to Wocky. "That sound good to you?"

Wocky clenched his teeth, knowing he didn't have any real say in the matter. "Fine, I'll be one of you."

"Good. Now just sit there while we decide which of us you'll possess. Also, don't think about possessing someone other than us, we still have the remote and we know that you don't want to lose it." Phoenix told him.

"Wait, Mr. Wright," Apollo interrupted Phoenix "Were you serious about Possessing Wocky for weeks earlier?" He asked concerned.

Phoenix put a smile on Olga's face. "If there's one thing I've learned in my seven years of poker playing, it's that whoever has the best bluff, wins the game." He said with confidence "Now there's the important question, who's body should we let Wocky take?"

After thinking it over for a while, one of the three of them volunteered themselves, who was it?
1253122122221121221.title: Gave up the information

12531221222211212212.content:
After a pause with the three huddled together, Trucy reluctantly spoke up. "i'll do it," she said. "Wocky can use my body for now."

Phoenix seemed surprised by this, "are you sure Trucy? We can probaby still convince Apollo to offer himself up."

"Hey!" Apollo shouted, irritated by the remark.

Trucy shook her head, "Polly has an important job to do, daddy. Who knows when a case will come up! Not to mention, you're too busy getting back into legal stuff to let him take a vacation in your body. I don't have to be on call like you two, and you can more easily stop him from getting out of hand in my body as well."

Phoenix held a frown over Olga's face, but nodded. "I guess it makes sense, Trucy. Don't worry, Apollo and I will keep a close eye on him."

They turned to Wocky who was waiting expectantly. "Alright Wocky, we've decided. You can use my body so long as you leave Ema."

Wocky's eyes lit up, "really Shorty? You'd do that for me?"

"Not so much for you as for Ema," she retorted. "But sure, however you want to look at it. Go ahead and untie him Apollo."

---

A short period of time later, a confused Ema was walking out of the Borscht Bowl, not sure how she arrived there. Olga Orly similarly woke up, apparently having dozed off for a few minutes. She was a bit startled by it all, but quickly got back to work when she noticed the time.

Both of them were back to normal, but now there was a new thing different. "Yo Attorney Man, you really got to be tailin' me all the way back home?" 'Trucy' asked, annoyed while a disturbed looking Apollo followed behind. They were a few blocks from the Borsht Bowl now, having left Phoenix behind while Apollo showed Wocky the way to Phoenix and Trucy's home.

"Mr. Wright wouldn't exactly like it if I let a stranger run off with his daughter's body," Apollo replied dryly. "Besides, 'Trucy', you're only 16. You shouldn't be walking home alone."

Wocky replied with a grunt, pulling his arms behind his head as he kept on walking, knocking Trucy's hat to the side. "You're no fun at all, lawyer."

"It's Apollo, now hurry it up, it'll be dark soon."

---

Meanwhile, back at the Borscht Bowl, Phoenix was staying behind to help out Olga, feeling a bit sorry for taking that time from her. He was stacking up chairs and putting away dishes as they closed up for the night. The remote was still safely in his pocket.

"I, uh, appreciate it, Mr. Wright," she said, a bit uncomfortable around Phoenix due to their brief past. "I'm not really sure what happened back there - I've never blacked out like that before."

"Don't worry about it," Phoenix said, "these things happen. You're okay and nothing was broken, so its fine, right?"

"Yeah I guess so. You have a good night, I guess," Olga said as the two parted ways.

With Olga out of sight, Phoenix turned his attention back to the remote. He had opted to help Olga so that he'd have an excuse to split off from the two of them. Trucy's body would keep him occupied, and Apollo could keep him under control. He could now use the moment alone to figure out how to use the remote and investigate its functions without Wocky trying to potentially sabotage him. "I guess the best place to look would be Kitaki manor," he muttered to himself as he thumbed through the buttons. "There could be more information he's not telling us. Maybe there's a function that's not obvious on the device... I have to look to be sure."
12531221222211212212.title: Trucy

125312212222112122121.content:
Eventually Apollo and 'Trucy' made there way to the Wright residence, an apartment not far off from the office. Apollo suppose the two didn't need a whole lot of living space since they spent so much time at the office anyways. It was essentially just a kitchen and two bedrooms. The walls of the kitchen area were a rather bland off-white, without much in the way of decoration at all. It seemed rather tidy as well. Apollo was sort of surprised, given the way they treated the agency.

'I guess that place really is home to them,' he thought idly as he looked around for any personal touches either of them might've put down. He would've thought he got the wrong apartment if Mr. Wright hadn't given him the keys to the place. His focus, however, was cut off as he heard a door shut along with a click.

'Uh oh,' he though as he walked down to the bedroom door. He tried to turn the knob only to find it locked. "Wocky, what are you doing in there?" he asked.

"Just relaxin' in my room, take a chill," Wocky shot back from the other side in Trucy's voice. "What'cha still doin' here anyways? You got your own place to be."

"Mr. Wright, you 'father', told me to watch you," Apollo replied. "Come one out and wait in the living area for him to get back."

"Nah!" Wocky said, "I'll wait here instead. You can run along."

Apollo was still shouting something at him from the other side of the door, but Wocky tuned him out. Trucy's bedroom was a bit less barren than the rest of the apartment. The walls were colored now - mostly pink - with a few posters here and there. Some of them seemed recent - one of them was for a band called the 'Gaviners' and even had a signature on it. Others seemed more vintage, mostly focusing on some old circus troupe or something called the 'Gramaryes'.

'Shorty must be a big fan, she dresses just like them,' he thought to himself, looking down at the big cloak Trucy wore over her shoulders. It was beginning to annoy him, so he lifted it up and threw it on the bed along with the hat, surprised to hear a thud as it landed.

"The heck?" he looked through the cloak to find was seemed to be a wooden figure in the shape of a person...wearing its own cloak. "Why on earth... how does she even wear that all the time? Shorty's definitely dedicated if nothin' else..."

Wocky shook his head, turning over to the mirror. He couldn't believe he was wearing a dress, bu he supposed he would have to settle for whatever body they gave him while they had the remote. Without the cloak, it was clear that Trucy's dress lacked shoulder straps, and stopped just past the knees. "Ha! Without the magician stuff on, Shorty looks like she could be ready to party," he said as he threw off her gloves too. He spun around to get a view of the dress from behind; other than the diamond studs, it was pretty normal overall. "Wonder if there's anywhere around town a 'girl' can have some fun..." he muttered, beginning to feel the boredom of this place set in.

Not to mention, Apollo's knocking on the door was getting harder to ignore. Couldn't that guy lighten up? Wocky was willing to bet that Apollo would lighten up if he also used the remote, but it'd be hard to talk him into it. The guy seemed way too stressed out! Was really a buzzkill. With a mischievous look, Wocky moved over to the window, looking down at the street below. The sidewalk seemed empty, and he was only two floors up. Trucy's body seemed acrobatic, probably as a result of the tricks she'd have to perform, so Wocky was willing to bet he could get down there without hurting himself. Once he was on the town, he could have some fun! Only problem was the attorney and Shorty's dad: they still had the remote. He wasn't sure what they'd do to him if he got caught while out, but he had stalemated them before, right? He could probably just pull the same card he did when he was in Ema's body.
125312212222112122121.title: Follow Apollo and/or Wocky

choices: "... you should call up a friend."
1253122122221121221212.content:
It was tempting, but Wocky knew that the red-haired lawyer wouldn’t be all that forgiving if he ran off using Trucy’s body. The guy just never knew when to relax!
‘[i]Maybe I can do somethin’ ‘bout that…[/i]’ Wocky thought to himself. Turning away from the window, he opened Trucy’s door to see a flustered and impatient-looking Apollo on the other side. “What were you doing in there?” He asked expectantly.

“Nothing much, law man,” Wocky replied, brushing past him. “Just throwin’ off that heavy thing Shorty wears over her shoulders all day.” He made his way to the living area where he flopped himself on the couch, grabbed the remote, and turned on the TV. The pose looked very uncharacteristic of Trucy, especially with the short dress.

Apollo took a seat over by the kitchenette, since Wocky was taking up the whole couch, still holding a distrustful look on his face. “Well do it faster next time.”
“Attorney man, you need to chill,” Wocky replied, waving a hand dismissively. Suddenly, a smile came to his face as he got an idea. He lifted up his head and spoke, “hey, come to think of it, ‘Daddy’ back there gave you the remote, right?”

Apollo shook his head, “I’m not letting you use the remote Wocky.”

“Well that’s fine, I don’t need to use it right now. I’m sayin’ you should give it a go!”

“Me?” Apollo asked incredulously, “why?”

“Cause you need to lighten up! I bet a new body would help you chill out. There ain't nothing in the world like it! Shorty's body feels great – lots of energy! Not a care in the world either. Get a bod like hers and I bet you’d be seeing things my way.”

“I’m not using the remote while I have to keep an eye on you,” Apollo replied matter-of-factly.

“Oh, because Mr. Boss-Man told you to, right? Forget him! So long as you got the remote it don’t matter what he thinks. Besides, you have to be curious.”
Apollo’s eyes looked off to the left, avoiding eye contact. “Who would I even use it on? Not exactly a lot of options.”

Wocky knew he had him now. “Well, ‘Polly, I think…”
1253122122221121221212.title: Wocky stays for now

12531221222211212212121.content:
"Just go grab someone off the street and take their body! It's what I did. Easy enough, right?"

Apollo shook his head, "I can't just steal the body of a stranger like that! What would they even do?"

Wocky pulled himself off the couch and began to look around the room for a second. "Here we go! How 'bout this then?" He pulled open a small book full of phone numbers and contacts that Phoenix had built up throughout and after his legal career. Apollo recognized some of the names, but others were pretty foreign to him. "Just call up a friend, take theirs! That easy enough for you?"

"We can't just steal someone's body, Wocky!"

Wocky shrugged Trucy's shoulders, "if you use shapeshift or possession, they'll never know. Or just ask permission if you're that scared!"

Apollo was about to object again, but Wocky began to dial the number in on Trucy's phone. "Trust me, you won't regret it!"

As the phone dialed, Wocky tossed it to Apollo, who fumbled with it and put it to his ear. "Who even is this?" Apollo asked.

Wocky looked down to the name, "I dunno someone named..."
12531221222211212212121.title: "... you should call up a friend."

125312212222112122121211.content:
"I dunno, someone named Pearl." Wocky said to Apollo.

Apollo vaguely recognized the name. Pear as some who Mr. Wright had apparently worked with years ago and a friend of Trucy's, Mr. Wright described their relationship as sister-like. Apollo had seen her once or twice when she would come and visit Mr. Wright and Trucy at the office, but he wasn't exactly acquainted with her.

As the phone stopped ringing, Apollo heard a voice on the other end "Hello? Trucy? Why are you calling this late?" He heard Pearl's voice.

As much as Apollo wanted to hang up, he knew that if he did, Wocky would just call someone else a minute later. "Uh, No. This is Apollo, I work for Mr. Wright." Apollo said.

"Why are you using Trucy's phone?" Pearl asked on the other end, curious.

"Uh, Trucy isn't available right now." Apollo bluffed. "Mr. Wright said he needed help with a case, Trucy had your number, so that's why I called you using her phone. Can you come to Mr. Wright's house as soon as you can?"

"Mr. Nick needs me? I'll be there as soon as I can!" Pearl said excitedly. Before Apollo could say anything, Pearl had hung up.

Once the phone conversation ended, Wocky spoke up. "No goin' back on it now." He said with a smile. Apollo sighed and said nothing.

About an hour later, Apollo and Wocky heard a knock at the door. "Mr Nick, it's me! I heard you needed my help." They heard Pearl say from the hallway.

Apollo looked at the remote. He knew Wocky wouldn't be quiet about it if he didn't use it, plus he had already gone through the trouble of calling Pearl here, He eyed the buttons and wondered which one to use. After a few seconds of thought he decided to use...
125312212222112122121211.title: Pearl

12531221222211212212121121.content:
Deciding that he neither wanted to go through the trouble of explaining the remote to Pearl or disappoint her by telling her that Mr. Wright actually didn't need her right now Apollo pointed the remote at himself and clicked the possession button. In an instant he found himself in some kind of strange ghost form. Although Wocky had explained earlier how the remote had worked, this was Apollo's first time using it for himself. His wonder at the situation was cut short when he heard Pearl once again knock at the door "Hello? Mr. Nick? Are you home?" He heard her asked. He flew through the door, ready to possess her.

Pearl began to knock again, but her knock was cut short when Apollo's ghost like form flew into her body. Everything was black for a short while as Apollo's senses began to take over her body. Once Apollo was completely in control of Pearl's body, he felt the same unfamiliar sensations he felt when Wocky had swapped his and Trucy's bodies earlier in the day. He noticed that the remote had materialized in Pearl's hand after the possession

Before he had time to think about the differences in his body however, his own body answered the door. "If you're looking for Mr. Wright, he should be down at-" His own body began to say, but it was cut off by Wocky in Trucy's body running in front of it. "Ah! Yo' finally here Pearl!" Wocky said, he eyed the remote in Apollo's hand and gave a smile. He turned to Apollo's auto-pilot body "Sorry 'Polly', but me and Pearl are goin' to have a, um, uh, a 'Girl's night out. Stay here, we'll be back late! Don'tchu think about leavin' my 'daddy' would be mad if he found out you didn't 'stay and watch us'"

Before Apollo in Pearl's body could say anything, Wocky had grabbed his arm and was pulling him away from the door. Apollo took one glance back and saw his body closing the door, clearly annoyed by the situation as much as the real him was. He firmly planted his feet on the ground to make Wocky stop pulling him. "Why would you do that?!"

Wocky put his arms behind Trucy's head and gave out a chuckle. "That apartment was cramped and boring with just the two of us. If I had to be stuck in there with two of ya, I woulda went crazy from boredom."

"And just where are you planning to go right now?" Apollo said, he crossed his arms over his chest, but put them down as he accidentally felt Pearl's body.

"Don't know.....yet. Right now we're both teen girls. There's gotta be someplace around here we could have fun." Wocky mused.

Apollo desperately wanted to go back right now, but he knew Wocky would not be satisfied with that. The only thing he could do now was stay by Wocky and make sure he didn't do anything to Trucy's body.
12531221222211212212121121.title: Possession

125312212222112122122.content:
It was close to midnight when Phoenix arrived at the Kitaki Manor. He still felt guilty about letting Trucy offer her own body to Wocky. After all, he knew that she was a young professional planning on the revival of her family's magical performances. But what's done has been done, and now he needed to see if there was a way to force Wocky back into his body. (I'm going to see if we can get a quicker resolution to this, Trucy.)

After ringing the bell, he waited for a few moments before Plum opened up. "Who the hell comes around at midnight?!"

"Good evening, Mrs. Kitaki. Phoenix Wright. You may know me as Apollo's boss."

Plum seemed to flinch for a moment. Phoenix slightly smiled. Somehow, local criminal organizations thought he was an associate of the Cadaverinis ever since he had proven Furio Tigre's guilt in court over seven years ago. He had been worried at first that he might become a target of crime, but none of them had tried anything during that time period. He figured it was useful to have a seedy reputation if it could give him clout when he needed to deal with a less law-abiding crowd.

"What do you want, Mr. Wright? It's a very late hour."

"I'm merely concerned about something with Wocky. He's still recovering from surgery, isn't he? I just thought I'd stop by and make sure he's alright."

Plum didn't buy that excuse for a second, but she didn't really want to mess with the man. Even if he decided not to involve his contacts in the legal world, Shelly de Killer still owed that man a debt, one she would rather not be called against her family. "Fine, Mr. Wright. But please don't stay long. He needs his rest."

"Thank you, Mrs. Kitaki. Could you show me the way to his room?"

Plum obliged, leading Phoenix to a room on the second floor before knocking. "Wocky, are you awake?"

A voice came from inside. "Yeah, Mom. Couldn't sleep...feeling a bit hungry."

"Oh...why don't I go make you something while a guest keeps you company?"

"A guest...?"

"May I?" Plum stood aside before heading elsewhere. "Hi, Wocky. Phoenix Wright."

"Lawyer-man's boss, right? What're you doin' here?"

"There's something I need to get from here." Phoenix spotted an unusual looking pamphlet. "That looks like it."

Wocky looked at it suspiciously. "Eh? When did that get here?"

"No clue, but it's exactly what I need. Do you mind?"

Wocky seemed to tired to care. "Do whatever you want."

"Thank you, Wocky. Hope you get better soon."

Phoenix stepped out just as Plum came back. "Thank you for your hospitality, Mrs. Kitaki. Wocky seems like he'll be fine."

Plum merely nodded, not trusting anything about the former lawyer. "Are you leaving now, Mr. Wright?"

"Yes, I think I've stayed up past my bedtime. My daughter will probably be worried about me. Have a good evening."

As Phoenix made his way back to his apartment he read through the manual to learn more about the remote. Did he discover something that could forcibly return someone to their body?
125312212222112122122.title: Follow Phoenix with the remote.

choices: Phoenix plans to use the remote.
Phoenix tries to come up with a better plan.
1253122122221121221221.content:
As Phoenix read through the manual and got a sense of what it could do, he noticed something about the possession feature that suggested unintentional effects could happen if the remote's functions were used while someone was possessing someone else. It specifically mentioned body swapping between a possessed person and an unpossessed person as an example of a situation that might go awry. How it would go awry, it inconveniently left out, perhaps because it might be random in nature. It wasn't a very strong lead, but Phoenix considered it at least one potential solution to the problem of getting Wocky back into his own body.

Of course, it seemed too vague to risk his daughter's safety with. It's not like he was in court where the only options were surrender or throwing out long shots in an attempt to turn the case around. If he thought about it some more, he might be able to find a way to convince Wocky to return to his body even though he wasn't fully healed from the surgery.

Does Phoenix try to use the remote against Wocky or come up with another way to get him out of Trucy's body?
1253122122221121221221.title: Yes, he did (maybe).

choices: Make Wocky want to be himself again
1253122122221121221222.content:
Unfortunately, as Phoenix read through the manual, he found no mention of any function that could force Wocky back into his own body. 'Possession' would just let Wocky loose to go into any body he desires, and 'Aware swap' wouldn't just put Wocky into his own body, it would swap the second Wocky into Trucy's, bringing things back to square one. Of course, this didn't cause Phoenix to lose hope. If the remote itself didn't have a convenient way to get Wocky back to being himself, then Phoenix would just need to find an inconvenient way.

Phoenix had two options. The first would be to make Wocky want to willingly go back to his own body. This would be hard, Wocky was very against going back to being himself earlier. Phoenix didn't even know where to start with this idea. Perhaps he shouldn't try to make Wocky go back to being himself, but make him want to stop being other people?

The second option would be to experiment with the remotes functions and find a roundabout way to get Wocky back to being himself. Of course, the flaw with this play was that Phoenix would need to get someone else involved with the remote. While Phoenix considered getting Apollo to help him with this, the only reason Wocky was currently Trucy was because Apollo had his career to focus on and they couldn't have someone like Wocky going around in his body. Phoenix thought about who he should have help him experiment with the remote's functions. He had made quite a few friends over the years, he was sure that at least one of them would believe this insane story about a remote that switches bodies.

What did Phoenix decide to do?
1253122122221121221222.title: No, he didn't.

12531221222211212213.content:
The three of them were silent for a moment, and eventually Phoenix spoke up. "Well, since I'm Trucy's father and Apollo's boss, I suppose I best take responsibility," Phoenix sighed, "Wocky, go ahead and take my body for the moment. I suppose I'm not currently using it anyways."

Above them, they could hear the sound of the piano stop playing, followed by lukewarm applause. "That was my last song for the night. Don't have any cardgames to tend to either, so I suppose now is the time," Phoenix said with a tone of resignation in Olga's voice. He had Apollo untie Wocky, who breathed a sigh of relief as he stretched Ema's arms.

"Ema will probably be confused, so to minimize it, you guys go sit back at your table and act like nothing was wrong," Phoenix instructed, with Trucy, Apollo, and Wocky all nodding in agreement.

---

"Huh?" Ema shook her head, confused. "W-wasn't I at the park a second ago?" she asked, her head spinning as her surroundings changed. Why was the taste of grape in her mouth?

"You, uh, came out with us for dinner," Apollo said, suddenly to her left. "After helping us carry the supplies back to the office, we invited you to the Borscht Bowl. You dozed off after a few bottles though - you seemed tired."

Ema looked to the table, seeing a few bottles of grape juice lying around. "That's weird... I was feeling fine before."

"Well, we're glad you're okay now," Trucy interjected, all smiles. "You worried us for a moment there. Anyways, we were all about to order."

"We were?"

"Yup!" A new voice came in, belonging to a blonde woman in thick blue coat, a white apron draped down the front. She seemed to be the waitress, holding a notepad in her hand. "Take your time though if you're tired."

"Uh, I'll need an extra moment to look at the menu," Ema replied, as she shook her head, very confused.

---

"Yo Mr. Wright, thanks for hearing me out man!" 'Phoenix' said to 'Olga' excitedly as the 4 of them left the Borscht bowl after closing. Ema chose to part ways on her own, saying she needed to go clear her head. This was helpful, as Trucy, Apollo, and Wocky needed to wait for Phoenix to close up, seeing as how he was the waitress for the moment. "You won't regret it, fo' real!"

"Yeah. No problem," Phoenix replied in an unenthusiastic tone.

A bit silent until now, Apollo suddenly spoke up, "well, what are you going to do now, Mr. Wright? If Wocky's using your body, that leaves you sort of out in the cold. You can't keep using Olga's body, right?"

Phoenix thought it over as he looked down at Olga's gloved hands. "Not sure how this woman doesn't die of heat stroke..." he muttered. "But on topic, I don't know, Apollo. Wocky's already using my body, so I don't have many places to go."

Trucy leaned in to whisper, out of range of Wocky's hearing, "if you do keep Olga, though, then we can keep the remote away from Wocky. If you possess someone close to the office, he might try to snatch it back up."

Phoenix nodded a bit grimly at this, realizing it was a good point. They had gone out of the frying pan and into the oven - now Phoenix was the one short a body. What did he decide to do?
12531221222211212213.title: Phoenix

125312212222112122131.content:
After Thinking the situation over, and keeping the fiasco from earlier in mind. Phoenix decided to stay in Olga's body for now, if not for any other reason than to keep the remote out of Wocky's hands. "I'll stay as Olga for now, just until we can figure out this whole body situation." Phoenix whispered to Trucy

"What about Olga? Is it really okay to take her body for awhile?" Trucy asked concerned.

"I don't like it that much either, but it's not like we have much of a choice. Don't worry, I won't be her for too long, we'll think of what to do soon." Phoenix reassured her.

Their whispered conversation was interrupted by Wocky shouting toward them "So, what we doin' now?" He asked.

"It's getting late, it might be best to call it a night." Apollo said, exhausted after all that had happened today. Somehow, being part of Trucy's magic show was the least stressful part of his day.

"Call it a night? You crazy? Night is still young, no G would sleep now!" Wocky said.

"In case you didn't notice, you're not exactly we 'G' right now." Phoenix spoke up.

"No, man. Body doesn't matter, I'm always a G at heart!" Wocky said.

"You're not going anywhere with my body tonight." Phoenix said seriously.

Knowing that arguing with Mr. Wright was probably pointless, Wocky spoke up again. "Fine." He sighed, planning to sneak out later.

"Alright, let's make our way to my office. We can stay there tonight." Phoenix said

"No way, boss-man." Wocky said. "In case you didn't notice, you ain't yourself right now." He said using the same words Wright did earlier.

Phoenix had a bad feeling about this "What's your point?" he asked

"I don't want no strange Russian lady in MY crib tonight" Wocky mocked.

"Not funny Wocky, now come on, let's get moving." Phoenix said as he continued walking.

"No man, I'm serious. If ya gonna make me follow the rules of your body. Then yo are gonna act like that waitress chick! That means stayin' at her crib." Wocky said, although the real reason he didn't want Mr. Wright around tonight was so he could have an easy time sneaking out.

Apollo was going to object to Wocky's demands, but he was interrupted by an unexpected remark. From Phoenix "Dah!" He said, imitating Olga's fake russian accent. "I'll play your game." He said.

Trucy and Apollo just looked at Phoenix shocked. "Are you sure Mr. Wright? You don't have to listen to Wocky you know.

"Don't worry, Apollo. It'll be fine. We'll meet back up at the Borsht Bowl tomorrow ." Phoenix assured him.

"But why did you agree to do it?" Apollo asked, confused.

"Maybe Wocky will have more incentive to act like me if I do the same thing. Plus, I haven't had a poker game in a while. Maybe trying a different type of gamble will be fill in the void until more people want to try playing against me." Phoenix explained as he began to separate from the group.

As Wright parted ways from the others, he looked in Olga's pocket and found a wallet. Inside was what seemed to be her address. He began to make his way toward it.

Both groups knew in their head that this was going to be one of the most confusing nights of their lives.
125312212222112122131.title: Stay as Olga for now

choices: Phoenix decides to lie down first
Phoenix decides to keep pushing onwards
1253122122221121221311.content:
Upon reaching Olga's apartment, Phoenix immediately threw off her waitress uniform, relieved to be free from the overheated costume. He set the device itself down on a small coffee table. "How on Earth does she put up with that thing!" He complained as he collapsed onto her couch. Looking around, her apartment was a rather small space - she clearly lived alone. Decks of cards were strewn all about, as were books and guides that explained various tricks and sleights of hand. There was a small TV across from the couch, but overall it was a rather spartan place.

"I guess being a con-artist doesn't give a great paycheck," he observed as he pulled off Olga's boots, only to frown when he found heels underneath them. "Not that gambling is much better," he continued to himself as he pulled off the second pair of shoes.

Getting off the couch, Phoenix managed to find a cramped bedroom with a mirror. There, he undid the bow-tie and unbuttoned the the collar. It'd been so long since he had to wear a tie! It was suffocating. The bandanna came off as well, freeing up Olga's hair. As Phoenix reached for her vest though, it dawned on him that he was essentially undressing her. It was an uncomfortable realization; her clothes were just so layered and overdone that he had wanted to change without really thinking about it.

As he looked over Olga's body in the mirror with more detail, he began to worry that he might've gotten a bit in over his head by accepting Wocky's challenge. He didn't really have any experience being a woman at all, could he handle it? The long walk in the oppressive outfit left him feeling tired and more than a bit sweaty. His natural impulse this time a day would be to take a shower and change clothes, but that just seemed horribly intrusive.

"Probably something I'd need to get used to though if Wocky is really going to stay in my body..." Phoenix muttered. Even if he ultimately left Olga, that'd leave him jumping to someone else's body. Breaches of privacy might just be a thing he has to adjust to if it means keeping Wocky contained, as worrying a thought that was.

"Maybe I should just sleep this all over first before rushing in..." Phoenix wondered aloud as he began to run Olga's hands through her hair. The proportions and sensations of her body were all beginning to enter his mind as he stood there, looking at his current reflection. "This is all nuts, I've only known about the thing for a few hours. Maybe I should just slow down before doing anything rash, its not like I don't still have the device."
1253122122221121221311.title: Follow Phoenix as Olga

12531221222211212213111.content:
Deciding to take things slow for now, Phoenix chose to just lay down and rest for now. If he eventually needed to use the shower or change clothes then he would, but for now he just wanted to rest after this convoluted day and the extremely hot outfit. Before he laid down he took off Olga's vest. Leaving him in just her shirt and pants.

----

The next morning Phoenix woke up and let out a loud yawn. Initially confused by the high pitchness of his voice, he looked down at himself and recalled the event's of last night. "Guess it wasn't the most confusing dream ever." He joked to himself.

He took another look at Olga's body in the mirror, still shocked that this was him now. Her body certainly did seem like it had been sleeping, Phoenix thought as he looked at her now messy hair and wrinkled clothes.

He supposed that he should get her body ready for the day, although he didn't particularly want to shower or change clothes as her. An idea came to mind though.

He picked up Olga's vest that he had taken of last night and put it on. Next he folded up her sleeves. He then patted down her hair. It still looked messy, but it looked slightly less messy. He looked in the mirror again. If you were to look at him closely then it would be clear that he didn't put much effort into getting ready this morning, but anyone who would just glance at him wouldn't be able tell. Phoenix had gotten used to days without showering during the between time of his disbarment and becoming a poker player

Deciding that he was ready to go Phoenix began to make his way out of Olga's apartment, choosing to leave her Russian outfit behind, it wasn't as if anyone didn't know that she wasn't Russian.

As he was about to leave, he wondered if he should bring the remote along with him. On one hand, if he brought the remote with him, he could test out it's functions and get a better understanding of it. On the other hand, if he left the remote here, he would have to worry about losing it or of the off chance it could get stolen. After thinking it over, he chose to...
12531221222211212213111.title: Phoenix decides to lie down first

1253122122221121222.content:
"You're lyin'!" Wocky said, staring Phoenix-as-Olga down. "You lawyer types are all good-two-shoes, you'd never do something like that. We all know I can outlast ya'."

Phoenix shook his head morosely. "You had your chance," he said, "but I guess there's no going back now. Apollo, Trucy, come with me," Phoenix said, leading the two up the trap door and out of the hidden room, going backstage to talk while Phoenix's body kept up his piano performance.

"...Mr. Wright, that was all a bluff right?" Apollo asked in a low voice, his face a bit incredulous at the threat they just doled out. "We wouldn't really do that to him, right?"

Phoenix laughed a bit, "well, it was mostly a bluff."

"What are we going to do then?" Trucy butted in. "Just leave him? If we back down now he'll just get even more confident."

Phoenix put a hand to Olga's hip and held up a finger as he began to explain himself. "That's why I said mostly. Its been a while since I've been an attorney, but I still have plenty of contacts in law enforcement. I've heard stories about prisoners in solitary confinement who lose all perception of time; to them, a few hours seems like a day. When you take away stimuli and things that mark time's passage, it all lumps together."

"So what are you getting at?" Apollo kept asking.

"I'm saying that we only really need to possess Wocky for maybe a few hours - a day at most, and when we depossess him just make sure its impossible for him to know how long it actually was. If I'm right, he'll cave fast."

Trucy nodded, "see Apollo, daddy has a plan! Now, who's going to be the one who uses the remote?"
1253122122221121222.title: Remained defiant

12531221222211212222.content: Which one of them volunteers?
12531221222211212222.title: Phoenix/Apollo Volunteers

125312212222112122222.content:
"Apollo will do it." Phoenix volunteered Apollo.

Apollo got a look of shock on his face "Why me?!"

"Simple, I wouldn't feel comfortable having Trucy in someone else's body and as you can see, I already filled out my possession quota." Phoenix explained.

"Don't I have a say in this?" Apollo desperately asked.

Phoenix laughed "Do you every" He said as he pointed the remote at Apollo and pressed the possession button.

Apollo's body went silent for a second before it spoke up again. "So, why did you call us back here Ms. Orly?"

Not expecting Apollo's body to act like nothing happened, Phoenix quickly came up with an excuse to tell Apollo's body. "Dah! You need to stop the obnoxious yelling! The other patrons are complaining." Phoenix said, imitating Olga's fake Russian accent.

"Uh, right. I'll be sure to keep it down, I guess." Apollo's body said and went back to his table.

---
Meanwhile Apollo was floating above them in a ghost form. After getting over the initial shock of being in this state, he tried moving around. Once he got a hang of moving around he floated back downstairs to possess Wocky in Ema's body. Wocky in Ema's body was doing his best to attempt to get untied.

Ready to possess Ema's body, Apollo flew into it. Was he able to possess Ema's body even though it was already possessed?
125312212222112122222.title: Apollo

1253122122221121222222.content:
Everything seemed to work for a moment, as Apollo descended into Ema's body, which was struggling against it's restraints. He became solid once more, and Ema's limbs and senses yielded to him. 'It worked!' He was about to call for Phoenix and Trucy, but then something strange happened.

"Yo what was that!?" Ema's mouth moved without Apollo's input. "Attorney Man?! You hiding down here?"

"Huh?" he said, commandeering Ema's voice. "W-wocky!?"

"What's happenin? Why am I talkin without wantin too?"

Apollo contorted Ema's face into a look of dread as he realized what happened. He didn't take full control of Ema's body - he was just sharing it with Wocky now. It seemed that the device wouldn't let him totally override someone who was already possessing a body.

Soon enough, Phoenix and Trucy descended down the stairs. "Apollo? Is that you?" Phoenix asked hesitantly.

"Pfft, you think I'm that-" Ema's body began but was cutoff. "Mr. Wright! Something went wrong!"

Wocky shook Ema's head in confusion, but suddenly realization dawned on him as well. "Oh don't tell me we're sharing!"

Apollo resumed, "We're both in control Mr. Wright, you got to fix this!"

Trucy was wide eyed, taken aback by the seemingly schizophrenic Ema in front of them. Phoenix-as-Olga, however, processed the information quickly however, and pieced together his options. "Well," he said, "we might have to leave you that way for now Apollo."

"W-why!?" It was hard to tell which one shouted that.

'Because if we just used the possession button again, it might release Wocky too, and then we're back to square one, right? This way, you're atleast present as a sort of restraint in Ema's body. You can keep him under control."

"That's whack man!" That was obviously Wocky. "Mr. Wright, c'mon, I didn't even really volunteer for this!" That was Apollo.

Phoenix thought it through. It was crazy, but it might be worth it. Having to fight for control of Ema's body might wear down on Wocky's resolve. He didn't strike Phoenix as someone with a plan - he was probably just doing this because he thought it was fun. He was contrarian for sure, but if they made the situation as unbearable as possible for Wocky, he might surrender. If not that, Wocky would maybe learn a valuable life lesson about cooperation and sharing or something similarly corny.

"What are you going to do, Daddy," asked a concerned Trucy. It was a bit odd, being directed towards Olga's body.

Phoenix...

125322.content:
It had been nearly a year since the murder of Romein LeTouse. Machi was charged with smuggling Borginian cocoon. Thankfully he was let off easy because he was a minor and only needed to spend a few months in a juvenile detention center. Needless to say, the time spent there was not time that Machi enjoyed. While in prison, Machi had spent some time learning English. He still couldn't speak the language 'well' per say, but he could keep up simple conversations. He was released a few days ago, not that he had any idea what to do with himself now that he had been released. During the trial for the murder of Romein LeTouse nearly a year ago, Machi was sure that he would end up having to suffer the Borginian penalty for smuggling. Even after the trial, he hadn't given much consideration of what he would do with his life

With that bit of exposition out of the way, here comes the strange part. Once Machi had been released from prison, he had discovered a strange package along the side of the road. Inside was a remote and some kind of instruction manual. Machi took the package off the road and attempted to read the manual. Unfortunatley, although he could speak basic sentences in English, he could barley read a word of it. He could make out a few things, such as the remote effect people and it had something to do with bodies, but he couldn't figure out exactly what it did.

That was all a few days ago and while Machi attempted to put the remote out of mind and focus on other things, however his curiosity eventually got the better of him and he was tempted to test it out. The question was, on who?

There were a few people who he hadn't been able to see yet since he had been released from prison. The very first person to come to mind was Lamiroir. He had been planning on seeing her even since he had been released from prison, but he had been unable to since Lamiroir had been out of town for various reasons. He knew she would be back tomorrow, maybe that would be a good time to simultaneously meet up for the first time in a year and test the remote.

The very next people to come to mind were Apollo Yoostis and his assistant Trucy Wright, they had defended him in court a year ago and while he had wanted go see them, he had trouble gaining the confidence to face them. They had done so much for him then and he had caused so much trouble for them. Perhaps he would have an easier time going and seeing them if he convinced himself he was going there for a reason.

Who did Machi decided to go and see
125322.title: Machi after his cocoon smuggling penalty

125332.content:
Juniper was sitting at home one day, when she suddenly heard a knock at the door. She went to answer it, but to her surprise, no one was there. She looked around, but there was no sign of anyone. On her doorstep was a package addressed to her. She took the package inside to look at it's contents

Inside the package there was a remote and manual. She read through the manual. The manual claimed that the remote had the ability to swap bodies around and things like that.

She had a hard time believing the remote was real, it seemed to be completely impossible, but the remote's mysterious appearance tempered her to at least try it out. The question now was, where to try it.

The first thought that came to mind was to show it to her friends from Themis Academy. Robin, Hugh, and Myriam. They were her best friends after all, it only made sense to show the remote to them.

Another place she thought of using the remote at was at the Wright Anything Agency. Athena was a close friend of here's, plus, Apollo would be there too.

Of course, there were other places she could go and try the remote out at. In the end she decided to use it at...
