Considering that this was his first time walking ever since the accident, Acro chose to just take it slow for now and walk around the circus. Of course, this meant that he couldn't go into the center of the big top itself, as Regina was currently in there feeding the animals, but he could at least walk around the other areas of the circus. Like the cafeteria or the rooms of his fellow entertainers. He hadn't been able to go to those areas in a long time, it would be nice be there after so long.

As he though of where to go he heard a grumbling from his stomach. Regina's body must have been hungry. She must not have eaten before today's show. At least that cleared up some thoughts of where to go. He began to head to the kitchen.

He went into the kitchen and inside he found Moe with many burgers. Moe looked at him and began to speak "Hey Regina! Did you already finish feeding all the animal?"

Acro figured the best thing to do here was to attempt to act like Regina. He put a happy attitude behind his words as he began to speak. "Yes! It didn't take as long as usual. I'm kind of hungry now, can I please have a burger?"

Moe got a burger ready. "Sure, but first...What did the hamburger say when it pleaded 'not guilty'?"

Acro sighed internally. Moe was always telling jokes like these, although, they were rarely funny, but who knows, maybe this will be the one that hits the mark. "What did the burger say?"

"I've been flamed!" Moe said loud and exaggerated before he began laughing wildly to him. The joke did not hit the mark. Acro gave a polite laugh. Moe seemed to get depressed. "Usually you laugh along with me Regina. Am I getting so bad I can't even make you laugh." Moe sighed and handed Acro a burger.

Before Acro could say anything else, Moe slammed his fist down into his hand. "That's it! I'm going to work three times as hard on my jokes tonight. I've hit a new low, but that doesn't mean I won't bounce up higher than ever before!" Moe exclaimed before storming out of the kitchen.

Acro sat down and began to eat the burger Moe made for him. As he ate he heard to the door to the Kitchen open again. As the person enter the room they exclaimed "Regina sweetie!"

Who entered the room?
155311221.title: Walk around the Big Top as Regina while she fee...

1553112212.content:
Looking up, Acro was greeted by Ben, the ventriloquist, with his puppet in hand. The ventriloquist was a nervous and anxious fellow, and Acro recalled that he was hopelessly infatuated with a girl who was much younger than him. Also his ventriloquism was questionable at times.

"Uh, hello Ben," Acro said, looking up at him, instead of the puppet.

Ben's face flashed red, nervous, as he began to maneuver the dummy. "How's it going toots? The food good today?"

A bit annoyed, Acro continued to address the ventriloquist. "Yeah, its fine, Ben," Regina's voice sounded uncharacteristically annoyed with Acro using it. "How are you?"

Ben seemed unsure of how to reply to this. "Uh..." he stumbled, "I'm, doing... fine?" Suddenly, the puppet's voice piped up too, "I'm doing just great! No, uh, I had a question to ask you, Regina."

Acro was only Regina for a few minutes and this guy was already beginning to exhaust him. He flicked an eye over to Ben, who had a hand in his jacket pocket awkwardly. If Acro remembered the rumor mill properly, Ben had it in his head that he would propose to Regina. It was a pretty absurd prospect; his competition was Maximilian Galactaca. Acro could hardly fathom why anyone would want to be with her after what happened to his brother.

'Maybe I'll set him straight,' Acro thought with a grin. "I'm reeeeeally, sorry Trilo, but I only talk to real people," he replied with feigned sweetness as he pulled himself up from his chair. "Now, I got to head out, I'm pretty busy with the tigers and whatnot, y'know?" he said with a tilt of Regina's head, trying to imitate her smile. Ben sputtered at this, choking on the water he had begun to drink. Trilo visibly spazzed out as well, all his pieces seeming to fall of his torso.

Ben was burning red as he bent over to start picking up the pieces to his precious dummy. "I'm uh, I'm really... sorry..." his voice trailed off as he gathered up the pieces to the dummy, turning around and slowly walking away from the room, embarrassed

Acro sorta felt sorry for him, but he had trouble caring in the long run. The guy would be better off if he just gave up on pursuing Regina after all. Acro realized he still had the device on him. He wondered how Ben would respond to a switch with the remote; Ben was a really nervous fellow, but he seemed to be at his best when he was pretending to be someone else. He could register Ben with one of the swap functions now and find him a new body later, just to inject some entropy into things. Maybe it'd do some good for his confidence in the long run?
1553112212.title: Ben and Trillo

15531122122.content:
Acro eyed the remote and gave it another thought. Deciding that it would do Ben good to be someone else for a while. He aimed at Ben and clicked the Aware swap button, registering him as the first target.

The question now was who to swap him with. Thinking it over there were three options here in the circus. The first was Max Galactica, the new star of the circus. From what Acro understood both Max and Ben were after Regina's affection, making them rivals. Max was the new star of the circus and was use on all of the posters to advertise the circus. Ben on the other hand was the lowest act in the circus. Swapping the two of them would be an interesting change of ranks and perhaps Ben being at the top would give him the confidence he needs.

The second choice was Moe. Moe was the oldest act at the circus and very respected in the eyes of all the performers, Acro included. However, Moe was growing old and less people paid attention to his jokes. Maybe being someone younger would help out Moe as much as being one of the most respected performers would help Ben

The third choice was more risky, swapping Ben with Regina. It was clear that Ben liked Regina. Perhaps making him become her would help him. Although, Acro was only considering this because the thought of Regina being trapped in someone else with no idea how it happened. However, this would be risky. Acro himself was currently a copy of Regina. Going anywhere near Regina right now brought the risk of her seeing him and finding out about the remote.

After thinking his options over, Acro chose to swap Ben with....
15531122122.title: Use the remote on him

155311221221.content:
Max was a bit stuck up for Acro's taste, but Acro couldn't think of a reason to rope him into this without his consent. He felt Moe might react negatively to a switch as well. It was a lot of stress to put on a person, and Acro had no grudge with either of his coworkers.

He did have a grudge with Regina, however. He had no idea how she would take to a body swap, but he imagined it would leave her rattled, especially if she had no idea why. Eager to get some revenge, Acro decided to hold off for a second while Ben walked out, to put some distance between him and the target.

Satisfied with his plan, Acro then took off in Regina's body towards the big top itself, where Regina would probably still be tending to the animals. He became careful now as he brushed aside the tent flap, slowly walking his way down the center, careful to not make noise with Regina's boots. He could hear Regina's voice not far ahead, along with what he assumed were the sounds of the new tiger, Regent. This would be tricky; he couldn't change back until he reached his home because he still needed Regina's legs. He'd need to hit her with the body swap while hidden and still get out unnoticed.

As he made his way through the audience stands, crouching low, he could hear Regina call out in a sing song voice, "alright Regent, that's enough for now, back to the cage!" He pulled himself up slightly, looked up from the front row as Regina directed the tiger back to it's home.

'Good, it'd complicate things if Ben had to deal with the animal,' Acro noted. Regina disappeared for a bit as she guided the tiger to a back room, but he knew she would be back as she left some of the food for it behind. She'd have to clean it up at some point.

Eventually Regina did come back to gather up the mess she left behind. Ducking out of sight, he wasn't sure where she was facing as she cleaned up her mess, but he realized he would have to pull himself up to get a view on her. Hesitantly, he decided to take the risk, and he slowly lifted his legs, peeking over the pew he was behind. Glitter scattered about as he moved to see Regina...
155311221221.title: Regina

1553112212211.content:
As Acro looked toward Regina he let out a sigh of relief as he saw she had her back turned to him. He didn't have much time though, she could turn around and see him at any second. He aimed the remote at her and hit the Aware Swap button.

An instant later Regina dropped the food she had been picking up. She began feeling herself all over. She began to cough wildly, presumably because some glitter got caught in her mouth. Acro couldn't see her face, but he could imagine that Ben in her body was surprised beyond belief of what had happened. Acro crouched back down to avoid being seen by Ben

Ben in Regina's body, panicking, went over to the nearest reflective surface, some water left in a large bowl for the animals and looked at his reflection. He screamed as he saw who he was now. He ran out of the big top tent in a panic.

Satisfied with the swap, Acro waited a minute and then stood back up. It might be best to either go back to his room or leave the circus for now, He thought. He was able to freely walk around the circus as Regina up until now because she was preoccupied with the tigers and wouldn't see him, but now that Ben and Regina are in each other's bodies he would have to avoid them both. He didn't think he would be able to do that for very long at all. He headed out of the tent

-----------------

Meanwhile Ben in Regina's body was running to where his body was before the swap. He need to find out what was going on and if Regina was stuck as him too. He had some difficulty running due the the proportions of his new body, As he headed toward where his body was, His heart nearly stopped. A few feet away he saw his rival in love, Max. He hated being anywhere near Max when he was himself. He couldn't even imaging being around him as Regina. Although, maybe he could use the current situation to make Max lose interest in Regina.
1553112212211.title: With her back turned

155312.content:
After some thought Acro chose to not use the device on one of his fellow Circus performers. If the device didn't work, then he would look like a fool in front of the other performers. If it did work, then whichever performer he used it on would know about the remote and Acro wasn't sure he wanted anyone else in the circus to know about it yet. He figured if he used it on some circus goer he could keep it a secret, if it even worked in the first place. Unfortunately for him, his choices in circus goers was limited to whoever he could see outside his window, due to inability to leave his room.

Thankfully for him, tonight's show had just ended and there were many people leaving. Acro got the device ready and looked at the various Circus goers, trying to find a good target.

There were two people who caught his eye at first. They seemed to be either husband and wife or boyfriend and Girlfriend. The woman was wearing what seemed to be a biker outfit and had long hair that was either brown or dirty blonder.

The man, well, with the outfit he was wearing and his weird hair style, he wouldn't look to out of place in the circus.

Acro could easily use the remote to take one of their bodies, but he couldn't help but wonder if he should look through the large crowd of people leaving the circus for other potential people to swap with, after all, this man and woman were literally the first people that he saw.

Acro had to make his decision fast, they were on their way out of the circus and could be out of sight at any moment. In the end Acro decided to use the remote on...
155312.title: A circus goer

155331.content: Pre Death or Post Death
155331.title: Dahlia Hawthorne

1553311.content:
Dahlia was not in the best of situations. She had gotten away with the murder of her sister and caused the suicide of Terry Fawles with no consequence. Not only that, but she had successfully murdered that annoying defense attorney Diego Armando. So, if she was able to do all of this, then what was the Problem? Simple, how she had to hide the evidence of Diego's murder.

Hiding the evidence itself was simple, she just handed it off to an idiot college student who happened to be at the courthouse. Sadly, getting the evidence back was turning out to be the hard part. The moron refused to give it back! Keeping it as a present and falling in love with Dahlia.

For the past few months, Dahlia had her sister Iris pretend to be her around Phoenix and get the necklace back, but after several months of Iris making no progress in getting the necklace back, Dahlia was getting impatient.

Thankfully for Dahlia, she had received something that might help her get it back. In the mail she received a strange package that contained a remote and a manual. The manual claimed that the remote was some kind of body switching device. Dahlia didn't want to believe it, but considering the fact that she was originally born in a village full of spirit mediums, this was not the weirdest thing that she had heard of.

The question now was, who to test it on? The first thought that came to her mind was to use the remote on Phoenix. If she did that, she could easily get the bottle necklace back and then completely stop contact with that moron. Of course Phoenix was not the only person she could test the remote out on, she could easily use it on Iris just to check if it would work. Or maybe she could use it to get rid of that annoying Mia Fey for good.

Who did Dahlia test it on?
1553311.title: Pre-Death

15533111.content:
Dahlia decided that the most important thing on her mind right now was getting the necklace bottle back from that idiot Phoenix Wright. She grabbed the remote and began to make her way to Ivy University. The fact that she had to even spend this little amount of time with that idiot irritated her to know end, the fact that in order for this plan to work she would have to temporarily have to be in his body made her want to puke. She just wanted to get this over with as soon as possible. It was a rainy day, so she made sure to bring her umbrella

Once Dahlia arrived at Ivy University, she was lucky enough to see Phoenix exiting the building, it was possible to tell who he was from a mile away, he was wearing that pink sweater of his. She decided not to approach him, but rather use the remote from a distance. Both to make sure she would have to spend as little time with Phoenix as possible and to make sure that he wouldn't see the remote. She wanted to keep this remote a secret to everyone, especially him.

Dahlia pointed the remote and pressed the button that she wanted, what button did she press?
15533111.title: Dahlia uses it on Phoenix

1553311111.content:
Dahlia pointed the remote at Phoenix and clicked the Aware Swap button. Dahlia then pointed the remote at herself and once again clicked the Aware Swap button.

In an instant, Dahlia was standing where Phoenix had been. She was overcome with man weird sensations due to her being in a completely different body. The most noticeable thing being the change in gender. It also seemed that Phoenix was coming down with a cold and now Dahlia had a headache because of it.

Dahlia didn't have time to thing about things like that. She wanted to leave Phoenix's body as soon as possible. She looked down at Phoenix's neck and saw that he was indeed wearing the necklace that she had given him. She left the university, she was going to personally deliver the necklace to her home. Once she had done that she would return to her body and retrieve it.

Maybe it was the headache because of Phoenix's cold, or maybe it was the excitement of finally being able to get rid of the only evidence against her, but Dahlia hadn't noticed one small yet important fact. The remote hadn't followed her when she swapped bodies.

Meanwhile Phoenix was standing outside the university confused. One moment he was finished with all of his classes for the day and was heading home, the next moment he was twenty feet away and facing the university. Not only that, he was in a completely different body!

It didn't take him long to figure out whose body he was in. He saw strands of red hair fall into his face. He was wearing a white dress and on the ground was an umbrella that was a similar color.

"I'm Dollie!" He shouted in shock, although there was definitely a small amount of joy in his voice as he shouted that. He couldn't believe that he was in his girlfriend's body!

He looked around for Dahlia, who he assumed was in his body, but strangely he couldn't find his own body anywhere. "Oh no, did she get scared by the body swap and run away?" Phoenix said to no one in particular, as far as he knew, Dahlia was the kind of girl who got scared easily.

"She probably got scared and went home." Phoenix told himself, he would have gone to where she lived and met up with her, but despite them dating for months Phoenix had no idea where she lived. He assumed she was just to shy to tell him. With no other options, Phoenix decided to just head home.

He picked up Dahlia's umbrella off the ground, he was glad she had brought it. Now he had a way to avoid the rain on his walk home, he had gotten a cold in his own body, he would have hated if he gave Dahlia a cold too. As he picked up the umbrella off the ground, he had not noticed that right next to it was a remote of some sort. As Phoenix walked away, he had a smile on his face. Sure, he was in a completely different body, but at least he was his precious Dahlia and not someone he barely knew
1553311111.title: Aware Swap

choices: Larry gets home before he does
15533111111.content:
As Phoenix walked home, he couldn't help but feel grateful that Dahlia had brought her umbrella today. It was beginning to pour hard. Assuming that Dahlia was in his body, he couldn't imagine how she was handling herself with this rain. He wasn't doing so good himself, sure the umbrella was protecting him from the rain himself, but he was getting very cold with the wind. He wanted to get out of the rain as soon as possible, unfortunately, he wasn't walking as fast as he could be. Dahlia's body wasn't exactly easy for him to walk in. She had been wearing both a dress and heels, obviously not the kind of clothes that Phoenix was used to walking in.

As Phoenix got near where he lived, he suddenly tripped, it was surprising it took so long for that to happen. As he picked himself up off the ground he noticed that when he had tripped he fell straight into mud. He looked at Dahlia's dress and saw that it got covered in mud during the fall. Not only that, but her umbrella was broken in the fall. "Oh No!" He yelled as he grabbed part of the muddied dress. "I hope Dollie doesn't get too upset." Deciding that standing out in the rain wouldn't doing any good, Phoenix continued on his way.

Being a college student, Phoenix didn't have his own place to live. However, he didn't live with his family either. Instead, Phoenix was temporarily staying in an apartment that one of his friends owned. His friend's name was Larry and he was a childhood friend of Phoenix. Larry had graduated from junior high, and only junior high. Phoenix had no idea what or where Larry worked, from talking with Larry it seemed that he did something different every other week. Phoenix didn't plan on permanently living with Larry, he planned to move out as soon as he could.

Phoenix slowly entered Larry's Apartment, he stuck his head in before fully walking in. It seemed that Larry wasn't home right now. Phoenix didn't know whether not to feel lucky or disappointed about that. He really wanted to tell somebody that he was somehow in Dahlia's body, but at the same time he was positive Larry would react very, Larry-like, at seeing a girl in his apartment. Phoenix wasn't sure that he wanted to be on the receiving end of Larry's flirting.

Phoenix sat down on Larry's couch. He looked down at Dahlia's wet and muddy dress. He felt really bad about the fact that he tripped while in her body, but more importantly, he was feeling really cold. Because he had broken the umbrella on his way here, Dahlia's body got drenched in the rain. He would feel even worse if Dahlia got sick because of him. He supposed he should at least change clothes, although he felt that he would breaching on Dahlia's privacy by doing so. He obviously didn't have any of Dahlia's clothes here, but he was sure that if he looked around his own clothes he would eventually come across something that would fit her body.
15533111111.title: Follow Phoenix in Dahlia's body

155331111112.content:
Phoenix made his way toward his bedroom, but before he could enter, he heard the front door open and shut behind him. It was Larry, staring at him with eyes as wide as quarters. At first he looked shocked, but a smirk quickly grew on his face as he psyched himself up to talk with the pretty lady before him.

"Hey, baby," Larry said, approaching 'Dahlia' with as suave a walk as he could muster, which, to be fair, wasn't all that suave. "Are you here to have your way with me? Because I accept."

Phoenix grimaced. "No, Larry."

"Aw, you know my name, too, huh?" Larry said. "Most chicks do around here. But enough about me, gorgeous, tell me a little bit about yourself. What brings you to Casa de Butz?"

Phoenix cringed internally. He felt violated on a bunch of levels, not the least of which stemming from the fact that Larry was flirting with his girlfriend. (Like my Dollie would ever dream of stooping to your level,) he thought.

But now he had a difficult decision to make. Does he let the Butz know about his situation, or does he try and play the part, making sure to mention that Dahlia is his girlfriend?
155331111112.title: Larry interrupts "Dahlia"

1553311111122.content:
Phoenix wanted to tell Larry who he really was, but then he had a thought. What if Larry didn’t believe him? Larry had a very, active, mouth. If he went around telling people that Dahlia was going around saying that she was someone else, people would think she was crazy! The last thing Phoenix wanted was for Dahlia to have a bad reputation.

“I’m, uh, waiting here for my boyfriend.” Phoenix made up an excuse.

“Well, baby. I’m right here for you.” Larry flirted.

Phoenix was practically holding back puke, both at Larry flirting at him and at Larry flirting with Dahlia. “No, you’re not my darling Feenie.” Phoenix said, putting on an impression of Dahlia.

“Oh! You’re Nick’s girl.” Larry said, seeming to lose some interest. “Niiiick! You doooog!” Larry shouted to the ceiling. “You had a girl like this and you never brought her over!”

Phoenix sighed. At least Larry seemed to understand that Dahlia was his girlfriend, hopefully now he would hold off on the flirting. Although, Larry was still eyeing Dahlia’s body up and down.

“Say, you’re all covered in mud. Did something happen?” Larry asked.

“Uh, well, I tripped and fell into a mud puddle on my way over here.” Phoenix tried to laugh off what happened.

Larry smirked. “Well, if you need a new dress. I can provide!”

Phoenix was shocked “What?! What do you mean?!”

“I can get you a new one, there’s a place nearby. Give me fifteen minutes and I’ll get you one.”

Phoenix put his hands up defensively “No, no, that’s fine. I don’t need one!” He didn’t want Larry buying Dahlia a new dress. He didn’t want Dahlia to know some random stranger went and bought her something when Phoenix himself couldn’t. Plus, Larry would never buy someone something like that unless he was still interested in dating them.

“I insist! Any friend of Nick is a friend of mine!” Larry insisted. ‘Plus, if you ever break up with Nick, I need to be ready to catch the rebound.’ Larry thought to himself as he walked out the door.

Phoenix realized he had no choice but to accept Larry’s kindness for now. Once Larry left Phoenix sat down on the couch again. He wondered how Dahlia was doing right now. Similar to how he didn’t know where she lived, he had never given her his address. Meaning that the soonest that he could meet up with her would be tomorrow. He'd have to spend the night in Dahlia's body.

Phoenix waited for Larry, he was still a bit mad that Larry hadn't listened to him and insisted to buy Dahlia a new dress. 'Maybe I can tell Dollie I was the one who bought it?' Phoenix thought to himself. As he waited for Larry, he realized that Larry had exaggerated a bit about how long it would take him. He had been gone for about forty five minutes.

After a bit more waiting, Larry eventually come back through the door. He was drenched from the rain and had a bag with him. "I'm back" He said with a smile on his face.

"You said you'd take fifteen minutes, that was nearly an hour!" Phoenix said, after he said that he sneezed.

"Was it that long? Sorry, I'm not good with division." Larry said

'There was no division with that!' Phoenix mentally screamed.

"Well, anyway. Here you go!" Larry said as he handed Phoenix the bag.

inside was a dress exactly like the one Dahlia had, the only difference was the color. Unlike Dahlia's dress, which was white, This one was very pink. As Phoenix looked at it, he couldn't help but blush. It didn't fully hit him until now exactly what changing clothes in Dahlia's body would entail.

"You can change in Nick's room. I'm sure that he'll be here soon. I stop by Ivy University a little while ago and I didn't see him, but I did find something cool on the ground. Look at this cool ____!"
1553311111122.title: Pretend to be Dahlia

15533111111221.content:
"Look at this cool remote!" Larry exclaimed, holding up a small television remote, a bit damp from the rain. "You want to take a look at it with me?"

Phoenix shook his head. He was used to Larry getting sidetracked by stuff like this; it was best to just not play along. "It just looks like a TV remote to me, Larry. Someone probably lost it somehow. Should've left it there."

Larry shook his head. "But look at the labels! There are no channels or anything!" Larry exclaimed. "I don't know what any of it means," he pushed it closer to Phoenix and pointed towards the writing. 'Aware Swap', 'Unaware Swap', 'Posssession', and 'Shapeshift' were labeled on it. Phoenix wasn't entirely sure what any of it meant, but the word 'swap' and 'shapeshift' stuck out to him.

'Could it be...?' he wondered. "Er, uh, may I see it, Larry?" he asked, trying to give off Dollie's usual sweet persona. "I think I may know who owns it, actually."

"Sure, but first I want to see if it does anything!" Larry replied. Before Phoenix could interject, Larry started clicking on buttons.

What did he press?
15533111111221.title: Remote

155331111112211.content: Phoenix could only pale. What did Larry do this time?
155331111112211.title: Aware/Unaware Swap

1553311111122112.content:
A few moments passed and Phoenix sighed in relief. It didn't look like it did anything, but at least Larry didn't screw anything up.

"Oh my, I guess it was just a normal tv remote." He put an emphasis on capturing Dollie's sweet, pure tone.

Larry looked like a fish out of water. He was gnawing on his umbrella, eyes wide and confused, and his red hair was standing on end. Phoenix dragged a hand down Dollie's face, feeling her short beard. Larry was freaking out again, just like always. If only he was as patient as Dollie! She'd know what to do.

"Don't worry, Larry. I'm sure it has some use to whoever owns it."

She could still hear the buzzing. The chair was a loud contraption, and rather unsightly, for that matter, but that quickly bolted from her mind as Dahlia Hawthorne looked around these new surroundings. Wherever she was, this wasn't the prison. And she wasn't in chains, either, for the first time since her initial arrest. That was pleasant. She took a look at her feet. choices: Use it to stop Kane Bullard.
155332.content:
Ah, a wondrous gift for a wondrous human being, it seems!

Luke Atmey, Ace Detective and Ace Heist Planner extraordinaire, was checking his mail as usual one morning, when a curious curiosity curiously peeked it's head from inside the mailbox in question. Curious, Luke Atmey opened the box with haste! And what did he find? He found a most splendid invention! An invention that may even rival Edison! Tesla! The Lord Himself!

It was a remote that could switch the bodies of anyone it was used on? Luke, upon learning of this miraculous gift, snickered to himself as he considered his possibilities. He could use it to stop that Blackmailer, Kane Bullard, and stop his ever-so-slightly more evil plans of dastardlyness! He could use it to break down security for Mask☆DeMasque's heists! He even considered switching with a person solely so he could actually fit his nose inside a mask, as that currently... wasn't an option.

What does Luke decide to do?
155332.title: Luke Atmey

1553331.content:
Furio was in a bad situation. He currently owed a large sum of money to Bruto Cadaverni, due to the injuries that Viola had sustained in her car crash. While he had a feeling that he could make it up with he money he would get from people paying their loans, with each passing day it felt like that was less and less likely. Glen Elg was nowhere near close to paying him and not even rats would eat the food at Armstrong's restaurant. It would take some sort of miracle for either of them to pay him back. Elg was insisting that he was working on some sort of computer virus and would pay back Furio with that, but it would take at least another few weeks before it was done. Furio needed money and he needed it now!

Furio sat in his office thinking of what to do, maybe he could threaten Armstrong for money? Although he doubted that Armstrong would have more than a few bucks. It was then that Tigre noticed a strange package sitting over to the side of the room. Strange, he was sure that the package wasn't there before. Maybe Viola brought it in, but why wouldn't she tell him about it and why would she put it off to the side, almost out of sight? Regardless of how it got there or who put it there, he went to pick it up.

Once he picked it up, he began to walk back to his desk. As he walked, he couldn't help but think of what was in the package and listened to the sounds the package made as he moved it. It was of a decent weight, there was some empty room in the package so he could hear moving, it sound like there was paper inside and another object. Maybe someone had paid their loan and had sent in the money through the mail? That's what Furio hoped for anyway, he didn't give much thought to the object in the package. Unfortunately for him, there was no money in the package only a remote and a manual, the manual being the cause of the papery sound that he heard. In his anger, he roared and threw the remote and manual across the room.

As if on cue, Viola came into the room, carrying a tray of donuts and coffee for Furio. Something she would often do when she heard him get angry. "Violetta, Youse go 'nd 'collect' some dough from Armstrong!" He ordered her to do, even if Armstong didn't have much money, Furio needed to collect some right now just to calm himself down. While he didn't enjoy being Viola's 'boyfriend', she was at the very least useful for 'Collecting' loans.

Once Viola had left the room, Furio looked the the donuts and coffee she had brought in. He then proceeded to open a window, throw out the donuts, and pour out the coffee. While Viola was technically his girlfriend, he wasn't stupid enough to try any of her food. Once he was done with that, he looked back at the remote and manual he had thrown. He picked them up and read the manual, it was the most ridiculous thing he had ever read! It was some sort of 'Body Swap' remote. There was a note attached to the remote itself. 'Your money problems have now been solved' the note said, as if mocking him.

While Furio didn't believe the remote, a thought occurred to him, the sender knew of his money problems! Furio never told anyone about that, the only ones who knew were him and Bruto Cadaverni! While he doubted that Bruto himself had sent this package, maybe one of Bruto's contacts sent it? This thing could be real if that was true. It didn't matter exactly who sent it, he was desperate. Maybe this could help him with his money trouble? Or better yet, let him get out of this situation without him paying a cent!

Of course before he could make any grand plans, he needed to test out whether or not it worked. There were a few people that he knew and could easily get in contact with. The first three that came to mind were Viola, Elg, and Armstrong. Armstrong and Viola were both currently at Tres Bien and Elg was most likely at Blue Screens inc. right now. Both of those place were only a few minutes walk away. Where did he go to test the remote?
1553331.title: Furio Tigre

15533312.content:
Furio decided to go to Blue Screens Inc. There wasn't a particular reason he chose to go there over Tres Bien. He didn't have a very specific idea of what he wanted to do with the remote now. He would probably test the device on Elg or something like that when he got there. He got up from his desk and began to head to Blue Screens Inc. on his scooter.

It didn't take long for Furio to get to his destination, it was only a short drive away. Blue Screens Inc. was a small company and the outside of the building was rather bland looking. Despite the bland exterior, the interior of the building looked like something straight out of a Sci-Fi movie.The walls were all a blue-ish white with the corners curved. All of the employees were wearing some king of blue computer display on their faces.

Speaking of Employees, Furio looked at one desk and saw who he had been looking for, Glen Elg, Glen Elg was scratching away at some lottery tickets or something of the sort. After he had finished scratching his ticket, seemingly disappointed with the result, he looked up and saw Furio. He face contorted into an expression of fear upon seeing his loan shark in the building he worked at.

Furio grabbed the remote out of his pocket and was prepared to use on of it's functions to swap with Elg, when he suddenly saw a much, much, better target. He saw the almost robotic CEO of the company, Lisa Basil. He recognized her because one time he had come here to collect some money from Elg and she tried to kick him out saying his 'access was prohibited' or something like that.

He chose to swap with her for one major reason, her position as CEO. With a CEO position, Furio would have access to everything that Blue Screens Inc. had to offer. That included both the money that the company currently. It would be simple, all he would have to do is take her body, do a little searching around and find out the companies banks accounts and transfer all of the money to himself. It was simple and he would gain a lot from it.

Now that he had a plan, all he had to do was take her body. What kind of swap did he use?
15533312.title: Blue Screens inc.

1553331221.content:
Furio decided to go with the cleanest option, Possession. With this option he wouldn't have to worry about Basil in his body nor would he have to worry about there being two Basils running around. He saw Ms. Basil walking over to him, presumably to kick him out. He smiled and aimed the remote at himself and clicked the possession button.

In an instant he was floating above his own body and was in some sort of Ghost-like state. Not wasting any time, he floated over to Ms. Basil and flew into her body. Suddenly he was physical again, although it was clear that he was no longer himself.

The change in gender was the most noticeable thing about being in Ms. Basil's body, but there were other more subtle things that he immediately noticed. His hair was lying flat and he had one of those weird headsets on his face.

Seeing his own body still standing in the entrance, Furio smiled and turned to his 'Employee' Glen Elg, who was currently hiding under his desk hoping that his loan collector hadn't noticed him. Furio smiled and began to speak with Basil's voice. "Elg. Youse have a guest. Go see 'im or youse fired" Elg had no choice, he begrudgingly got up from his desk and left with Furio's own body.

"Now That'sa taken care of." Furio said and cracked Basil's knuckles, he was now ready to begin his plan of taking all the money he could salvage out of Blue Screens Inc. He went over to Lisa's computer, which was thankfully logged in and began to get to work.

Unfortunately, Furio wasn't the best with machines. He had no idea how to transfer any money from the company. He usually had Viola take care of things like that. He decided that it would be best to just bring Viola here and have her help out. She should still be at Tres Bien.

As Furio walked out of the building he turned to the other employees "Youse all have the week off! Git outta here!" He yelled at them, not even attempting to act like Basil. He needed all of the other employees out of here if he was going to bring Viola, there would need to be no witnesses connecting the loss of money to him.

Once all the employees had left, Furio began to walk over to Tres Bien in Basil's body
1553331221.title: Possession

choices: Use the remote to escape now.
15533321.content:
Kristoph opened his eyes. He stepped out of bed. He took his daily shower. He only left his cell to shower. He ate breakfast. He got dressed (not that he had anyone to dress up for). He read his mail. He sat on his old chair. He read one of his books. He thought about what might have been. He went to bed.

For days, weeks, and eventually months, the monotony of the hell the men in blue called solitary started to get to him. Every day was that same routine. He got up, took care of his hygiene, read, and slept. The courts called him mad, but if he was mad, he sure as hell wasn't before he was walked into this room. This cramped, yet admittedly comfortable room, the guard introduced with a smirk by saying, "I give you, your cell".

He wondered if it was too late for them to take it back.

One day, though -- oh, that day was different. On normal days his mail contained nary more than the news and letters from the parents he'd yet to give a word back to. But this day, he received a package. And the content of that package was one he would not soon forget.

"Interesting..." Kristoph muttered to himself as he investigated this so-called "body-switching remote". Normally, he'd be more skeptical of these types of things, but it's clear whoever gave this to him had the kind of clout he could trust to tell him the truth. Perhaps the mystery benefactor wanted to see him on the outside again.

Whatever the cause, there were a few things he could do now that he had this device.

The first: Use the remote to escape right now. He could switch with the guard or maybe possess an unsuspecting person in the street. Both options were viable, and both would get him out -- with the remote in tact.

Of course, he always had option two: He could lie in wait, perhaps for a visitor, or maybe even a passerby, and use the remote on them to get out. He could even use the remote while staying inside the prison as means to his ends.

So what did he choose to do?
15533321.title: Apollo Justice (Post Arrest)

choices: Someone who had been in prison for years
Someone who was only recently convicted
155333211.content:
Kristoph smiled, he could use the remote to leave the prison immediately, but why put in that much effort? He could exact his revenge from the comfort of his jail cell. He wouldn't be staying in here forever of course, but he wanted to have a full plan prepared before he himself acted. What was the plan?

Although Kristoph was confined to solitary, he had connections throughout the prison and had a basic understanding of things. there was an overabundance of one thing in this prison. People who wanted revenge on the people who put them in this prison. Whether the target of their revenge be a defense attorney, a prosecutor, a witness, or a detective. Kristoph could in some ways, relate to their pain. Of course, unlike them, he had a way of getting his revenge.

Why not turn their desire for revenge into his own personal gain? He could give them a way out of prison, a new body, no criminal record, and a chance for revenge. The only thing he would ask for in return would be small 'favors'. Whether it be information on how certain people that Kristoph wanted to keep an eye on were doing. Or perhaps even luring certain people to the detention center for a 'visit'. It would be simple really, even a simpleton could do it. Now that he had began to think this plan through, Kristoph needed to select his 'partners' in crime. It would be difficult, but he knew he could succeed. he began to write a letter.

'Dear ______
your prison term has been....shortened. On account of 'good behavior'
If you want your freedom, find a way to solitary cell 13 by 12:00 a.m. on Sunday.
I don't need to explain this, but destroy any trace of this letter once recieved.
From - The coolest attorney in the west'

Kristoph hid away the letter, thanks to his connections, it was entirely possible for him to deliver the letter to the person he had chosen. Who did Kristoph send the letter to?
155333211.title: Lie in wait.

1553332111.content:
Kristoph's nail-painting was cut short when he heard nearby footsteps. He set his nail polish at his desk, faced his chair towards the accursed iron bars, and watched his letter's recipient come to face him.

Who was it?
1553332111.title: Someone who had been in prison for years

15533321111.content:
Somehow, even in a prison uniform, Redd White looked ostentatious beyond comprehension. His cocky stride forced a miserable sigh out of Gavin as the gap between the bars and White closed. The guard eyed them both closely.

"I believe I was written a message instructutating my appearance here?" Redd said, cautious of Kristoph's every move.

"Yes... it was my message."

"Well, hello! Please furnish me with-"

"I'd like for you to, from this moment on, ignore everything I say and direct your attention to the guard."

"Wh- okay."

Redd turned to the guard, confused. The guard looked similarly confused. "I don't know what he's-"

Suddenly the guard's speech cut off, and Kristoph went back to his book, seeming to ignore everything taking place outside the bars. The guard began to speak again.

"Mr. White, what just took place was an example of a device I received a short while ago."

"Fascillating. What is your point?"

The guard's eyes turned colder. "I want to use this power to allow you escape from this place."

Redd's eyes lit up. "Oh? Well, it would be foolish of me not to accept!"

Smiling, Kristoph pulled the remote from his pocket. What did he intend to do now?
15533321111.title: Redd White

155333211112.content:
"Now Mr. White, once I use this on you, you will be as free as a bird. No strings attached." Kristoph told White of his intention.

"Oh how Marvelous!" White said in his usual flamboyant way, before his tone got serious "I'm no fool, Mr Given, business is all give and take, now, what can Redd White do for you?"

Kristoph didn't appreciate White's butchering of his last name "Oh, nothing major Mr. White. I only need you to do one small job. I assume you're familiar with Phoenix Wright?" Kristoph asked a question he very well knew the answer to.

Redd White's face contorted in rage. "Yes, very much."

Kristoph smiled at White's anger "Now, I'm not asking you to do anything major like killing him, you don't want to go back to prison right after I break you out. No, I want you to affect his life on a much more.....personal scale."

Redd smiled at the idea. Getting revenge on Phoenix Wright was something he had long dreamed of. If it weren't for that pesky junior lawyer, he'd still be sitting in his comfy CEO chair atop of the blackmail empire he knew as Bluecorp. "So, you want me to steal the body of Mr. Wrong?"

Kristoph shook his head "No, no Mr. White. Simply taking his body is too simple. I want something much more than that. I want everything that he knows destroyed. I will break his spirit." Kristoph said with a chuckle. "Your job is to possess someone close to him. Do not worry, there are plenty of people you can choose from. Some with successful careers that you can exploit and take as your own. However, there is one person I will not permit you to possess, a rookie lawyer by the name of Apollo Justice. I have a personal vendetta against him and plan to get revenge against him in the same way."

"So, you want me to replace someone close to Wrong? And how will this break his spirit?" White questioned Kristoph.

"Simple. At first he probably won't find anything odd with one person acting differently. However, as more and more people start acting different, he'll begin to question it, and once I have deemed that enough is different, we ruin him. His closest friends and colleagues all trying to ruin his life and career with eventually lead him to the point of insanity." Kristoph explained his plan in whole.

"And you plan for I to do all that?" Redd White asked, smiling at the thought of being important in a plan to ruin Wright.

"Why, no, Mr White. You are merely the first I have chosen to move. Others will follow soon after you, I merely chose you to go first due to your personal involvement with Wright. Your imprisonment was his first major success in court." Kristoph explain

"So, I get to be the entrepreneur of possessing? How fantastabulous! Let's begin" White said with a large smile on his face.

Kristoph pointed the remote at White again. "Now White, a fair bit of warning. This remote can do more than Possess, if I deem you untrustworthy, I have the ability to put you into the body of bug. As you can imagine, I don't want to dirty my shoes with extermination. Choose all your moves wisely, I might be in jail, but I have ways of getting information on people's actions."

Redd said nothing as Kristoph pressed the Possession button, Redd soon found himself in a strange ghost form. He took this opportunity to fly threw the prison wall toward the outside world, meanwhile his body was escorted back to his cell. Redd hadn't been outside prison in years. He took a minute to bask in the sunlight before he got to his mission.

He needed to possess someone close to Wright, but who? He had two options, a co-worker, or a friend. He didn't know much of Wright's personal or professional life. He flew toward Wright's office, thankfully he hadn't moved in all these years. Inside he found Wright talking to someone. Someone perfect to be possessed.

Was it a friend or co-worker?
155333211112.title: Ask for White's cooperation.

choices: Possess Klavier or someone Klavier knows
155333212.content:
Kristoph was a patient man, but even his patience had it's limit. He had been in this cell for months, far too long for his taste. This remote was his chance to escape and he was going to get advantage of that as soon as possible. He aimed the remote at himself and clicked the 'Possession' button. In only a few moments, he was floating above his body. He was in some sort of ghost-like form. He looked down at his body. It was going about his daily routine as if nothing had happened, it appeared that the remote had vanished too.

Not wasting any time, Kristoph floated threw the prison walls and began to make his way to the outside world. He didn't even bother to look at guards as he passed by. He could possess one of their bodies and just walk away from prison, but he decided against it. They were an unnecessary step, why bother becoming a guard and leaving when he could just possess someone who was already far away from the prison?

As he floated outside, he had to cover his eyes. It had been quite awhile since he had seen so much sunlight. He had done it, he was free as a bird. The wonders of being free could wait however, there was still the matter of a body to worry about. Kristoph wasn't particularly picky when it came to a body to first possess. He'd prefer to be pretty much anyone compared to being in jail. The person could be male, female, rich, poor. As long as they were healthy and in good shape he was okay.

Of course, whatever body he took, wouldn't necessarily be permanent. He had plans for the future now that he knew that this remote works and those plans may require him to end a few lives, in more ways than one. He made a mental note to allways keep the remote close to him.

Thankfully, the prison was close to a relatively public area. The courthouse and the prosecution's office were both nearby. Sadly, the office of false Justice and the fallen Phoenix who he wanted to exact his revenge on was on the opposite side of town. Judging by how long it took for him to move out of the prison in this ghost form, it would take hours to float over to their office Of course, he didn't have to take revenge on the defense attorneys just yet, there were other people he wanted revenge against. His treacherous brother's office was nearby, he was as good a start on this cycle of revenge as any.

The question now was, who to possess. The obvious choice was to take Klavier's body, not being in control of himself for however long Kristoph decided would be a good punishment. Of course, Krishtoph had a second idea. Instead of possessing Klavier directly, why not possess someone he knows? Being betrayed by someone he thought he knew. Kristoph couldn't help but smirk at the karma.

What did Kristoph do?
155333212.title: Use the remote to escape now.

1553332121.content: Did he opt to possess Klavier or one of his acquaintances?
1553332121.title: Possess Klavier or someone Klavier knows

15533333333331.content: When does he find it?
15533333333331.title: Florent L'Belle

15533333333333332.content: Maybe the Ratings Rajah, Roger Retinz?
15533333333333332.title: Someone else

15533333333333332222.content: The world's greatest politician, Paul Atishon?
15533333333333332222.title: Someone else

choices: Use the remote to help him win the election
Use the remote for something stupid, like fun or charity
155333333333333322221.content:
Another day on the campaign trail, another day closer to the election. And one more day until he wins said election, if he were to be frank. After all, who else has become so personally invested in all his subjects' lives? Certainly not Mr. Cole Ectacks, the greedy fool. Certainly not Ms. Isla Ving, she's far too sympathetic to give each and every subject attention. No, only he, Paul Atishon, grandson of the prominent congressman Abe Atishon, would be good for the job! All he had to do was convince everyone else of that.

And the perfect way to do so presented itself the following day. He stepped out his front door and into his palanquin, when suddenly there was a knock on the curtain from one of his staff members.

"Mr. Atishon-Wimperson! There is a package addressed for you."

A package? He grabbed the package, and began to open it, hoping it was of the $1000 or above variety. He couldn't stand those sub-1000 gifts. They went right in the garbage. But this was no sub-1000 gift, no. This was priceless. Inside the package was a remote control and an instruction manual that read "Body switching remote." A remote that could switch bodies? If he had that kind of power, he could win the election! Not even that, he could do whatever he pleased! Oh, it was glorious! It was stupendous! It was perfect! It was... destiny.

It had to be destiny. Clearly the Gods above thought him to be deserving of such a miraculous device and entrusted it to him, Paul Atishon, out of nothing less that sheer amazement. It was clear he was free to use this remote control as he saw fit, as he was only capable of doing good with the thing. But that lead him to a single, most important question.

What does the Great Paul Atishon use this amazing gift from the heavens for?
155333333333333322221.title: Paul Atishon

choices: Someone who lives in Kurain Village
1553333333333333222211.content:
The right use for the remote was obvious. What other use was there for a device that could let you control other peoples bodies and have them do things, even against their will? He would use it to win the election! Of course, there was no need to use the remote at all. He could easily win this whole thing without it, he was too glourious to fail! The remote would merely get him the same result, with him having to put in less effort. All for the better of course, why should he, someone who reaches near divine levels of magnificence have to put his full effort into something so one-sided.

The question now was, who to use this device from the heavens on? The very first thought he had was to use the device on someone in Kurain village. While he was positive that his thought provoking and excellently worded speeches would win over the public, maybe the people in Kurain would prefer to hear of his magnificence from one of their own citizens? All he would have to do is take the body of one the people living there and give one of his usual speeches and even if this plan didn't work, he could at least use the body that he had stolen to vote for himself. There was more than one way to win an election after all.

Of course, why limit himself to the village himself? There were many people outside of the village he could use the remote on. For starters, he had heard that many people of the village were familiar with an agency in the city called the 'Wright Anything Agency' or something like that. Even the villages' future master was on friendly terms with the people at that agency. He could see it now "We are the Wright Anything Agency and we approve of Paul Atishon for assemblyman" that's what he would say, it would be simple. Too bad the future master was currently out of the country, if she were here while he took one of those bodies, he might get her vote too!

The choices were many and they were all up to him, more than usual though! For a normal person this was a simple choice, but for him, this was a momentous decision! He carefully thought about it and soon came upon the magnificent decision to take the body of....
1553333333333333222211.title: Use the remote to help him win the election

15533333333333332222111.content:
Paul decided that he should keep his new "campaign" to inside the village. If someone outside the village found out about this, he might be thought of as some kind of body thief or something, and a scandal was the last thing he needed.

So, the selection was narrowed. He could switch with a few kinds of people. The obvious would be potential voters or people with political or marketing influence, but then he suddenly had an idea. He could switch with his political opponents and cause a scandal, or even make an announcement that they're dropping out of the race! It would be beautiful!

So. Who should he switch bodies with?
15533333333333332222111.title: Someone who lives in Kurain Village

155333333333333322221112.content: Who is the village will Paul switch with
155333333333333322221112.title: A citizen of the village.

1553333333333333222211121.content:
After giving it some thought, Paul decided to swap with Pearl Fey, a citizen of Kurain village. There were several reasons for him choosing to switch with Pearl, but the biggest one was that she was the cousin of the future master of the village, Maya Fey. While switching with Maya herself would have been better, that was unfortunately not possible with her being out of the country. Thankfully, Pearl herself was still respected by many people in the village, due to her having extremely high spiritual power. Now that he had chosen who to swap with, all he had to do was find her and use the remote. He left his home and began to make his way toward Kurain Village.

Once he had arrived in Kurain village, he began his search. While walking, he passed by multiple people. He made sure to give a speech about his campaign to each person that he passed. They all said that he was bothering them, and that was true! He was interrupting their ineloquent lives with his gracious presence. He soon found Pearl. She was exiting a large building in the center of town known as Fey Manor. As she walked out, multiple people passed her and those people gave her respectful bows as they passed.

Now that he had found her, he had to choose which of the remotes buttons to use on her. The three that would most suit his plan were the 'Aware Swap', 'Possession', and 'Shapeshift' buttons. However, 'Unaware Swap' was still a viable option because this was just a test and the most important thing to do was test out the remote and make sure that it worked.

Which button does he use?
1553333333333333222211121.title: Pearl Fey

155333333333333322221112111.content:
Paul pointed the remote at Pearl, and selected "Aware swap". He then flipped it around, pointed it at himself, and hit the button again. Instantly, he found himself in a completely different location, and from the looks of things, a new body. He looked down at his feet, and saw the acolyte robes and body of the young woman. It had worked! And speaking of working, Atishon had a lot of it to get to. He barely stopped to get a look at himself before walking away and beginning his plans?

And on the other side of the road was a silently panicking Pearl Fey, confused, scared, and disgusted all at once. What just happened? Why was she suddenly the annoying politician who kept her up at night with all the noise? Why was her body walking around like nothing was wrong? What happened to the real Paul? Pearl spent what felt like hours thinking about what possibly happened.

So who do we follow? Paul in Pearl's body ("Pearl" Atishon), or Pearl in Paul's body ("Paul" Fey)?
155333333333333322221112111.title: Aware

choices: Let it run amok, and do something else.
1553333333333333222211121112.content:
Pearl broke from her reverie to realize that her body had ran off without her noticing. That could be bad. What could it be up to? She should probably try to find it.

At the same time, though, she wasn't sure if she wanted to meddle. Maybe the situation would resolve itself if she just left it alone for a little while. And besides, she'd never ridden in a palanquin before.

What did she choose to do?
1553333333333333222211121112.title: Follow "Paul" Fey.

info.brief_description: A Phoenix Wright character gets the ability to swap bodies. More organized and more swaps!
info.description:
READ THESE RULES BEFORE ADDING CHAPTERS. DON'T WORRY THERE ISN'T MANY
There are four functions that can be preformed with the remote; aware swap, unaware swap, possession, and shapeshift, this is how each of those swaps work

The Aware Swap function is a simple body swap. When used, the two targets of the swap will be put into each others bodies and be able to notice. The rest of the world would see them as each other

The Unaware Swap function puts the targets into each others bodies, but only those holding the remote would notice. No one else in the world would be able to tell a swap took place

The Possession function turns the affected party into a ghost-like state. Once in this state, the user can fly into and possess the body of any person. Once they turn into this ghost-like state, their original body act completely normal and will retain no knowledge of the remote

The Shapeshift function can copy someone's shape. If Phoenix were to use the shapeshift function on Maya, then Maya's shape would be saved. If he were to use the shapeshift button on himself, then he be in an exact copy of Maya's body and the world would see him as Maya. This function can also be used to shapeshift others. The remote can save multiple people's shapes and has a 'undo' button to let someone back into their body after they shift.

The Command function is unlike the others in that it is hidden in a compartment on the under side of the remote and it isn't mentioned in the manual. It is used to give orders to whoever the wielder of the remote chooses. The person the button is used on will enter a motionless state until a command is given. Once a command is given, it will take immediate effect. The person being commanded will not remember being given the order, however, they will be fully aware that they are doing something against their will. Commands that result in physical harm will NOT take effect, however commands that result in mental harm will.

If Phoenix were to aware swap two other people then both of those people would be able to notice the swap and everyone would see them as each other

If Phoenix were to do an unaware swap on two other people then they wouldn't know they are swapped however Phoenix would know

If Phoenix were to press the possession button on someone else, then that person would go into ghost form and be able to possess people

You may use characters from any Ace Attorney game.

There is only one remote. Whoever finds it may give it to others, but there is only one

Only Ace Attorney characters

Keep this T rated

No ending the Story! There is always a way it can continue!

Have characters only appear time periods they should be in EX: No Professor Means in the original trilogy

No killing off Ace Attorney characters. If you want to have a murder case then make up a character to die for the case.

No mental changes for aware swaps! characters may like another persons' life more, but not think they are the other person

Please ADD!

If you have any questions about the interactive or these rules, message me

Please ADD! If you know anyone who may like to add, tell them!



NOTE: It is possible that some chapters may include DGS spoilers, read at your own risk
